description.summary:
Enjoy nature in it's purest form in this unique floating cabin.  Located in a small cove and accessible by water only, we are completely off-grid.  Fish directly from your front porch and dock or head out into the lake for spectacular views and world-class game fishing.
Accessible by water only. 
discounts for military / veterans, healthcare workers and first-responders
description.space: Camp floats directly ON the water in a small cove.
description.notes:
Enjoy nature in it's purest form in this unique floating cabin.  Located in a small cove and accessible by water only, we are completely off-grid.  Fish directly from your front porch and dock or head out into the lake for spectacular views and world-class game fishing.
You'll have views of the lake throughout the cabin.  Each bedroom sleeps two.  One bedroom features a custom-made full-size bed while the other provides bunk beds.  The living space offers a comfortable futon couch for up to two additional guests. 
The cabin uses solar lights, propane stove and heat and a composting toilet (**no running water**).  A brand new dock system was installed to easily accommodate your boat.  Should you need a watercraft we offer a canoe rental or we can help you find a local marina for larger boat rentals.  
Bed linens, towels, cookware and tableware, toilet paper and soap/bathing items are provided.
PLEASE ask us about our discounts for military/ veterans, first-responders, healthcare workers and educators. We salute you!
*this property is veteran-owned*
description.transit: Accessible by ONLY - canoe available for rent
description.house_rules:
No pets, please.
Due to safety consideration we do not allow children the under age 13 on premises when there is open water.

hosts.about: I am a retired nurse and hospital executive with a healthy passion for nature and photography.  With the surrounding scenic beauty of the marina, the St. Johns and Wekiva Rivers and the wildlife, purchasing Floating Cottage and making it available to travelers for vacation use was an easy decision for me.  Sun makes me happy!

recent.comments:
The cottage was perfect . Kim was so helpful when we had trouble getting inside multiple times.  We had a great time feeding the turtles and fish. 
The inside of the cottage was wonderful my husband was very surprised .  Thank you Kim!

items.comments:
The cottage was perfect . Kim was so helpful when we had trouble getting inside multiple times.  We had a great time feeding the turtles and fish. 
The inside of the cottage was wonderful my husband was very surprised .  Thank you Kim!

My husband and I stayed at this adorable cottage on the water, and we had a fantastic time! It had everything we needed. Close to shopping and Orlando parks. Feeding the turtles and fish from the porch was my favorite! Food is provided to feed them. The view in the morning and night of the sun on the water was such a beautiful sight as we drank our coffee/glass of wine. Although the cottage sits right on the water, you can hardly feel swaying. Boat rentals discounted too! The kitchen was fully equipped and had a full-size fridge, oven, and even a dishwasher!  Also, Cabana Live was open, which is a short walk right in the marina. It is an amazing bar, with delicious food,  tons of tvs and a pool! We had a great time there and even received a discount on drinks and food because we were in the cottage. Connie's deli is another awesome spot right up the ramp with delicious breakfast and lunch.  Kim was an amazing host who made our stay very special. Thank you!! We will definitely return!!

We enjoyed the best little vacation at this floating cottage! Kim had great instructions and the cottage is perfect for two people. We loved the views and the calmness. Connie's Diner is the way to go for breakfast and lunch. We spent our days exploring historic Sanford and going to Blue Spring State Park. It's a great little area and we hope to return again!

We had an amazing time at Kim’s place.  Can I move in?  We would definitely stay again!  Rent a boat, it’s amazing how much there is to explore.  We saw so much wildlife, from birds to alligators.  We even saw a manatee.  I highly recommend the awesome floating cottage.

This was the best rental weve ever visited.  Kim is absolutely amazing.  If you want a peaceful place to relax. This is it !!  Her floating cottage is beautiful and it looks brand new inside. You wont need anything because she provides it all ! I highly recommend  this great getaway.  Please take good care of this gem because its too amazing to treat any other way. We will return to this beautiful cottage in the future.
I am a repeat visitor and will keep coming back. Love this little house boat. Kim is a perfect host.

description.summary:
Welcome to FLOATING COTTAGE . . . 

Imagine staying in a small cottage, gently afloat on the beautiful St. Johns River in Sanford, Florida.  

Perfect for social distancing! Sanitized between guests.  Contactless check-in.

Floating Cottage provides a magical space to relax, refresh and explore.  Relax on the front porch; enjoy the warm breeze while watching marina activity, and the bounty of nature.   Enjoy the peaceful comfort of the fully equipped small home.
description.space:
The cathedral ceilinged living room is bathed in natural light, has hardwood floors, and embraces the outside.  Its French doors expand the living area to include the protected front porch.   Furnishings include a versatile work or dining table, full size sofa bed, electric fireplace heats to take the chill off a cool morning, and TV with basic channels.  Equipped with Roku to enable guests to select their favorite streaming channels.

No ordinary boat galley, the fully equipped kitchen meets the needs of the casual to the gourmet chef with a five burner gas stove, full size side-by-side refrigerator with door ice dispenser, dishwasher, granite counter tops and tile back splashes.  Microwave, toaster, utensils and dinnerware are included.  Paper products are supplied for guests not wanting to wash any dishes.

Walk up the stairs to the carpeted loft bedroom with queen size bed, walk-in closet and be surprised by the stained glass window.  The loft is air-conditioned.  Open the shades and screened windows to enjoy the gentle river breeze. 

The cleverly outfitted small boat bath has a full size shower, flush comfort toilet, storage space for linens and toiletries, and a view-catching window.   

The cottage is approached from the dock through the back porch.  Notice the gas barbecue for outdoor cooking.  

The French doors to the front porch open the cottage to a full view of the marina and its enveloping forests.  With four comfortable chairs, guests of the cottage may choose to sit for hours simply enjoying the quiet peace of the marina.  Watch boaters come and go from trips up the lazy St. Johns River or to Lake Monroe to visit Sanford.  Turtles swim to the cottage to greet the guests.  An occasional manatee can be seen from the porch.  Herons and egrets are common sights as guests share the lovely outdoors with feathered friends.

Floating Cottage is designed with comfort and efficiency built into the 550 square feet of living space.  The gentle movement of the water beneath relaxes cottage guests and assures a great night's sleep.  

Floating Cottage is berthed in the Boat Tree Marina, just north of Lake Monroe on the scenic St. Johns River, a river of abundant wildlife and scenic vistas.  The marina offers a casual deli and restaurant, bait shop, laundry and pool.  There is a pool-side bar associated with the restaurant.  Stroll to the deli for  breakfast and lunch or ask them to deliver to the cottage (if staffing allows). Yes,  beer is available for thirsty patrons.  Guests of Floating Cottage enjoy a 15% discount on boat rentals for half and full days.  The friendly staff at the office will assist with boat reservations as well as with local information on fishing.

Don't miss visiting quaint downtown Sanford, home to cobblestone streets and brick-lined store fronts, restored nineteenth-century Victorian homes, lovely towering oaks draped with Spanish moss, numerous art galleries, unique shops, pubs and great restaurants.  Catch the open market with crafts and produce at the square.  

Follow Sanford 360 to explore local events and discover what is happening in the Sanford area.

The Riverwalk on Lake Monroe has shady places aplenty to watch lake activity or beautiful sunsets and sunrises.
description.access: Contactless check-in using smart lock.  Guests have full access to the cottage and the kayaks.  Once reservations are confirmed, the owner will send an email to guests that has full access information and details about the Floating Cottage.
description.notes:
There is ample free parking available at the marina.  The cottage is berthed behind the deli.   Guests with mobility concerns should be aware that there is a ramp to the floating dock,  and to expect some barely perceptible movement.  The angle of the ramp to the water depends on how much water is in the river. . .it can be nearly parallel or it can be as much as forty degrees.  There are ten stairs with a secure handrail leading from the living room to the bedroom loft.

Security cameras are mounted on both the front and back porches for safety.

Day trip options include Daytona and New Smyrna Beaches, Orlando and Disney World, the Audubon Raptor Center, swimming with manatees in Crystal Springs, and Merritt Island National Refuge are all about an hour's drive from the marina.

Tax:  an additional 12% is added to the daily rate for state and local taxes.
description.neighborhood: The marina is certified by the State of Florida as a Clean Water Marina.  Your neighbors will be turtles, herons, egrets, an occasional manatee and other boaters.  The marina is in a rural cove surrounded by forest on two sides and the river ahead.  Old-Town Sanford has great restaurants, pubs and art galleries and there is a large mall anchored by Macy's and Walmart Superstore about four miles away.
description.transit:
Car recommended!  Canoe, kayak or boat for crossing the lake into Sanford or cruising up the St. Johns River.  Guests can rent bicycles in Sanford.

Guests may bring their own boats.  The marina charges for launching boats.  There is a daily charge for secured trailer storage as well as slip fees.  The marina makes every effort to rent adjacent slips  and provides a 15% discount to cottage guests.
description.interaction:
Your host communicates via email with all guests and every guest has full contact information for the host.  Our cottage team in Sanford will be able to available to answer any questions about the boat and the surrounding area, as will the host from home.  The owner/host is always available  24/7 to you via email, text or phone and will respond promptly, assuring that the guest experience exceeds  expectations.  

You will be greeted by the turtles, the official greeting party, who sense when someone is aboard the boat.  Open the French doors to the front porch to see them as they swim up to the boat.  Try not to feed them and inadvertently attract gators.

Guests receive an email with access information about two weeks prior to the stay, and another, short reminder list two days prior to the stay, one that can simply be scrolled through on your phone.  Another email will be sent on the day prior to departure with simple check-out hints.
description.house_rules:
Acknowledgement of Risks & Assumption of Risk & Responsibility

Because this is a cottage, floating in a marina over which the host has no control, the host requests that guests are aware of and agree with the following.  

By making this reservation, I  agree to the following:

This is a legal agreement between myself, to be known as the Guest, and the Host, which is collectively to be known as Floating Cottage, LLC, its owners, employees, trustees, heirs and/or assignees.  As Guest, I take full responsibility and assume all liabilities to others caused entirely or partially by myself, my minor children, my friends and/or family members and their minor children that are staying or visiting me during my stay at the Floating Cottage.  I fully understand that the liability that I am assuming extends to any bodily Injury, accidents, illnesses, paralysis, drowning and/or death, loss of personal property and expenses thereof as a result of any accident which may occur during my stay at the cottage. I completely understand, agree to and accept all liability for all persons staying or visiting me at the Floating Cottage during my stay even if these injuries, death, or loss of personal property were due to the negligence of the Host. 

I acknowledge that I am aware of the risks associated with my stay at the Floating Cottage accommodation and I release the host, of any liability associated with my stay at this accommodation.  I understand fully that this agreement is a contract that is legally binding upon me personally. I further understand that by the booking of my reservation, I am waiving valuable legal rights including any and all rights I may have against the Host.  I also agree to hold the Host harmless and to indemnify the Host for any accidents, injuries and/or resulting deaths which may befall me, my guests and any minor children.

description.summary:
Kent Narrows Rentals Welcomes you aboard Cass-N-Reel! A 432sqft luxury getaway in the Kent Narrows. With 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom, and a gorgeous covered rear facing deck; this is the ultimate couples retreat! 9 waterfront/waterview bars/restaurants within walking distance! NO Fishing/Crabbing on property
description.space: Don’t forget to bring your binoculars, the views are magnificent! Unfortunately, the fridge does not have an ice maker. You will need to bring your own ice. Due to wind and movement, their may be some movement of the houseboat.
description.interaction: We are just a text or phone call away if you find you need anything. We are less then a 5 minute drive away.
description.house_rules:
Absolutely NO Fishing or Crabbing from the houseboat or anywhere on the property. 

Please NO heels on the rooftop deck. 

NO smoking on the rooftop or inside the houseboat. Please smoke out in the parking lot. 

Absolutely NO swimming in the Kent Narrows. 

Absolutely NO fishing or crabbing from the houseboat or dock

Please lower and secure umbrellas at the end of the night. 

Please put the cushions down in the living room at the end of the night so they do not blow away.  

Due to insurance reasons, we require our renters to sign a separate stay agreement prior to their arrival. The agreement highlights the rules specific to the houseboat that AirBnB doesn't cover

description.summary:
Immerse yourself in nature on picturesque Lake Fontana, nestled in the backcountry of the Great Smoky Mountains, when you stay in this unique floating tiny home. An ideal stay for adventurous water lovers!

This stationary houseboat is accessible only by boat, & provides guests the opportunity to fish & swim right off the front porch. Guests are provided with a canoe in order to travel back & forth from Fontana Marina (where guests park, and can also find wifi, snacks, drinks, etc) to the house.
description.space:
This unique tiny house features a 225sqft interior with approximately 500sqft of exterior dock space. 
Being a tiny home, it is truly best suited for 2 guests as a time, although it can sleep up to 4.
The primary sleeping space is a queen bed "nook," with alternative sleeping options in the living room area being a twin-sized daybed + trundle pullout. The interior layout follows an "open concept" design (please note there are no true doors separating rooms). The bathroom includes a marine toilet, sink, and full shower. The kitchen features a gas stove, fridge & top freezer, small blender, basic cookware (pots, pans, baking tins & trays, utensils), dishes (plates, bowls, glasses, silverware), and a french press for coffee (instructions provided).
Outside on the docks, guests can enjoy 2 cushioned lounge chairs, a dining area, a propane grill, and 2 swinging hammock chairs. There is a ladder provided for swimming access, as well as fishing poles. Guests are responsible for obtaining an NC fishing license & lures/bait, if desired.

This is an off-grid solar-powered house, so guests are advised to think of it as an "upscale glamping" experience (re: please leave the hair styling tools, coffee makers, and any other high-draw electrical items behind. This is not the same as a "normal" house or hotel. Be sure to ask if you have any concern about bringing a particular item).
description.access:
Guests will be provided a canoe upon arrival at Fontana Marina if they do not have their own boat to access the house with. Guests with their own boat can use the ramp at the marina to launch, and are able to keep their boat docked at the house. It is a 3 min boat ride or 15 min paddle from Fontana Marina to the house. Parking at the marina is free.

Nearby amenities include Fontana Village Resort (1.5 miles up the road from marina), where guests can dine at 2 restaurants, play mini-golf, rent bikes, hike, get gas, visit the general store, etc. Guests are welcome to rent a pontoon, fishing boat, kayaks, SUP paddle boards, and more at Fontana Marina. There is also a historic lake tour most days. Fontana Dam (a .5 mile drive or 1.5 mile hike from the marina) is the tallest dam east of the Rockies. The Great Smoky Mountains National Park features countless trails, with Hazel & Eagle Creek trail access points being a short boat ride away from the house.

Guests are encouraged to enjoy all areas in and outside the house- but NOT underneath it. It is very dangerous to swim underneath the house or docks. Swimmers can easily be knocked unconscious when the house & docks move in unpredictable ways due to boat wake and weather. Children are especially drawn to this, as it can seem like a great "hide and seek" idea while playing in the water. Parents should always be paying close attention to children in the water, but this is especially true while they swim around the house for this reason.
description.notes:
There is NO WIFI at the house. This is a great chance to "unplug" & enjoy the sights and sounds this beautiful area has to offer. :) If you have Verizon, there is a limited amount of cell service. Otherwise, guests can head over to Fontana Marina (3 min boat ride, 15 min paddle) for free wifi access. 

There is NO A/C. Keeping the windows & doors open allows a cooling breeze to pass through the house most days. There is a box fan provided if the breeze needs a little help. Cooling off in the water is the best & most authentic way to enjoy this stay!

This floating house is suspended over roughly 80-100ft of water. It is not accessible by land in any way, and you cannot stand up in the water. All guests MUST be strong swimmers, or wear a life jacket at all times while outside on the dock. 

The house is secured in place by a 10,000lbs anchor block, as well as tethered off to land by rope in 2 places. As all floating structures do, it will move around some depending on weather conditions and boat traffic. Guests can rest assured it is perfectly safe in storms, and the marina is just 'a hop & a skip' away if guests ever feel in any way uncomfortable with the movement.

This home is connected to a city water line, and thus has clean potable water for drinking/cooking/showering/etc. All black & grey water goes into a holding tank. Please be conscious of water usage at all times (keep showers to a 5 minute limit) to avoid filling up the tank prematurely. Again, think "glamping."

Solar panels provide all power. If you use high-draw tools or appliances like a hair dryer or coffee maker, you WILL run out of power. Kindly leave such things at home. Charging phones/cameras & using the lights is no problem. 

Please note that some facets of this home may be inherently challenging for folks with balance or mobility issues. The queen bed, for example, can only be entered at the foot, as the sides of the mattress are flush with the wall (i.e. one must crawl into bed). The bathroom is a relatively small space, without a lot of "wiggle room." Good balance will be needed when stepping on and off the dock onto a boat or canoe. The house will noticeably "rock" when boats pass by. Please know your own limits and make a fair determination whether this stay is truly right & safe for you.
description.transit: If you don't have a boat, a canoe will be provided. There are also hourly/daily watercraft rentals (pontoons, bass fishing boats, paddle boards, kayaks, etc) available at Fontana Village Marina.
description.interaction: We live just across the harbor in another floating cabin. We would be happy to come do a walk-through of the house with you upon arrival to ensure you feel comfortable with the off-grid systems, marine toilet etc. We can be reached via phone should you have any issues (remember, no WIFI at the house so you will need to go to the marina to reach out unless you have Verizon as your provider), or message in a bottle of course. ;) We hope you enjoy your stay & we trust it will be an unforgettably beautiful experience!
description.house_rules:
-Guests MUST sign a liability waiver (emailed after booking).
-NO swimming underneath the house/docks. It is very dangerous.
-NO hair dryers, curling irons, straighteners, coffee makers, etc.
-Children under the age of 12 MUST wear a life jacket at all times when outside the floating cabin (i.e. on the dock, on boats, etc).
-The 4-guest limit is STRICT (& will already be very tight). 
-Have fun!!!!

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: Marcia was very responsive and flexible. Place was clean and beautiful. Had everything we needed.

items.comments: Marcia was very responsive and flexible. Place was clean and beautiful. Had everything we needed.

Marcia's, boat house was exceptional!  Each room was inviting and taste fully decorated.  While everything you needed was in this beautiful two-story house, the surrounding area provided you with fantastic eateries and plenty of activities to get involved with, both day and night.

One of the surprising secrets was the lively downtown sector, full of chic restaurants, unique stores and other rare finds.  You will be pleasantly surprised by all of the things you will be able to do during your stay, be it relaxing on the upstairs deck over the water or walking the streets of downtown.

Again, this was a 5 star experience and Marcia was the ultimate host!  Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to a stay on this fabulous boat house.  Just don't make  the mistake I did–stay longer than 3 days because you will not want to leave!
Not a lot of words needed. This place was beautiful, perfect location and a slice of luxury on water! We rented two boats across from each other and our group of 8 was so happy.

The place was beautiful inside felt like a home no motion from the water.  My favorite part of the house was upstairs it felt super cozy and the couch they have is very comfortable.  The view from the balcony is amazing and we had a wonderful sunset, once it was dark outside all the lights from the boats and buildings made for a beautiful picture!
We had a really great time.  The location was fantastic and the place is very nice with a great scent

We enjoyed our stay.  House was clean and beautifully decorated.  Everything we needed and more was supplied   Beds were very comfortable 
Parking was a bit of an issue because we had two cars and were only able to accommodate one.  There were a few bugs but we were on the river so not surprising 
Would definitely book again!

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our houseboats offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.

*Please note: Decor differs from current pictures, but is equally as beautiful. Updated pictures coming soon!
description.space:
After parking in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our houseboat community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your houseboat, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three benches along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed, large closet, ceiling fan, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2 (Sofa bed):
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with a sectional couch (with pull out sleeper), 60" Smart TV, desk and chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 55" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bath, featuring another walk-in shower. 

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this houseboat is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other houseboats at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire villa for the duration of their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent houseboat community. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 houseboats and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per villa. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)

hosts.about: I'm a Merchant Marine, living in Florida.

Hi there! A little about us…

We have called the Treasure Coast home off and on since 2008, but finally moved down full time in 2019 because we absolutely love it here! We’ve been married for 11 years, and currently have three furbabies. Sonny is a Merchant Marine and I am a Realtor, so after selling a gym we owned for 6 years, we needed a new focus… enter our little Houseboat! We absolutely love to travel and explore new places. We’ve always enjoyed the hotel feel and we’re looking forward to providing that experience for our guests, and hopefully make some new friends along the way!

description.summary:
Why settle for another basic hotel stay when you can have an entire experience? Welcome to our floating oasis!

Soak up the rays or take in the breathtaking sunset views from your very own rooftop. 

Wake-up to the beautiful waterfront views of the St. Lucie river from the comfort of a plush queen bed, then sip your morning coffee on the patio and maybe even catch a glimpse of a manatee!

If you’re looking for a unique, peaceful and relaxing escape, this one is for you!
description.space:
This modern 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom open concept houseboat is compact but efficient; perfect for a romantic getaway or relaxing escape for close friends. You’ll find all the basic amenities you’ve come to expect from your favorite hotel chain in a tranquil environment. Many of our guests have enjoyed falling asleep to the gentle rocking and sounds of the river, we are a boat after all! 

Enjoy a plush queen bed fit with crisp white linens. An additional pullout sofa-bed is also available if needed, but we have found our houseboat to be best suited for an intimate getaway for two. Fresh towels and washcloths are provided as well as beach towels if you’re planning a trip to the nearby beach. 

The kitchenette includes a full size sink with and drying rack, mini refrigerator, air fryer/toaster oven, and keurig coffee maker, but you probably wont be whipping up any home cooked meals here!

We’ve provided a variety of coffee and sweeteners, as well as bottled water. There is also a small store at the marina where you can purchase additional beverages and items. 

We’re situated in FL so we get the occasional storm, especially during the rainy season! We’ve stocked a few of our favorite board games for some good old fashioned fun to keep you entertained!

Situated at the Sandpiper Bay Marina, you’ll find very peaceful, quiet surroundings! While we are not walking distance from any restaurants, we’re just a short drive from the local grocery store and many of our favorite dining options; only 8 miles from downtown Stuart, where you’ll find more delicious dining and local shopping options; and just 10 miles to Seaturtle Beach!

Our guests can also purchase full and half day passes and enjoy all the luxuries offered at Sandpiper Bay Resort, the only all-inclusive resort in the US, featuring multiple dining outlets, a rejuvenating spa, and multiple pools. If you’re the adventurous type, you can even rent kayaks or jet skis for an additional fee!
description.notes: The nearby resort and marina are currently undergoing some renovations. We have not found it to be disruptive and none of our guests have expressed any concerns but we prefer to be fully transparent with what you can expect! We’re excited for the new updates and an improved experience for our future guests!
description.neighborhood:
Sandpiper Bay Marina is located on the beautiful St. Lucie River in Port St. Lucie, Florida. It is situated in the calm waters of the river, with easy access to the Atlantic Ocean. This protected area of the St. Lucie River is a great haven for those looking to relax and let the stresses of everyday life fade away. There is an abundance of marine life and a short trip to world class fishing.

The beautiful neighborhood of Sandpiper Bay is a quaint and pristine neighborhood which features the Saints Golf Course and Port St. Lucie Botanical Gardens. Home to Sandpiper Bay Resort, an all-inclusive resort, which offers the largest Sports School and academies in the community.

Sandpiper Bay Resort is the only all-inclusive resort in the US! It features multiple dining outlets, a rejuvenating spa, infinity pools, and kids' camp. Our guests can purchase full and half day passes at a great rate and enjoy all the luxuries of the all-inclusive resort!

description.summary:
Welcome to FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape, your home away from shore! Our luxury houseboat is docked at the premier Inner Harbor Marina, with the best waterfront views in downtown Baltimore.

We offer a complete mind-body-soul immersion. From elevated hospitality and curated amenities to a perfectly imagined layout and 360 views for idyllic sunrises and sunsets, you’ve never had a waterfront experience like this. 

Recharge, explore, and connect with the water.
description.space:
Here at FLOHOM, we’ve artfully designed FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape for unparalleled experiences. Floating in Baltimore’s Inner Harbor, everything’s within reach. Enjoy adventurous on-water and waterfront activities, romantic sightseeing, and popular Baltimore attractions.  

Whether you’re looking for an enchanting couple’s getaway, an adventurous weekend, or a serene staycation, you’ll find it here.

Our designer suite with Williams-Sonoma decor is equipped with all the modern amenities you’d have at home, plus a little extra. Upon check-in, receive your personalized welcome amenities. 

Then settle into your cozy, spacious primary bedroom adorned with deluxe features. Start and end each day on an award-winning Helix Midnight Lux mattress and premium Brooklinen sheets. Take our word for it – this might be the best sleep of your life. 

Speaking of starting and ending each day right, we’ve positioned FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape for the most magical sunrises and sunsets. Early birds can wake up at dawn to perch on the outdoor deck and watch the show. Bonus points if you enjoy it with a hot coffee brewed from our Fellow pour over coffee station.

FLOHOM days hold infinite potential, from curated experiences within the home to special community adventures recommended through your FLOHOM guest app. 

We believe that you should have access to nature, well-being, and excitement no matter where you go. That’s why our home features wellness amenities, scenic outdoor decks, and indoor and outdoor spaces for remote work. 

Guests will love our bright living area with cozy seating and incredible views. Connect with our concierge team and book a private yoga, meditation, or massage session that comes right to you. 

If you prefer a more relaxed experience, choose a book from our library of curated book selections to enjoy from the rooftop, stern or bow deck. And we know many of you take your business on the go. Work-from-homers can be productive at our functional workstations with high-speed WiFi that won’t fail you. 

Feeling inspired? Our well-equipped kitchen has everything you need to prepare a delicious meal with modern appliances and spacious granite countertops. Gaze out at sailboats leaving the marina while delicious aromas fill the space, and open a bottle from the wine cooler to share at dinner. 

The luxury bath is equipped with a large walk-in shower and vanity. The washer/dryer combo makes it easy to pack light. 

As the moon illuminates Baltimore’s Inner Harbor, there’s no better place to be than atop the rooftop. Climb the spiral stairs to enjoy a tea or nightcap beneath the stars. It’s the perfect way to get lost in the current of this unforgettable floating getaway.
description.access: To access the property, guests will unlock and enter remotely using the FLOHOM guest app to unlock the smart keybox.
description.notes:
(1) FLOHOM's gentle movement or sway in response to the currents and winds is part of the unique experience we offer. It allows you to truly go with the flow and immerse yourself in the tranquil rhythm of the water. Our houseboats are thoughtfully designed to ensure stability and minimize excessive movement. Many guests find the gentle sway adds to the charm and relaxation, but if you have a history of motion sickness, we recommend considering your comfort level beforehand.

(2) To ensure a peaceful and respectful environment for all guests and the neighboring liveaboards, quiet hours are from 10pm-7am, which are strictly enforced. Your FLOHOM is noise monitored by indoor and outdoor noise awareness sensors, which will monitor the decibel levels on the vessel but are not active listening or recording devices.

(3) At this time, pets are not allowed. We plan to allow our furry friends in the future.

(4) FLOHOM is designed with the needs and preferences of adults in mind, and as such, it's not the best fit for families with young children. Children 10 and older are allowed. Our goal is to create a peaceful and relaxing environment that adults best enjoy, and we believe that by setting an age limit, we can ensure that our guests have the best possible experience during their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Welcome to the vibrant and historic neighborhoods of Federal Hill and Inner Harbor, two of Baltimore, Maryland’s most iconic areas, each offering a distinct taste of the city’s rich culture and heritage.

Federal Hill, set on the South Baltimore peninsula, is a treasure trove of American history. A walk through its tree-lined streets is akin to stepping back into the 19th century, with the boasting stunning period architecture. As the heart of this neighborhood is Federal Hill Park, a lush hilltop haven offering panoramic views of the Baltimore skyline and the neighboring Inner Harbor. 

This community is buzzing with life, hosting a collection of trendy bars, boutiques, art galleries, and eclectic restaurants. Make sure to visit Cross Street Market, a modern reincarnation of the historical marketplace, where local vendors serve a diverse menu of culinary delights. 

On the other side of the water sits the Inner Harbor, the city’s primary entertainment and tourism hubspot. The waterside community features attractions such as the National Aquarium, Maryland Science Center, and the USS Constellation. Stroll along the scenic promenade to encounter lively street performances, or take to the water in a paddleboat or Baltimore Water Taxi for picturesque city views. When the sun dips below the horizon, the Inner Harbor truly comes to life; its many restaurants, bars, and entertainment complex lights up the night.
 
Federal Hill and Inner Harbor are well-connected, offering convenient public transportation options for exploring the wider city. But perhaps one of the standout features of these neighborhoods, especially for sports fans, is their proximity to Camden Yards and M&T Bank stadium, home to the Baltimore Orioles and Ravens. Within walking distance from the stadiums is FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape, the ideal lodging option for any sports enthusiast. Imagine spending an exhilarating day cheering on your favorite team, then strolling back to your comfortable accommodations without the hassle of navigating traffic or searching for public transportation. 

Whether you’re a history enthusiast, foodie, sports fan, or just looking to immerse yourself in the local culture, choosing to stay at FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape in the heart of Baltimore’s Federal Hill and Inner Harbor neighborhoods ensure a memorable experience filled with excitement, convenience, and comfort.
description.transit:
Federal Hill and the Inner Harbor are ideally situated neighborhoods, enabling guests to access a wealth of attractions within walking distance. Yet, should you wish to broaden your Baltimore experience, numerous convenient transportation options are available. 

We recommend utilizing rideshare services like Uber and Lyft to explore nearby neighborhoods or venturing slightly further. Alternatively, the city provides a greener option with electric scooters, such as Bird and Link, which can be found scattered throughout the neighborhoods. 

Maritime enthusiasts will love the Baltimore Water Taxi. This local service stops next to the Rusty Scupper Restaurant, adjacent to the Inner Harbor Marina. It’s not just a mode of transport but a scenic way to explore the city, providing routes to the other side of the Inner Harbor and several stops within the beautiful Baltimore harbor area. 

For those flying in or out, the Baltimore Washington International (BWI) Airport is conveniently less than 20 minutes away by car. Washington, DC is less than an hour’s drive for day trips or onward journeys, or you can catch the MARC train for a more relaxed journey. At FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape, you’ll find you’re at the heart of Baltimore’s vibrant neighborhoods and the hub of excellent transport connections.
description.interaction: Guests will have 24/7 communications with FLOHOM’s concierge team through the FLOHOM guest app. Message our team with anything you need, from questions and concerns to local recommendations.
description.house_rules:
Please be respectful of the space and everything in it, as well as be respectful to your neighbors. 

1. To ensure a peaceful and respectful environment for all guests and the neighboring liveaboards, quiet hours are from 10pm-7am, which are strictly enforced. FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape is noise monitored by indoor and outdoor noise awareness sensors, which will monitor the decibel levels on the vessel but are not active listening or recording devices. 

2. The maximum number of overnight guests is four. The maximum number of guests on the houseboat at any one time is eight. 

3. At this time, pets are not allowed. We plan to allow our furry friends in the future.

4. FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape is designed with the needs and preferences of adults in mind, and as such, it's not the best fit for families with young children. Children 10 and older are allowed. Our goal is to create a peaceful and relaxing environment that adults best enjoy, and we believe that by setting an age limit, we can ensure that our guests have the best possible experience during their stay. 

5. We kindly ask that you refrain from smoking or vaping anywhere on FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape, including the rooftop and decks. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in maintaining a pleasant and smoke-free environment. 

6. Parties and events are prohibited.

7. For safety reasons, we strictly prohibit jumping, diving, and swimming from FLOHOM 1| Bay Escape and the marina piers. While we understand the allure of the water, it's important to ensure everyone's well-being and avoid any potential accidents or injuries. 

8. We kindly request that you refrain from leaning or standing on the rooftop railings. While the rooftop offers breathtaking views and a wonderful space to relax, exercising caution and preventing any potential accidents or falls is essential.

9. For the safety and integrity of FLOHOM 1 | Bay Escape and its mooring, we ask guests to refrain from adjusting the dock lines; our dedicated FLOHOM concierge team or Oasis Marinas staff are available to assist you in case of any concerns or issues with the dock lines. If you suspect a problem, please contact our concierge team, and we will promptly address the situation.

10. Please close all sliding doors and windows when you leave. This will help keep the boat secure and prevent damage from the elements. Keep all screen doors and windows closed when you're on the boat. This will prevent insects from entering the boat.

Large couch in the downstairs living room can sleep 1 tall adult, or 2 smaller adults.
Details of the “museum” area that displays lots of old cool stuff we found while renovating.
Living room details. This fan is great on hot Florida days!

View of the game area and kitchen from the living room.

recent.comments: Interesting place to stay

items.comments: Interesting place to stay

This was my second time staying here and I love this airbnb so much!

Such a cute and creative getaway. I have stayed in a lot of airbnbs and this is one of my favorites everrrrr. Her attention to detail is amazing! Even left some snacks like pop tarts for her guests ☺️💜

Kelly Ann and Davis proved their Superhost status… exactly as advertised… super unique… very fun and memorable trip for us.  Enjoyed exploring the area and trying a few eating establishments!  On-site bar and Deli cafe were excellent, when we didn’t want to venture out.  Highly recommend!  

Boat is just FUN!
It was a nice getaway for a birthday weekend for a unique experience. The property had a nearby restaurant/pool/bar. Plenty of amenities provided by the host.  Very comfortable bedding.

Swamp boat! Swamp boat! A concrete boat in the swamp! Comfy, cosmically aligned, and cozy! Wonderful layout with a lovely living room area in the bow and the comfiest bed in the stern. Inbetween! A beautiful bathroom and a tapped in kitchen! Wowzerz!

The boat is adorable & perfect for those who want something unique. The below galley & bedroom space is lovely. .  If all you want to do is stay on the boat, or go to the one bar/restaurant & pool that's at the marina, it's great. Otherwise there's absolutely nothing to do there in 90+ degree weather & nowhere close by either. We are in our 60's & found the floating dock & stairs to be very rickety & unsteady. And the hatch to the below deck accommodations was quite heavy & cumbersome. Also, it took a very long time for the air conditioner to cool things off.  Probably our fault, but it's really designed for younger people.

description.summary:
This ferrocement boat was made in Sweden in 1973. That’s right! It’s made of concrete! The boat circumnavigated the globe twice before eventually ending up here in sunny Sanford FL. We spent 2 years completely renovating everything and tried to leave as much of the boat’s original personality intact while adding modern amenities. 
Laundry facilities, showers and restrooms, diner, and marina store all on site, and downtown historic Sanford and river walk close by.
description.space:
This quirky, unique, relaxing, fun boat is one of a kind! Lounge on the sun deck, enjoy a frozen cocktail and lunch at the restaurant with a pool at the marina, or take a short trip to historic downtown Sanford. 
Keep an eye out for wildlife such as turtles, alligators, fish, tons of birds, and the occasional manatee!
Everything you need is provided so you don’t have to worry about forgetting something. Just bring your clothes and enjoy your stay!
description.notes:
Boat life is a little different than your everyday rental. Since it is in water the boat does move and rock slightly. 
The marina is gated and a key will be locked in a lockbox so you can come and go as you please. I am 30 minutes from the marina if needed. Another thing to keep in mind is that things are a little smaller in a boat. It’s very similar to an RV, so smaller sinks, lower ceilings (5’10” at the lowest downstairs), and a smaller hot water heater. You can enjoy a shower for about 10 minutes. There are also shower facilities at the marina.
description.neighborhood:
*Boat tree marina pool and bar is currently under construction due to hurricane damage** 

Close to downtown Historic Sanford (5 miles, 12 minute drive) that has tons of amazing restaurants in historic buildings, fun events like food truck festivals, brunches, a German festival, breweries, clubs and bars, live music, a river walk on the St John’s river that has beach vibes, a zoo where you can feed giraffes, and much much more.
Blue springs State Park is a quick 30 minute drive and is famous for being the home to hundreds of manatees in the colder months. It’s definitely worth visiting. After a walk on a beautiful boardwalk seeing the manatees I recommend going to historic downtown Deland for lunch a d shopping.
description.transit: There is a parking lot at the marina for you to park. You can also easily use Uber or Lyft, there are 2 Sunrail (our local train) stations that connect to downtown Orlando, river cruises and airboat tours, local Sanford airport. There are also lots of bike and hiking trails nearby.
description.house_rules: Please take trash with you and dispose of in the bear proof dumpster. Please do dishes to prevent bugs.

gallery.caption: The restroom trailer is just a short walk from your boat!
Each restroom has its own private shower, sink and toilet!
Paddle Boards are available for rent!

hosts.about:
I love being outdoors and traveling all over to see the world! 

I also find purpose and joy in helping people! 

My ultimate goal is to help you have the most amazing experience while visiting our homes and make it memorable, no matter the occasion!
Enjoy the outdoors and friends!

recent.comments: Perfect stay. It was like glamping (camping but fancy). Very close to all of sandusky best spots. 10/10 would recommend but bring a cooler lol.

items.comments: Perfect stay. It was like glamping (camping but fancy). Very close to all of sandusky best spots. 10/10 would recommend but bring a cooler lol.
Cute little spot especially for couples. We really enjoyed our stay, but would definitely recommend you bring some sort of fan with you as it does get quite hot in there.

This home was a fantastic place to stay.  Very convenient and only a block away from the Cedar Point entrance.  A couple great restaurants nearby that we got to see.  My only recommendation is that you come prepared with portable chargers.  I underestimated how much they could come in handy so we only brought one.  I would bring two or more next time to be safe.
Fantastic stay. The grounds were awesome and the other guest were even great! Super easy to check in and super comfortable bed on the boat. Will be returning very soon!
Cute, cozy and a awesome experience!!!

Stayed here for one night, Cidny was accommodating for late checkin and communicated clearly. Had a little trouble finding the correct houseboat (was actually the 7th one not the 5th as told). Other than the prevalence of several spiders, the place was clean, cozy and welcoming.

description.summary: Reconnect with nature in this tiny houseboat at this unforgettable escape. We are only about a 1/2 mile from Cedar Point, yet nestled on the tranquil waterfront of Sandusky. With views of breathtaking sunrises, activities all summer, a community private hot tub for adults over 18, outdoor grilling areas and much, much more, this experience will be everything you’re looking for. Nestled in the new and completely remodeled SōlStay Retreat - Marina. More pictures to come!
description.space: This is a tiny houseboat located directly on Lake Erie. Each boat is unique. You will have to walk off the boat to use the restroom facilities and other amenities.
description.access:
We encourage guests to enjoy the grilling area, the hot tub and other amenities on the property.

The hot tub is seasonal. It is available May - September.
description.notes:
Please note that the restrooms are not in the unit. There is a high end restroom trailer with individual locking restrooms that have a toilet, shower and sink. These restrooms are shared with other guests on the property.

The hot tub is not shared with the public, but is shared among other guests on the property.

Please keep in mind, Lake Erie welcomes mayflies, spiders and other insects in the warmer months. This is something that we can not control, but will always take steps to prevent best we can.
description.neighborhood:
Nestled on a small road just off Cedar Point road, we are situated in a very private secluded and safe little neighborhood.

We are about 1/2 mile from Cedar Point. There is a bar across the street and the Pipe Creek Wildlife area within walking distance with a great walking path and views!
description.transit: Getting around by car is best but we have many boating amenities on the property including paddle boards, tiki boats and many other boating rentals available. There is also a boat taxi that can bring you right up to the Cedar Point docks for a small fee.

title: Lacey Township, New Jersey

hosts.about: From the East Coast of the United States.  I enjoy many outdoor activities, traveling, and meeting people from all over the world.

recent.comments: What an awesome, unique experience. I loved the view from the living space, watching as the boats went by whole drinking my morning coffee. Such a clean, cozy, beautiful space. So relaxing and peaceful!

items.comments: What an awesome, unique experience. I loved the view from the living space, watching as the boats went by whole drinking my morning coffee. Such a clean, cozy, beautiful space. So relaxing and peaceful!
Relaxing stay, beautiful beaches nearby, great food… couldn’t have asked for anything better. Would definitely come back again!
We were so impressed with the houseboat! Just what the family needed, a beautiful and relaxing getaway. Keith is a wonderful host!
amazing!
My husband and I really enjoyed our stay on the houseboat. Super cute, quiet and relaxing. We loved it and will return.

Le chalet flottant était très propre et comme sur les photos. Le lit était confortable. Nous avons moins apprécié l'emplacement, nius savions que c'était dans une marina mais le chalet est situé côté de le pompe à essence alors pour relaxer sur le toit terrasse c'était moins agréable avec l'odeur d'essence. Il s'agit aussi d'un endroit pour faire la réparation des bateaux alors présence de plusieurs travailleurs autour du chalet et le brui des outils. Le soir le calme était de retour !

description.summary: Completely updated 1 bedroom Float Home on the beautiful Forked River!  Enjoy a glass of wine for a sunset on your rooftop deck.  Play, drink, and eat on the many party spots up and down the river.  Fall asleep to the calming sound of water right outside your window.  Includes 4 beach badges (required for 12 and up) and 2 splash pad badges (required for 12 and below) for Ocean Gate's Bay beach (8 mile, 15 minute drive).  Good WiFi!
description.space:
Well appointed Float Home with all the comforts of home.  Perfect for working from "home", for a comfortable place to stay while visiting the area, or for just getting away to enjoy a unique experience.

The Float Home (or houseboat) was built for year- round living with a powerful HVAC system to keep you toasty in the winter and cool in the summer.   

The kitchen features a full size fridge, stove, oven, microwave, toaster, Keurig coffee maker, and a full set of cookware and dishware.

The bedroom is cozy with a comfortable queen size bed, a closet, and plenty of storage shelving.  

The open floor plan of the kitchen, dining area and living rooms offer a spacious area to enjoy a meal or watch a movie.  

The large couch in the living room is a great spot for an afternoon snooze with the water right outside the 3 large sliding glass doors, or for enjoying a movie at night on the large 55" flat screen tv.

Please note, this is a floating houseboat that needs to be boarded.  Please use caution stepping on and off the Float Home.
description.access: Guests have private and complete access to the entire houseboat as well as the rooftop deck.  The Houseboat is docked in a slip in a marina next to the travel lift.  It is relatively quiet in the winter and busy in the summer.  There will be other boaters around the marina and normal marina - type activities going on.
description.notes:
This is not a party house.  So please do not plan on having a wild party here or your reservation will be canceled and will lose access to the home and your security deposit.  Please also book for the correct number of guests.  This houseboat accommodates a max of 4.

Please BRING YOUR OWN BEACH TOWELS.  Bath towels are provided but are NOT to be taken to the beach. :)

Pet Fee - $25 per pet per night.  Pets are welcome as long they are 100% house trained (meaning no accidents in the house, will not constantly bark, howl, or cry when left alone and will not scratch at the door or chew furniture) completely cleaned up after (poop outside and HAIR inside), and kept OFF the furniture (bedding, furniture, etc.).  Upon booking please inform the host that you will be bringing a pet(s) that meets the above criteria and the pet fee(s) $25/ night (plus state taxes) will be manually added to the reservation by the host.  
An additional minimum charge of $50 will be applied for each pet accident or hair.

"Events" with more than 4 people will be considered on a case by case basis and start at a minimum of 2x the nightly rate for the day of the event.
description.neighborhood: The neighborhood consists mostly of marinas.   Lots of like-minded boaters who enjoy being on the water, fishing, boating,  and the exploring.
description.transit: Having a vehicle is not necessary as there are plenty of services and establishments in walking distance including:  Diners, restaurants, bars,  ice cream parlor, convenience stores all less than 1 mile away.  Uber or taxi from the Toms River Park and Ride!
description.interaction:
Your hosts live nearby and are occasionally around, but we also work alot.  So you may see us, and we would love to meet you!  At the same time we are very respectful of your privacy and will not bother you.  We are always happy to help if you need something or have a question!

Please reach out to your hosts with any questions via the airbnb app.
description.house_rules:
HOUSE RULES-

1) No Parties.  Locals must communicate with the host before booking.  This is to prevent parties.
	
2) Occupancy limits: Be sure to book with the correct number of guests so that the price is accurate.  Unless given prior approval from the host, there cannot be any more than 4 persons in or on the property at any one point in time.  A violation of this could result in immediate removal of all guests without refund and will result in a $100/per person per day penalty.

3) Self check-in: Please inform your host of your anticipated check in and check out time so we can efficiently coordinate our turnovers.  This is a self check-in property.  You certify that you are willing and able to follow instructions that you are being provided by Airbnb through the check in guide.  You can find your check in guide in your trip Itinerary under the “Trips” tab. You also agree that you will read your house manual and check in instructions before contacting your Airbnb host with questions.  

4) Please be mindful of our neighbors during your stay. Our property's quiet hours of 10pm to 7am are in place to ensure that everyone can enjoy a peaceful night's sleep. We care a lot about maintaining good relationships with our community, so we appreciate you following our "house rules" during your stay.
We are committed to Rent Responsibly standards. This means we follow best-in-class guidelines to ensure you have a peaceful, safe and memorable stay with us.  No loud music or disruptive behavior that could bother other marina guests.

5) Fee schedule:
Pet Fee - $25 per pet per night.  Pets are welcome as long they are 100% house trained (meaning no accidents in the house, will not constantly bark, howl, or cry when left alone and will not scratch at the door or chew furniture) completely cleaned up after (poop outside and HAIR inside), and kept OFF the furniture (bedding, furniture, etc.).  Upon booking please inform the host that you will be bringing a pet(s) that meets the above criteria and the pet fee(s) will be manually added to the reservation by the host.  
An additional minimum charge of $50 will be applied for each pet accident or hair cleanup. 
Flushing Fee - $100.  Please use caution with our delicate waste system.  Do not flush anything in the toilet other than human waste and toilet paper.  All plastics, feminine products, paper towels, condoms, disposable diapers, flushable moist wipes, etc. must go in the trash can provided.
Smoking Fee - $200 per night smoking fee.  This is a non-smoking building.  Any type of smoke is prohibited.  You are welcome to smoke outside.  Please clean up your own cigarette butts and ash outside, do not just throw butts on the ground outside.  There will be a $1 fee for each cigarette butt that we have to pick up.
Late Checkout Fee - $50.  Unauthorized late check out is a $50 fee.  
Extra Cleaning Fee – Minimum $50.  Our cleaning fee is based on a “Courteous guest” that leaves the place in similar condition to which it was found.  Extra cleaning fees incurred by host from turnover crew will be the responsibility of the guest.  
Mailing/Shipping of Left Behind Items- $25 handling fee (boxing, handling and delivery to shipping vendor) plus cost of shipping.

6) No fishing or crabbing on or from houseboat.

7) No jumping or rough-housing in or on houseboat.  

8) Rooftop cushions are guests’ responsibility!  Please secure in deckbox during high winds or when left unattended.  If they are blown away by the wind during your stay they will be guests’ responsibility.

Any violation of any house rules (checking out late, leaving a mess, losing a beach badge, etc) that results in additional losses to the host for having to discount or refund the next guest will be the full responsibility of the offending guest in addition to any applicable fees.

hosts.about:
Hi we are Mike and Ashleigh,
We moved to Louisa VA in 2018 with our 3 children after finding our dream property. A Lake, Island, Streams, Woods with trails, fishing, boating, swimming, stand up paddle boarding, who could ask for anything more! The views and wildlife are amazing and we want to preserve the beauty of this property and share it with our guests!

recent.comments:
Great stay with the family on the tug boat. Even if our captain was freshly promoted, no wrong manœuvre has been accounted for !

Ashleigh and Mike have build multiple theme lodgings around a large piece of water, so each one can be in their own private world. Congrats for the imagination !


We had everything needed to really enjoy the place (kayaks, SUP, fire pit, hamacs, ..) - not to forget the boat itself
And the pet ducks coming by to check in was also part of the adventure 

All in all, great memories

items.comments:
Great stay with the family on the tug boat. Even if our captain was freshly promoted, no wrong manœuvre has been accounted for !

Ashleigh and Mike have build multiple theme lodgings around a large piece of water, so each one can be in their own private world. Congrats for the imagination !


We had everything needed to really enjoy the place (kayaks, SUP, fire pit, hamacs, ..) - not to forget the boat itself
And the pet ducks coming by to check in was also part of the adventure 

All in all, great memories
We had a wonderful time staying in the tug boat. The fishing, boating, and all the other amenities were just lovely!

We had an absolutely GREAT TIME on the boat!!! Hosts were extremely helpful and area is secluded, peaceful and quiet. Welcoming committee was on hand when we arrived (the ducks) and the fishing was great. Also spent some time exploring the local area. You can't go wrong with a stay on the tugboat. Would love to spend more time next time.

It is a serene and magical place. The houseboat itself is very comfortable and the beds and linens are so soft and cozy. We had a wonderful stay at this property and really enjoyed all it had to offer. We had extended family stay at the other properties on the lake and got to spend quality family time together for several days. The kids ran free, going from swimming, to kayaking, to fishing, back to swimming! It was the perfect getaway!! We're all planning to come back next year!

We met Ashleigh a couple of times walking the area. Nice family, pet-and-animal friendly. My wife and I went for a wedding anniversary as a getaway from the world. We haven't gone camping in a long time and this was glamping with a great access to water, fire pit, and comfortable indoor. Cooking on the fire was an adventure to get re-acquainted with and enjoyable. With enough Internet to get spotify playing our music on bluetooth speakers, a roaring fire lakeside, great drinks, food, company, we had a fabulous time in our getaway. We brought our dog. He was fine with it all and played in the water, walked the lake perimeter, and visited the animals. We did visit some local wineries, Lake Anna and the Luray caverns.
the perfect get away retreat

description.summary: Get swept away to a Magical Tug/Houseboat! Newly renovated with all modern conveniences, incl. fully stocked kitchen, full bathroom, AC, heat, & WiFi. Tug floats on an 8 acre private Lake w/ Island on 142 Wooded Acres, with 5+miles of hiking/biking trails. Enjoy Swimming, Kayaking, SUP, Fishing, Hiking, Biking, Exploring, or just relax on your own beach by the fire pit.  We also have some farm animals...Sheep, goats, turkey, ducks, chickens and rabbits that you can meet and feed.
description.space:
*Please read entire listing*
Our goal is to provide a unique adventure for guests with all the conveniences of home.
Our Custom Tugboat was brought all the way from Connecticut! Getting the boat in the water and put back together was it's own adventure! 
The Tug is at the opposite side of the Lake from our home and our Log Cabin Listing. Guests can drive over the Dam to the other side of the lake where you can park (Paved road except last 1500' is gravel/dirt 4x4 is NOT required). From there you walk a short way through a beautiful wooded trail(1/10th of a mile or 500').
We provide a yard cart to help move luggage or we are happy to help deliver your luggage for you with our ATV.(Please let us know in advance if you will need help)

Inside The Tug Boat
There is a Galley/Kitchen with cooktop, microwave, coffee pot, full-size refrigerator w/ freezer, utensils and everything for your cooking needs. We do provide coffee, tea, sugar, flour, condiments(Ketchup, Mustard, Mayo) along with spices and cooking oils. 
The main level:
Has a lovely dining area with view of the lake and kitchen, there is a Double Bed located at the stern of the boat. There is a twin air mattress located in a drawer under the main level bed that can be blown up and placed in the dining area. A small full bathroom is also located on the main level of the boat with a full shower and flushing toilet. 

The Pilot house/upper level:
Offers 360 degree views of the Lake and Forest. Accessed from a ladder and trap door within the boat or from the outside stairs. There is a comfy seating area that transforms into a California King Bed. Enjoy your coffee or cocktails on a deck overlooking the water with the best views on the property. This is the spot for stargazing, with no light pollution whatsoever. 

The Outdoor space:
Is very well lit at night by twinkle lights(can be turned off) which makes for a very romantic setting. A beach area sits just outside the Tug to play, launch boats or slowly wade into the water. Kayaks are provided and trails are right outside your door that can be taken all the way around the lake and more! There is a large fire pit with a grate that swings over for grilling over wood or charcoal. We sell dry Firewood or you can help yourself to any fallen wood that you can find. 

There is never a lifeguard on duty! Please use life vests and supervise children. By booking with us you agree to use the lake, trails, and property at your and your guests own risk.
Swimming, or any other water play is at your own risk. You are accepting responsibility of yourself and other guests when having full use of the property, trail hikes, biking, swimming...etc.

Please use your best judgement when bringing children of all ages, if you are unsure about something please ask.  
No parties.  
No outside guests allowed.  
No motorized vehicles on trails or Lake
No jumping/diving off boat - SHALLOW water


You will most likely meet our golden-doodle Mabel while hiking. She is extremely friendly but please do let us know if she's a bother. She enjoys meeting new guests and their furry companions and is wonderful with kids! 

FAQ:
WIFI? 
Wifi is provided through Starlink, which typically works great for streaming movies, music and social media.

Are Dogs allowed?
We are allowing dogs on a case by case basis. You may need to lift your dog in and out of the boat. There is a 2 step ladder down into the boat, some dogs jump in. We do charge a $125/ per pet fee that we charge in advance. The terrain is dirt/gravel so please wipe paws so we can keep the Tug beautiful and maintain our rental. Please do not allow dogs on the furniture. 

Does the boat rock?
Yes, but not much under normal circumstances. Mostly just when someone is getting on or off.

Is there Heat and A/C?
Yes, there is one window mounted A/C unit on each level and will be equipped with space heaters durning the cold months (It stays quite warm with little effort). Of course the boat will not regulate temperature as well as a home so please come prepared with warm and cold weather clothes.

How are the bugs?
The Tug boat is in the middle of the forest on a Lake, so yes there will be bugs, frogs, toads, and all that mother nature has to offer. Mosquitos are not bad at all, but bring bug spray anyway.

Can you Swim in the Lake?
Yes, our family swims here on a regular basis. About 1/2 way to the island the water is much deeper and makes for a nice swimming spot.

Is there a motor?
No, the boat cannot be moved around the Lake.

Is it safe for kids?
Please note that while we have done our best to make the Tug safe for everyone, it may not be suitable for all young children. The boat is surrounded by water and forest with many entrances and exits. Please use your best judgement as parents.

Is there running water?
Yes, there are 2- 50 Gallon tanks of water and a pump that turns on when you open a faucet. If you run out during your stay we can easily fill it back up! We fill a 1 Gallon Jug in the refrigerator for drinking. The water is potable but if you'd like to limit the use of water please bring more drinking water. We do provide marine safe/ biodegradable soap in the shower and at the kitchen sink. 

How big are the doors?
Please see our pictures and info under accessibility. There is no standard size door to use, so please ensure you are comfortable with the small doors before booking. 

Can you jump off the boat?
NO! The Tug is docked in 2-3' of water.

Is there a grill?
The fire pit has a grate that swings over the fire for grilling over wood or charcoal! It is also the perfect setup for S'Mores! You may purchase wood from us and we provide lighters and grilling tools in the Tug. 

Do you need 4 wheel drive?
No, after our paved driveway the road turns to gravel and dirt. However, it is hard packed soil and gravel and fairly easy to manage for most cars. If you are concerned, you can park on the driveway and we will help you get to the boat.

Does boat make noise?
You will hear the bilge pumps occasionally test for resistance. They are located in the hull on the front and back of the boat and it sounds like a dull groan.

*Please read all rules*
Our family lives here and we have other listings on the property, please be courteous:) 
No loud music as it disrupts the sounds of nature and possibly other guests. Noise does travel across the lake. 

There is never a lifeguard on duty! Please use life vests and supervise children. By booking with us you agree to use the lake, trails, and property at your and your guests own risk.
Swimming, Kayaking, SUP, or any other water play is at your own risk. You are accepting responsibility of yourself and other guests when having full use of the property, trail hikes, biking, fishing...etc.

Please use your best judgement when bringing children of all ages, if you are unsure about something please ask.

No parties.

No outside guests allowed.

You must be comfortable climbing a ladder to the loft.
description.interaction:
Our family lives on the property at the opposite side of the lake. We are available at most times of the day and are typically here should you need anything during your stay. We are always happy to meet and chat with guests, but understand many guests come here for privacy. 
Our small farm has free range chickens, ducks, and rabbits as well as sheep and goats. We love sharing the animals with guests, please let us know if you would like to visit and feed them.
description.house_rules:
By booking you agree to all house rules:
We supply our own renter agreement and waiver that you must e-sign after booking on Airbnb. We're happy to provide a copy prior to booking. You must provide a real email address and phone after booking, so that we can contact you directly without messaging through Airbnb for important/emergency matters.

No Outside Guests
No Indoor smoking
No Outside Boats
No Motorized Boats, or Vehicles on Lake or Trails (ATVs, Dirt bikes Etc)
No Hunting
Fishing is Catch and Release please!

Use of of this Agritourism Property, including, but not limited to the Lake, Pond, Trails, Farm, and Animals is at your own risk. There is never a lifeguard on duty. You are responsible for you and your guests safe use of the listing and property.

recent.comments: I had an absolutely great experience! Worth every penny!

items.comments: I had an absolutely great experience! Worth every penny!
Airbnb descriptions and photos were accurate.  Prior reviews were spot on.  Great view!

We absolutely loved our stay! The house boat was beautiful and very well kept. The rooftop was a really wonderful part of the place. There are a lot of different bars and restaurants within waking distance, which we really loved. Our stay was perfect and we can't wait to return when we have the opportunity.
Super clean and nice ambiance

We had such a great time at Cass-Away. The place looked exactly like the photos, if not better in person. The rooftop deck was my favorite. Such a great spot to catch the sunset and watch the boats go by. The couch was also super comfy for our movie nights. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Just fun and very good

description.summary:
Kent Narrows Rentals welcomes you aboard Cass-Away! A 640sqft luxury getaway in the Kent Narrows. Fully equipped with a living room, kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, and a magnificent view from the rooftop deck! With 9 bars/restaurants within walking distance, you can get a taste of what the eastern shore has to offer. Minutes from the Bay Bridge and a short drive to Annapolis, D.C., St. Michael’s, and Ocean City.

NO Fishing/Crabbing on property! 

Check our website for more info!
description.space: Don’t forget to bring your binoculars, the views are magnificent! Unfortunately, the fridge does not have an ice maker. You will need to bring your own ice. Due to wind and movement, their may be some movement of the houseboat.
description.notes:
Wanna come by boat? We have a 50ft x 16ft slip available for rent right next to the houseboat! Electric can be provided if needed. Please reach out for pricing and further info! 
We are restricting pets and children under 10 years old on the houseboat due to insurance reasons.
description.neighborhood: Cass-Away is in the heart of the Kent Narrows. If you find yourself on the rooftop deck, you’ll be amazed at the amount of boat traffic and entertainment you’ll find.
description.transit: The Kent Narrows is the perfect getaway for food junkies and dancers! With 8 bars/restaurants within walking distance, you can park your car when you first arrive and not have to get back in it until you leave. Walking distance to everything. Keep your eye out, there may be a golf cart shuttle running around on the weekends to transport you from place to place.
description.interaction:
We are just a text or phone call away if you find you need anything. We are less then a 5 minute drive away.
Please check out our website for more info!

https://kentnarrowsrentals.com
description.house_rules:
Absolutely NO Fishing or Crabbing from the houseboat or anywhere on the property. 

Please NO heels on the rooftop deck. 

NO smoking on the rooftop or inside the houseboat. Please smoke out in the parking lot.
