Absolutely NO fishing or crabbing from the houseboat or dock

Please lower and secure umbrellas at the end of the night. 

Please put the cushions down in the living room at the end of the night so they do not blow away.  

Due to insurance reasons, we require our renters to sign a separate stay agreement prior to their arrival. The Agreement highlights the rules specific to the houseboat that AirBnB doesn't cover

name: Kick back at the Slackin Shack!
title: Swansboro, North Carolina

recent.comments: We throughly enjoyed our stay. The boat was a new experience for us and it was the perfect way to spend our vacation in Swansboro. It’s a sweet little nook sound side. Full of charm and history. Mikey was a great host. We will be back!

items.comments: We throughly enjoyed our stay. The boat was a new experience for us and it was the perfect way to spend our vacation in Swansboro. It’s a sweet little nook sound side. Full of charm and history. Mikey was a great host. We will be back!

It was a great adventure, comfortable, can’t beat the views. The top deck was great! Saw the Super full moon come up, the rocket that went up from VA, and the International Space Station! Easy to get to Emerald Isle area and the Pine Knoll Shores Aquarium. Highly recommend and will be going back!
Awesome find! Place is beautiful and incredibly peaceful. Bathroom is a challenge, but what do you expect you’re on a boat!

It was a lot of fun to stay at the Slackin’ Shack. Mikey was very responsive and flexible which was appreciated. The boat has everything you need to be comfy. The area was beautiful and the live music nearby was a lot of fun! If we’re ever in the area again we would definitely stay again!

We surprised our daughters with this awesome houseboat vacation, and they were STOKED! This place is in pristine condition and we couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Many memories were made that I know will never be forgotten! Thanks for having us, Mikey!

We had a wonderful stay at the Slackin Shack. The boat was perfectly clean, organized and we found everything we needed. Mikey was a great host. We enjoyed watching the sunrise and listening to live music from the top of the boat.  Swansboro is a great little costal town with lots of restaurants and shops. The boat is perfectly situated in walking distance to everything.  We would love to comeback for another visit. Thank you!

description.summary: Welcome aboard the "Slackin Shack" - our beautiful handcrafted houseboat, located right on the water in the heart of Historic Downtown Swansboro! This charming and unique home is the perfect way to experience the beauty of the North Carolina coast in a truly special way. The interior has been fully updated with modern amenities for a comfortable stay, while the outside spaces allow you to take in the breathtaking beauty of the waterway and scenery in style.  Escape to the Crystal Coast today!
description.space:
This updated 35-foot houseboat with an open layout is a perfect floating home for those who want to enjoy the water without sacrificing comfort and convenience. The houseboat has a classic design, with a clean white exterior and large windows that let in plenty of natural light while offering picturesque views of the water.

The main living area of the houseboat is an open concept saloon, with a convertible dinette that can be transformed into an extra sleeping space if needed. The living area also includes a fully stocked longitudinal galley (a kitchen for your landlubbers), complete with a mini-fridge, propane stove/oven, and plenty of counter space for meal preparation.

The houseboat features two sleeping areas - one with a queen-sized futon bed and the other with a twin bed, providing plenty of space for up to four people to sleep comfortably. The head (bathroom) contains a separate stall shower with hot water, electric toilet, and all the amenities you need to feel at home.  The head is smaller than what you might be used too but is efficiently designed to make best use of the space available.

Step outside onto either of two decks and you'll be greeted with stunning views of the waterway and the surrounding scenery.  Both decks are furnished with inviting seating that offers plenty of room for relaxation and entertainment. The upper deck is ideal for soaking up the sun, while the lower deck provides a shady retreat from the heat. Whether you're enjoying a cup of coffee in the morning, taking in a picturesque sunset, or stargazing at night, the decks provide the perfect spot to relax and unwind.
description.notes:
In addition to its prime location on the water, our houseboat is also just a short drive away from some of the area's most popular attractions, including Hammocks Beach State Park and the vibrant beaches of Emerald Isle. With endless opportunities for outdoor adventure and relaxation right at your fingertips, this is truly the ultimate vacation destination.

The houseboat does not leave the dock.    Happy to help arrange a boat rental to get out and explore the local waters or a private charter with an experienced captain to help you find the best spots!
description.neighborhood:
Historic Downtown Swansboro is a charming and picturesque area located in Swansboro, North Carolina. The town was founded in 1783 and the historic downtown area still retains much of its original charm and character.

The main street of the downtown area is lined with quaint, historic buildings that house a variety of shops, restaurants, and art galleries. The buildings feature a mix of architectural styles, including traditional Southern styles and Victorian influences. Many of the buildings have been beautifully restored, and visitors can enjoy strolling down the street and taking in the sights.

In addition to the shops and restaurants, Historic Downtown Swansboro is also home to several historic landmarks, including the Swansboro Historic District, which is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. Other notable landmarks include the Hammocks Beach State Park, the Ward-Adams House, and the Bicentennial Park.

The town is also known for its beautiful waterfront, which offers stunning views of the White Oak River. Visitors can take a stroll along the waterfront, enjoy a picnic, or even rent a kayak or paddleboard to explore the river.

Overall, Historic Downtown Swansboro is a charming and peaceful destination that offers a unique blend of history, culture, and natural beauty.
description.transit: All of Historic Swansboro is accessible by walking from the houseboat.  Free parking is available on the street in designated spaces.  Expect more traffic during the Summer months and holidays.
description.interaction: Always available to help our guests, don’t hesitate to reach out via message or call before or during your stay.

description.summary:
(2009 River rd)

hosts.about:
Hi I'm Will! Marketing Strategist at Historic Downtown Sanford® the brand, I'm  passionate about good food, drink & music and excited at the opportunity to showcase our amazing destination Historic Downtown Sanford, Florida to you! 

As the publisher of the local Visitors Guide and co-owner of a local Tours & Experiences Operator,  I enjoy giving recommendations to our award-winning restaurants, craft breweries, gastropubs, theaters, and our extremely popular street parties and events. I look forward to hosting you in this unique property 'The Famous Tiny Houseboat'!

recent.comments: Thank you Will.  You were easy to work with and accommodating.  I have and will continue to refer people to the Tiny Houseboat in Sanford.

items.comments: Thank you Will.  You were easy to work with and accommodating.  I have and will continue to refer people to the Tiny Houseboat in Sanford.
Will was a great host. Downtown Dharma was adorable. The town of Sanford is lovely. Our whole experience was wonderful.
The property was fantastic and we could not have asked for a better host!
The place is very cute! And very clean! Fun to explore this town and really enjoyed the art festival.

The Tiny Houseboat, and Will, are as great as you would imagine from the listing and reviews. The boat itself didn't feel tiny in any way and had everything we could think of needing. The stairs to the loft might pose a little problem for some, or for taking up luggage, but we were only there for 3 days, so we staged our clothes and backpacks in the downstairs mudroom so the stairs would be more manageable.  We visited Monday through Thursday and just a heads up, most of the shops and restaurants are closed on Monday. We found Henry's Depot to be one of the few spots open on Monday and were hugely surprised at the great choices. Will recommended the Hawaiian BBQ at Sweet and Salty and he was right!  My husband and I eat a plant based diet and from the research we had done of the restaurants before coming we didnt think we would find Vegan/Vegetarian options but we were wrong! The Huli Huli Tofu was incredible!!! LoJax had 3 choices for vegan pizzas.  Great town, great host, great stay!

We enjoyed our stay. It was close to a lot of good restaurants so we really didn’t need the golf cart. Only downside for us was the stairs going up to the bedroom. Would have been good to have a railing or something.  Everything else is perfect, just as shown on the website. St. John’s Steak and Seafood was excellent and within a short walk.

description.summary:
The Famous Tiny Houseboat named ‘Downtown Dharma’ is a gorgeous floating houseboat parked at the Monroe Harbour Marina in beautiful Historic Downtown Sanford, Florida just 20 minutes North of Orlando FL. 

It was made famous after being built on HGTV’s Tiny House Hunters TV show in Season 4, Episode 12.

Over 500 sq ft, entire house on the water, full bath, kitchen, living room, bedroom, chill space (extra couch for tiny person) and porch.

Super unique and cool space you're sure to love!
description.space:
Please note it's a luxury floating house on water and it moves slightly with the wind.

Also remember it's a "tiny home" ... book accordingly. :)

IMPORTANT: Never leave entrance or porch doors open for too long as bugs will creep in quickly.

hosts.about:
I live to innovate and develop building and lifestyle techniques that enable our labor to yield healthy water, food, shelter and energy using as little resource as possible. An ever aspiring minimalist, artist through and through, dreamer and mover. Always asking questions and looking to explore what's going on! Passionate about mud (of all kinds), treks in the forests and hills, and good company.

My home is an eccentric work of art, renovated purposefully to accomodate your AirBnB experience. 

I live only with my plants, am an avid sprouter, and have an awesome vermiculture setup that ties it all together in an urban permaculture way.

All questions welcomed..

My name is Bonnie and I am the captain and co-captain of the River Den, the River Zen, The Nellie, The Dragon and the Cove (4 season chalet).  

 I'm the daughter of a québécois log driver and I grew up on the river in Low Qc, driving boats and living on islands. I am passionate about artistic building  and designing dens. My current project is the completion of an island meditation retreat on the island of Oddiyana.

I have been an entrepreneur since the age of 19 and plan on continuing to explore my creativity through inspiring and creative business endeavours of designing and creating sacred spaces fit for kings and queens.

A perfect place for a moment of tranquility. Brings together a fun little nature adventure with intimate surroundings. The house boat is very well designed, the minimalist aesthetic is beautiful and has everything you need.

The houseboat was lovely, peaceful and secluded which was what we were looking for! The hosts were very responsive and accommodating. There are a few downsides that could be reflected in the price per night: 1. There is very little air circulation and it was very hot in the houseboat. There is no shade on the boat - we did go during a heatwave but we could not spend our second night there. 2. This was very much “glamping” and all the amenities are such as what you’d use to camp so the price felt a bit high in that regard 3. description.summary: The Nellie is a four-season houseboat, located in the wilderness of the Gatineau River; a boat-in location in summer, accessed from our home parking 2kms from the boat, or via two public boat launches 10km away. We offer canoe rentals and ferry options below. Before winter, Nellie returns home to freeze into the ice; providing access by foot 30m from our home parking, and electric heat. She has a bucket toilet on board, a summer outhouse, and winter access to our shared indoor basement bathroom.
description.space:
During summer, The Nellie is nestled into a quiet cove on the Gatineau River 2km from our home parking, and is accessed by boat. During winter she returns to our mainland home to freeze into the ice 30m from our parking allowing access by foot. She is well insulated and remains cozy with her windows closed during colder spring and fall days nestled in her cove, and is heated electrically only during the winter months when moored next to our home. During the winter months, Nellie will only be available to rent when our house "Manitou Cove" is not rented. Please as us via Airbnb message before you send a request to book if she is available for your dates.

The Nellie is 24’ long, and the cabin is the perfect size for a couple. There is a majestic queen bed over the water, including a full set of clean linens and towels for each guest. There are two substantial duvets for colder nights.

In the warmer season The Nellie is only accessible by boat! She remains anchored to shore in a secluded 
cove with a quaint sandy beach. Guests cannot drive the boat. Boat rentals, rides and guided adventures are available for various fees. See below and feel free to inquire for details... 

She is off grid, with small battery powered lights and a USB phone charger. Cell phones work fairly well, including data. We provide drinking water in 18L  jugs and basic cooking and dining supplies for two people  (plates, bowls, silverware, coffee cups, glasses, pot with lid, cast iron pan, spatula, colander, chopping knife, cutting board, wooden spoon, coffee Bodum, and a 2 burner stove with propane included). We stock coffee, tea, maple syrup, cooking oil, salt and pepper for you to use as needed. Please bring your own food, cooler and ice if desired, flashlights, batteries, warm clothes, rain clothes, etc...

You can canoe, swim and fish right from her deck!
description.access:
Please choose from one of he following options for getting to the boat:

A) 0$ extra: Bring your own motor boat or canoe to access the Nellie. Motor boats launch from one of two public boat launches 10km from the Nellie. IF YOU HAVE YOUR OWN CANOE or non-motorized boat; you are welcome to park at our home and boat launch 2 kms from the Nellie. We provide a map to the Nellie via digital image.

B) 50$ extra: Parking and canoe rental.  We provide a map to the Nellie via digital image, as well as a labeled laminated map and compass in the canoe. It is around 2 km and approximately a 40-60 minute paddle from our parking to the Nellie.

C) 120$ extra: Park at our home and book a 
round trip ferry ride on one of our motor boats, and rent our canoe for use during your stay. We coordinate a meeting time at our waterfront home parking, and drive you to the Nellie in one of our motor boats, leave you with a canoe, map and compass, and arrange a pickup time to come back and get you at the end of your stay.

items.comments: This is not just a hotel/place to stay it is a immersive experience riding the dingy to the boat was so awesome but be careful of manatee there were a few I got to swim with! The boat launch you park at was only a ~5 minutes drive to St. Armand’s Circle with lots of great restaurants, bars, and shopping. We had great meals The Old Salty Dog and New Pass Grill and Bait Shop which are right down the road from the launch. We definitely recommend renting the paddle boards. We had manatees swim right up to us while we were on them! This was the best/most fun Airbnb we’ve ever booked. We had an amazing time and can’t wait to book again!

We just love this houseboat so much, it’s always an incredible stay. Super easy to get to the boat with the dingy, and the hosts are super nice and accommodating. Such a unique experience! The manatees love the boat and always come around to say hi, they are so sweet!

Our 2nd stay at the Floating Oasis was just as lovely as the first.  Easy, breezy check-in/check-out and the hosts were always quick to respond.  We love the private, peaceful location of the house boat, surrounded by nature and wildlife.  It’s a very special place.  Thank you again, Diona and Eli!

We live local in Tampa and are so glad we found the floating oasis house boat! Truly an experience of a life time. We saw manatees, egrets, dolphins, fish, pelicans. One of the most unique airbnbs we have ever done. Really awesome to take a little dingy to the houseboat, which completely surrounded by water. Waking up on the water and grilling dinner watching the sunset at night was so relaxing. It felt like glamping on the water. We can’t wait to come back again soon. Do not hesitate to book this—it’s life changing!!!! Just do it!

My husband and I had an amazing time on this trip! It was so much fun and relaxation in one place. I am so greatful for Diona and her husband for helping us and treating us like family. It was an adventure we will love to take again and have recommended many friends and family to give it a go as well! 10/10 recommend!

description.summary:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE LISTING BEFORE BOOKING. 
The Floating Oasis is a 4 season houseboat, moored on the Sarasota Bay. This dream boat is designed by an architect with AC, shower, and electricity. There is a cozy full size bed and lounge chairs on the balcony for year round stays, bbq, and dry composite toilet on board.
description.space:
The Floating Oasis is a 4 season (fully insulated) houseboat. The boat is 30ft long with 23ft of inside cabin space. The boat has a cozy bed with surrounding windows to watch the sunset and sunrise. The boat has two doors, the front door for the patio and access to the balcony and the back door for fresh air from the sea next to the bed. There is a full turf top deck, perfect for suntanning, star gazing, or yoga! The boat comes with 3 circular windows with netting to open for more fresh air without letting any bugs in and many more rustic features! 

There are two 120v batteries and solar panels and a generator for electricity and AC on the boat. There are two USB charging ports connected to our solar system which you can use to charge your phones. THERE IS CELL SERVICE ON THE HOUSEBOAT. 

On board is a dry composite toilet and a shower with hot water that lasts up to 5 minutes with maximum heat afterwards, the water is lukewarm and still bearable to shower. If you wait another hour or two there will be more hot water. 

There is a lock on the boat from the outside if you need to leave to go to town. (It’s a very quiet and safe place). You can also lock it from the inside. 

THE BOAT WILL BE MOORED AND GUESTS CANNOT DRIVE IT. 


Water shuttle: 
This Floating Oasis is moored out in the bay away from land and can only be accessed by boat. We offer a 9-foot dinghy enough for two people and luggage. The dinghy is a powered boat to get you to and from the houseboat. You will be ferrying yourself to the houseboat in the dinghy, which is about a 10-15 min ride. Expect some wind and waves. We will meet at the ramp to check-in.

There is free overnight parking available at the boat ramp. 

The boat is on the Sarasota Bay, great for paddle boarding and fishing. Dolphin sighting is almost guaranteed.

We supply:
2 gallons of purified drinking water.
(Bring more if you wish)
Coffee and tea (no creamer) 
Oil, salt, pepper, sugar and some spices. 
BBQ and utensils for BBQ.
55 gallon Cooler (you may bring ice to store food)
Plates, bowls, utensils, pans, cutting boards, cups and mugs.
Biodegradable soap and shampoo.
Bug spray and sunscreen. 
Restroom essentials 
Cleaning supplies



Please note:
This is not your typical stay. While efforts have been made to preserve the modern conveniences we’ve become accustomed to on land, some of them must be sacrificed while still other conveniences must be accepted. (Limited power and water, no wifi)

Air conditioning is installed but is recommended to only be used if you intend to stay inside as it requires the generator to be running in order to be used, which is loud outside. Please keep in mind that it takes up to an hour of run time to bring the temperature down inside the boat once the AC has been started, depending on how hot it is outside. 

You must bring food and drinks with you just like camping. 


Safety:
-We provide 4 life jackets.
-First aid kit.
-Air horn and whistle.
-Fire extinguisher
-flashlights
description.access: Full access to the entire boat.
description.interaction: We are available to offer help throughout your stay and we can keep in touch either through Airbnb or if it’s an emergency you can call us as well.

recent.comments: If you are traveling across the country you really should check out Will’s river boat on the Ohio River. I will definitely be back.

items.comments: If you are traveling across the country you really should check out Will’s river boat on the Ohio River. I will definitely be back.

If you are looking for a UNIQUE getaway.....look no further!!!  We wanted a little break and I found this!!!  Will and Co-Host Lori run a private marina in a wonderful spot on the Ohio River.  The boat is absolutely amazing!!  There are two floors.  The upper floor has a small living room that leads outside to a deck.  The bottom floor has a great little kitchen where we made breakfast every morning.  Then a bathroom and bedroom.  The bed is very comfy and we both slept so well it was unbelievable.  There is a sitting area at the front of the boat where we hung out just taking in the scenery and other boats going by.  It is calm, peaceful, relaxing and so unusual!!  Not too mention...this is a working boat!!  Just to see the paddle wheel going is amazing!!  Will and Lori live on a nearby boat and in between is a common area that is under cover.  It has an ice maker and a grill is available for your use.  Will and Lori were awesome hosts!!  We def will be back!!!

This gem on the water was so fun! The two levels are well thought out and the view of the river and bridge are beautiful. Will and Lori were helpful hosts and the communal lounge space worked out great. We would definitely recommend and stay again. Thanks.

I stayed for one night only, wish it could have been 5.
Great space and setting, Peaceful to sleep onboard again.(ex USN)
Will is a very friendly and helpful host. I will be back
Slightly cramped for a big guy like me, but I’m adaptable

Beautiful space!! Highly recommend 😀
Host was even available and  happy to run to the store for me.
Early morning and evenings are the best times to relax
On the deck watching the barges, fish and resident duck 🦆. She loves chips!
This is a very friendly atmosphere and we were lucky enough to have some live music 🎶 
Much needed mini vacation!!

description.summary: You won’t forget the peaceful surroundings of this rustic destination.
description.space: The sternwheeler is docked on the Ohio river in moundsville WV. its charming and cozy for a weekend stay. it sits on the river bank below the moundsville walking trail. go explore local attractions restaurants or just do some fishing from her bow
description.access: there is a shared grilling area with seating. fridge freezer and ice machine
description.notes: There are steep steps to get to the docks. If you have bags to carry it is easier to walk down the cement ramp.
description.interaction: Someone will be available at all times to answer any questions to make your stay comfortable
description.house_rules:
all children under the age of 16 years of age MUST where a life jacket at all times when outside of living space. lifejackets are available upon request. 
NOTE: lifejackets must be worn when entering or exiting the docks .

name: Harbour House (House Boat) on Cambridge Creek
title: Cambridge, Maryland

gallery.caption: The house boat is the longest boat in the picture! Check out the blue heron on the piling!
House Boat Porch Living!
Boat house TV! Our TV is hooked up to an old school Antena that gets local channels! Or bring DVDs for an onboard movie night!
Lots of Storage Sapce!!!!
Open Concept living area!!!
Living space privacy!!!
Lots of counter space for your groceries and snacks!!!
Storage space for your things!!!!
Lots of dockside parking!

The neighboring dock is full of workboats, working the water for fish, crabs, oysters, clams, and more! They bring in their morning catch around 2pm. You can see them unloading their catch from the house boat!
We have Ruku! Connect your phone's hot spot/internet with our Ruku!  Watch You Tube, login to your own internet TV or Amazon Prime TV account!!!!
Boat entrance off the fingerling pier. Steps with rail are anchored on the boat to help you board during low tides! The buoy can be pulled up to bring the boat closer to the pier for boarding.
Xfinity WiFi hot spot is avaliable on th house boat, so if you have a comcast/xfinity account ypu cam login for free. If not you have the option of these passes. Or use your own data on your phone!
Only 4.6 miles away! Only an 8 minute drive or a 22 minute beautiful bike ride!
Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historic Park and Visitors Center is only 3.9 miles away (8 minute drive).
Located on the Iron Man and Eagle Man Bike Race course! Only 8.2 miles to the finish line!
There are all kinds of shopping and attraction options close by the house boat!  There is a copy of this in the boat for your reference!!!
There are all kinds of dining options close by the house boat!  There is a copy of this in the boat for your reference!!!

hosts.about: Hello from Lisa Marshall!  My husband and I are Eastern Shore Natives!  We grew up, work, and live in Dorchester County! We too love to travel and and can't wait to see you in beautiful Cambridge, MD!

recent.comments: Lisa was an amazing host and her home was fabulous! Would highly recommend and would absolutely come back!

items.comments: Lisa was an amazing host and her home was fabulous! Would highly recommend and would absolutely come back!
Wish we could have booked for a longer stay. Very peaceful.
I really enjoyed my stay in Lisa’s houseboat. Such a cool, fun space, in peaceful surroundings. I’d definitely stay again!
Lovely, peaceful stay! Lisa was super communicative and jumped right in to help when we had an issue (our fault) with the key.

Thank you to the host for making the stay INCREDIBLE. Always quick to communicate and accommodate, I would highly recommend you stay here for a memorable experience. Small touches including well labeled things that needed explanation, to providing everything needed for a great cup of coffee - Lisa provided a great spot to stay.
It was an awesome stay and Lisa was such a great host! Location was right in the middle of so many fun places!

description.summary: This is your opportunity to truly embrace living on the water! This remodeled house boat is the perfect way to make your next getaway unforgettable! Enjoy your floating private suite featuring an open concept kitchen living area, full bathroom,  beautiful 360 degree waterfront views, shade deck and roof top sun deck! Enjoy watching local watermen unload their morning catch around 2pm. Within walking distance of downtown and shopping! Central to all local attractions, in the heart of Cambridge!
description.space:
The House boat is at 35 foot Catamaran Cruiser located in a small harbor with a mix of pleasure and work boats of waterman who are commercial fishing, crabbing, and oystering.  It is located next to the gated community of Deep Harbour.  Yes, this is how they spell it, which inspired the name of our boat, Harbour House!  The boat has everything you need to be comfortable and feel relaxed during your stay in Cambridge! There is AC and heat onboard! The boat will remain docked during your stay!
The Trenton Street Boat Dock is home to many local waterman and local boaters!    The boat is within walking distance to local seafood dining, shopping, and waterfront parks!
Only 5 minutes away from the Hyatt Regency Chesapeake Bay!
Cambridge is centrally located on the Eastern Shore of Maryland!  The perfect spot to stay if you want to explore the shore!  This is the perfect home base for Eastern Shore day trips to Kent Island, Easton, Tilghman Island, St Michaels, Ocean City, and Assateague!
Dorchester County is also the perfect place to go Eastern Shore "Island Hopping" and visit Hoopers, Taylors, Elliotts, Tilghman, and Kent Island for the weekend!
description.access: Guests have access to the entire house boat.  The boat will stay docked during your stay! (The house boat is very difficult to drive.  It is kind of like driving a tractor trailer when compare to road driving, LOL!)
description.notes:
There is a xfinity/comcast wifi hot spot that can be accessed on the boat if you have an account!  There is a Ruku TV, so you can connect your own internet from your phone to the TV and watch any internet TV subscription that you have!  Or you can sit back and watch You Tube! There is also an old school antenna that gets three local channels!
The boat rises and falls with the tide!  When the tide is high the boat is nearly level with the dock!  When the tide is low you will have to take a big step down to the boat or use the ladder attached to the dock to lower yourself down the boat!  This is certainly unique to boat living!
description.neighborhood: The small harbor is located in downtown Cambridge next to a gated community.
description.transit: If you want to explore downtown Cambridge you can do so by foot or bike.  Of course you can also travel downtown or out of town via car.
description.interaction: Feel free to call, text or message through Airbnb.
description.house_rules: Please do the dishes prior to departing! Thank You!

hosts.about:
I am the Eco-Tourism Manager for Baywater Landing Marina in Snow Hill, Maryland. 
I love birding, kayaking, and hiking.
I also love a good night on the town!

recent.comments:
If you’re looking for a place to disconnect from the stress of life and reset, Jolly is the place to do it.  Kayaks, paddle boards, grills and a fire pit are all at your disposal. The kitchen has a very convenient fridge, microwave and coffee maker, should you choose to bring your favorite beverages and snacks. The simplicity of this place is what makes beautiful. 
Side note: I have big dogs and they were allowed and had the best time of their lives. 24 hrs later and they’re still exhausted.
Lovely and kind hosts. Lovely one day staycation! Thanks much! ☺️
Ps- check out the wine bar in local Snow Hill. It’s extraordinary!

items.comments:
If you’re looking for a place to disconnect from the stress of life and reset, Jolly is the place to do it.  Kayaks, paddle boards, grills and a fire pit are all at your disposal. The kitchen has a very convenient fridge, microwave and coffee maker, should you choose to bring your favorite beverages and snacks. The simplicity of this place is what makes beautiful. 
Side note: I have big dogs and they were allowed and had the best time of their lives. 24 hrs later and they’re still exhausted.
Lovely and kind hosts. Lovely one day staycation! Thanks much! ☺️
Ps- check out the wine bar in local Snow Hill. It’s extraordinary!
Beautiful setting and we especially enjoyed the kayak rentals.

This was my 2nd time stay here with my family, and we enjoyed everything, etc....
from the boat house to kaky, going crabbing and fishing, the fire pit, we even order steam crabbing them as well. What I love most is we don't have to pack much, just clothes and personal and food. Everything was provided the grill, firewood, crabbing net's, kakys,  and life jackets. it was a nice quiet place to unwind. WE WILL BE BACK..........

My family had a short but excellent stay. This was our first time staying on a boat and it was a great experience, my daughter loved it! We really enjoyed the scenery, my husband liked that he was able to fish, and the nearby town was very cute and great food! 5 stars all around.

This was a very cool experience. The property and the ability to build a fire and hang-out outside was awesome. It should be noted that the second bedroom downstairs had a very low ceiling and our taller guest was not able to get down there, so just be aware it’s best for kids.
Beautiful and fun stay

description.summary: This houseboat is newly renovated; and that's just how you'll feel staying here. Baywater Landing offers a cozy, coastal style that is warm yet minimalistic. This houseboat has a master suite, lower second bedroom (and 2nd full bath), and 4 outside deck areas to enjoy! Just 30 minutes from Ocean City, Assateague Island, and Chincoteague Island, this is the epicenter of everything coastal! A firepit in the sand just outside your door round out everything you'll need for a stress-free vacation.
description.space: Baywater Landing Marina is an active space with watermen and pleasure cruisers, as well as seafood customers during hours of operation. Let us know if you'd like to enjoy fresh crabs or oysters during your stay! There is a patio, grill, and kayak launch site available.
description.access: You are welcome to hang on the beach, patio, and in the grass. You may explore the marina, but please, no swimming. There is a public beach just up the road to enjoy the Chincoteague bay's water with the family.
description.notes: 2 dogs are typically on site. They are extremely docile and love greeting our guests!
description.neighborhood: During business hours, Staff, watermen, pleasure cruisers, and seafood customers are often moving around the marina. At night, Only Houseboat guests on on premise. Very quiet at night, mostly farmland and wetlands.
description.house_rules:
Swimming is not permitted at the marina. 
Please pick up after your pet.
Dispose of butts and trash properly around the property.

name: Modern stationary houseboat villa in Wilmington NC
title: Wilmington, North Carolina

recent.comments: This place is worth every penny. We had a fantastic weekend here. Walkable from downtown, beautiful marina views and an amazing house. Jeannette was super helpful and made our trip even better. I cannot recommend it enough.

items.comments: This place is worth every penny. We had a fantastic weekend here. Walkable from downtown, beautiful marina views and an amazing house. Jeannette was super helpful and made our trip even better. I cannot recommend it enough.
Absolutely amazing hosts! The place was exactly like the pictures. Jeannette and John were extremely helpful when arriving. A must stay and is a save for future trips!
I would definitely stay there again, and I absolutely recommend this place for the picky person, extremely clean!!!!   Location outstanding!!!
We loved this houseboat!!!
Beautiful getaway weekend with friends. Immaculate houseboat with all the amenities. It was beyond amazing!

Has to be the best AirBnb we've ever stayed in!  Absolutely top of the line in all aspects but still so homey and comfortable. Perfect location and walkable to downtown restaurants, shops, entertainment and sightseeing.   We'll definitely be back!

description.summary: Amazing over-the-water home. Walkable to Wilmington's finest. See more about the home and neighborhood at staydockside.com.  Located in Port City Marina. Brand new modern dockside villa home is anything but a houseboat. This unique home is centrally located between historic Wilmington and the new Waterfront Park and Amphitheater, with a six-minute walk to the bars and restaurants downtown. Unique opportunity to stay literally ON the water in Wilmington.
description.space: Amazing views of the Cape Fear River, the beautiful yachts that visit Port City Marina and 360 degree views from decks in the front and back of home. Actual décor for this Strands Premier home will be modern. Check out staydockside.com for details and progress.
description.access: You will have full access to the entire home, the pier and the private community park when completed.
description.notes: This community is in a marina setting.  Care should be taken for young children and you should expect to do some walking.
description.neighborhood: An easy and safe walk along the lighted boardwalk to downtown Wilmington.  Check out staydockside.com for up to date information and area exploration ideas.
description.transit: Parking for one car is provided in a reserved area of the marina property. It's a short walk to the houseboat community and there's a spot to drop your bags and provisions, plus marina carts to carry items. Overnight paid parking for additional cars next door.
description.interaction: You have the entire houseboat home to yourself.  We are not onsite, but live nearby if we're needed.
description.house_rules: The community strictly enforces a 10 pm noise ordinance.

recent.comments: Boat was comfortable and felt private. As described. Great weekend getaway.

items.comments: Boat was comfortable and felt private. As described. Great weekend getaway.

It was our first time staying on a houseboat and I must say we will be doing it again. It was nice for a relaxing weekend getaway. Donny was very responsive when it came to our questions/concerns. Great location to catch a beautiful sunset…..due to weather we didn’t get to see the sunrise 😔
Great Boat and location! Good spot for one or two people to enjoy a nice get away. Beautiful views right on the water and a short walk from downtown. Great price and comfortable stay.

We had a wonderful stay.  Donny met us at the dock to check us in and let us know how some of the things on the boat worked.  He also let us know where to walk to go to different restaurants downtown.  The boat reminded us of a camper or RV. We loved it!

The boat was exactly what we were expecting and was perfect just to hang out at before the concert we were attending and come back to sleep. We had a great time hanging out on the outside patio sections on the boat overlooking the water. Host was also super nice and very responsive to all of our questions. Overall, had a great time and would stay again if we’re in the area!

The boat is great for a shorter stay than what I intended. It’s a comfortable space but I just didn’t do well with the rocking when there was weather. I recommend for a short term stay.  Donny is an excellent host.

description.summary:
I have a 36 foot houseboat with gorgeous views of sunrises and sunsets on the Savannah River from the back deck and mid-deck. Downtown restaurants are within a quarter mile. Gated entry. Located in Augusta, Ga. Kitchen includes sink, toaster oven, microwave, mini fridge, utensils, coffee pot. Sit on the back deck and watch the river and boats go by, or front deck and watch the  bike and foot traffic. Two kayaks are available, with paddles and life jackets.

Available for extended stay Dec-Feb
description.space: You can be in the boat and watch the river and boats go by or on the water in a kayak. A gas grill is on the back deck. River walk is a one mile pedestrian and bike trail there at the marina
description.notes: Bear in mind that a houseboat isn’t like a motel room. You have the amenities of a motel but on a reduced scale. You also have solitude and you’re surrounded by nature, along with a beautiful view and colorful sunsets and sunrises. If you want all the creature comforts, a houseboat might not be for you. If you want a unique experience this is where you need to be.
description.interaction: I am on the same dock in my cabin cruiser so there will be no problem contacting me in person, by phone, or e-mail

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: Amazing place with beautiful decor and calming colors. Being on the water and close to the heart of downtown was really nice and convenient.  So many restaurant choices and places to visit within walking distance.  I probably wouldn’t pay that price again, however, it was a nice experience and I wished I could have stayed longer!

items.comments: Amazing place with beautiful decor and calming colors. Being on the water and close to the heart of downtown was really nice and convenient.  So many restaurant choices and places to visit within walking distance.  I probably wouldn’t pay that price again, however, it was a nice experience and I wished I could have stayed longer!
Awesome experience!! Loved the boathouse and listening to live music from the balcony at night overlooking the water.

We came to see a show at LiveOak and the location is perfect for that. No need to wait for an Uber after the show! 

Marcia and team have great communication, and it was super easy to get from the airport to the houseboat. 

It was the perfect size for a couple and provided plenty of comfort to relax for the weekend.

Amazing place. The concept of it is incredible! Being on the water and close to the heart of downtown was really nice. I really like the interior decoration and deck up top. Would I pay that price again? Probably not! The host seems to do a great job though and it’s a great place. Not to take away from that.
The boat house was beautiful!  We loved the top deck!
We had a wonderful time at the Cove!

description.summary:
Are you ready for a breathtaking experience ON the water?!  This memorable place is anything but ordinary.  

Enjoy this unique houseboat on Port City Marina in Wilmington, NC, where the amazing view of the Cape Fear River takes you into ultimate relaxation mode. 

This houseboat is centrally located between the Wilmington Convention Center and the new City Park and Amphitheater. 

You will not regret staying in one of Wilmington's newest communities!
description.neighborhood: Port City Marina is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent houseboat community.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per villa. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)
description.house_rules:
Please help us maintain a clean and safe space for all guests by respecting our houseboat rules listed above.
Failure to abide by these rules may result in additional fees.

gallery.caption: Nicely situated kitchen and living area!
Full kitchen with all of the conveniences of home!
Plenty of seating for dining.
Guest Bedroom with double bed
Master bedroom with queen size bed
Two identical bathrooms equipped with walk-in showers
Walk-in Shower
AMAZING view of the Chesapeake Bay from the Bow Deck!!
Outside  of the Houseboat, walkway and steps to enter.
Roof top deck!! Perfect spot to catch a sunrise or sunset!
Gorgeous sunrise
View from deck!

recent.comments: The condo is as described. It was very clean, comfortable beds and fantastic location. Easy and safe walking to downtown (about 1 mile)

items.comments: The condo is as described. It was very clean, comfortable beds and fantastic location. Easy and safe walking to downtown (about 1 mile)
Houseboat on Back Creek in Annapolis--unique housing in a great neighborhood.  Great views, really spacious boat-home, extremely comfortable and fun.  Highly recommended.
Houseboat in a GREAT LOCATION--best views in all of Annapolis.
Location fabulous. The houseboat was very clean and fairly well-equipped. However, it was very hot and humid and the air conditioning is rather too noisy to run at night. Great communication etc

This was our first stay in a houseboat and it did not disappoint! Everything went exactly as Kimberly described and she even gave us a heads up about the festival that was going to be happening while we were there. The views were amazing! We did not care one bit about how much it rained this weekend. Note to folks who may get motion sickness - since the weather was bad when we got there the boat was rocking a little more than usual. Luckily I had a motion sickness patch and felt better very quickly. There were several restaurants within walking distance so we did not have to always drive to downtown Annapolis and fight for parking. Hands down, I would totally stay here again.

This is an absolutely gorgeous place to stay.  Walking distance to great restaurants.  But who wants to leave?  We sat on the front deck and watched the “highway” of boats go right past us all day.  Simply beautiful.   Clean and modern.  Highly recommend!!!

description.summary: This BRAND NEW condo house boat is nestled in Back Creek. The views of the Chesapeake Bay are amazing! This is the best place to see the sunrise from the roof top deck while sipping a cup of coffee. (Four guests maximum)
description.space: The houseboat is kept on a boat lift which is suspended above the water. Even though the houseboat is stationary on a lift, the boat does have some movement and will sway with wind.
description.notes:
We do not allow pets or child under the age of 10 years old.

CHECK-IN IS AFTER 4pm

Please note is you are looking for an early check-in prior to 4pm there's a $100.00 fee. An early check-in can not be guaranteed until 2 days prior to check in.
description.house_rules:
Rules of the Houseboat
Do your part to help keep our Houseboat clean, unique and enjoyable!

IMPORTANT INFORMATION, PLEASE READ CAREFULLY!
•	Please be respectful of our space & everything in it.

•	Please be respectful of your neighbors.

•	Parties are strictly prohibited.

•	Registered guests only. Max of 4 people at all times. 

•	If you break, burn melt or destroy anything, don’t just throw it away. Please let us know so it can be replaced.

•	NO jumping, diving, or swimming off the boat or docks. 

•	NO outdoor grilling on the boat. We do have grills available near the Bath House. 

•	After each use please secure the 4 deck chairs on the top deck to the railings with bungees. We can get gusts of wind up to 35 mph or more so to protect yourself and others it is important to secure the chairs after each use. 

•	Hang wet bath towels on provided hooks, don’t leave them on the floor.

•	Please keep in mind you are staying on a boat; the plumbing is quite different then a normal house. DO NOT flush anything besides waste! We know it is a different concept, but please discard toilet paper in the trash can opposed to flushing it. Every couple days the Marina staff will pump out the 100 gallon holding tank. (This is done at the stern of the boat with no disruption to you.) All water used on the boat, kitchen sink, bathroom sinks, showers and toilets is all captured in the 100 gallon tank, so please be mindful on the amount of water that is being used. Should you notice the sinks slow to drain contact the Marina Office so that we can pump out the holding tank. 

•	The TV’s have a HULU account available for your enjoyment. If you would like to access your own web-based TV account you are more than welcome to do so, just remember to sign out of your account prior to departure. 

•	We do have onsite coin operated washer and dryers in the Marina Bath House if you need to do laundry. If you need quarters, stop by the Marina Office. 

•	Be sure to have a yellow hanging parking permit visible when parking in the Eastport Yacht Center’s parking lot. Vehicles without a parking permit will be booted at the owner’s expense.

name: Houseboat in Providence! Spacious But Cozy!
title: Providence, Rhode Island

gallery.caption: Can you pick out your next stay... It's the one with with the blue roof!
This counter space can be used for office space, buffet, dinner table and more..
Main bedroom with a view and private deck!  Queen-sized bed.
Night views from your private deck off the main bedroom!
Enjoy your favorite drink on the deck off the bedroom!
Spacious living quarters!
Marina at night..

Coffee Bar.. Help yourself to a cup of your favorite hot beverage.. K-cups, 5-cup coffee maker, tea, hot chocolate, honey, sugar... Enjoy!
Check out the updated bathroom!  Good size for a "boat"!
Cozy, king size bed in the loft.   Great views!
The pillow says it all.. "the river is my happy place!"  King mattress in the loft.
Did someone say BBQ?
The kitchen has all the amenities of home!Breakfast, lunch and dinner can all be served from here!  There's a grill too!
Private main bedroom, comfortable queen bed, room-darkening roman blind, spacious closest.
Newly renovated bathroom with all the amenities of home!
Rain or shine, great covered deck to hang out by yourself or with a few others to create unforgetable memories!
Welcome aboard Risin' Tide Inn!
You can get use to this view!  I-195 bridge/Hurricane Barrier.  Very cool!
Private deck of the master bedroom!  Nice relaxing view!
Come relax on the water at the Risin' Tide Inn!  A unique experience to stay on a houseboat and explore the city!
Come relax at the Risin' Tide Inn.  Looking forward to seeing you soon!

hosts.about: Hi from Sue and Steve

Sue and I are a laid back and easy-going couple who welcome you aboard our cozy houseboat located in Providence.  We enjoy hosting guests and making sure they have a great experience.  We are here to provide advice or recommendations on things to do and see while you're in town!  Please message us with any questions, comments or concerns.  Enjoy your stay at the Risin' Tide Inn!

recent.comments: Such a cute place, unfortunately we were only there overnight but would have loved to stay longer!

items.comments: Such a cute place, unfortunately we were only there overnight but would have loved to stay longer!
Very happy we stayed and Steve and Sue were great hosts
Great space and perfect fun for our 2 kids and then after time for us on the deck!

I have stayed on boats and houseboats before and this place is meticulously cared for and is a great place to stay! The location is convenient, instructions very easy to follow and all the furnishings are clean. The boat has such a homey feel and we really enjoyed our stay. You have all the comforts of home on this boat. Thanks for offering such a unique stay in Providence!
Would go back 100 times over
Very nice boat in a beautiful city. Steve and Sue gave detailed  instructions and responded  quickly to questions.  I would highly recommend!

description.summary: Experience Providence from the unique perspective of your own floating house!   Nestled in a protected marina in Providence Harbor, our houseboat is fully equipped with all the comforts and amenities of home, including full baseboard heat for cooler Sping and Fall months! !  Our location is the most secure marina in Rhode Island. We are nestled inside of the Hurricane Barrier and visible when driving along  Interstate 195.  Full use of the boat and spaces within offer complete privacy!
description.space:
Walk in to a bright, warm and welcoming living space.  Privacy window shades are light filtering, while bedroom and loft window shades are light blocking.  
The main bedroom has a comfortable queen bed, with a private deck off the rear of the boat.  The loft area has a king size bed, accessed by a ships ladder.  
The kitchen has all the dishes, glasses and utensils you will need.  A full size refrigerator / freezer for your groceries and drinks.  A two burner electric cooktop, microwave, sink and range hood provide everything you need to make breakfast, lunch and dinner!

The bathroom has a boat toilet, sink, shower and vanity with a full compliment of towels and washcloths…including make-up towels!

The living space offers two futons that can be unfolded for additional sleeping areas.  Two comfortable bar height stools sit at the high counter, separating the kitchen and living area, and can be used as a work area.  The coffee table unfolds and lifts to a full size seating table for dining and games!  Lights are on dimmers to set your mood when the sun goes down.  A coffee bar, stocked with some coffee and pods is available for your use.  In the coffee bar is a Bluetooth speaker you can connect to and listen to your music!

Outdoor decks, 3 in total, offer great views of the river, hurricane barrier, marina and downtown Providence.  The lower deck, dock side, has a gas grill and table with 4 chairs, all under cover!  Enjoy the sun on the deck above and spend quiet time on the deck off the master.
description.access:
A private code access gate will lead you down a ramp and to all the areas of the marina.  While all docks are available to access, please respect the privacy of the other boat owners.

There is a marina bathroom and shower available, which will be listed in the onboard book that will provide details about everything you need to know during your stay.

Right next to the marina are 3 restaurants, one being a cigar bar!  Late nights can be noisy on the weekends.
description.house_rules:
No loud noise after 11 pm.
Any movement or disconnecting of the outdoor security camera is grounds to forfeit the deposit.
Any more than 6 guests will automatically change guest rates to &1,200 per night.
Please observe use and care of the toilet
Please use provided soaps, as they are ecologically friendly

gallery.caption: Leave from The Love Boat by water in two kayaks provided with your rental (paddles and life-vests included!)
Set up two rocking chairs provided on the back deck and enjoy marina life!!!
Or rock on the front covered porch - a perfect place to rest, relax, and getaway from the sun!
Nantucket style breakfast bar with stools!
Comfortable couch that converts to a single pullout!
View from the couch out to the covered front porch!
Kitchen leading into bedroom! Pocket door should you want to separate the two spaces!
Gentle rocking of the boat in a cozy bed are the ingredients of a good night's rest!
Bathroom with standing shower, vanity and toilet!
View of the back deck and canal from your bedroom!
Lay out on the upper deck and enjoy the breeze!
Waterfront restaurant, Stripers Bar & Grill, just steps away from The Love Boat! Excellent food, service, and live music!
Ship store located in the Marina next to Stripers Bar & Grill for all your convenience needs!
Skyview of Shallowbag Bay Club & Marina, access to downtown Manteo on right side of picture!
Book on board to capture all the memories - hand written by the guests' themselves!
The show that inspired it all...The Love Boat ....truly a Labor of Love!

hosts.about:
HELLO There!!!  I moved to the Outer Banks from Ellicott City, MD in 2013.  I studied Human Nutrition, Foods & Exercise with an emphasis in Exercise and Health Promotion at Virginia Tech and put that knowledge to work on a daily basis as a Pilates Instructor at the only classical Pilates Studio in the OBX, The Presidio of Pilates!  In addition to my education, my love for business and entrepreneurial spirit led me to AirBNB!  I CoHost multiple spaces in locations throughout the United States and as a Professional Referrer of AirBNB I take great joy in teaching folks how to start their own business hosting by themselves or with assistance.  I have taught a course at the local church - The Path To Financial Freedom with AirBNB - I LOVE to TRAVEL - so reach out if you would like me to teach a course in YOUR home town in the US or Internationally!

Things that bring me great joy:
1. My relationships with my K9 Medusa, kitties Oli & BB, close friends & family, clients & guests!
2. Water (referring to all large bodies of water....not the beverage! ;)
3. Beach walks and Podcasts!
4. Meditation
5. Pilates
6. Quotes!!

As an Air Ambassador, I am grateful for every guest, and potential new host, I correspond with! I look forward to hosting YOU, your loved ones, and many more in the months and years to come...truly a labor of love!  Should you need assistance in hosting your own property, I would be delighted to help you with that AS WELL!

Travel quotes that inspire:

~A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.
Laozi

~Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers, that the mind can never break off from the journey.
Pat Conroy

~All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.
Martin Buber

~Two roads diverged in a wood, and I -- I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
Robert Frost

~Remember that happiness is a way of travel - not a destination.
Roy M. Goodman

~Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

~We are all travelers in the wilderness of this world, and the best we can find in our travels is an honest friend.
Robert Louis Stevenson

~Experience, travel — These are an education in themselves.
Euripides

~Little by little, one travels far.
J. R. R. Tolkien

~Travel far enough you meet yourself! 
Joseph Campbell

items.comments: Very Cool Spot

Quiet, quaint and soothing. Perfect for single or couple looking for unique place. We loved relaxing on the back deck - practically even with water. Easy drive into all parts of the island. Wonderful stay.

It’s a boat. A little boat. Not much to it. It’s in an ordinary place, with not much to do nearby. If you just want to stay in a boat to say you did, this’ll work. But for the price, there’s pretty much always something better to stay in at OBX. Of course, I knew it was a boat- I was thinking about more like Joe Manchin’s boat than my uncles boat. It was an ok stay- I’d stay there for free for sure. But the value was not a good one.
Really cute boat in a beautiful setting with lots to do!

The Love Boat was a cool experience, Gia was very responsive, and the location was great. However, the towels were not fresh, the shower drained slowly, and it could have been cleaner. Overall a positive experience, but I wouldn’t rent it again.

Manteo may seem like a typical North Carolina coastal town, but the area is as rich in attractions and fun as it is local history. The area is home to one of the world's greatest mysteries, the birthplace of English colonization in American, (literally), and a collection of Outer Banks attractions that have wowed vacationers for generations.

A visit to Manteo, whether it's for a day or for a week, can be a veritable visit back in time with historical attractions like the Roanoke Island Festival Park, the Island Farm or the Elizabethan Gardens setting the scene of a bygone era. For vacationers more interested in modern fare, the downtown offers blocks of homegrown boutiques, book shops, gift stores, and some of the region's most celebrated restaurants, all located conveniently in one downtown stretch adjacent to the bustling but beautiful Manteo waterfront.

Manteo Attractions
Downtown - Downtown Manteo, located just a few blocks off the main road of US Highway 64, is a destination in its own right, and the small streets that lead to the harbor are filled with gorgeous gardens, manicured lawns, and charming bed and breakfasts. The Pioneer Theater, a fixture in the town for decades, is located along these side streets and claims the honor of being the oldest single-screen and family owned movie theater in America. Unmistakable by its Tudor-style exterior, the theater is open year-round and features a budget-friendly feature as well as a historic theater setting.

The waterfront portion of downtown is lined with locally and nationally renowned restaurants, water sports companies, gift shops, antique stores, book stores, galleries, and many more shops and attractions with doors wide open for patrons. The waterfront is usually stocked full of sailboats, skiffs and yachts of both visiting mariners and year-round locals, as wSell as several local tour companies that allow visitors to hop on board for an afternoon or evening waterfront view of the Outer Banks. Many restaurants have outdoor seating overlooking the harbor, presenting guests with maritime watching at its best, and everyone is encouraged to take a stroll along the waterfront, or simply pull up a bench or a gazebo seat and enjoy the views.

Summer visitors should also be on the lookout for seasonal events, including monthly "First Night" celebrations, and Saturday Farmer's Markets that invade the downtown with fresh locally grown produce, homemade goodies, and local arts and crafts.

Roanoke Marshes Lighthouse - At the edge of the harbor front lies Roanoke Marshes Light, the Outer Banks' only example of an "in-shore" lighthouse, and a squat but charming one-story backdrop for fantastic Manteo photos.

Roanoke Island Festival Park - Elizabethan era lovers can also make a day trip to neighboring Roanoke Island Festival Park, which features a real-life recreation of everyday life in an early American colony. Some of the attractions within Roanoke Island Festival Park include:

Settler's Village and Native American camp - Visitors can explore the workings of the settler's village with interpretive character demonstrations and blacksmith shop, and a neighboring Native American camp with interactive displays of the lives of Native Americans before English settlers arrived.
Elizabeth IIThe elaborately constructed replica of the Elizabeth II, a fantastic and detail-perfect example of the ship that brought the original colonists to Manteo. The ship can be explored in person during the prime summer months, guided by costumed interpreters, or can be admired by anyone who strolls along the downtown Manteo docks. Stationed right in the forefront of Manteo's harbor, adjacent to the wooden bridge that leads visitors to the waterfront park, the Elizabeth II is an unmistakable and alluring site to any downtown visitor.
Roanoke Adventure Museum - featuring interactive exhibits and displays that take guests through 400 years of Roanoke Island history.
Outer Banks History Center - Visit this library-like treasure trove of Outer Banks information, dating back centuries and serving as an instrumental tool for historians, scientists, journalists, writers, educators, and the everyday public. Researchers and visitors who take a tour through their extensive achieves will be overwhelmed with the raw materials at hand, and it would literally take years to sift through all the documents and accounts available.
Pavilion Outdoor Theatre - This outdoor concert and live entertainment venue with Roanoke Sound backdrop is truly stunning. It features a 3,800 sq.ft. stage and lawn-style ampitheatre seating. Check the official schedule for the latest information on upcoming concerts and festivals.
N.C. Aquarium on Roanoke Island - Located just a few minutes drive from downtown, the aquarium presents a slice of natural island life, and features exhibits on everything Outer Banks, from the marshy inland habitats to the deep waters of the Gulf Stream. Of course, every exhibit has a healthy sample of the critters that inhabit these areas as well, and guests can expect to see river otters, land and sea turtles, alligators, local and tropical fish, and even a number of different kinds of sharks. The aquarium was designed with kids in mind, and special exhibits and programs are offered year-round to allow the future scientists in your group an opportunity to explore the natural world of the Outer Banks. Open 363 days, visitors can also gently touch stinrays, horseshoe crabs, bamboo sharks, urchins, stars, hermit crabs and more. The N.C. Aquarium is a hugely popular activity, and many families return each year. If rain spoils a beach day, the aquarium is afantastic activity for all ages.

Fort Raleigh National Historic Site - More than just old earthen fort walls, this complex has a lot to offer visitors:

Fort Raleigh Visitor Center - Filled with artifacts excavated from the nearby fort, exhibits, historical records, and displays.
Elizabethan Gardens - A beautiful 10-acre, year-round garden display with sculptures, formal gardens, and native plants. The garden casts a spell over history buffs and nature lovers alike, with acres of perfectly manicured gardens and sculptures, as well as wild-growing native species of plants, flowers and trees. Every season brings a new show-stopper in bloom at the gardens, and visitors who frequent the Outer Banks are encouraged to make multiple visits during different times of year to enjoy the full display. Hydrangeas, Camelias, roses, tulips, and magnolias all make regular appearances, and guests can also marvel at the Elizabethan Era-inspired sculptures, gazebos and garden settings throughout the park. A self-guided walking trail leads visitors in a circular route that borders the Roanoke Soundfront, and a gift store and plant shop are also on the premises for Elizabethan and natural, locally grown souvenirs. Open year-round, the Elizabethan Gardens is a must-see for anyone who wants to take a natural step back in history, and enjoy the stunning Manteo view.
The Lost Colony Outdoor Drama - The longest-running outdoor symphonic drama in America. This is an enormous two hour production, and highly rated by visitors. Over two hundred actors, technicians and volunteers bring the historic "Lost Colony" story to live each Summer. A true gem in the Outer Banks, and fun for the entire family.
Dare County Airport - Ever wondered what it would be like to see the Outer Banks from the air? Several air tour companies offer helicopter and open-cockpit biplane rides over your favorite landmarks. Check out the list of air tour companies here.

Manteo History
The history of Manteo is storied and deep, beginning with the town name's origin itself. "Manteo" was a chief in the local Roanoke Island community of Native Americans who made a long trip oversees as an ambassador of goodwill to the late 16th Century English explorers. Chief Manteo was, in fact, one of the first American residents to travel to Europe as an honored and distinguished guest.

Surprisingly, this is not the most notable footnote of the town's history. Manteo is the home to one of the world's longest running historical mysteries, specifically, the disappearance of the Lost Colony. In 1597, after a series of surface explorations, including one commandeered by Sir Walter Raleigh himself, a new colony was sent to Roanoke Island to settle and begin the English expansion of the New World. Led by John White, the colonists arrived in Manteo and quickly set to building and creating a new settlement. In the process of building a new civilization, John White's own daughter gave birth to the country's first English child, Virginia Dare, for which the Outer Banks home county is named.

Months later, however, supplies had run short, and John White had to make a hesitant trip home to England to resupply the camp. Once in Europe, White found himself bogged down by both government inquires and bad weather, and it wasn't until 1590 that he was able to make the long voyage back to Manteo to bring help to his colony, his daughter, and his new granddaughter. Sadly, when he returned, he found the entire colony had been virtually wiped off the map, with only a minor clue to their fate carved into two neighboring trees: the words "Cro" and "Croatan."

Many modern historians take this as a sign that the colonists, either as a desperate move to escape starvation or outrun threats from neighboring Native Americans, relocated to the southern beaches of Hatteras Island, where the Croatan Native Americans thrived peacefully. However, after long coastline explorations, John White found no sign of his daughter, grandchild, or any other living soul of that first original Roanoke Island Colony.

Today, the drama of the Lost Colony is honored in Manteo with, quite appropriately, an Outdoor Drama. "The Lost Colony" show is the nation's oldest running outdoor drama and features a prestigious cast of former players, including Andy Griffith who starred in the show for several years before becoming a star, and then later returned to the Outer Banks to live out his days as a happy, retired resident.

These days, the show is performed nightly in the summertime to sold-out crowds who enjoy the Broadway worthy singing, dancing, acting and pyrotechnics. Reservations are strongly recommended in the prime June, July, and August months as the legendary show, which also features a post-show meet and greet with the cast of characters, tends to sell out fast.

The area is also home to the majority of the county's local government offices and services, including the county courthouse, the DMV offices, and the administrative county offices. In addition, vacationers in Manteo will find everything from small grocery stores to pharmacies to bait and tackle shops, for any items they might need during their vacation.

For a day trip that's overflowing with the area's most treasured historical attractions, or a relaxing vacation that's off the beaten path, a trip to Manteo should definitely be on the Outer Banks agenda. Vacationers find that after a full day of exploring the shops, sites and attractions, there's still plenty left to see, as well as plenty to love, about this small town with a lot of coastal character.

Frequently Asked Questions
Where is Manteo, NC?

The town of Manteo is located on Roanoke Island, which is sandwiched in between the central Outer Banks beaches and the eastern North Carolina mainland. It is bordered by the Roanoke Sound to the east, and the Croatan Sound to the west.

How do you get to Manteo, NC?

Visitors from the western part of North Carolina or the Outer Banks can reach Manteo via US 64.

What is there to do in Manteo, NC?

Manteo has one of the highest concentrations of attractions in the Outer Banks. These popular sites include the North Carolina Aquarium, the Elizabethan Gardens, Fort Raleigh National Historic Site, Roanoke Island Festival Park, the Lost Colony Outdoor Drama, the 1800s Island Farm, the Roanoke Island Marshes Light lighthouse, and the historic downtown area. The town also has a wide array of shops, restaurants, art galleries, historic homes, and other distinctive attractions.

Where did the name Manteo come from?

“Manteo” is named after a Native American Croatan Chief who greeted and befriended the early English explorers of Roanoke Island in the 1580s. Manteo helped the first colonists survive their initial winter, and even traveled to England in 1584, and again in 1585.

How old is Manteo, NC?

Manteo is one of the oldest communities in the state of North Carolina, and the country. Founded and settled in the 1580s, the area was the site of the first English child born in America, Virginia Dare, as well as one of the first English settlements in the New World. Centuries later, Manteo would be named the seat of government for Dare County in 1870, and the town was officially incorporated in 1899.

What is the Lost Colony?

The Lost Colony was one of the original colonies in the New World, and was settled in 1585 on Roanoke Island. Founded by Sir Walter Raleigh, the colony suffered from tensions with the nearby Native Americans, as well as a lack of food and supplies. As a result, the colony’s governor, Governor White, left the settlers behind in 1587 to sail to England and ask for help. When he returned in August, 1590, all 115 members of the colony had disappeared, and the only clue of their fate was the word "CROATOAN" scratched onto a post, and the letters “CRO” etched into a tree.

What happened to the Lost Colony?

The fate of the 115 settlers of the 1580s Lost Colony remains a mystery. Some historians believe the colonists tried to sail back to England and did not make it, while others believe that they perished in escalated conflicts with the local Native Americans. Many historians believe that the colonists may have moved south, to Hatteras Island – a theory that was further bolstered by the recent discovery of a 16th century Signet ring in the town of Buxton.

What are the special events in Manteo?

Manteo has a myriad of special events throughout the year. Favorite annual events include the Bluegrass festival in October, the annual Dare Day Celebration in June, the New World Festival of the Arts in August, and a wide range of holiday-themed celebrations.

What are the holiday events in Manteo?

Manteo has a line-up of holiday events that last from November through January. These events include the annual Outer Banks Winter Lights display at the Elizabethan Gardens, the annual Christmas Tree Lighting and Holiday Boat Parade in the historic downtown area, and the annual downtown Christmas Parade.

What are the summertime events in Manteo?

Manteo hosts a weekly summertime farmers’ market on Saturdays in the summer, and the area’s shops and restaurants also have regular special events including live music and outdoor concerts. The Roanoke Island Festival Park features a handful of larger concerts in the summer with nationally recognized performers and bands as well. The town is also famed for its annual Dare Days Festival in June, its New World Festival of the Arts in August, and its 4th of July celebration with fireworks over the downtown waterfront.

How close is Manteo to the beach?

Manteo is roughly a 10-15 minute drive away from the Outer Banks beaches, depending on traffic. Visitors will find a number of public parking areas in the nearby town of Nags Head, as well as within the Cape Hatteras National Seashore.

Where is Downtown Manteo?

Downtown Manteo is in the heart of Roanoke Island, and is on the edge of Shallowbag Bay and the Roanoke Sound.

Where can you park to explore downtown Manteo?

Streetside parking is available throughout the town, and there are also six public parking areas in the downtown region. These parking lots are found at the following locations:

Roanoke Island Festival Park
Queen Elizabeth Street next to the Festival Park bridge
Queen Elizabeth Street next to the Tranquil House Inn
Queen Elizabeth Street at the Waterfront Shops
Fernando Street next to the boathouse
Fernando Street next to the Roanoke Island Inn

Can you Dock in Downtown Manteo?

Downtown Manteo offers town docks for visitors who want to explore the downtown area during a day trip. The town also has a number of local marinas that can accommodate transient mariners.

What are the attractions in Manteo, NC?

Attractions in Manteo include the Lost Colony Outdoor Drama, Roanoke Island Festival Park, Fort Raleigh National Historic Site, the Elizabethan Gardens, the North Carolina Aquarium on Roanoke Island, the 1800s Island Farm, Roanoke Marshes lighthouse, and the historic Downtown area. The town is also known for its charming collection of shops, boutiques, art galleries, antique stores, and restaurants along the downtown waterfront.

Are there shops and restaurants in Manteo, NC?

Manteo has a wide variety of popular shops and restaurants, especially in the historic downtown area. The town is known for its gift shops, antique stores, art galleries, and other specialty shops and eateries along the waterfront.

Where do you stay in Manteo, NC?

Manteo has a number of smaller hotels and motels, as well as a collection of historic bed and breakfasts. There are also a number of vacation rental homes or condos in Manteo.

What can you do on a rainy day in Manteo, NC?

Manteo has a wide array of attractions for rainy days, like the North Carolina Aquarium on Roanoke Island, the historic 1918 Pioneer Movie Theater, and the Roanoke Maritime Museum. In addition, the town has a wonderful variety of charming shops, galleries, and restaurants.

When is the best time to visit Manteo?

Manteo is unique on the Outer Banks as it is popular with visitors all year long. The town is especially enticing during the holidays, when the area hosts a number of events, and in the summertime when Outer Banks vacationers make a day trip to explore Roanoke Island’s many attractions.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the house boat.  The surroundings are beautiful. Ting was very welcoming and had great communication - especially during a pretty nasty thunderstorm!  We enjoyed use of  the kayaks and sauna.  The bath house & kitchen were very clean. We had a very nice getaway at Silverlaken.

Great cozy spot right on the lake. Quite, clean place with friendly hosts. 👌 

Perfect for having a relaxing getaway with good campfire and smores.

Everything we could have needed was included which made things so easy and took away lot of stress of packing and planning. Having the kayaks and paddle boards available, and the campfire with everything you need included (even the s’mores kit!) sold us on the spot. Coffee on the water in the morning with a book was so peaceful. The boathouse had a heated blanket which we didn’t need but was nice to know it was there. Washrooms are clean and nice, and the kitchen area was better than I thought - with the propane cooktop and all your pots and pans, you could definitely cook up a nice meal in there. The hosts we spoke to were very kind, and you can tell how much effort and care has been put into the property.
Very friendly owners!

We had such a great romantic getaway to the boathouse. Waking up surrounded by water was fantastic. Ting and Mike were so friendly! We hope to come back, and definitely will be recommending to friends!
