description.space:
Things to know about the Houseboat before you book:
 
Does it float? 
The “Houseboat” is a cabin built on a floating platform that is raised up in a hoist. It does not have an engine and only floats when we take it off the hoist and tow it to the local marina for Winter storage.
 
Due to wave action, it is not comfortable or safe to float the cabin in the water. However, the boat is lifted just a few inches off the water by the hoist, so the guests will enjoy the feel of living “on the water” without the headaches of getting seasick or being knocked over by waves! It is normal for the boat to sway back and forth a few inches in the hoist.
 
Occupancy/Bedding/Temperature Control
ü  Limited to 2 guests as the unit has 1 queen bed.
ü  The houseboat enjoys the cool breeze off the lake. There is also a ceiling fan above the bed and all the windows have screens. 
ü  In the cooler months, an electric blanket and electric radiator is provided.

Shared Infrastructure
ü  In the Sauna Cabin (about 50 ft from houseboat) you will find the Sauna room, the indoor shower & bathrooms as well as outdoor tent showers. 
ü  Feel free to use the gas grill and any of the picnic tables in the common area.  The kitchen is on the porch of the Sauna Cabin.
ü Kayaks and Standup paddle boards are available at the common area.

✓ Free Parking on Premises
✓ Wifi (but very slow and unreliable. Designed to get you offline and enjoying outdoors)
✓ Heat & Fan 
✓ Bedding and Linens
✓ Shower amenities
✓ Free Smore's & Coffee welcome kits
✓ Common area kitchen: Stove, Refrigerator, Microwave, Coffee Maker, Toaster, Dishes & Silverware
✓ Camp Fire Pit
✓ BBQ Grill (propane provided)
✓ Kayaks & Paddleboards (life vests and paddles included)
✓ Sauna
✓ Picnic table
description.notes:
For detailed information on the estate- how to access WIFI, where to find firewood, kayaks, etc. visit
https://silverlaken.com/housemanual/

Quiet Hours/ No Parties
For the comfort of our guest, we are serious about tranquility. Quiet hours are in effect from 9 P.M. to 9 A.M. No parties, loud music, raised voices or screaming kids at any hour.   

Self Check In
Instructions with details for accessing the rental unit, directions, where to park, Wi-Fi password and such are found in the Airbnb app after the booking has been made.

Directions
The Silverlaken Estate is on a rural road.  Please be respectful of neighbors by driving slow on the dirt road to keep down dust.

Please make sure you are clear about the directions and know the location of your rental unit before you start your drive to Silverlaken.  

Do not drive around the neighborhood looking for the estate and never knock on a neighbor’s door to ask where is Silverlaken.  The map and directions are very clear, but if you have any problems, please contact your host.

Housekeeping 
Linens are professionally dry cleaned and a starter kit of towels, toilet paper, soaps & shampoo is included in each rental unit.  As we do not have full time staff, long-stay guests should know that on-going housekeeping, top up of starter kit items and replacement of linens is not provided, unless additional fees are agreed in advance, before booking is made.

Before check out, guests are expected to do their own dishes, remove trash (refuse bins are centrally located onsite) and place used linens in a pile.   

Green Energy
The Silverlaken estate is powered by solar panels.  Consider an environmentally friendly approach and use the fans rather than AC when possible and turn off lights/electronics when not in use.

Dark Sky Commitment
Bring a flashlight as we intentionally limit lighting between the buildings to reduce light pollution and enjoy the night sky. The advantages include an increased number of stars visible at night, reducing the effects of electric lighting on the environment, improving the well-being, health and safety of both people and wildlife, and cutting down on energy usage. 

Things To Do At Silverlaken
Registered guests are warmly welcome to use the following infrastructure (free of charge) found in the common area:
• Kayaks.  In the common area you will find a rack with 10 red kayaks and a bunch of universal fit lifejackets. Consider to bring your own lifejacket for a better fit.
• Campfire pits (firewood and start kits provided)  
Picnic Tables & BBQ grills (propane provided) 
• Horseshoe pits 
• Sauna
Visit the “things to do” page at Silverlaken dot com for more information.

Things To Do Near Silverlaken
The estate is conveniently located on the shores of Silver Lake, near the Village of Perry, just minutes from Letchworth State Park.
Upon request, your host will be happy to curate some itineraries for what to see, do, eat and drink nearby during the specific dates of your visit. To get started, visit the “things to eat, see and do nearby” page at Silverlaken dot com. 

Before You Book
So that you are familiar with the estate, its infrastructure and rules, please visit Silverlaken dot com and download the “Important Notes for Guests” which covers the following items:
Welcome letter from your hosts
History of the Silverlaken Estate
Silver Lake Sea Serpent
Map & Parking
Communications
Covid Related Items/ Medical
The “No’s” To Know & Quiet Hours
Bedding & Housekeeping
Check In & Check Out
Trash & Recycling
Solar Power/ Electric
Shared Spaces: Sauna, Firepits & Campfire Wood
Special Notes for Water Activities: Boats/ Docks/Fishing
Drinking Water
Farmland/ Wild Animals/ Mosquitoes & Poison Ivy
Things to See & Do Nearby
Groceries & Where to Eat Near Silverlaken
Sunday Church Service
Unique/Local Gifts & Souvenirs
Kid Friendly Places
Bike Maps

hosts.about:
My husband and I love the river and want to share the experience of staying in a boat enjoying the Savannah River with everyone else.  We know that you will enjoy it as much as we do.  

 We run 5th Street Marina so we are on site most of the time and can be available for any assistance.

recent.comments:
Island Oasis was a perfect getaway for the weekend. It was spacious enough for me and my husband. The boat was cozy and the floating dock was perfect for relaxing, sunning, reading a book, and enjoying a cold drink in the evening with a perfect view. Everything was clean, cozy, and tidy. I highly recommend this for a quiet weekend or getaway. Beth was a great hostess!
We also found some great local restaurants including The Brunch House, Luigi's, and Taco Cat. You could walk to each place if you wanted. We would definitely return!

Beth is amazing; she helped us out in a pinch and was EXTREMELY accommodating. This was our first time at a boat stay, and she made it a great experience. The boat is beautiful. It is well kept, clean, and a great weekend get-away. We can't wait to come back! Thank you, Beth!!
It’s a boat on the river walking distance to downtown. Good fun thanks!
Beth is the best, every time I need something she is always there

We decided to stay here for a girls trip since we’ve never stayed an actual house boat. We are definitely glad we did! Host was extremely helpful and showed us around at check in. She was very friendly and responsive. The boat was exactly as described and located in the most beautiful area. It was very peaceful and relaxing. We plan on coming back soon!

description.summary: This is a tiny houseboat that is on the beautiful Savannah River.  What a great place to come and unwind and get back to nature while relaxing on your own tropical oasis.  The boat comes with an island as well.  The  floating island that is attached to the dock with outdoor seating under the canopy of the stars sets the mood for a great time.  The only thing missing from this tropical oasis is you!
description.space:
This is a small houseboat that is on the beautiful Savannah River.  What a great place to come and unwind and get back to nature while relaxing on your own tropical oasis.  The boat comes with an island as well.  The  floating island that is attached to the dock with outdoor seating under the canopy of the stars sets the mood for a great time.  The only thing missing from this tropical oasis is you!
Amenities: Two twin beds, refrigerator, coffee pot with coffee, towels, sheets, blankets, pots and pans, gas grill with tools,  blender, tv with basic channels, cooler for use, small bathroom with shower and portable toilet, sitting area outside on your own island.
description.access: Getting to the boat is easy.   After arriving at the marina gift shop at 1 Fifth Street Augusta, GA 30901 to pick up your key, you will be escorted to the boat.  After instructions are given, you are on your own to enjoy the day.
description.notes: Right now the 5th street bridge is being worked on to make a walking bridge.  It will appear that it is a detour.  When you arrive on 5th St, you drive up the hill and turn left into the marina right before you get to the barriers.
description.neighborhood: Being right on the Savannah River, there is no other place to be in Downtown Augusta. If you do want to explore the area, you are right in the heart of the Downtown with various activities always happening, be it the restaurant and bar scene, local art museums, the weekly farmers market(seasonal), multiple opportunities to exercise. There is always something going on.
description.transit: We are located at the end of the Riverwalk.  Restaurants and bars are within walking distance from the boat.  Delivery is available as well.  Let the driver know the address is 1 Fifth Street, 30901  Boat slip # 22 tell them to go to the second gate of A Dock (the first Dock) and you can meet them outside of the gate.  There is jet ski rentals and kayak boat rentals  available as well as Patriot Boat tours on the weekend.
description.interaction:
The marina gift shop is open daily and you can come see us with any concerns.  We are only minutes away from the boat. 
If you need ice during your stay, please come by the marina gift shop during business hours to pick some up.  Just let the associate know that you are staying on Airbnb.
description.house_rules: No parties allowed on the boat.  The toilet can only handle two (2) people using it during a stay.

hosts.about:
Hi! My name is Sandra Brown and I will be your hostess with the most-ess!!!   I own multiple cottages that I rent through my company, Woodgate Cottages.  Therefore you get the benefit of a professional rental with top notch service as well as the personal touch of me being the Owner-Operator. 
I work hard and take great pride in being a "Super Host" and I work hard to maintain that status. We have hosted so many wonderful people at our cottages ...many of whom we consider friends now.   

I love the peace and quiet of cottaging and love getting away. I'm a "hands-on" hostess and I go above and beyond to ensure my guests have a relaxing and wonderful cottaging experience.

recent.comments:
Staying at Fernglen was lovely! The separate accommodations suited our family perfectly. The outdoor space was very well kept and clean. The kiddos loved the beach area and the water was clean and free of debris and weeds. Great fishing off the dock was great too! 
As the ad describes, the kitchen was small with very little counter space so that was a little bit of a pain but otherwise, the size of the cottage was just right for us. With no AC, it was great to have all those fans for the very hot days too! 
Overall, I would certainly recommend Sandra’s place to anyone looking for a quiet, relaxing holiday!

items.comments:
Staying at Fernglen was lovely! The separate accommodations suited our family perfectly. The outdoor space was very well kept and clean. The kiddos loved the beach area and the water was clean and free of debris and weeds. Great fishing off the dock was great too! 
As the ad describes, the kitchen was small with very little counter space so that was a little bit of a pain but otherwise, the size of the cottage was just right for us. With no AC, it was great to have all those fans for the very hot days too! 
Overall, I would certainly recommend Sandra’s place to anyone looking for a quiet, relaxing holiday!
had a great time and the place was exactly like the pictures. Sandra gave us a welcome tour and showed us the best fishing spots and how to care for the hot tub. Would definitely come back again
Sandra is an amazing host! If you have any questions she is very quick to respond. Wonderful place to stay with friends and family.  Highly recommend!!

We were quite pleased by the property. Very nice waterfront, quiet location, good internal layout, and few wooden buildings created a perfect weekend getaway vibe. 
 We were a little surprised by the fact that a few days before we had to sign an additional agreement  directly with the real Sandra required us to provide the names and ages of all guests including small children and infants.  Reviewing , filling and signing  of that Agreement took us some extra time which is a bit unusual for AirBnB experience.Also, a few days before our arrival date we requested to add two more people to our guest list which did not look like a problem as the Agreement we signed earlier indicated that the property may accept up to 20 people. But that request was strongly declined by the agent. (Our group had only 16 persons including one infant).That was quite frustrating.

We spent this past weekend at Fernglen, and it was the perfect getaway! We went with a large group of ladies to celebrate a friends upcoming nuptials and it was the perfect space. We really enjoyed the 3 separate sleeping spaces as not everyone knew each other. The beds were all super comfortable, and the view was fantastic. Not only was Sandra super responsive but they had everything you would need to have fun at the lake included in the rental. A few of the girls even mentioned about booking next summer with their families. Thanks for hosting us!
My family and I had a wonderful time! would definitely book again!

description.summary: HOT TUB AND GAMES AREA.  This property is not suitable for loud / rowdy groups.
description.space:
We recently received a cancellation for summer. Friday August 18 - Friday August 25, 2023 is currently available.   7 nights minimum rental during summer.

RENTAL POLICY: primary renter must be minimum 25 yrs old and in attendance at our cottage during your stay.

THIS PROPERTY IS LOCATED ON A QUIET COTTAGE ROAD AND BAY. IT IS NOT SUITED TO LOUD/ROWDY GROUPS. NO PARTIES / NO WEDDINGS / NO WEDDING RECEPTIONS PERMITTED.  


13% HST ADDED TO THE OVERALL TOTAL
You will receive a follow up separate / payment request via Airbnb for 13% HST. 
This is because Airbnb is not set up to include HST in their quotes so it has to be a follow up payment but within the Airbnb system.  

MAXIMUM CAPACITY 16 :  All human beings, regardless of age, are included in our maximum capacity ... adults + children + babies + infants.  


We provide:
1)	Comforters
2)	Pillows

Please bring:
1)	Pillow cases
2)	Bed sheets
3)	Bath and swim towels
4)	Kitchen linens

__________________________________________________________

Beautiful, quiet and private 1 acre property.  All 3 cottages on the property are rented to the same group (we never rent to multiple groups at a time) .  Your group would have the entire property and all 3 cottages included in your rental.

We have a  7 person Arctic Spa hot tub that is operational through Covid & all year round. 

NO SEA DOOS/JET SKIS PERMITTED AT OUR COTTAGE
Due to problems and complaints from our cottage neighbours, we no longer permit any jet skis at our cottage. 


MAIN COTTAGE DETAILS
- Bedrooms: 3
- Beds: 7
- Bathroom with shower only (no tub)
- Main floor Master bedroom: 1 x queen bed
- Main floor Bunk room: double bed on bottom & single on top
- Loft upstairs (accessed by ladder): 2 x queen beds    and   2 x single beds  (extra large room)
-  Front porch fully screened in
- Kitchen (note: this is the only kitchen on the property and it is a very small kitchen with no dishwasher)
- living and dining room

BOATHOUSE DETAILS.. (located on 2nd floor of boathouse)
Total bedrooms: 1 large open concept room with loft above
Total bathrooms: 1 (shower, no tub)
Total beds: 3 .....plus sofa bed
Queen beds: 1
Single beds: 2 accessed by ladder located in the loft
Extra sleeping capacity: sofa bed with double bed for 2 people
- Kitchenette with mini fridge, toaster, coffee machine and microwave .  No stove.  All cooking is done in the main cottage.  

NOTE:  loft accessed by ladder 

DETAILS OF COACH HOUSE (ABOVE GARAGE)
- Bedrooms: 2
- Beds: 3
- Master bedroom: 1 x queen bed
- 2nd bedroom: 2 x single beds
- Bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi tub
- Dining area with table and chairs
- Kitchette has mini fridge , toaster , coffee machine and microwave, no stove.   Cooking is only done in the main cottage .  

WHAT IS INCLUDED
- 2 x canoes, 2 x kayaks, 1 paddleboat, 1  floating lilypad
- hot tub (available year-round and during Covid) 
- Propane BBQ including propane
- 1 wagon full of wood for campfires 
- hammocks
- sand toys 
- outdoor furniture, Muskoka chairs, lounge chairs etc
- horseshoe pit
- laundry facilities (bring your own laundry detergent)


We have a ring doorbell video recording device outside near our back door that overlooks the entire driveway.  It operates and records at all times. Do not tamper with this device. 

BRING YOUR LINENS
We do provide a comforter and pillows for every bed however, we ask that you bring the following linens
- bedsheets and pillow  cases
-  bath / swimming towels
- kitchen linens ie dish cloth, dish towel, hand towels etc

WIFI
We do offer wifi but our cottage is located in a rural area therefore  it can be temperamental /slow/ unreliable (  especially in the event of bad weather or other unforeseeable circumstances, as is the case in most rural areas). We do have good cellular towers nearby so generally cellular data usage is more consistent.

PETS
We only permit dogs (no little puppies who are still chewing) 
Most rentals charge a $100 pet fee per pet.  We do not.  However, we do have some rules
1)	No dogs on furniture
2)	Clean up dog waste outside
3)	Keep barking to a minimum 
4)	Do not allow your dog on our neighbour’s property, ever
5)	If your dog leaves a lot of hair, please use the vacuum and clean up the dog hair. 
If any of these rules are not followed, then we will charge a $200 extra cleaning fee. 


ALL RENTERS MUST:
1) Complete and sign our rental contract.
Anyone who wishes to rent our property must complete and sign a rental contract.  If you wish you review the contract prior to booking, just ask... Id be happy to send it to you in advance.

2) Provide have driver's license on their Airbnb profile
Only people who have  a driver's license etc uploaded on their Airbnb profile are permitted to rent my property. (Only Airbnb can see your ID, the host/I can never ever see your ID).  This is to protect this booking from fraudulent / scammers /ill-intentioned individuals from booking my property.
description.access: Each cottage has its own key pad code entry.  I will provide you a Welcome Tour upon arrival.
description.notes:
NOTE: Airbnb is not set up to incorporate 13% HST taxes so I will send you a separate request for this tax payment .   All bookings are subject to HST


RENTERS MUST FULLY COMPLETE AND SIGN OUR RENTAL CONTRACT, in which , providing a full list of everyone’s names and ages who will be in attendance at our property .  All individuals, regardless of age, count in our maximum capacity. Anyone who wishes to read the rental contract in advance, before booking, I am happy to do so.  Just ask.

LIST OF THINGS TO BRING
- bed sheets/pillow cases
- swim towels/ bath towels
- kitchen linens
- Personal items: sunblock, insect repellent, hair dryer
- kitchen items: spices, coffee, tea, coffee filters, oil & vinegar, sugar, milk
- paper products: toilet paper, paper towel, napkins,
- laundry detergent


OWNER ACCESS TO THE PROPERTY
The owners/their hired professionals may need access to the property during your stay.  We would always contact you in advance before accessing the property.  Reason for access would be: lawn mowing, gardening, watering of the lawn, snow removal, accessing the garage etc.   And we would do our best to be quick and efficient.
description.neighborhood: This cottage is located on a quiet but scenic bay overlooking a bay with no cottages on it....just trees and frogs.  The sunsets off dock are amazing to enjoy your morning coffee or happy hour drinks. We are located between 2 cottage towns (Magnetawan is 5 mins away and Burk's Falls is 15 mins away).
description.transit:
Lots of parking on our property.  There are 2 towns nearby:
1) Magnetawan: only 5 minutes drive
2) Burk's Falls: only 15 minutes drive
description.interaction: We own multiple waterfront cottage properties on the same cottage road. All within walking distance of each other. We rent out all 3 properties so I'm typically close by so we're are available if you need anything or need help.
description.house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

1)NO NOISE COMPLAINTS/ NO ROWDY BEHAVIOUR
-Noise complaints are the #1 concern of all Airbnb hosts.  
-Please be considerate of your cottage neighbours
-No loud music at any time 
-No loud talking/yelling 
-If we receive any noise complaints about your group, then YOUR DAMAGE DEPOSIT WILL NOT BE REFUNDED

2)CAMPFIRE FIRE BANS (occasional and seasonal)
-Sometimes during summer we have fire bans, due to lack of rain.  GUESTS ARE LEGALLY RESPONSIBLE for checking the Magnetawan website daily to get updates on the Fire Ban status. 
-Sometimes in the past, we have had serious fire bans and the police were issuing fines to anyone with an outdoor flame.  
-During fire bans, no open flames are permitted outside ie no campfires, no camp stoves etc (Propane BBQ is permitted)
-Even when there’s been recent rain, the fire ban may persist… you must check the Magnetawan website daily to get updates on the Fire Ban status
-The fire ban is updated and listed on the BOTTOM RIGHT of the website page
-http://magnetawan.com/fire-rating/

3)DON’T EXCEED MAXIMUM CAPACITY  - includes adults and kids/babies
-Do not exceed the maximum capacity of the property.  
-Maximum capacity is determined by the limitations of our septic system, not based on sleep capacity
-Cottages do not have plumbing systems like in the city. Our cottage is on a septic system which has a limited capacity. If you exceed the maximum capacity of the property then you exceed the maximum capacity of the septic system. In which case, you may cause serious damage to our plumbing system and this expense will be deducted from your damage deposit
-Any group that is not honest about the number of people in their group (including adults, children and babies), and exceed the maximum capacity, will be at risk of their booking being cancelled 
- 


4)NO SMOKE SMELL INDOORS (cigarette/marijuana/vape)
-No smoking indoors
-Smoking outdoors is permitted but not near any open doors or windows  (the smoke will get blown into the cottage
-Any smoke smell inside the cottage may result in a cleaning fee charged to you.  (deducted from your damage deposit)

5)NO ROWDY /LOUD BEHAVIOUR 
-Parties cause loud noise and noise complaints

6)DOGS PERMITTED, BUT NOT ON FURNITURE
-Dogs are very welcome at our cottage (no cats)
-Clean up all dog waste outside
-Don’t allow your dog to wander onto other cottage properties
-Any dog fur found on furniture will require extra cleaning and these fees will be charged back to you (deducted from your cleaning deposit)
-Keep barking limited to avoid noise complaints

7)MINIMUM AGE - 25
-All guests in your group must be 25 years or older, except families. Any exceptions must be approved by the Host
-No high school or university groups (ie graduation celebrations) permitted under any circumstances
-Stag/stagette groups are permitted, with approval from Host.  We have had many Stag/Stagette groups in the past who have been wonderful and respectful.  But rowdy Stag/Stagette groups are not suited to our property.  (I prefer to have a conversation with the group prior to booking to discuss expectations and noise concerns)

8)LINENS
- This rental includes: comforters & pillows
-Guests need to bring: bed sheets, pillow cases, towels, kitchen linens etc


9)PAPER PRODUCT "STARTER KIT" PROVIDED ONLY
We provide you a "Starter Kit" of paper products.  This kit includes:
- 2 x roll of toilet paper per bathroom 
- 1 roll of paper towel for the kitchen
Please bring extra toilet paper and paper towel if you feel your needs will exceed our Paper Product Starter Kit

10) SEPTIC SYSTEM
- Our toilets are on a septic system (like all cottages). Septic systems are super sensitive and get clogged easily. Please don't use thick toilet paper/ a lot of toilet paper or it will clog the toilet easily. 
- Only toilet paper down the toilets (No baby wipes, no paper towel, no feminine hygiene products etc)
- Any damage to the toilets/septic (due to disregard of the above mentioned rules) will be charged back to renters.

11) DO NO LEAVE GARBAGE / FOOD OUTSIDE ON THE PROPERTY
-Ensure you have walked the entire property looking for garbage that your group may have left outside ie pop cans, water bottles, cigarette butts, etc Children often leave garbage outside
-No cigarette butts on the property.  All cigarette butts should be placed in the fire pit outside
-No beer caps/water bottle caps left outside on the property
-Any garbage (listed above) left outside will be subject to extra cleaning fees 



BRING YOUR LINENS 
1)	Bed sheets & pillow cases
2)	Bath / swim towels
3)	Kitchen linens ie dish towels, dish cloths etc


WHAT TO BRING/THINGS TO NOTE
1)	LINENS:  Please ensure to bring:
-        bed sheets
-        pillow cases
-        swim/hot tub towels 
-        bath towels
-        kitchen linens ie dishcloths, dishtowels etc   
2)	PAPER PRODUCTS: Please DO NOT bring thick toilet paper as it will clog the toilet very easily.  All cottages are on septic systems and they are very sensitive and susceptible to clogging with thick toilet paper.
3)	KITCHEN/PERSONAL ITEMS:  Spices for your cooking, including salt and pepper, oil & vinegar, coffee & filters, sugar, butter, cooking oil, tin foil, zip locks, saran, shampoo, laundry supplies, hair dryer etc
4)	LAUNDRY DETERGENT
5)	FLIPFLOPS FOR HOT TUB
6)	FIREWOOD FOR CAMPFIRES

7)	FISHING GEAR/ FISHING LICENSE/BOATING LICENSE
 
8)	LIFEJACKETS FOR KIDS   Our insurance company doesn’t permit us to provide life jackets for children under 80lbs due to sizing issues.   Please bring life jackets for all children under 80lbs 


13% HST PAYMENT VIA AIRBNB
You will be asked to pay your HST in a separate Airbnb payment.  This payment will be processed through Airbnb and closer to your arrival date. 

RENTAL CONTRACT  IS MANDATORY
- Must complete our rental contract and provide the names of all individuals that will be at our cottage property.  All parts and pages must be completed
- Must upload your driver's license to your Airbnb profile 
- 13% HST ... you will be send a separate payment request through Airbnb. 
- Check-in information will not be released until these 3 items are received
If you wish to read the rental contract before you book,  I would be happy to send a copy, upon request. 


SAFETY
- Supervise your children at all times. Especially near water, fire and near places with height i.e. upper loft railing, ladders etc
- No diving off the dock
- Ensure you've read our Wood burning Stove instructions before operating it (located in the Welcome Manual)
- Please exercise extra caution near and around the wood stoves (when in use).  Children, adults and dogs can receive serious burns if they touch any part of the wood stove when it is in use.

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: Amazing set up and great location.  Almost seemed as it was a "BRAND NEW" home.  Would highly recommend this location.

items.comments: Amazing set up and great location.  Almost seemed as it was a "BRAND NEW" home.  Would highly recommend this location.

What a lovely and unique experience! The houseboat was beautifully decorated, sparkling clean, and exceeded our expectations! All of the comforts of home were provided. Comfy beds, nice linens, soaps, shampoos, laundry soap, and even cleaning supplies! There is fabulous shopping, food, and entertainment all within walking distance and we could even hear the concert from down the street sitting on our deck! The host, Marcia was wonderful and helpful, attentive to every detail.  We were even lucky enough to meet her in person! We will absolutely be staying at The Cove again in the near future. It was hard to leave and go back to the real world...

Wow!  What a unique and fun place to stay, especially for attending a 2 day concert at Live Oak Bank Pavilion. The location is only a 5 minute walk from the venue but an easy and beautiful walk to downtown shops and restaurants. The houseboat was spotless and we loved sitting on the back porch. So much fun!!!!!  Even though it’s a bit pricey it was well worth it!

First timing staying on a houseboat and enjoyed the experience!  Marcia was a very helpful and responsive host!  Location to downtown Wilmington made our trip even better!  I would highly recommend staying here!!

Super unique houseboat just a few blocks from downtown Wilmington!    Super clean and comfortable. View of the cape fear waterway/river—some of the other houseboats face the Embassy Suites. Very close to all the action—river walk, restaurants, shops. Loved it!  Ate at PinPoint restaurant downtown. Such good food—  Burrata salad, fried chicken, grouper were all excellent.
Amazing place! It was beautiful inside and out! Marcia was very accommodating and responsive. We will definitely be back!

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our houseboats offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.
description.space:
After parking in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our houseboat community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your houseboat, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three benches along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed, large closet, ceiling fan, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2:
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with comfortable furniture, a 60" Smart TV, desk & chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 55" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bath, featuring another walk-in shower. 

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this houseboat is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other houseboats at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire houseboat for the duration of their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent houseboat community. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 houseboats and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per houseboat. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, please ask us about getting another parking pass or plan to park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)

gallery.caption: This island houseboat stay is not just "on the water", it's ON THE WATER.
Magic evenings in this tiny home and houseboat with an amazing view.
Sleep in this floating cabin / houseboat. relax on the front porch, cook over the fire or grill on shore.

You can bring your own boat.  We’ve got free island dock space, a free public boat launch, and free parking.

No boat?  No problem.  You can paddle one of our canoes or kayaks (also free).  It’s about a 30 minute journey from or to shore (for intermediate paddlers - weather permitting).

If weather doesn’t permit, you can take a free pontoon ferry (regular service is 10a, 3p, and 5p.

And if those times don’t work for you, then we can run a special ferry service at whatever time you want for $50.00.
1 Big Sustainable Island is home to 5 remote stays that share bathroom and shower facilities.  Each stay is sited for privacy and convenient access.
Fishing is amazing on Annabessacook Lake!
The Nautilus is the houseboat tiny home that floats off the Northeast corner of the island.
You've got cooking options!  Cook over a wood fire or on a propane grill with a side stove.
Inside the Compoloo. Rain water is stored for hand washing.
The island is 14 acres of  places to swim, fish, or relax
Take a HOT shower at the Showah-Loo!
Showah time!
Swim out to our meditation swim dock for a quiet moment…
"Yee Haw" on our ropeswing.
Fly in and park your float plane on our beach!
Island life is dog heaven.
The Nautilus is attached to 1 Big Sustainable Island that is 1/2 mile from shore - an amazing view from bed on the houseboat.
A map of the lake neighborhood.
Sleep in this comfy queen size bed and watch the sun rise from your pillow - an amazing view.
Options for getting to the island:  Bring your own boat, paddle your way in ours, or take a free ferry ride on our pontoon boat
The comfy full size futon bed offers 2 added indoor sleeping accommodations.
Bring your own boat and make the Nautilus your home base!
Dine outside on the "floating front porch", inside on the foldout table, or onshore at the picnic table next to the fire pit.
Just bring your vacay clothes and a cooler full of food.  We outfit you with the rest - everything you need to conveniently enjoy island life.
We're dog people.  Your pup will love the freedom of island time...
Explore the 1400 acre lake in our canoes and kayaks for free.
Loons are not shy.  This is Larry, one of two dozen that live on the lake.

Nautilus Waterhouse not exactly what you're looking for?
Each of the stays at 1BSI is unique.
Here's what makes them so...
Berry the Bass lives in his undisclosed home near the island.
Just bring your favorite foods...we'll provide everything else...
Large mouth and small mouth bass with an amazing view.
Even when it rains on the island, there's a silver lining...

hosts.about: The Ackley family has been in Maine since the 70's.  Kent, a Registered Maine Guide, is dedicated to teaching, learning, sharing, and experiencing outdoor life.  Island living on Annabessacook Lake is an important piece of his life.

recent.comments: Our stay on One Big Island was spectacular! We had a little trouble finding the launch, but Kent was very helpful and responsive. The surroundings are beautiful, the houseboat was clean and cozy, the bathrooms were clean and not smelly or spidery like camp bathrooms usually are. We had a campfire, strolled the island, swam in the lake, watched a storm roll in, and were rewarded with a beautiful double rainbow, watched a meteor shower, and woke up to a beautiful sunrise--all in one overnight trip.

items.comments: Our stay on One Big Island was spectacular! We had a little trouble finding the launch, but Kent was very helpful and responsive. The surroundings are beautiful, the houseboat was clean and cozy, the bathrooms were clean and not smelly or spidery like camp bathrooms usually are. We had a campfire, strolled the island, swam in the lake, watched a storm roll in, and were rewarded with a beautiful double rainbow, watched a meteor shower, and woke up to a beautiful sunrise--all in one overnight trip.

Our stay was a very peaceful one. Although it was raining, we got to unwind and enjoy the fresh air. My partner and I went on a kayak ride, with a kayak provided by IBSI (one big sustainable island). I will be booking here again next time I am looking for an escape from the city life.  Thank you to Kent, Heather, and the rest of the friendly crew.

We had such a lovely stay on 1BSL. The Nautilus was beyond dreamy and offered a cozy and private stay rain or shine. We loved our time inside, just reading and admiring the views, but we also got a lot out of the island's other activities (kayaking, swimming, rope swings, fungi-identifying etc.) Beyond the setting, Kent and Heather were wonderful and attentive hosts. We'd love to come back again soon!

This place was beautiful and unique. Great place to unwind and have quiet. Kent was the perfect host, always available to answer questions and ready to help if we needed anything. Would definitely recommend this experience to a friend!

Myself, my daughter and her 4 year old had the absolute best time on the island. Stayed a few days in the big tent and final night in the floating boat house “Nautilus”. Both accommodations were exactly if not better than expected. Hearing the loons all day and watching the beautiful sun set/sun rise each morning was nothing short of incredible.  Would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for adventure or looking to settle down and relax!

We had a wonderful overnight stay at the island as we traveled through the NE states. I wish we could have stayed longer.  Fishing was great off the dock.  We enjoyed the kayaks around the island as well. Such a hidden gem. It’s a unique enjoyable experience for anyone that loves nature and the great outdoors.  Kent was a wonderful host and went out of his way to ensue we had a great time.

description.summary:
Waves peacefully lapping at your cabin door...
Watch the sunrise over the lake from your comfy bed. Cook your favorite meals. Chill out in a hammock.  Bask in the campfire glow. Dine on the floating front porch. Enjoy hot showers. Play on the rope swing.  Tie a canoe up next to the porch. Explore the trails of  a 14 acre wooded island.  Enjoy super clean, Superhost, Maine Guide hospitality. We'll help you settle into the rhythm of island life and return you refreshed, renewed, and inspired.
description.space:
We supply everything you need for a unique Maine island experience.  Just bring a cooler with ice, your favorite food and beverage.  Then prepare to unplug. Serving the naturally curious since 2015.

Sleep soundly in a comfy queen size bed made up with extra blankets and a comforter.   The futon couch coverts to a full-size bed in the living room.  Or, lounge in the indoor hammock (better yet, hang it outside next to the firepit).  Modern amenities include:  a compost toilet and hot shower (available during the non-freezing seasons) with towels and soap nearby.  Island life is barely "roughing it", even though there is no grid-electricity and running water.

RETURNING GUESTS:  We appreciate the many folks who return year after year.  Remind us of your last stay and we'll honor last year's nightly rates.  If you are looking for an exception to our minimum night requirements, please reach out.

LAST MINUTE RESERVATION?:  If you are looking for an exception to the minimum night stay requirements for last minute reservations, we do that.  Please just send us a message and we'll do our best to fit you in for a super short stay.

COOKING OPTIONS: Cooking is easy, so pack light.  We supply: kitchen utensils, dishes, pots and pans, French press, coffee, tea, sugar, salt, pepper, and drinking water from our homestead well.  You can cook on the gas grill with a side burner on the floating front porch  or you can cook over an open fire near the shore picnic area.

FREE STUFF:  Every Maine Island adventure includes: camp chairs, unlimited firewood, lantern, fire starter, matches, canoe or kayaks with life vests and gear. Explore Annabessacook Lake!  On the island there is a rope swing, a mile of walking paths, benches and hammocks.

WANT TO VACATION WITH YOUR DOG?  Send us a request!  The Nautilus WaterHouse is pet-friendly for most of our furry friends.  The dog fee is $30 per night per dog.  During the day, dogs should be leashed as there might be others visiting the island.
description.access:
Guests enjoy exclusive access to the Nautilus where they can enjoy privacy and shared access to 1 Big Sustainable Island and its facilities.

There's lots to do on 1 Big Sustainable Island and (as has been the tradition for generations in the neighborhood) visitors are encouraged to stop by (so expect some company from the neighborhood on the island during daylight -- after dark, however, the island is closed to the public).  Activities in these shared areas include:

Hiking or walking on more than a mile of trails
Swimming
Swinging off the rope swing at the lake's edge
Cooking over an open fire
Watching the sunset from Sunset Rock
Resting in one of the hammocks sprinkled about the island
Fishing off the dock

We are happy to provide safe luggage storage so you can enjoy free early arrival or free late departure.  Guests can take advantage of the shared areas and activities either before check in or after check out.
description.notes:
Is it a houseboat?  a Tiny home?  on an Island? or is it a Cabin?  How about all of the above.

OUTHOUSAPHOBES:  We're with you!
New guests might wonder about our island, off-the-grid bathrooms.  Rest assured that our compost toilets are designed with usability in mind. They smell great!  

We have all been to rural outhouses where this is not the case.  It's the number 1 complaint (or is that #2?). Which is why, when we built each of our toilets facilities, we did something different.  Through management of airflow, separation of liquids from solids, application of saw dust, and optimizing the force of gravity, we have a composting toilet system that has been in place for years with very little odor and maximum sanitation.  So rest easy:  if a member of your party is an "outhousaphobe", know that so are we!

CAN'T FIND THE DATES YOU'RE LOOKING FOR?
Check out all our Maine Island eco-retreat listings at 1 Big Sustainable Island.

LOOKING FOR A SHORT STAY?  
So that guests looking for longer stays have options, our minimum night stay (MNS) requirements tend to start high and then fade away.  So if you've got a quick stay in mind and are surprised by our MNS requirements, please check back with us.  The closer we get to an empty night, the more flexible we will be.

Packing Advice for glampers:  PACK LIGHT!

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
•   Cooler with ice (We'll replace thawed ice for FREE)
•   Favorite foods and beverages 
•   A cable for your cell phone (we provide phone juice via battery)
•   Sunscreen and bug repellent
•   Layers of warm clothing
•   Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
•   Fishing permit, if you plan to fish
•  Slippers or heavy sock for indoors (shoes get left at the door)
•  Water shoes for swimming
•   Curiosity

Our Rates include: 
•   Free canoes, kayaks, paddles and life vests
•   Dock access
•   Hammock
•   Camp chairs
•   Unlimited firewood
•   Out door fire pit
•   Indoor woodstove 
•   Adjustable grill for cooking over the fire 
•   Gas grill with side burner
•   Pots, pans
•   Dishes 
•   Utensils 
•   Biodegradable soap 
•   Sheets 
•   Towels 
•   Playing Cards 
•   Lanterns 


Work Remotely - Wifi, cell, and battery recharges
Most cell providers register 3 bars and 5G on the island .  If you have a smartphone, then you can get to the internet!  Be sure to bring a charge cord for your phone - we provide phone battery charging.  We offer a mobile hotspot upon request and laptop battery recharging.
description.neighborhood: Annabessacook Lake is our 1400 acre backyard of clear water, good fishing, and great neighbors.  Whether they are year-round residents, summer vacationers, or visitors, most folks you'll meet will tell you that they have been coming here since they were a kid.
description.transit:
Getting to the Island:  You’ve got check in options

CHECK IN YOURSELF by:

*       Bringing your own boat or boat plane - we have a public boat launch, free parking for your rig at our place, and free island dock space available.
*      Paddling yourself - Take one of our canoes or kayaks and paddle the 30 minute trip across the lake to your stay.  We can shuttle your gear on the next ferry if you want. Or, 

CHECK IN WITH FERRY SERVICE:

Free ferry service to the island runs at:

*         9:45 Early Arrival - We’ll shuttle you to 1 Big Sustainable Island early and while your stay is being prepared, you can begin your “Island Time” early.  We’ll safely stow your gear and let you know as soon as your  accommodations are ready.

*         3pm and 5pm - With the standard checkin ferry, we’ll move your crew and your gear to the island and help get you settled in.

*.        Pre-arranged Ferry Service is available at other times for a one-way Fee.  All paddled boats need to be off the water by sundown.  Seats on all of our ferry services are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis, so it's important to make your reservation early.  We'll transport your gear and all your guests on this 10 minute private boat ride.  

FREE PARKING:  Park in our private parking area for free.  Cart your gear to  our dock and begin your "Island Time" journey.
description.interaction:
Kent is a Registered Maine Guide and experienced boater.  Guests typically enjoy a boat ride to and from the island via pontoon boat and then have access to canoes and kayaks to explore the lake throughout their stay. 

He is available if needed.  During the daylight hours, the island receives visitors from the surrounding lake community who want to hike, explore, or take the rope swing for a ride!  At night, the island is quiet, peaceful, and restricted to our overnight guests. Four other stays are remotely located on the island , as well.
description.house_rules:
Our Island-Life Vacationing Manual has all of our hints, tips, and rules for experiencing a memorable and inspiring island vacation.  Let us know if you would like a copy.

And here is the fine print.  We are strict about our House Rules and the additional rules below because we want folks to have a safe, enjoyable, peaceful island adventure.  Like most people, we don't like surprises, but we do like questions, so if you have any about our house rules, feel free to ask beforehand.

We do not allow parties.  
All overnight guests must be registered within the reservation request.  
Day visitor guests must be pre-cleared before inviting them over.  
All occupants of our canoes and kayaks are required to wear life vests.  
All boats are required to be off the water by dark.  
When checking a boat out you must text message to Kent.
When returning a boat, a text message to Kent is required.
There is no smoking allowed in any structure.  
Smoking is allowed only outside, provided that smokers clean up.
Our smoking damage fee is:$300.  
Illegal substances and fireworks are prohibited at all times.
Please remove footwear at the door.
Fires in the fire ring shall be attended to at all times.
A bucket of lake water should be filled and available whenever fires are active.
Fires in the wood stove should not exceed 375 degrees
Active wood stoves should be attended at all times. 
Smelly garbage must be disposed of in the garbage cans outside.
Quiet hours are from 9pm to 8am.  
No personal items should be left in shared spaces.  
All requests for pets (service animals and others) are required at the time of booking.
All dogs shall be on leash at all times.
The lost key charge is $50.
All guests are liable for any and all damage to the buildings and common areas, including legal fees.

recent.comments: Vincent and his team were great and so welcoming! The house boat is tiny but very cosy:) The location is perfect and so peaceful! The team drop us off to Heart island to visit Boldt castle which is a must see!!!! Thanks for everything and we will be back for sure☺️

hosts.about: I am an artist and a high school teacher. I love theatre and music. I actually went to college with the guys who started AirBnb.

recent.comments: My daughter and I stayed at Erin’s for one night. It was a fun adventure. The location was great and we had never stayed in a house boat before. Was very comfortable and Erin was super responsive and helpful.

items.comments: My daughter and I stayed at Erin’s for one night. It was a fun adventure. The location was great and we had never stayed in a house boat before. Was very comfortable and Erin was super responsive and helpful.

Erin is a great host! The place is exactly what you can expect from a small houseboat. Two of us stayed very comfortably (we each brought a backpack and a suitcase) and used one bed to put our stuff on so we could have a clear path to walk from the front of the boat to the back. Tip: if you have a lot of stuff, there is not a lot of space to store things, so pack light! The deck is cute and gives a great view. Erin was super quick to respond to all of my questions! 

Things out of Erin’s control: You can expect some noise from nearby Hot Club on the weekend nights but it’s not bad from the Houseboat. The neighbor boat right next to us was playing music late, and loud. They really loved their bass. 

Overall great stay! I loved how close it was to coffee shops, restaurants, and downtown. Would definitely stay again!

Floating on this boat was a much needed exhale for my partner and I after a long stretch of travel. We needed a last minute stay for a night and it was such a romantic blessing to sleep on the water like this. Cannot recommend enough!
Very friendly host and fun experience!

We were in town at the last minute and wanted to stay somewhere fun. The boat was in a great location and super for one night. Erin was a great host and gave us all of the info we needed right away. Def a unique experience and I’d suggest it for an adventurous traveler.
Thank you for the quick responses and recommendations. It was just as pictured! My son also loved the experience of staying in a boathouse.

description.summary:
Experience the enchantment of REI DA GAMBIARRA, the 1969 Nautaline Houseboat.  Step aboard this creatively renovated floating gem and prepare for a one-of-a-kind adventure. With its whitewashed wooden floors and walls, this charming houseboat offers a unique and inviting atmosphere, ensuring an unforgettable stay.

Perfect for singles, couples, or friends seeking a distinctive getaway, REI DA GAMBIARRA comfortably accommodates up to 3 guests.
description.space:
REI DE GAMBIARRA: The name of the boat comes from a nickname that the previous owner was called in Brazil which means “the king of invention”  – he was always coming up with ways to fix things on his sailboat without actually having the original parts.  This boat has gone through an extensive remodeling. It has been gutted on the interior and creatively redone. The style of the boat is similar to a Nantucket cottage – it is rustic and basic in its aesthetic.  The walls and floor are done and white similar to a beach cottage in Nantucket and colors to accent the interior are modest with solid blues and linen hues.  

This boat is recommended for up to 3 people. For four people, it is recommended that two people sleep on one which is very possible. This booking is truly ideal for three people each of whom would have their own bed. 

For amenities, there is a separate bathroom that has a raised shower, a gravity-fed toilet and a sink. There’s plenty of hot water. For warmer days, we have an air conditioning unit. And also for cooler evenings, we offer a space heater which heats everything up nicely on cool evenings.  There’s also a wonderful upper deck that allows panoramic views of the city.   The kitchenette includes a sink, a mini fridge, plates silverware and glasses. 

For modern entertainment there is a flatscreen TV with a Roku and free wifi. A Nintendo Switch can be arranged upon request. 

This is a truly unique opportunity to spend some time aboard a very unique Houseboat - REI DE GAMBIARRA, tremendous care and thought have been taken to provide a unique experience aboard this rare Houseboat.

We offer parking for multiple cars in a 24/7 offsite lot for free. The lot is a walking distance away so if you are not prepared to walk to the marina this may not be the booking for you.  We are located in the east side of Providence within the hurricane barrier. We are in a very protected marina which offers a safe and very convenient location. We are close to Many Providence attractions including Brown University, Rhode Island School of Design and Federal Hill.
description.access: The entire boat will be yours for the duration of your stay.
description.notes:
Occupancy of 3-4 people is STRICTLY enforced given the close-quarter nature of the marina;  failure to abide by the stated occupancy will result in forfeiture of the guest's security deposit and possible expulsion from the marina.

Please note that guests should bring their own Bluetooth Sound system if they wish to have music on board.
description.transit: The marina is walking distance to the Newport Ferry. Uber is recommended for going into downtown Providence for restaurants or nightlife as parking in Providence can be costly and stressful. For those who love a stroll, Downtown is a pleasant 20 minute walk.  Wickenden Street and the Pedestrian Bridge Restaurants and food Trucks are a 5 minute walk.  Bikes and Scooter rentals are available throughout the neighborhood via Apps.

hosts.about:
Bienvenue  à Aloberge
Bien que les hébergements flottants soient en eux seuls des expériences uniques, nous avons pour but d'aller encore plus loin et de nous distinguer dans la catégorie des prêts-à-camper flottants, par un maximum d'équipement (selon les limites d’électricité de 30 ampères disponibles sur les quais) et par une ambiance zen, afin de rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible. Il nous tient à coeur que tout soit à votre satisfaction.

recent.comments: Such a fun opportunity to stay in a boat house! The property was lovely with plenty of recreation. The house was very clean and accuratly described. My only complaints were that there were no hooks inside to hang things (coats, towels, etc.), the bathrooms smelled very badly of sewage, and the boat houses themselves are right next to one another so you can hear your neighbors as if they are in the same room. The price is a little steep for what you get, paying for an experinece more than anything else, but I would still recommend this space as I have never seen anything else like it!

items.comments: Such a fun opportunity to stay in a boat house! The property was lovely with plenty of recreation. The house was very clean and accuratly described. My only complaints were that there were no hooks inside to hang things (coats, towels, etc.), the bathrooms smelled very badly of sewage, and the boat houses themselves are right next to one another so you can hear your neighbors as if they are in the same room. The price is a little steep for what you get, paying for an experinece more than anything else, but I would still recommend this space as I have never seen anything else like it!
Such a unique Airbnb listing! Calming energy & an overall great experience. I have a feeling that I’ll be back!
Magnifique endroit pour un séjour qui sort de l'ordinaire. J'avais l'impression de dormir dehors! Tout est pensé pour un séjour agréable.

We had a great stay on the water! It was a fun and unique experience for our toddler too. The scenery was gorgeous, and we enjoyed a peaceful breakfast watching the sun rise. Everything in the cabin was as depicted! The beds were not very comfortable, but okay for just the weekend. I wasn't able to find the water access that was shown in the picture, but still found a tiny opening that was good enough to dip our toes.  Overall, we had a great mini getaway and have suggested it to a few friends already!

Nous avons adoré notre séjour, mon petit chien aussi! 
Beau paysage, paisible, propre 
Service impeccable!
Hôtesse vraiment fine et à l'écoute!
Nous suggérons fortement 
Merci Nathalie pour tout!

My fiance and I had a wonderful vacation at Nathalies place. The chalet is so cozy yet quaint, you get an automatic welcome feeling once you're inside. We felt like we were so spoiled, Nathalie provided EVERYTHING just not the food of course and basic your own linens but everything was provided. We come from the city and being able to sleep on the water as it rocks you to sleep and relax outside on the terrace staring at the water and your surrounds so beautiful!! we also were welcomed by a few beautiful blue Herons as well 🙂

description.summary: Joli prêt-à-camper flottant, de style glamping,  avec grande terrasse zen, vue panoramique, électricité, barbecue & autres petits équipements de cuisine, ainsi que place gratuite pour votre petite embarcation. Chiens bienvenus. Prenez vos repas/barbecues et relaxez entourés d’eau en observant les oiseaux. Le jour profitez des nombreuses activités du site et la nuit admirez confortablement le ciel étoilé. Endormez-vous et réveillez-vous bercés par les flots et par le chant des animaux.
description.space:
***SPÉCIAUX/PROMOTIONS 2023:  Réservez deux 2 nuits consécutives (3 lors de congés fériés) en basse saison 2023 (avant le 16 juin et après le 16 septembre) ET OBTENEZ L'ACCÈS JOURNALIER GRATUIT À 6 PETITES EMBARCATIONS: 1 PLANCHE À PAGAIE, 1 PÉDALO, 1 KAYAK DOUBLE À PÉDALES, 1 KAYAK SIMPLE, ET 2 CANOTS (une à la fois par hébergement, selon disponibilités, 2 heures maximum à la fois par embarcation).  VALEUR DE 90$ 

Aloberge 6 est la dernière des six unités du Refuge de l’Île-aux-Noix (celle la plus près du Richelieu). Elle est de catégorie « prêt-à-camper avec électricité (30 ampères) » et les chiens sont bienvenus.

La plate-forme flottante mesure 12 x 26 pieds et est fixée en permanence au quai.

La cabine est de grandeur 10 x 12 pieds et elle comprend : 

-Deux banquettes simples avec sommiers en lattes, dont l'une peut s'étirer en lit double (capacité de dormir 3, mais l'hébergement est idéal pour 2) 

-L'équipement de cuisine suivant : frigo compact avec compartiment de congélation, micro-onde, grille-pain, bouilloire, cafetière à filtre et cafetière Keurig avec k-cup réutilisable, mixeur, vaisselle de base pour 3 personnes, poêlon et/ou wok en fonte pour le barbecue, nécessaire pour faire la vaisselle, bol à chien, table d’appoint (long banc pliable) 

-Une distributrice d’eau avec 3 gallons d’eau de puits. (L'eau courante n'est disponible qu’à l’entrée du quai et à la capitainerie) 

-A/C et petite chaufferette 

-Serviettes pour 3 personnes et articles de bains (séchoir à cheveux, trousse de premiers soins, petits échantillons de savon & shampoing écologique à la citronnelle) 

-Literie pour 3 personnes: oreillers, ensemble de draps simples et doubles (COUVERTURES NON INCLUSES/en option). 

-Espaces de rangement (tiroirs des banquettes, petites étagères)

-Fenêtres qui s'ouvrent des 4 côtés (pellicules de polymère anti-uv)

La grande terrasse avant, de grandeur 12' x 10', comprend : -2 chaises longues à gravité zéro -Une table avec rallonge et 2 chaises -Un appareil électrique chasse-moustique 

Le balcon arrière comprend : -Barbecue extérieur avec rond de cuisson intégré, ustensiles pour barbecue, plaque ou tapis de barbecue (gaz propane non inclus/en option) -Banc-coffre avec articles de loisirs (ballon, jeux de boules, raquettes de badminton, frisbee)

-Place gratuite pour amener une petite embarcation, si elle rentre à côté de l'hébergement (l'espace disponible mesure 8 pieds par 15 pieds)

-Deux salles de bain unisexes avec douches, disponibles à moins d'une minute de marche, à la capitainerie du site 

-Stationnement gratuit 

-Wi-Fi gratuit à partir de la capitainerie (non garanti de l'hébergement) 

-Accès gratuit au terrain du Refuge et à ses infrastructures (foyer extérieur, quai de pêche, terrain de volleyball, petit sentier, aménagement de sable, tables, barbecues à briquettes).


EN OPTION (à commander si possible plus de 24h d'avance)
-Couverture chauffante (8$+taxes/séjour)
-Gaz propane pour le barbecue de l'hébergement (7,5$/nuitée + taxes)
-Avant le 26 juin et après le 4 septembre: Accès journalier partagé aux 6 petites embarcations d’Aloberge: 45$/jour + taxes  (*voir conditions)
-Tours en voilier avec initiation à la voile (disponibilités à confirmer)

-Disponible en LOCATION SUR PLACE EN HAUTE SAISON : Entre la Saint-Jean-Baptiste et la fête du travail, la municipalité prévoit louer sur place ses propres embarcations à pagaie lors de beau temps. 


(* Conditions d’utilisation des petites embarcations d’Aloberge : À utiliser une à la fois par hébergement, 2 heures maximales à la fois par embarcation, selon disponibilités et selon les règles de sécurité mentionnées dans le contrat de location).
description.access:
Accès privé au prêt-à-camper flottant avec terrasse et barbecue.
Accès partagé au site du refuge et au bloc sanitaire avec les autres visiteurs et citoyens de la municipalité.
description.notes:
NON INCLUS/À AMENER : 

-Briquettes pour les barbecues sur le site ou petite ou grande bonbonne de gaz propane pour le barbecue de l’hébergement (possibilité d’achat de bouteilles 1 lb, ou de location d’une bonbonne 20 lbs, à 5 minutes en voiture) 
-Chaussures d’eau pour la baignade dans le Richelieu (jetée rocailleuse)
-Veste de flottaison pour enfant de moins de 12 ans, obligatoire sur les quais 
-Eau potable (si plus de 3 gallons sont nécessaires)
-Lotion chasse-moustiques
-Couvertures. N.B. : L’hébergement n’étant pas isolé/insonorisé, et le mode de chauffage étant d'appoint (petite chaufferette),  IL EST FORTEMENT CONSEILLÉ D'APPORTER DES COUVERTURES TRÈS CHAUDES EN BASSE SAISON, ou de commander (si possible plus de 24h d'avance) une couverture chauffante en option (8$/séjour + taxes)
description.neighborhood:
Les hébergements sont situés à St-Paul-De-L'Île-Aux-Noix, capitale nautique du Québec, au Sud du Québec, à 18 km des frontières de l’état de New-York et du Vermont et à seulement 40 minutes (58 km) de Montréal (pont Champlain). 

Pour les nombreuses activités de la région, consultez notre guide de l'hôte, les sites de Tourisme Montérégie et de Tourisme Haut-Richelieu, ainsi que le site de Alorichelieu  (disponibilités à vérifier pour chaque endroit avant de vous déplacer)
description.transit: L'Hébergement est accessible par voiture, vélo et petite embarcation nautique
description.interaction: Votre hôte demeure à 10 minutes et se fera un plaisir de vous aider en cas de besoin, ou de répondre à toute question.
description.house_rules:
RÈGLES À RESPECTER AFIN D'ÉVITER LA PERTE DU DÉPÔT DE SÉCURITÉ, EN PARTIE OU EN TOTALITÉ (OU MÊME L'EXPULSION)
*Suivre les règles sanitaires publiques en vigueur
*Sauf avis contraire, arrivée après 16h à l’hébergement (vous pouvez arriver quand vous voulez sur le site du refuge)
*3 Personnes maximum en tout temps et 2 chiens maximums (propres, tranquilles et non agressifs). 
*Pas de bougie permise et interdiction de fumer dans l'hébergement. 
*Si vous utilisez le barbecue sur l’hébergement, il faut fermer la bouteille de gaz (disponible en option) après chaque utilisation.
*LES CHIENS NE PEUVENT MONTER SUR LES BANQUETTES, à moins que vous apportiez des couvertures pour recouvrir entièrement les banquettes, dossiers inclus.
*Les toiles blanches enroulées doivent être légèrement retenues en les remontant afin d’éviter qu’elles ne remontent complètement d’un coup sec et que les ressorts se désajustent.
*Toutes les fenêtres et portes doivent être fermées en cas de risque de pluie ou de grand vent ou lorsque vous quittez pour la journée. 
*Les procédures de départ (rappel sur le frigo) doivent être suivies (le barbecue, les accessoires de cuisson et la vaisselle doivent être nettoyés pour être aussi propres qu’à votre arrivée, poubelles et recyclage disposés dans les bacs extérieurs appropriés, fenêtres fermées, portes verrouillées). Nous nous réservons le droit de vous charger tout frais supplémentaires en ménage suite à votre départ. Notamment, DES FRAIS SUPPLÉMENTAIRES DE 20$ SERONT CHARGÉS SI NOTRE ÉQUIPE D'ENTRETIEN DOIT NETTOYER LA VAISSELLE,  LE BARBECUE OU DES POILS DE CHIEN SUR LES BANQUETTES SUITE À VOTRE DÉPART. 
*L’hébergement et ses équipements doivent être intacts à votre départ, sinon nous en avertir dès que possible. Nous nous réservons le droit de vous charger tout équipement brisé, perdu ou volé.   
*Nous aviser dès que possible, de tout manque, inconvénient ou problème concernant l’hébergement, afin que nous puissions y remédier dans les plus brefs délais et améliorer votre séjour, ainsi que celui des prochains clients.

RÈGLEMENTS MUNICIPAUX DU SITE 
*** Aucun bruit ne sera toléré après 22h. 
*Stationnez aux endroits indiqués
*Tenir les chiens en laisse et svp ramassez les excréments
*Respectez les règles sanitaires
*Enfants de moins de douze ans, veste obligatoire sur les quais 
*Respectez les lieux, gardez la rivière propre, ramassez vos déchets
* Pêchez aux endroits permis
* Interdiction de consommer de l'alcool et des drogues sur le site (alcool permis sur les hébergements)
* Interdiction de faire des feux autres que dans le foyer et vous assurer qu'il est éteint en partant
* Interdiction de couper et ramasser le bois (lorsqu’il y a des cordes de bois sur le site, vous pouvez prendre quelques bûches pour le foyer extérieur)
* Aucun VTT n'est toléré sur le site
* Les contenants en verre sont interdits
* Pas de lavage de vaisselle dans les salles de bains (un lavabo extérieur est disponible sur la terrasse de la capitainerie/bloc sanitaire)
N.B. La descente de bateau sur le site est réservée aux citoyens de la municipalité. Il y a une descente payante à 5 minutes en voiture (Pourvoirie Guy Mayer)
N.B. La municipalité permet aux clients des hébergements d'amarrer une petite embarcation, si elle rentre dans la place restante à côté de l'hébergement et qu'elle ne dépasse pas 8' x 15'. 

RÈGLEMENTS LORS DE LA LOCATION DES PETITES EMBARCATIONS À PAGAIE/PÉDALES D’ALOBERGE (OU LORS DE L'ACCÈS PROMOTIONNEL GRATUIT À CELLES-CI) :
À utiliser à vos risques, par beau temps, une à la fois par hébergement, deux heures à la fois par embarcation. Tous les utilisateurs doivent porter en tout temps les vestes de flottaison : il faut prévoir d’amener celle pour un enfant, adaptée à sa taille. (Seuls deux vestes pour adultes sont disponibles sur l’hébergement). Ne pas consommer d’alcool. Rester le long des berges. Être prudent et visible lors de la chasse aux canards (à partir de septembre). Revenir avant le coucher du soleil. Remettre l’embarcation exactement comme elle était (à sa place, cadenassée et remettre la protection par-dessus s’il y a lieu). Veuillez noter qu'en cas de pluie, les clients sont responsables de vider l'eau accumulée dans les petites embarcations avant utilisation.
En acceptant ce contrat, vous acceptez de respecter les règles ci-hauts mentionnées et vous acceptez de dégager Aloberge de toute responsabilité en cas de problème pendant votre séjour, ou en cas d’imprévus vous obligeant à annuler votre séjour (mauvais temps et maladie/décès dans la famille inclus). Aucun remboursement n’est possible en dehors de la politique d’annulation, sauf si l’hébergement est déclaré inaccessible par les autorités, un crédit pourra alors vous être alloué pour un prochain séjour.

Pour toute question, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter 

Un très bon séjour !

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: Absolutely beautiful home! First time on a boathouse and let’s just say I will be back. Home is a little pricey for a short stay.  But all in all it was very clean, in a great location and has everything you need. Pack light because there is some walking from the parking area to the actual house.

items.comments: Absolutely beautiful home! First time on a boathouse and let’s just say I will be back. Home is a little pricey for a short stay.  But all in all it was very clean, in a great location and has everything you need. Pack light because there is some walking from the parking area to the actual house.
Great home and host, we will definitely be back!
This house boat was like a little slice of heaven. Beautiful and relaxing setting. Close to everything. Plenty of food, shopping, Riverwalk and more. Definitely a 💎 gem!

We were moved day of our arrival to a different houseboat, unfortunately it wasn’t as close as what we originally had but in the end it didn’t matter. Marcia offered us a late check out to make up for the move, which was nice. The house was great and location was beautiful. The only “complaint” (and it isn’t a big one), was there were no extra trash bags, so we had to buy some and no tea towels or dish rags.
This place was beautiful.  I’d stay again

Marcia was an excellent host. She communicated frequently and was very responsive. The pictures were very accurate and the house boat was larger than expected. Very well decorated. Love being on the marina and we had a surprise live concert Friday night. Thank you for an awesome stay!!!!

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our dockside villas offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.
description.space:
After parking (one parking pass per villa) in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our dockside community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your villa, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three stools along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as towels, laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed (linens provided), large closet, ceiling fan, Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2 (Sofa bed):
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with a sectional couch (with pull out sleeper), 55" Smart TV, desk and chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed (linens provided), dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 50" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bathroom with shower, and towels provided

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip. Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this Villa is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other Riverwalk Villas at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access: Guests have full access to the entire villa during their stay
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent floating villas. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 villas and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per villa. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)
