items.comments: One of the best !!
Kevin is solution based… we had a couple minor issues and he went up and beyond to take care of them. He’s a great host and I’ll definitely recommend this experience for others.

Karen was so welcoming and personable. She did an outstanding job explaining the houseboat and making us feel welcome. This Airbnb is perfect for making memories with a unique experience. Our young family cannot wait to visit again. Thank you.

This place was fantastic!!! we absolutely loved our stay. we were only there overnight but it was the most relaxing and peaceful time we've had in a long time. Karen was so sweet and friendly we will definitely be back..
Had a great time on Maggie Jo- a beautiful marina, and very comfortable boat!
perfect location and nice experience

description.summary: Reconnect with nature at this unforgettable escape. Maggie jo is a 1970 completely restore houseboat. She has got a full size refrigerator , gas range ,microwave and toaster oven. Out on the back deck she has a gas grill.  The aft berth has 2 full beds that are extremely comfortable. Galley dinette make into bed and the couch in the saloon pulls out also. While on the decks you will see eagles, dolphins , gator or fishing jumping out of the water. I also have 2 tandem  kayaks for your use.
description.space:
The marina  is in a subdivision that sits on sampit river in Historical Georgetown SC. There are picnic  tables and a fire pit at head of the docks.  There is a quite time from 10:00pm and 7:00am. Please no
load music or load voices during this period. 
You can spend your time on one of 3 decks . Rear deck has gas grill and is in the sun. The forward deck has built in bench and a table and chairs , it is in the shade. The upper deck will provide best views, it has table and chairs . It is also in the sun during the windy months of April and May while I have  canvas top off.
The galley has nice dinette that 4 people can sit to eat or play some card or board game.
But the best part is the river . You can just sit there and be amazed of the beautiful sunsets or just watch all the wildlife. 
You can fish right off the boat and might pull in one, of a dozen species.  
Or you could just jump in the kayaks , go up river and take a calm ride down pennyroyal creek.     
Make a week of it and you could spend a day or 2 on the river. A day in Downtown Georgetown, maybe you will take the fox rabbit tours where they ride you around downtown and the neighborhood . Giving the history of all the churches and homes and who lived in them. Or you might take one of the tour boat out into winyah bay to see the light house  or ride the rivers. 
 Head out to the beach for a day . Pawleys island beach 12 miles away . Huntington Beach State Park 15 miles away. Don’t forget Myrtle beach just 25 miles away .
We are also a 1hr country drive to downtown Charleston . If you go I recommend going to see the Uss YorkTown to pay tribute to our service men and women that ensured our freedom in WW2.
description.access: All areas
description.notes:
We really want families to enjoy Maggie Jo.
It is on the water and is not suited for young children under 8. All children are welcome , but the younger they are the more supervision they will need while on decks or docks. There are always plenty of life jackets for your children. We have twin 7 year old grand boys and If they are fishing off boat or on the docks , they will have there life jackets on!
There is NO SMOKING inside the cabin  of the boat!
There is an upper roof , it has no guard rail around it and no one is permitted to be on roof!
Kayaks use will require all users to have life jacket on 100% of the time you are on them! 
NO load noises during quite time hours 10:00pm to 7:00am!
25 mph speed limit in subdivision .
When entering into subdivision camera system will take picture  of license plate of every vehicle entering and existing.
description.neighborhood: Marina is in a private subdivision
description.transit: Free parking is at head of the dock. There are picnic tables , charcoal grill and a fire pit also at the head of the docks
description.interaction:
Yes myself or my wife Karen will  do what ever we can to assist you, so you  have a fantastic time while you stay on Maggie jo.
When you check in we will have laminated contact list and guide for operation of boats functions . ( like how to turn on cabin nightlights)
We also have a great guy Mike that lives at marina and will be more than happy to assist you if Karen or myself are not available
description.house_rules: Your safety is my #1 goal. Friendfield Marina and Maggie Jo are meticulously maintain for that reason . It is still over water and it is your responsibility to protect yourselves from any accidents, on dock , boat or kayaks ! The steps in Maggie Jo going into galley and aft berth have tall risers, so you must be careful!!! All children are welcome, children under 12 must wear life jackets on decks or docks!!! All children must have constant supervision being over water!!! Life jackets are mandatory for everyone using kayaks!!!

name: The Pink Lady - Houseboat on Cayuga Lake!
title: Lansing, New York

gallery.caption: Marine toilet with sink. Full toilet across parking lot.
Shared showers in office.
Shared showers in office.

hosts.about: Lansing Harbor is Cayuga Lake's premier Marina. Located just south of Myers Park in Lansing, New York. Choose either a The Lake House, a cabin on the land, or one of our houseboats on the water. Cabins and Houseboats vary in size and amenities but you are guaranteed to have a great time with any option! Our season is from April 1st - to October 31st for the cabins and houseboats, The Lake House is available all year long!

recent.comments: Great location with a beautiful lake.

items.comments: Great location with a beautiful lake.

This place was amazing! My partner and I did a getaway weekend for our anniversary. The spot was very quiet and peaceful. There was a dock in walking distance we took our paddle boards off of. Also, the marina had live music Saturday evening which was an added bonus. There was a little boat cafe at the marina that was open on the weekend and had amazing breakfast and lunch options! We will definitely be back here!

We had a lovely stay at the Pink Lady! I visited with my dog and really appreciated how dog friendly it was and it was special to stay directly on the water. I think the guidebook could have been improved with more recommendations and specific instructions, and I was a little disappointed by the futon as it was somewhat unclear how to set it up and was not very comfortable to sleep on. Even a mattress pad to add on top would have gone a long way. Those things are a little nit-picky, but for the price I would’ve appreciated a better night’s sleep and clearer instructions/recommendations. Overall a great spot and would recommend staying here for the unique experience and the proximity to Ithaca and the finger lakes area as a whole!
We had a great stay! Beautiful on the water and a great view of the sunset.

Vacationing on a houseboat has been on my bucket list for a while. Pink is my favorite color, so this was a dream come true! It’s a beautiful experience to wake up on the water, and have a great view of the harbor. We enjoyed sitting on our porch and playing cards while watching the sunset. Hope to visit again soon!
Lovely spot on the water. Lovely spot to swim next door. Meyers Park beautiful and very close to Ithaca. Definitely recommend!

description.summary: Efficiency at its best! Custom-designed houseboat with sweeping views of Lansing Harbor. Marine toilet in unit with full toilet across parking lot. Showers, laundry, and marina store are just a short walk away. The perfect getaway! Easy access to Ithaca, Aurora, wineries, and breweries. Be sure to also book one of our BRAND-NEW pontoon rentals during your stay to access Taughannock Falls State Park, Boatyard Grill, Ithaca Farmer’s Market, wineries & more by water!
description.space:
This houseboat is set up like a studio apartment! The couch folds out into a full bed. The bathroom has a sink and a boat toilet with full toilet accessible just across from the boat in a separate building. Showers and additional restrooms are located in the main building of the Marina.

For the early risers and sunset chasers there are spectacular sunrises and sunsets from the Marina.
description.neighborhood: Located right next to Myers Park in Lansing. 10 minutes from Cornell, Ithaca College and Downtown Ithaca.
description.interaction: Host is at the Marina every day and available by phone if not at the Marina.

gallery.caption: Private lower level suite with a separate entrance, beautiful lower deck view, and access to a rooftop deck. Private kitchen, living room, bathroom, and bedroom. Air conditioning, heat, and washer/dryer accessibility. 55" Smart TV with an antenna connection. Great views! Moments away from local attractions such as the Jet Express,  local restaurants, beaches, and downtown Port Clinton. The Owners Suite is on the top level and not included in the rental.

recent.comments: Trish thought of everything.

items.comments: Trish thought of everything.

This was a great Airbnb experience! The houseboat is lovely and adorable. it was great to be able to walk to restaurants that were right on the beach and bars too. we enjoyed walking downtown and listening to live music at two different places. you can't beat how close the houseboat is to the ferry to get to Put-in-Bay.  Drinking coffee on the deck was a great way to start the mornings.

AAA +++ We have been coming for a few years now and never disappoints. Love being on the water, very close to restaurants and entertainment. Can’t wait till next time to come up.  Thanks again !!!  :)
Great place to stay and great hosts.
A beautiful little house on the water! The house is cozy and has so much charm and great views. Lots to do in the area and wonderful restaurants close by. Loved our stay in Port Clinton!

This place is like no other! It is absolutely beautiful！The only thing that would have been helpful for us to know when we were trying to find the floating home is the physical address that is listed is not correct so don't go by that if you're using GPS. Carefully read the message you receive from the host just before check in. The physical address and the Marine, where the house is located, are two different things. We came in really late at night so it was dark which was a disadvantage. We finally stopped at a bar and the manager was able to help us out. This is just a tidbit for the next guest trying to find it in the dark.

description.summary: Whether you are visiting to see the local sites or just to relax, enjoy our charming floating home  with a private 1 bedroom suite. The two decks offer amazing sunset views.  Prepare a meal in our kitchen with your family and enjoy our cozy living room.   Walking distance to local attractions such as the Jet Express,  local restaurants, beaches, and downtown Port Clinton. The Owners Suite is on the top level - not included in the rental (will not be occupied during your stay).

gallery.caption: 4 blocks from boardwalk and ocean.
Downstairs living and dinning room
Upstairs living room

hosts.about: I live in Annapolis Md and this is my only vacation rental home. The home was built in 1965 and is literally in the bay so it takes a beating.  The home is not perfect but I take pride in making it the coolest home in OC.  The location and features make it a one of a kind experience.

recent.comments:
Excellent place to stay. Great fishing from the dock in the back, the place was well kept and the host was super responsive and nice. 

Plenty of beds available as well which really accommodates plenty of people.

items.comments:
Excellent place to stay. Great fishing from the dock in the back, the place was well kept and the host was super responsive and nice. 

Plenty of beds available as well which really accommodates plenty of people.
Great place to stay.   Will stay here again
This place was beautiful and they were always responsive. They were very helpful on directions how they wanted every thing when we left. Everyone loved the location and thought it was perfect.

This vacation home in Ocean City, Maryland, was a hit for the whole family! The excellent host and fantastic fishing made our stay even more enjoyable. The combination of a comfortable home and fun activities is always a winning formula for a memorable vacation.  We created wonderful memories and cherished moments during our stay. Would highly recommend this Airbnb for families looking for a perfect getaway in Ocean City Maryland

We have stayed in OC many times over the years but this house was by far the best place we have stayed. Plenty of room for all 16 of us and we weren’t on top of each other. Spent many nights hanging out on the dock watching the sunset. Couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay!

The Aquarium is a fantastic place to stay if you have a large group and are looking to experience all that OCMD has to offer! The group I stayed with wanted to have the space to lounge and gather in while still having access to nightlife and other activities. Located on the bay with private access to the waters and just a few blocks from the beach and boardwalk, we had SO much fun and it was all very accessible. We loved that the house felt like hone - it had all the necessities to be able to fully enjoy the property and it’s amenities. We loved utilizing the fishing gear and made ourselves comfortable on the Adirondack chairs out back to watch the sunrise and sunsets on the water. Our host was also very responsive, which we appreciated. Would definitely stay here again with another big group!!

description.summary: Quite possibly the coolest home in Ocean City. You are in the heart of Ocean City without all the noise.  Four blocks from the ocean and boardwalk.  Lots of fun boat watching and fishing off the back pier.  This home is over 50 years old and takes a beating from the water so if you want a modern perfect rental this is not the home for you. If your group wants a unique experience that they will talk about the rest of their lives then you should definitely book this home.
description.space:
I do not live in this home. It is a vacation rental home so you will not feel like you are invading our space.  You have use of the entire home. This home fits 3-4 families or 7 couples. The home has 11 beds plus 3 twin pull out couch/chairs.  Two of the beds are queen-size and three are full-size, so if you plan it perfectly and share beds you can sleep 20 but it may be tight. 
The house used to be two separate condos but now interior stairs combining the two. There is a door that can closed to separate the two units. Staying in this home is a unique one-of-a-kind experience. Kind of like staying in a houseboat. There are many homes to rent in Ocean City but none like this.  This is the only single-family home in Ocean City built on pilings entirely in the water.  Every week we have large groups renting the home so minor things will break before we can fix them at times. We do our best and take pride in keeping this home as nice as possible while still allowing large groups to rent.
description.access:
Check-in is at 4:00 but 75% of the time it is cleaned and ready by 2:00.   You can message me the day before and I will let you know if it is rented the night before. If not, you should be able to have earlier access. 
You have access to the entire home and all the decks around the property.
Do to the large groups staying at the house you need to bring paper towels, dish towels, toilet paper…. Both kitchens are fully stocked with pots, pans, cooking utensils, plate, bowls, silverware, glasses, mugs. The home has pillows and lots of blankets.
description.notes:
Be careful with little children on the outside pier.  It is not a deck. The railings are not safe like a deck. Piers do not require guard rails but I added cables for extra safety instead of having nothing.  
There are six TVs. The downstairs living room has basic cable. The other five TVs have Amazon fire stick, Prime, Disney Plus. High speed Wi-Fi. 
There should be fishing poles and beach stuff available as long as other guests do not take them. I stock the house every May and when I periodically come down. There is a Propane bbq grill and normally propane. In rare occasions a guest will forget to turn it off and you may have to exchange it for more propane. There is a baby pack and play, iron, and two hair dryers. 

Be respectful to the year-round neighbors and do not play loud music or be excessively loud outside after 8 PM. Do not throw any parties with guests that are not staying at the home. The neighbors will call the cops and you will be evicted. 

Guest agrees to pay an excessive housekeeping or maintenance fee if Property is not left in the following condition: 
1) Remove all food from refrigerator and all trash from Property. 2) Clean dishes and cooking utensils and properly store them. 3) Put fishing poles back on rack 4) Leave furniture arranged as it was found. 5) Check all drawers and closets for items left behind. 6) Close all windows and lock the doors when leaving;  check out is 11:00 am. 
c. Toilets shall not be used for any purpose other than that for which they were constructed and no soap, sweepings, sanitary products, diapers, rubbish, rags or garbage shall be placed therein.
d. Guest is responsible for any additional costs associated with cleaning, repairs or loss of rental income to Owner, including but not limited to the following: 1) smoking in property; 2) bringing unauthorized pets into the property; and 3) excessive uncleanliness or damage caused as a result of Guests occupancy.
description.neighborhood:
You are in the heart of Ocean City without all the noise. Two blocks off the main strip. Four blocks from the ocean and boardwalk, two blocks from restaurants and shopping.  Lots of fun watching and fishing off the back pier.
2 blocks from Pickles pub, 7 blocks from the Da lazy lizard. 8 blocks from the Taphouse on the boardwalk and 7 blocks from Shananigans on the boardwalk. Private surfing lessons Malibu Surf shop only 4 blocks away. Playground and skate park 4 blocks way.
description.transit: Park you car and leave it there. Plenty of stuff to do within a mile walk.  If there is an open spot across the street grab it right away and keep your car there for the stay. Use the 2-3 cars that you park on the property if you need to drive. This way you are guaranteed a spot when you get back.
description.interaction: I do not live in Ocean City. I live in Annapolis. You are free to text or to email. You can call if it’s real important.
description.house_rules:
Suitable for children under two but you must realize that the exterior of the home is built in the water. It is like being on a fishing pier. We did install wire guard rails but it is not as safe as being on a deck. Little children must be watched closely outside. 
Must do dishes. No blasting music outside. No jumping off of 2nd story deck.

recent.comments: 10/10 recommend!! For every reason! We very much enjoyed ourselves!!

items.comments: 10/10 recommend!! For every reason! We very much enjoyed ourselves!!

My husband and I really loved staying on the houseboat for our anniversary while we were in Stuart. The location was amazing and there were a lot of great local shops and restaurants within walking distance. Matthew was a great host. He was very responsive and gave us clear instructions and recommendations of what to do in the area. The space itself was great. It was exactly what we needed for our 2 night stay. I would come back here in the future.
Matthew was very helpful and always responsive if we had a question or concern.  We had a small issue with one AC unit when we arrived and Matthew was helpful and got the issue resolved.
Boat and the area is beautiful. Definitely going to return

We had an absolutely amazing experience staying on this fantastic houseboat! The location couldn't have been more perfect - nestled in a serene and quiet spot that provided the ultimate relaxation. The food in the area was delightful, and the range of activities available made sure we were never bored. As a Realtor, short term rental consultant and blogger, with joyousvacations. I've seen a lot of accommodations, and this one truly stands out. Five stars all the way! A must place to stay.

This is our second stay in one of Matthew’s boathouses , but our first stay in this boathouse. As we expected, this was a great stay. The boathouse was very clean, spacious and accommodating. Everything was lovely and we intend to return again next year. Thank you, Matthew, for sharing your boathouse with us!

description.summary: This memorable place is anything but ordinary.

name: Super cute Houseboat with bedroom and loft.
title: Portsmouth, New Hampshire

recent.comments: Tom, Rolf, and Carol were warm and welcoming from the get go! “Come early.. we are ready for you!” A request for binoculars led to a nearly instant delivery. A last day checkout chat with Tom made us feel special. Of extra note: being on the water brings changes in tide and scenery. There is a kayak and SUP rental company as part of the marina. Very convenient. Very cozy yet more than adequate space for our family of 3. Wished we had stayed longer!  Excellent experience!

items.comments: Tom, Rolf, and Carol were warm and welcoming from the get go! “Come early.. we are ready for you!” A request for binoculars led to a nearly instant delivery. A last day checkout chat with Tom made us feel special. Of extra note: being on the water brings changes in tide and scenery. There is a kayak and SUP rental company as part of the marina. Very convenient. Very cozy yet more than adequate space for our family of 3. Wished we had stayed longer!  Excellent experience!
We had a lot of fun in the area. Portsmouth is a beautiful location and the houseboat was such a quiet and peaceful place to stay.

Endroit fantastique, gens de la marina sympathiques. La maison est compacte mais accueillante, on s'y sent bien.  Notre adolescent avait son petit espace à la mezzanine. Thomas est avenant et attentionné. Je reviendrai assurément et j'emporterai un kayak!  C'est le meilleur des deux mondes: la nature et une ville dynamique à quelques minutes en voiture.

Very cozy, often forgot we were on a boat. Adorable decor and very clean. Short drive to supermarket, and restaurants, and beach. Carol made a few great recommendations and very friendly and helpful. Loved meeting the dogs Jackson and Molly. Great spot for relaxation, a day of kayaking and heading to the beach. Neighbors were friendly too. I hope to return someday!
Excellent location and great place

This place was like a tiny house on the water.  We enjoyed sitting on the deck every night and watching the boats go by as well as trying out some fishing from the dock.  It was a quick drive into downtown Portsmouth, which made going to dinner so convenient.  It was about 30 minutes to long sands beach in York, which was great for a beach day or two!  I even enjoyed a few paddles on the Piscataqua river with my kayak, but be warned that the tide is no joke and can pull you out to the ocean if you get too close to the bridge when the tide is going out.  Thank you Tom and Carol for a wonderful trip!  We would love to come back some day!

description.summary: This quaint houseboat is located at a small privately owned Marina on Sagamore Creek just 2 miles from downtown Portsmouth. From the Marina you can rent kayaks and paddleboards or bring a small skiff that you can tie up next to the houseboat. Explore the creek and back channels of the seacoast area where you'll find bald eagles, hawks and other wildlife. Great bird watching right from the back deck.
description.space: This unique accommodation has all the features of a small apartment. 12'x40' space, separate bedroom with a queen size bed and closet for storage. Two single beds in a loft that overlook the open concept living area. The kitchen has 2 burners and a counter top oven (InstaPot), apartment size fridge and microwave. You will occasionally feel movement as it is a boat. And it does not leave the dock.
description.notes:
Enjoy the outside deck/patio with your morning coffee or an evening cocktail. 
Next door to the Marina is a restaurant and bar featuring your favorite seafood. Within walking or biking distance is another restaurant featuring homemade ice cream. Keep going and you'll get to the beautiful Wentworth by Sea Hotel just a mile from the Marina. There you'll find various dining choices, or spoil yourself with a spa treatment. 
A quick 2 mile drive (or bike ride) will take you into historic downtown Portsmouth where you'll find shops, restaurants, music and theater.

recent.comments: Was looking for a place to stay on the way back to Pittsburgh from VT.  Saw this listing and booked it, didn't tell my Wife until we got there and she loved it. We enjoyed sitting on the rooftop deck and having a couple drinks while the sun set.

items.comments: Was looking for a place to stay on the way back to Pittsburgh from VT.  Saw this listing and booked it, didn't tell my Wife until we got there and she loved it. We enjoyed sitting on the rooftop deck and having a couple drinks while the sun set.
Great experience! The rooftop from the houseboat was a very nice plus, you’re able to use marina facilities, and it was very easy to come and go! Would recommend!
Great
The house boat was amazing. Newly renovated and well maintained. Could not beat the views either! The marina is well maintained and lots of friendly people!
Loved our stay on this house boat! Really fun, unique, and very family friendly experience! Great location! Ten minutes from Ithaca with tons of waterfalls in the area! Will definitely book again!

My stay was an adorable little houseboat for four nights. I wasn’t sure what to expect and afraid it might be noisy.  I had my dog for the first night, arriving late (after midnight). The houseboats are very well insulated and I never heard a thing. Also Greg accommodated our late arrival making it easy!  The arrangement of the houseboats was excellent. They were in a quiet and beautiful environment. The boat was very comfortable, clean and well set up.  I LOVED the rooftop deck -having my morning coffee there with beautiful views. I would rent it again in a minute!  I also loved the outdoor shower! Fabulous!

description.summary: Custom designed 1 bedroom, 1 bath, newly renovated houseboat overlooking Lansing Harbor. Includes a private rooftop deck, perfect for watching the sunsets on Cayuga Lake.  Easy access to Ithaca, Aurora, wineries, and breweries. Be sure to also book one of our BRAND-NEW pontoon rentals during your stay to access Taughannock Falls State Park, Boatyard Grill, Ithaca Farmer’s Market, wineries & more by water!

gallery.caption: Photo rendering of the what the permanent dock will look like upon completion in winter 2023.

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: We couldn’t have asked for a better stay. What a surprise that a houseboat was one of the best Airbnbs we have stayed at (even for my mom who is very sensitive to motion sickness—wasn’t phased). We were allowed early checkin which saved our trip, since my son was desperately needing a nap. Bedding and linens were so well appointed. Thoughtful details like varying firmness pillows and white cotton linens and I w cold air conditioning were obvious. Walking to Marina Grill for live music rounded out a super easy night and saved us from dragging 3 small children downtown for dinner. Absolutely great! Thank you!!!

items.comments: We couldn’t have asked for a better stay. What a surprise that a houseboat was one of the best Airbnbs we have stayed at (even for my mom who is very sensitive to motion sickness—wasn’t phased). We were allowed early checkin which saved our trip, since my son was desperately needing a nap. Bedding and linens were so well appointed. Thoughtful details like varying firmness pillows and white cotton linens and I w cold air conditioning were obvious. Walking to Marina Grill for live music rounded out a super easy night and saved us from dragging 3 small children downtown for dinner. Absolutely great! Thank you!!!

This was the most beautiful and wonderful trip with friends! There were 4 couples that came via boat and stayed in these homes away from home!  The marina was helpful and it was so close to our place. The host was fabulous, the location was perfect and had great views! We had two house boats and asked if we could be close, the host and her team accomplished that accommodation and it was perfect for our group! The kitchen was so big and nice, the outside porches were the most wonderful place for a night cap or morning coffee. I seriously already have another trip in my wishlist and I can’t wait to go back! I’ve told all my friends to pick a date and let’s do it! These places were so swanky but also simple living. Best of both worlds!!!!
Great atmosphere and location.

It was a unique experience . The warmth that this house has is unmatched. a place to enjoy with the family. its terraces have an spectacular view. clean and with all the services. I would go back to adistir again and I recommend it to 💯. Your very welcoming hosts are always attentive. The stay here was great.

Even though our stay was only 2 nights, this would rank amongst one of the best trips I’ve  taken  due to to the quality accommodations at this property. It was only three of us and we had an incredible amount of space to share. It was clean and had everything you needed to truly make you feel at home. I will never forget this place and the time I had there with my friends. It is an absolute gem.

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our houseboats offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.
description.space:
After parking in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our dockside community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your villa, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three benches along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed, large closet, ceiling fan, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2 (Sofa bed):
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with a sectional couch (with pull out sleeper), 55" Smart TV, desk and chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 55" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bath.

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this Villa is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other Riverwalk Villas at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access: Guests will have full access to the entire villa for the duration of their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent floating villas. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 villas and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per villa. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)
description.house_rules:
-No flushing of anything other than natural waste and septic safe toilet paper
-Children under the age of 12 must be supervised at all times while in the marina
-Absolutely no swimming allowed - the current in the Cape Fear River is strong and dangerous
-No smoking or illicit drugs
-Failure to return the parking pass upon check-out will result in a $50.00 fee
-Failure to return the front door key upon check-out will result in a $300.00 fee

hosts.about:
I enjoy traveling to new places and visiting the local spots!
In my own home I have it professionally cleaned and keep things organized and comfortable. As a traveler, I treat places like they are my own. As a host, I like to think about giving guests what they need. Therefore, I try to make things easy, comfortable, and enjoyable.

recent.comments:
The place is your perfect Lake Geoege private spot.. little off the main drag but prime lake access to water activities and enjoy cocktails and food over the lake.

Very nice and easy clear communication on check in and check out!

items.comments:
The place is your perfect Lake Geoege private spot.. little off the main drag but prime lake access to water activities and enjoy cocktails and food over the lake.

Very nice and easy clear communication on check in and check out!

Beautiful and clean cottage, great location. Because of the shared lake access, I did feel a bit like we were intruding on the owners space though and didn’t spend as much time outside as we would have if it was private, but the listing was accurate about the space and was exactly as described.
Wonderful little private area. Great view of you walk down to the boat house. Parking wasn’t too bad. Nice and secluded for those who enjoy privacy.
Beautiful place on the water. Very peaceful and lots to do in the surrounding area! Great weekend getaway
Our stay at Heidi's Lake front cottage was a very relaxing time, cannot beat the views and access to Lake George!

Beautiful little cabin on the lake!  Even though the host's home was directly next door and we shared common space, it still felt pretty private.  The hosts and their guests were extremely respectful of our privacy.  After a major storm ripped through the area we lost power. Turns out the storm blew out a fuse that ran the internet modem.  Nicole was responsive and we  internet was restored the next morning.  The only downside was that the hosts were entertaining in the shared deck/dock space on the day we planned to hang out there. I imagine they would have welcomed us but that would have been awkward.  All-in-all it was a wonderful stay!

description.summary: Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space. Located by Sandy Bay on Lake George, on Cleverdale Rd which is the east side of the lake. Amazing mountain and lake views. Enjoy patio seating off the living area. Access (shared) to open and covered boathouse for lounging, dining, or entertaining. Take a jump off the boathouse right into the lake! Hiking within minutes as well!
description.space: Loft style bedroom in lakeside cottage with views of the mountains and lake.
description.access:
You will get to enjoy the entire cottage that sleeps max 4 people. Located at quiet dead end of our street. Lake access. Access to a boat slip (please ask/additional fee) if you are bringing a boat or want to rent one. Access to dock and boathouse areas. Access to inner tubes/floats (see pictures), tube for towing/tubing, water skiis, wakeboard, canoe, small kayak, paddle board, life jackets for adults and kids.

If you come with a dog without including on reservation, pet fee will be added to your reservation. If you come with a non approved pet then you will be charged additional cleaning fee + pet fee + inconvenience fee if necessary or host has right to cancel reservation.
description.notes: We want to make sure our guests know what to expect
description.neighborhood:
Enjoy relaxing and quiet getaway or be entertained by the many amenities offered in Lake George Village, Bolton Landing, and Queensbury. 

The neighborhood is filled with local residents and summer vacationers. It’s located on a dead end road. Local restaurant /bar and convenience store in walking distance.
description.transit:
Must have a car. Either personal or rental. No public transportation nearby. Uber or Lyft available. 

There is a restaurant in walking distance. Short (10-15min) drive to Lake George Village. Further north you can reach Bolton Landing and further doubt you can reach Saratoga Springs. 1 hour from Albany airport. Several boat rentals available nearby.
description.interaction: Myself and family will be available as we stay in the house next door and share the outdoor boathouse and dock area.
description.house_rules:
The only pets allowed are hyper allergenic dogs. MUST be potty trained. Must be well behaved, I.e. doesn’t scratch or chew on furniture or destroy property. Doesn’t bark endlessly. Cannot be left alone for long periods. Must be friendly with other dogs that share the outdoors.  If you come with a dog without including on reservation, pet fee will be added to your reservation. If you come with a non approved pet then you will be charged additional cleaning fee + pet fee + inconvenience fee if necessary or host has right to cancel reservation.

Absolutely NO smoking indoors. No smoking on the docks or boathouse either.

hosts.about: Hi I'm Julia: I started hosting in 2013 after I converted my townhome in Georgetown / Palisades of Washington, DC into two unique Airbnb units that are available when I’m not home. I now have two additional ways to enjoy this space: Rent the entire home or just a private room. New addition for 2023 is Chesapeake Houseboat Getaway on Kent Island, MD. Please check it out!

recent.comments: If you need to get away from all the stress of people, work, daily routines, this houseboat gives you comforting gentle floating motions and a great place to completely unwind. There are great outings nearby including beach. The marina has several bay fishing expeditions. We plan to return to this place. We want to create a listing of fishing services for this place.

items.comments: If you need to get away from all the stress of people, work, daily routines, this houseboat gives you comforting gentle floating motions and a great place to completely unwind. There are great outings nearby including beach. The marina has several bay fishing expeditions. We plan to return to this place. We want to create a listing of fishing services for this place.

As avid fishermen, I wanted to do something special for his birthday.  This houseboat was the perfect place. Beautiful inside. Clean. Well decorated. 

Everything we needed to make it feel like a home away from home.  The full kitchen, the walkable restaurant, the private beach, the ability to leave our trailered boat right outside our front door at the marina.  And access to a world class fishery outside our front door.

It was everything I saw in the images and more. We will definitely look to come back and bring our family with us.
Juilia's Houseboat was perfect.  We had a great time on the water.

Julia was a gracious host. She met us at the houseboat to explain how everything works and was very accommodating with check in and check out times. She responds quickly to texts and was available to answer any questions.

The houseboat is beautifully renovated. The pictures are true to the website. The views are even better. If you are looking for a relaxing, peaceful, unique get-away, this is it!
Julia is a wonderful host. This was our second visit and we will definitely be back!!

We absolutely loved our stay at Julia’s houseboat! It was the quintessential coastal Maryland experience for my family! The houseboat was well equipped with everything we needed, plenty of towels, linens, coffee etc. The upper deck was perfect for morning yoga and a serene view to enjoy our coffee! We enjoyed the restaurant at the marina as well as local restaurants Julia recommended! Don’t think twice-book your stay here and enjoy the tranquility of the Chesapeake Bay!

description.summary: Chesapeake Houseboat “Julia's Arc" at the Kentmorr Marina in Stevensville, MD has it all. Great location for Fishing Trips, Wedding Attendees, or anyone who wants to float on a barge with Eastern Shore Nautical Charm. With a private marina beach on the Chesapeake and outdoor activities: sports fishing, biking, golf, sight seeing abound. Welcome aboard for an unforgettable vacation stay.
description.space: There are two bedrooms (staterooms) and a large fully renovated kitchen (galley). The main living room (salon) has high ceilings and is flooded with light. Large windows give a view of the marina boats to the west. There is a queen sized sleeper sofa with comfortable memory foam mattress. There are two enclosed patios ( the fore and aft decks) and a roof top garden (the bridge) you can access by a spiral staircase.
description.access: The whole houseboat is yours during your stay
description.notes: This is a floating vessel. Individuals prone to seasickness should consider this when booking. Non-swimmers and children under 12 should not be guests without special permission. Swimming in the marina waters is prohibited but other water sports at the beach (no lifeguard) are allowed before sunset.
description.neighborhood: This is marina living. You will see working and pleasure fishing boats, a few sailboats too. The marina office has showers and bathrooms accessible by key-code. There is the Kentmorr Restaurant and Atlas Brewery now under new management for dining and events.
description.transit: You will need a car but Uber and Lyft may be available soon
description.house_rules: Although it says parties not allowed, small gatherings of 10 or less people may be acceptable with prior approval by host. Please be quiet(especially on the upper deck) after 9 pm on weekdays and 10 pm on weekends.

hosts.about:
We are part time missionaries who have led medical and other mission teams all over the world; focusing for the last few years on the fight against the horrible crime of Human Trafficking. We work through our local church and Teresa has founded "Chains Interrupted" which works locally, nationally and world wide to increase awareness as well as real prevention, rehabilitation and even rescue.
We love to travel and have children in 5 states.

recent.comments:
The houseboat was truly a special stay for us . Just the experience of sunrise on the boat was truly unique . Sanford was lovely , walkable and fun , the restaurants in the area where quite diverse . Loved biking on the path around the lake !Jay and Teresa left detailed instructions about lighting the stove and using the grill which were very helpful. Overall it was a great experience to have and immerse into a Florida lifestyle. 
.

items.comments:
The houseboat was truly a special stay for us . Just the experience of sunrise on the boat was truly unique . Sanford was lovely , walkable and fun , the restaurants in the area where quite diverse . Loved biking on the path around the lake !Jay and Teresa left detailed instructions about lighting the stove and using the grill which were very helpful. .

I can't say enough great things about this place! The location was perfect - you are on the water with a great, relaxing view and a very quick walk to downtown. (Less than 5 mins. walking to the edge of downtown.) This tiny home was modern and has all the amenities you need, and then some! Everything was very clean and communication with the hosts was superb. Our favorite part of the stay was relaxing on the downstairs deck for coffee/sunrise and then relaxing on the upstairs deck for sunset. The house was positioned with a great view of downtown, which lights up nicely at night. We loved watching the wildlife from the deck and even saw a gator! While the marina was active, we never once were disturbed by any neighbors. Being right next to the riverboat was also very cool. Plus, there were a couple restaurants right there in the marina as well.  This place is highly recommended and I can't wait to come back!

What a lovely place to stay.  Right on the water! We took evening strolls through downtown and enjoyed the walk along the water.  Place has 2 a/c units, and all the things you need to float your way to relaxation.  It’s small, but it’s a floating tiny house so we understood the assignment. Thank you so much, 10/10 would recommend.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Jay and Teresa's Floating Bungalow! It was so peaceful and comfortable, with much more room than we were expecting. We were able to just relax and enjoy. Location was awesome, having the riverwalk and historic downtown Sanford within a few minutes walk. Jay and Teresa were quick to respond to any inquiries, their communication was impeccable. We would highly recommend staying here, and would do so again. Thank you both so much!

We really enjoyed our short stay at the houseboat. Everything was in walkable distance. There was a lot to do in the small downtown area. Everyone was very friendly and kind. The houseboat was adorable and perfect. Highly recommend.
Stayed for work instead of staying at a hotel!  Loved it.

description.summary:
You'll love this unique romantic escape located in historic downtown Sanford! 
This is a nearly new built top of the line Houseboat and you will be amazed at all the amenities fit on this 12x40 floating tiny home. 
Nicely suited for one couple. One step to get in and then all on one level other than the upper deck. (Ladder) Max occupancy at any time is 4. 
Walking distance to downtown restaurants, shops and so much more.
Note that this is a very small space if you are used to a full size home.
description.space: Our floating bungalow is like a tiny house or an RV but it's bigger than that at 12' wide x 32' long cabin size. But it is very small compared to a regular house. Space is well utilized. High end appliances are a little smaller than normal but it works great for a couple.
description.notes: Maximum occupancy at any time is 4 persons with maximum 2 people staying overnight. It's very nice but small.
description.neighborhood: This is a working marina. Some yachts and house boats are live aboard, so you can expect a few neighbors about.
description.transit: Free public parking is readily available. Some weekend event crowds take a lot of the spaces but even then, you can typically find spots within a block or so. We typically walk to the downtown area which is just a couple blocks away. There are also a couple good restaurants right on marina island.
description.house_rules:
Maximum occupancy of 4 persons at any time. Maximum 2 persons overnight.

Please Read!
Do not lose gate key!
$500 lost key fee $300 lock out fee
The marina will not help you. If late at night, you will be locked out until the next day!!

hosts.about:
I am an old bluegrass musician, we started out having Bluegrass festivals, then realized that our place is so beautiful that we wanted to share this beauty with others, full time.
We have deer, turkeys, geese, fish and other wildlife. We offer hiking, fishing, birdwatching, as well as canoeing and kayaking. This place is wild and wonderful.

recent.comments: If you’re looking to “unplug” the Pond Tune is the spot. Stagger and Sue were both super friendly. The boathouse is just as described in the listing and there are definitely fish to be caught if you’re in to fishing! The bath house is as described and only a short walk from the boathouse. All in all it was a great time, very peaceful and relaxing.

items.comments: If you’re looking to “unplug” the Pond Tune is the spot. Stagger and Sue were both super friendly. The boathouse is just as described in the listing and there are definitely fish to be caught if you’re in to fishing! The bath house is as described and only a short walk from the boathouse. All in all it was a great time, very peaceful and relaxing.

Dear AirBnB Traveler: I found a place of great peace and so much unique fun in Hazelhurst and that place is Stagger’s “Pond Tune.” Stagger’s place is a rustic paradise, and he puts in so much care into being a great AirBnB host. The place was spotless, the AC worked like a champ, the bed was super comfy, there were so many nice finishing touches, all of which let you know that your host is interested in your well being. But the place! Oh my gosh! Your literally and comfortably sleeping on water. You’re on Stagger’s beautiful expansive in-the-country property where you might chance upon a cat (or two), see some chickens, and you can cast a line from the “back porch” of the “Pond Tune.” Sopping here really gives you a sense of the beauty of South Georgia. While there, there’s not a moment when you’re staying there that you don’t say: “Wow … this is very special!” I can’t wait to return to this treasure of a place. Highly recommended! Thank you, Stagger!
I was looking for a different place to stay with my husband for the night, and this "Pond Tune" did not disappoint. Thank you to the host for his flexibility!!
Cool spot located off the beaten path.

Excellent opportunity to disconnect and relax.    Stagger met us when we arrived and showed us around the place.  Super peaceful.  There are a couple of small towns 5-10 minutes away in case you need a place to eat, or forgot any thing.    Pond Tune is a great place for anyone who needs a reset!!

So I traded the beach weekend I had planned (after a few not so subtle hints from my hubby about not wanting to go to the beach 🙄🤣) for a relaxing experience on a boat house I saw advertised on AirBnB..... it did NOT disappoint. The hosts were very welcoming and accommodating and the boat house named "Pond tunes" was absolutely perfect. Not sure what my favorite part was.... being rocked to sleep on the water, waking up and reading our Bibles and drinking coffee on the water, getting to tap into our adventurous side exploring and fishing the 50 acres with the canoe, kayaks, and boat available, or the enjoyment and relaxation all over my hubby thus weekend. Nah, no contest, it was definitely him. 🥰 We even requested a late checkout because we weren't ready to leave.  Stagger Lee Music/ RV Park we will be back!

description.summary: Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in this unique place.
description.space: This is a charming little pontoon boat turned into a houseboat, there is a twin bed, it sleeps two, located on a small pond, cane fishing poles provided. This unit does not have a bathroom, it is a short walk to the bathhouse which has full accommodations with hot showers. Also available is a pavilion that is covered, picnic tables, and gas grill.
description.house_rules: No smoking inside, outside on the porch only.

Yves was very responsive yet not in truc at all. Amazing place for a sweet escape. He really accommodated us. We felt like we were alone on the planet, very safe!
Will definitely come back

description.summary:
STUDIO HÉBERGEMENTS FLOTTANTS offers you a unique experience of high-end accommodation in floating homes at Melville Island Park in Shawinigan. Paddle board paradise, you have access to boat trips, cycling, hebertism, nature interpretation, aerial course in the forest, fishing, kayaking and much more.
New: There are now water games nearby.
Immediate neighbor of the Cité de l’énergie, the site is also 25 minutes from Parc de la Mauricie. CITQ: 301229.
description.space:
Le site du Parc de l’île Melville est situé en plein cœur de la ville de Shawinigan dans un milieu nature. Vous avez accès à des excursions en bateau, du cyclisme, de l'hébertisme, de l'interprétation de la nature, du parcours aérien en forêt, de la pêche, une piscine extérieure, de la randonnée pédestre (15 km), du canot, de la chaloupe, du kayak, du pédalo, du tennis extérieur, du vélo de montagne (15 km) et bien plus encore.
Voisin immédiat de la Cité de l’énergie où l’on retrouve une tour d'observation de 115 mètres (377 pieds) de hauteur, un spectacle multimédia et une exposition permanente interactive, le site est également à 25 minutes du Parc de la Mauricie.
description.house_rules:
Respecter les règlements du Parc de l'Île Melville
Les enfants toujours sous surveillance.

gallery.caption: Updated 2023 - we have added additional structure to the dock to provide shade and better lighting in the evening for our guests!
Beach area a short walk from boat - firepit available for use.

hosts.about: I am a Registered Nurse who loves to travel and experience new places with my husband :) We are from Ontario, Canada and also host our own Vintage Boat Stays on our 21 acre property located in Port Colborne.

recent.comments: Such a great stay. Will definitely be back.

items.comments: Such a great stay. Will definitely be back.

Megan and Rob are exceptional hosts.  Their property was all that we expected and so much more. It was the perfect place for our family relax, unwind, and connect. We were able to disconnect from technology and enjoy one another.  It was the perfect place for our middle school kids to explore the great outdoors. We enjoyed fishing from the paddle boat. canoeing, paddle boarding, swiming, and the trampoline. We enjoyed  relaxing evenings grilling and eating on the lake, topping the evening off with a camp fire on the beach. The boat is a 10 min drive from Lake Erie, a short walk to Horse Play stables, and conveniently located to stores and restaurants. It is private and peaceful. Rob and Meg are exceptional hosts. Our kids are begging to return every year. 

To fully relax and unwind, we recommend a longer stay- 1 or 2 nights is not enough. 

Enjoy!

It was amazing experience here , best of all places. The ambient here was amazing , open to boat , kayaking. it was really the best decision to make.  Very peaceful and natural place . Loved the place. Will recommend everyone to once go and visit. The host Rob was amazing, so friendly and helpful. Really amazed by the place .
We stayed for a romantic weekend and got everything we hoped for.
Overall beautiful and unique experience! Meghan and Rob were great hosts, easy to talk to and very responsive with any questions we had. First time staying on a boat and we had a great time :)

This was my family’s first houseboat experience and Meghan and Rob made it perfect for us. Rob was right there when we arrived and took us on a quick tour of the boat. He even gave us a little history on how he came to own the property. It was a perfectly vintage boat and even a rainstorm on our first night made it that much more exciting. Anytime we needed something; Rob was there right away. He was even thoughtful enough to relocate the inflatable water trampoline closer to the boat so we could watch our kids easier. We already want to come back for another visit!

description.summary:
Welcome to our vintage boat stay!

Here’s your chance to come and enjoy the experience of staying aboard a vintage, 38-foot Chris Craft yacht, with full amenities, warm wood interior and 360-degree lake views outside. This boat offers a unique adventure, without ever leaving the dock. The surrounding water is a 10-acre spring fed private lake; perfect for paddling, swimming and relaxing. We do have a small beach area that includes a paddle boat, kayak and canoes. Where you can also enjoy a fire.
description.space: Aboard, there is a fully functioning kitchen, two bathrooms, and a living area. Our boat is the perfect getaway to relax and enjoy, private dock area.
description.access:
Full boat access, you have the entire boat to yourselves.
Beach area for easy access to paddle boat, kayak and canoes.
Fire pit available for guests to use on the beach.
description.notes:
There is a 200 foot walk from the parking space to the dock.
Water in the boat is not drinkable, please bring your own water for drinking.
All guests are required to sign a waiver before entering the boat.
description.neighborhood: Our space is located steps away from the Gord Harry Conservation Trail, a 13 km trail that connects directly to Wainfleet Wetlands Conservation Area, which passes near Long Beach, Morgan’s Point and Wainfleet Bog Conservation Areas. Nearby, is Horseplay Niagara, Burnaby Skydive and numerous golf courses. Minutes away from the quaint city of Port Colborne, where you will find an abundance of restaurants, small boutiques and attractions. As a bonus, our location is just a short drive to Niagara Falls. Come and experience this hidden treasure today!
description.interaction: We are available anytime during your stay, you can message us though the app or send us a message via text.
description.house_rules: Please pick up after your pets, dry them off before they enter the boat and do not allow them on the furniture.

gallery.caption: This picture shows it out on the water to get the full size of the boat, but the boat will stay docked during your stay! It takes a captain and a team to take a boat like this out!

recent.comments:
Carley is AMAZING! She is kind, responsive, and helpful. 

The views are also spectacular. 

We had a great time on the houseboat.

items.comments:
Carley is AMAZING! She is kind, responsive, and helpful. 

The views are also spectacular. 

We had a great time on the houseboat.

Carley and Bens house boat was such a great way to spend our staycation! The water did have an odor at first but did go away and Carley really set our expectations for that, truly a nonissue. The marina is peaceful and beautiful and we really felt recharged after our long weekend. Thanks again y’all!
Very nice and comfortable. Great views. Had a great time

Carly was so helpful,  answered any questions almost immediately. Very detailed check in instructions, clean interior felt comfortable with an at home feel. Washer and dryer were a huge help for our family on our stay.
An amazing houseboat on the water, very charming and unique experience!

My husband and I wanted a weekend getaway somewhere close that would remind us of home (we’re from the NC coast) so we couldn’t have been more excited to find Carley’s house boat! It was just what we needed to step away from the fast pace city life and get centered with nature again. I’d like to say that we did a lot while we were there (because there were several spots in the area we wanted to try out) but if I’m honest we mostly laid around on the top deck to get some sun and napped on the couch while watching movies! The natural rock of the boat was like melatonin for me lol Carley was awesome and very quick to respond when we had questions. Overall, we had the best experience and will definitely be booking again in the future!

description.summary: Looking for a real lake front getaway? This houseboat is the perfect, unique stay. 25 min from Charlotte! It is equipped with a full kitchen, stocked with everything you’d need. 3 bedrooms with queen size beds & 2 full bathrooms. Spacious living room & plenty of outdoor space for grilling out & hanging out. You won’t find a better view of Lake Wylie’s sunsets than on the roof top bar or front porch of this boat! The boat does NOT leave the dock.
description.space:
All bedrooms have queen size beds. 

The kitchen and living room are very spacious. The bathrooms are large enough to easily get ready in. The outdoor living space is huge! 

Do keep in mind this boat is in the water. It stays at the dock but you will feel and hear waves! Also keep in mind, it will smell like a boat as well. Although it looks like a home and is the size of a home it is still a boat! 

There are some things that come with lake life. Like insects. There are spiders. We knock the spiderwebs down and spray weekly but the water spiders are relentless and come back! The plus side is that they feed on mosquitos and are harmless to humans. We do our best to keep them away but we can only do so much. This is part of living on the water! 

You will park at the marina and walk around the back of the building to the stairs. You’ll walk straight down the first dock all the way to the end where the houseboat is docked. Take a left to get to the front door of the boat. Keep in mind it is somewhat of a long walk to the boat.

Follow us on Insta @thedoghouseonwylie for more pictures and videos!
description.access: The whole boat
description.notes:
Swimming is not allowed at the marina as it is not safe near all of the boats.

There will be some spiders but we leave out broomsticks and spider spray to knock them down. We spray weekly and clean weekly to get rid of them but they come back. 

If you leave food or trash out on the boat there is a raccoon that will find its way down to munch on it! Please be prepared to clean up after yourself.

The bathrooms on the houseboat are like an RV. The toilets are identical to RV toilets. The water may have a slight odor due to sitting in the pipes between renters but it disappears as the water gets ran and the pipes/tank get flushed out. We treat our water tanks and the water comes directly from the marina. It is clean water!

We want people to be aware beforehand of how houseboat living is. This houseboat is a blast to stay on but it may not be for some people. If you are in for an adventure on the water then this is for you!
description.neighborhood: The boat is 25 min from downtown Charlotte and the airport! You’ll be close enough to enjoy the city but far enough away to relax! Lake Wylie has plenty to offer as well if you don’t want to head into the city. Papa Doc’s (a restaurant on the lake) is right across the bridge from the houseboat. There are plenty of gas stations, grocery stores and other restaurants right down the road as well. Go for a hike in McDowell park, it is right on Lake Wylie and only a minute drive from the marina. Boat rentals are available on Lake Wylie too - Search Boat Rentals of Lake Wylie. You can also rent kayaks over at the boat landing by Papa Doc's. There's plenty to do here!
description.transit: Parking is free at the marina.
description.interaction: We live right down the road so we can be right over if there are any issues!
description.house_rules:
No parties. 
Boat does not move from the dock. 
No swimming is allowed due to the risk of electrocution and boat traffic. 
If extra cleaning or laundry is required there will be an added cleaning fee.

Great location with great hosts.  Rachel and Rick were very responsive whenever we had a question.  The Lilypad provided for a fantastic Canada day weekend.
Great place to spend a weekend, beautiful skies and so many water activities are provided. Check in went smoothly and easily. Clean and a great area.

Rick was very kind to help us build a bonfire and show us the whole house. The location is very convenient, there are many kinds of equipment provided. Kids had a great time fishing. We will introduce friends to visit here.

Incredible stay. Loved everything that the place had to offer. Enjoyed the multiple decks, the cleanliness, provided water sport equipment, and the location was great! Will be back with just my partner and I in the future.

The Lily Pad Cottage is amazing; such a unique and picturesque experience. Rachel was incredible from start to finish -- wonderfully accommodating and super friendly & welcoming.  While the pictures make this cottage seem incredibly inviting, it truly has to be seen to appreciate its beauty and uniqueness. Hoping to book a yearly getaway here :).

description.summary:
The Lily Pad  Vacation Rental HOUSEBOAT

Are you looking for something different - a new adventure with friends or family; well this is what you've been looking for!!

Enjoy this Multi level houseboat with breath taking views from every room. View the water, mountains and sunsets
description.space:
There are a total of 6 decks. Each deck has an amazing view

Pick your favourite deck and watch the wildlife right from the Boat. You'll see ducks, turtles, beavers, and Canadian geese. Sit and catch trout, northern pike, perch and large mouth bass from the boat!

A two minute walk to the public beach, park, tennis and Volleyball courts.
 Boat launch at a stone-throw away from property.

Dock is available

Five minutes walking distance to all amenities such as grocery store, beer and liquor store shopping and restaurants. Church and hospital also close by. 

This  happens to be a great spot to watch the Canada Day fireworks.

We have 3 Kayaks 2 paddle boards,2 river tubes, 4 person pedal boat and lawn games and sand Volley ball court for your enjoyment. ( Life jackets are provided) 

One favourite for our guest is to kayak or paddle to the beach

What to bring
-your food
-clothes
-personal items
-beach towels

We provide Drinking and cooking water  TV VCR with movies.  We also provide a tour of this unique cottage for instructions.

Please note that this property isn't child friendly

recent.comments: Loved my second stay.  Can’t say enough about this place.  So convenient.  The neighbors are all inviting and friendly.  The views in the morning are stunning.  I ventured downtown and it was a six minute cab ride.  Love the marina!!!

items.comments: Loved my second stay.  Can’t say enough about this place.  So convenient.  The neighbors are all inviting and friendly.  The views in the morning are stunning.  I ventured downtown and it was a six minute cab ride.  Love the marina!!!

One of the better Air BnB stays on the lake when you consider bang for buck.  The location is perfect, especially if you are bringing a boat.  The slips are there, ramps, and gas pumps.  The houseboat is pristine.  Very clean, easy to access and all the amenities needed are included.  I like to go into town at night and ubers found me with no problem.  If you want to remain on site, you have the luxury of either the convience shop, or the Tiki Hut for some good food and drinks.  I rebooked the following weekend.  Highly recommended!
Class act! Absolutely everything we were expecting and more!

description.summary: Palmetto Paradise Houseboat rental at Keowee Marina is a true hidden gem located on beautiful Lake Keowee. This 75' houseboat is available for overnight stays so you can experience a unique getaway with breathtaking sunsets, beautiful lake views, and views of the Blue Ridge Mountains!  Complete your stay with our full service marina with boat rentals and Tiki Hut Restaurant on site during the summer season. *Vessel must remain moored at all times as operation away from the dock is not permitted.

-Guest Bedroom: 1 queen bed, tv, closet, and dresser

-Kitchen: fully equipped kitchen with Keurig, dishwasher, full stove, microwave, -Full refrigerator
-Dining: Tall dining table with 4 chairs
-Living Room: 1 couch and 1 loveseat with smart tv

- Rear Covered Deck: 4 patio chairs

*No parties are allowed*
description.notes:
20% off Keowee Marina boat and recreational rentals during your stay with us on Palmetto Paradise Houseboat.

name: Boathouse loft above the Mighty St Lawrence River!
title: Leeds and the Thousand Islands, Canada

location.address: Leeds and the Thousand Islands, ON, Canada

recent.comments:
Over the years we have always chosen a location on the water for our vacation. Ralph's boathouse tops the list as our all time favorite. Looking to restore mind and body the boathouse worked it's magic. It is private, beautiful outside, and inside with everything spotlessly clean. The queen bed (only bed used) was comfortable as were the sofa and chairs which were perfect for lounging and taking in the view. It felt like home where much thought had been given to create its lovely decor with beautiful area rugs, and harmonious colors.

Ralph is an outstanding Airbnb host. We instantly felt we had made a friend upon first meeting him as he gave us our ride out to the boathouse. He is the kind of friend who respected our privacy, yet someone who could be counted upon if needed. He was only a text away always with a quick response ready and willing for whatever was necessary. With many thanks to Ralph, our stay was five stars all the way.

items.comments:
Over the years we have always chosen a location on the water for our vacation. Ralph's boathouse tops the list as our all time favorite. Looking to restore mind and body the boathouse worked it's magic. It is private, beautiful outside, and inside with everything spotlessly clean. The queen bed (only bed used) was comfortable as were the sofa and chairs which were perfect for lounging and taking in the view. It felt like home where much thought had been given to create its lovely decor with beautiful area rugs, and harmonious colors.

Ralph is an outstanding Airbnb host. We instantly felt we had made a friend upon first meeting him as he gave us our ride out to the boathouse. He is the kind of friend who respected our privacy, yet someone who could be counted upon if needed. He was only a text away always with a quick response ready and willing for whatever was necessary. With many thanks to Ralph, our stay was five stars all the way.

I have stayed at ~50 AirBnBs and this was among the very best. Ralph is an amazing, generous, and gracious host. The home is wonderful - perfect and peaceful. If you are anywhere near Ottawa or upstate NY, this is as good as it gets.
Beautiful boathouse and location ! The place is clean and well equipped and the host was very accomodating.

This is a must stay air bnb! Beautiful property with tons of activities: kayaks, floats, a water trampoline, etc.! Beautiful views and lookouts. Ralph was incredibly kind and accommodating and a very good communicator. We had a blast and will definitely be back!

Le boathouse de Ralph est encore mieux que sur les photos. C’est un endroit magique et les hôtes sont charmants. Si vous avez l’occasion de passer quelques jours dans ce petit coin de paradis, n’hésitez pas c’est une expérience magique. Pour profiter pleinement de l’environnement des milles îles, vous devrez louer un bateau. Nous avons loué le notre à pecks marina qui est seulement à 20mn de navigation du boathouse.

Ralph and Gary were excellent hosts and met us on the dock upon our arrival by boat. We were very pleased how the docks protected our boats from being rocked by incoming waves and the location was fantastic… deep clear water for swimming, and everything from a water trampoline, to kayak’s and fishing poles to enjoy the river. The beds were super comfortable and the kitchen stocked with everything you could need for meal preparation. The view from the upper deck can’t be beat, making morning coffee, afternoon wine, or evening beer even more enjoyable. We will definitely be booking again.

description.summary: Amazing Guest quarters above a historic boathouse in the heart of the 1000 islands!  Located on Club island across from the village of Rockport.   Island is boat access only….so either bring your own boat or use the complimentary shuttle!  You must arrive by 5pm for shuttle! The 900sq ft loft is very nicely furnished and has a beautiful deck out over the river.   Swim....fish...relax.....or walk the island!  See our sister cottage “incredible 1000 island cottage”!
description.space:
This is an open loft with 1 queen bed....2 twin beds......1 full bed.......kitchen....dining......and living area with TV.  Wifi is available.  Tv available for dvds only.   There is no cable on the island
There is a nice sunny deck out over the water looking directly at the main Canadian channel of the St Lawrence River!   View is amazing with beautiful sunset views. Swimming is great.  
Gas grill for your cookouts!  We also have a great water trampoline and slide for the kids or adults to use!!!
description.access: Guests have there own very private area on the island!
description.notes: I am available for shuttle service to and from the island if you do not have your own boat.....its about a 3 min trip!   I can also provide transport to Rockport for dinner at Cornwalls Pub...with pick up service after!   Its delightful and relaxing!
description.transit: Guests will need to park at a local marina right across from our island.  Andress Boat Works is the best and parking is not terribly expensive.
description.house_rules:
Hello!
Because we are on an island….we strictly enforce no outdoor fires of any sort!   It’s just not safe to have a fire here. 

Also we are a carry in/carry out loft.    There are garbage cans here but you must take garbage back to mainland and dispose of in dumpster at the marina!   Cost is 6$ a bag.   Recycle is free!

Thank you!!!

hosts.about: Hi everyone! Welcome to my beautiful Houseboat! My name is Daghan and I’m here to go above and beyond to ensure all our guests enjoy their stay and to provide the best quality customer service possible. I recently left the military and am enjoying catching up on quality time with family and friends. In my free time, I enjoy fishing, snorkeling, exercising, and cooking for friends. I look forward to hosting you and providing you with the best Airbnb experience.

recent.comments: What a treat! Great communication before during and after stay. Beautiful house boat just 15 minutes from Jones Beach Theater! Everything was clean, and the views are gorgeous!

items.comments: What a treat! Great communication before during and after stay. Beautiful house boat just 15 minutes from Jones Beach Theater! Everything was clean, and the views are gorgeous!
Easily the coolest air bnb I’ve ever stayed at .  Had an amazing stay with my kids , highly recommend ! Would definitely come back in a heart beat.
Daghans houseboat was a great getaway. It’s spacious inside and has an amazing view of the back bay. He was super responsive with communication. We would definitely stay again.

description.summary:
VIEWS VIEWS VIEWS!!!!! Scenic bayfront living year round! Enjoy unobstructed views of open bay, marine wildlife, Jones Beach Theater & magnificent sunrises & sunsets from 1 of 2 decks. Wake up to sunrise views right from the bedroom and enjoy a coffee and breakfast right outside on the deck. This houseboat is a one of a kind experience and you wont get the same views anywhere else.

Boat rides, fishing or clamming charters, and beach trips available upon request on my 18ft boat. PM for more info
description.space:
This floating home features 2 staterooms, 1.5 baths, an EIK w/granite counters & sliders to the upper deck & spiral staircase to lower deck/floating dock, a spacious living room, an entry foyers w/full-size W/D. Lower deck fits 22' boat & is great for fishing striped bass & snapper as well as enjoying ospreys, herons & other marine wildlife 24/7. Rooftop boasts panoramic bay views ideal for watching fireworks, stargazing & annual summer air shows. Turfed and furnished upper deck allows for a great place and enjoy the fireplace! Choose to shower in the newly renovated bathroom or outback in the hot/cold outdoor shower!

Boat rides, fishing or clamming charters, and beach trips available upon request on my 18ft boat. PM for more info
description.notes:
This houseboat is for people looking to get away, relax, enjoy nature and do some fishing. There are no parties allowed and you must respect the house rules. A houseboat is very different from a normal home and this place is not for you if you plan on being reckless and disrespectful of my home.
Boat rides, fishing or clamming charters, and beach trips available upon request on my 18ft boat. PM for more info
