I've only been an Airbnb host since March 2018, but have thoroughly enjoyed meeting my guests and the experience has been wonderful!  My goal is to make you feel completely at home and for your travels to be memorable!  God bless!

recent.comments: Angie's house boat is beautifully decorated and well supplied.  It has everything you need and is highly recommended for anyone looking for something different near downtown.  There are many places to sit and relax and watch the river roll by.

items.comments: Angie's house boat is beautifully decorated and well supplied.  It has everything you need and is highly recommended for anyone looking for something different near downtown.  There are many places to sit and relax and watch the river roll by.

Angie, is an incredible host, one of the best experiences I have ever had. I chose to stay here, even though I live local on the lake,  I wanted to try this type of experience. I will never try this type of experience with anyone else other than Angie. Words cannot describe how perfect she made this experience.

I would highly recommend staying with Angie   when you are in Knoxville! I will never stay in another hotel in Knoxville as long as Angie has a house boat! I will give her friendliness and cleanliness of this boat two thumbs up 👍👍 

Roll Tide! 😎

We were in town for a tournament and this was SO much better than a hotel! We turned it into a mini getaway and the houseboat was perfect! So clean & comfy and decorated so cute.  Owner met us at check in and was so helpful and welcoming. Would definitely stay again if we are in the area.

We had a couple of minor things come up when we’re at Angie’s houseboat. She was incredibly responsive and attentive to our needs. She brought the problem to a resolution quickly and to the best of her ability for our short stay. Staying on a houseboat is an experience for everyone to try and I would say that Angie would certainly be one that I would rent from again!  Really great host.

Angie's houseboat was wonderful! My family and I THOROUGHLY enjoyed our stay. The houseboat was very clean, well stocked, in a great location, and very relaxing. We lucked out with warm and sunny weather so we were able to enjoy a lot of time sitting on the "poop deck" and the front deck. We will most definitely stay here again in the future!

description.summary:
(Boat #2 of 3) TN River luxury!  This is a modern, completely remodeled 16x70 Sumerset houseboat featuring 4 bedrooms and 1.5 baths.   The rooftop deck has two easily accessible entrances for watching all the beauty of the TN River.  The boat is located at the quality gated Volunteer Landing Marina known for it's downtown location and family oriented, friendly residents.  Note: no parties, loud/obnoxious behaviors are permitted at this marina. 
***Boat must remain docked at all times***
description.space:
***Please note: boat cannot be moved!***
I spared no expense on furnishing this place with the best and I look forward to impressing you with the quality of this houseboat!  My goal is a 5 star stay for all of my guests!
The boat has undergone a complete remodel featuring a spacious kitchen with white quartz countertops and stainless appliances.  The salon features a stone electric fireplace, leather sofa and chair, and new flooring throughout.  The spacious master stateroom features a king bed and has a beautiful large bathroom with glamorous shower and granite countertops.  All 4 bedrooms are beautifully decorated and each have memory foam mattresses and smart TVs.

Again, I will emphasize there are no parties or large gatherings permitted on the vessel.  Any excessive noise or obnoxious behaviors will result in guests vacating with no refund.  

The large roof top deck has accessibility from the front or back deck and has outdoor dining for 6 as well as a hammock for 2, several seating areas and plenty of space to relax!

***This accommodation may not be suitable for young children due to proximity to water.

I am happy to allow pets traveling with their families!  However, pets are permitted with approval only.  There is an additional $15/pet per day fee which can be paid at check in and may vary due to size and/or breed of pet.  I ask that pets are flea/tick free, not permitted on furniture or bedding, and not left alone when guests are away from the boat unless they are crate trained and not barking.  

2022 South Bay Pontoon Boats available to rent from the marina!  Visit the website for Volunteer Landing Marina for rental information.
description.notes:
***Tennessee Volunteers home football gameday weekends require a 3 night minimum stay***
Golf cart is available for transporting luggage to and from the parking area  and is shared between my other boats.  Please be considerate and not leave it in the parking lot or keep it out for extended periods of time.
Children are not permitted to drive the cart.  Must be a licensed driver at least 18 years old.
description.neighborhood: The gated Volunteer Landing Marina is within walking distance to downtown Knoxville, Neyland Stadium, 2 adjacent restaurants, and the University of Tennessee.   Pontoon rentals are available at the marina.  I offer use of a golf cart for transporting luggage, and kayaks during your stay.  These items are shared between my 3 boats.  The greenway is located adjacent to the marina and is great for walking dogs or taking a leisurely stroll to the riverfront.
description.transit: There is parking at the marina parking area with parking pass that will be provided at check in.  Knoxville offers a free trolley that makes frequent stops throughout the day.
description.interaction: I will make arrangements to meet guests at the marina for check in to give a brief tour and ensure they are familiar with the boat.
description.house_rules:
Absolutely NO parties are permitted and all visiting guests must have prior approval.
Quiet hours are dusk until dawn.  There are several families that live in adjacent boats and I will ensure they are not disturbed.
Boat must remain docked at all times.
Pets require prior approval and $15 daily fee per pet applies. They must be on a flea control regimen, housetrained, and not left when owners are away from the boat unless kenneled.
Swimming is not permitted at the marina.
Golf cart is to only be driven by guests over the age of 21 and will be responsible for any damage to the cart or property.
NO loud music is permitted at the marina and guests are asked to be respectful of adjacent boats.
Guests not adhering to house rules will be asked to leave with no refund.  It is a privilege to be able to offer the houseboat as a rental at the marina and I encourage guests to help maintain the family atmosphere at this location.

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

recent.comments: My husband & I decided to find a houseboat to rent for something different to try for vacation.  I came across the Oasis through AirBNB and we couldn't be happier.  Very unique condos on the water.  Spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, 2 living rooms and a full kitchen and outdoor deck.  Very clean, modern and inviting. We enjoyed sitting on the outdoor deck every night overlooking the marina.    Loved the Riverwalk connected to the Marina being able to shop and dine within walking distance and the history of Wilmington is fascinating .  We will definitely be back!

items.comments: My husband & I decided to find a houseboat to rent for something different to try for vacation.  I came across the Oasis through AirBNB and we couldn't be happier.  Very unique condos on the water.  Spacious with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, 2 living rooms and a full kitchen and outdoor deck.  Very clean, modern and inviting. We enjoyed sitting on the outdoor deck every night overlooking the marina.    Loved the Riverwalk connected to the Marina being able to shop and dine within walking distance and the history of Wilmington is fascinating .  We will definitely be back!
Unique and Luxury experience.  Very spacious, clean and made me feel at home.  Walkable to downtown. Nice outdoor patio.

Beautiful houseboat!  Great communication.  While early check-in wasn't promised, they were able to accommodate us.  Great location, close to Live Oak Bank Amphitheater and in the heart of Downtown Wilmington.  Highly recommend...we will be back!
Truly enjoyed overall

We LOVED our time here!  We have already told several friend and family about it and can’t wait to come back!  It was very comfortable and a great alternative to a hotel or “regular” house.  Being in the marina was very special and the location to downtown and an easy drive to Wrightsville made it the perfect spot!

I found this listing in Tik Tok and it did not disappoint. It was a surprise Father’s day getaway with my husband and 2 teenage kids. The house was exactly as described. Every thing was clean and beautifully decorated. Marcia was very communicative from beginning to end. I felt well prepared before I came and decided to stay an extra night, and Marcia was gracious enough to help me with that process, and it literally took less than 10 minutes. The area was beautiful you can look out onto the marina from the back balcony and even hear the live music from the restaurant across the marina. There was lots of things to do in the area including restaurants, the beach and go karting. The best part was the kids had  their own space upstairs with their own room and living room so gave me and my husband privacy on the 1st level. I’m already planning my return trip!

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our houseboats offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.
description.space:
After parking in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our houseboat community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your houseboat, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three benches along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed, large closet, ceiling fan, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2 (Sofa bed):
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with a sectional couch (with pull out sleeper), 60" Smart TV, desk and chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 55" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bath, featuring another walk-in shower. 

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this houseboat is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other houseboats at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access: Guests have access to the entire houseboat for the duration of their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent houseboat community. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 houseboats and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per houseboat. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)
description.house_rules:
Please help us maintain a clean and safe space for all guests by respecting our houseboat rules listed above.
Failure to abide by these rules may result in additional fees.

name: The Driftwood Inn - Houseboat on Cayuga Lake!
title: Lansing, New York

gallery.caption: Showers at main office.
Showers at main office.

all.name: No stairs or steps to enter

hosts.about: Lansing Harbor is Cayuga Lake's premier Marina. Located just south of Myers Park in Lansing, New York. Choose either a The Lake House, a cabin on the land, or one of our houseboats on the water. Cabins and Houseboats vary in size and amenities but you are guaranteed to have a great time with any option! Our season is from April 1st - to October 31st for the cabins and houseboats, The Lake House is available all year long!

recent.comments: A beautiful location,  we really enjoyed the late nights by the dock. The toilet situation took some getting used to and had to ask for it to be cleaned twice during our stay due to the smell. Other than the bathroom, we enjoyed the easy drive into Ithaca Commons.

items.comments: A beautiful location,  we really enjoyed the late nights by the dock. The toilet situation took some getting used to and had to ask for it to be cleaned twice during our stay due to the smell. Other than the bathroom, we enjoyed the easy drive into Ithaca Commons.
Such a cute place to stay! The houseboat was very clean and its so nice to be on the water!
definitely hope to go back! thank you!

Greg was a great host, we were able to add an extra night because we enjoyed our time so much! Safe area. Easy check in. Easy steps onto the houseboat! The inside was very clean. The bed had a nice memory foam topper on it that made it very comfortable. There were a few games on the boat as well. Kitchen was perfect for what we needed - fridge, microwave, coffee maker. The bathroom is just a small set up port-a-jon, but the bathroom is a short walk across the dirt lot along with some outdoor showers. There are also nice showers near the office/checkin area. The “porch” on the boat faces away from the harbor which was fine but he has other rentals that have harbor facing “porches”. There is a nice dock a short distance from the houseboat that leads into the lake that you can jump off of and hang out - perfect little perk to float/launch a paddle board from there! Would love to stay and check out another one of the houseboats sometime!

We really enjoyed our stay, the place is just as advertised and steps away is a dock with excellent swimming and room to sit and enjoy the view at end of dock. Also had great breakfast at boat cafe on premises. Thanks!
Loved my stay here! The Wi-Fi worked great so I was able to work remotely everyday with a gorgeous view of the marina. I will be back

description.summary: Custom designed 1 bedroom, half bath, newly renovated houseboat overlooking Lansing Harbor. Showers are a short walk away. Easy access to Ithaca, Aurora, wineries, and breweries. Be sure to also book one of our BRAND-NEW pontoon rentals during your stay to access Taughannock Falls State Park, Boatyard Grill, Ithaca Farmer’s Market, wineries & more by water!
description.space: The entire space is yours and yours alone.
description.access: You have access in the main building to showers, coin operated laundry and extra bathrooms. There is a ramp to launch water vehicles, a long pier to enjoy. There is for sale on site ice, snacks, and a soda machine. We also have a small amount of marina products.
description.notes: There are many parks, water falls and trails to enjoy. But don’t forget the lakes, for we are one of the Finger Lakes.
description.neighborhood: We’re near Ithaca, Cornell and Wells College. Three hours from Niagara Falls. We are in the center of Lake Cayuga’s wine trail. We’re neighbors to Myers Park.
description.transit: We provide free parking for our guests.
description.interaction: We’re here to greet you until 5pm and will be around to chat any day of the week. After hours, all you have to do is message me. I’m on site in case you have any questions.
description.house_rules:
Clean up after yourselves. We have dish soap, and trash bags and dumpster to put trash into. 

Do not smoke inside 
Do not wear shoes inside

name: AirBNBeached Houseboat Salem SC - Free Park Pass !
title: Salem, South Carolina

recent.comments: Staying in a houseboat was great!! My kids loves it. Very close to the lake and other things we needed when necessary. Would recommend staying here! Great hosts!

items.comments: Staying in a houseboat was great!! My kids loves it. Very close to the lake and other things we needed when necessary. Would recommend staying here! Great hosts!
Had a great time it’s always a great weekend at the lake
We just thought the houseboat was a great place to vacation. The lights on the outside made it stand out at night. I would recommend it for an overnight or a  longer stay.

Made a quick trip to fish Lake Jocassee. What an absolute beautiful lake and the boat house was perfect for our trip. Thanks so much to Mary and team. We accidentally left with the park pass. They were patient with us as we mailed it back to them. Thanks Mary!  We had a great time!

What a cool place to stay. I’m always on the hunt for different or unique. This definitely fits!!!  Cozy but very well laid out.  Full kitchen allowed us to cook a meal. WiFi and the park pass was a definite bonus.  Only thing to be aware of is the shower. I’m a big boy. So it was definitely a tight squeeze. But for most it would do fine.  We will definitely be back next summer.

We were suppose to stay in the house boat but due to unexpected circumstances we stayed in the dome which was a very unique experience, we enjoyed our stay and the hosts are amazing and understanding/attentive.

description.summary: You'll love this unique and romantic escape. Come aboard our awesome Houseboat on land- This perfectly restored rustic yet modern space will be a joy for you and your guests while you travel the area- With all the comforts of home you will be rested and ready for a day on Lake Jocassee or Keowee or to hike or fish the local preserves… Kids will love climbing into their “quarters” and standing at the helm- We can’t wait to get you aboard and share our space with you any questions feel free to ask
description.space: You’ll love this space !! Plenty of outdoor space for cornhole and kids
description.access: All of our units are self check in- Keypad lock sets
description.notes: Includes free pass to Devils Fork State Park. We also only provide one roll of paper towels and 2 rolls of tissue paper, one bottle of shampoo and conditioner , 2 trash bags. Linens we provide all bedding , towels and wash rags, kitchen towels . It is your responsibility to get anything you need extra. We do not provide lake towels or extra blankets.
description.neighborhood: Very peaceful neighborhood 1.2 miles from Lake Jocassee and 2 miles from Lake keowee
description.transit: Planeta of parking for vehicles and boat trailers
description.interaction: We are available anytime for anything that may arise… forgot something? Give us a shout we will help you anyway we can…

gallery.caption: Desk and Queen bed with dresser and side table.
The kitchenette is equipped with pots, dishes & cutlery. (Extras are coffee maker, popcorn maker, blender, crock pot, toaster, kettle and microwave).
Eat in kitchenette.
Pine dinette table with three chairs. Folding chair and folding TV table stored in kitchen area.
Entrance way with coat rack and privacy screen.
Four piece bathroom with towels, soap, and hair dryer.

You have arrived at our Beaverton harbour Boathouse also known as the Sweet Suite. Please park in front off of the laneway and only in front of our boathouse. There is room for two cars or a car and boat trailer if you are bringing a boat to launch.
We have put out a floating dock for your own private waterfront to enjoy.
The floating dock is accessed from beside the boathouse and has tie ups for boats and solar dock lights. You are welcome to fish off the dock.
Boathouse from the water side.
Beaverton Harbour Boathouse.
This wonderful beach has shallow water with sand bars that stretch out into Lake Simcoe making this a warm, protected, and clean beach for you to swim at.
Playground in the Beaverton Harbour park beside the splash pad.
Splash  pad in the Beaverton Harbour park just steps from the boathouse. Your kids will love this!
Kids check out the playground.
The park area in Beaverton on Lake Simcoe has shade trees and picnic tables for your dining  pleasure.
A few stones are found at the edge of the water but after that it is sand bar after sandbar. The water is clean and warm and safe for swimming.0
Stroll along the pier to catch the sunsets on Lake Simcoe, Beaverton.
The pier offers a view of the park, the Beaver River and harbour as well as swimming and sunsets too.
The pier is open for all-nighter or swimming. Just be aware of social distancing while walking out to see Lake Simcoe and it’s beautiful sunsets.
The Boat launch is available and accessed from the parking area. There maybe a charge of $15 for non- residents to launch their boat but is often free.
The dock has a wheelchair acessible canoe and kyak launch to assist in getting in and out of your boats.
Boating is beautiful on lake Simcoe and is connected to the Trent river canals.
Barneys is open for breakfast and lunch. The take out window is open in the later afternoon and there is hard icecream cones too.
There are two boat launches and they charge $15 for non-Brock township residents but is rarely enforced.
Barney's restaurant open for breakfast and lunch with  icecream  &  take out available till  5pm.
Transient slips available.
Beach passes are provided for your stay so you can enjoy the park and splash pad and beach. One pass is good for up to 6 people.
The pier streches out into Lake Simcoe for fishing and swimming in the warm waters.
Spend a lovely afternoon waving to the boats or lying on your floating dock and laze away the day. Fishing off the dock is another option.
These are the transient docks available for daily use. Free for up to 3 hours daily. First come first serve.
As the sun sets you may want to take your dinner over to the park and enjoy the evening in the shade of the trees.

hosts.about:
I love to travel. I love my dog the most. I cannot live without good friends. 

I aim to treat people (and places) how I would like to be treated. If I were to have you in my home, I would expect you to be friendly, respectful, honest and clean. I would love it if you laughed a lot. Thus I try to do all these things when Im a guest and am very grateful to those who open up their homes to me when travelling.

recent.comments: My mother and I were looking for a new spot to try for our annual get away cottage weekend and Malcom's place was a great little find! It is a cozy 1 bedroom space that is right at the steps of a nice local beach and pier perfect to catch a nice sunset. Malcolm was a very attentive host and ensured timely communication for a smooth check-in and check-out which was appreciated.  An all around positive experience!

items.comments: My mother and I were looking for a new spot to try for our annual get away cottage weekend and Malcom's place was a great little find! It is a cozy 1 bedroom space that is right at the steps of a nice local beach and pier perfect to catch a nice sunset. Malcolm was a very attentive host and ensured timely communication for a smooth check-in and check-out which was appreciated.  An all around positive experience!
Nice place, quiet and nice view of the harbour.

This review is actually for Malcom's other property in Beaverton (Buttercup), as he kindly offered an upgrade the morning of our arrival.
Malcolm provided informative communication, and also promptly responded to my messages, so I was very clear on how to access the property and what to expect on my arrival.
The property is spacious, well-furnished and has a well-equipped kitchen - it also has 2 balconies (one over looking the river, and one facing the beach and children's park).
The property was clean, and there were no problems with any of the amenities. In order to provide a well-rounded review I do however have to say the screens could do with a clean to remove the bugs, and the interior paneling is looking a bit tired.
The town is about a 15 minute walk away (we ate at Joe Simcoe's twice - very good food), and Barney's restaurant is conveniently located 30 seconds from the property.
Overall we had an enjoyable stay.
Wonderful location!!

Malcom was a super host. He was there when we arrived, and made everything easy for us. He was very pleasant. We had come for 3 days of ice fishing, and unfortunately the weather turned nasty after day one, and we decided to leave early. The "suite" was very clean and in a great location.

This is my third time staying and had another lovely stay. You might think this is a better place to stay during the summer months, but it’s beautiful in the fall too. I look forward to my next visit.

description.summary: This unique boathouse suite is  on Lake Simcoe in the Beaverton Harbour. It includes a full  bathroom, queen bed, love seat/ sofa bed. The kitchen is fully equipped or Barney's is just steps away. Walk downtown , LCBO, beachfront in the harbour  for swimming and fishing off our private dock ( floating deck ) Splash pad in playground, and shaded  picnic tables at the park. Boat launch & transient slips are available. To  end a perfect day walk the pier and watch the sunset over Thor Island.
description.space: Over night parking is allowed in front of the boat house only. There is enough space for two cars. Boat trailers must be parked in overflow parking and will require a parking pass from the host to display in the vehicle for over night parking.
description.notes: This studio suite is best suited to a single or a couple , and can sleep 3 in a pinch . It has the comforts of home , but  in a smaller space that is functional and comfortable , with access to everything lake simcoe  and the town of Beaverton has to offer . .
description.neighborhood: Located right in the Beaverton harbour , there is a playground including picnic tables and a splash pad fir the little ones to enjoy right on sight , along with a sandy beach and of course the harbour pier . It also offers transient docking if you choose to bring your boat , and there is a launch right in the harbour .. walking distance to liquor store and other conveniences in the small town of Beaverton , this is a great place to unwind and enjoy summer endeavours at lake simcoe .
description.transit: You can walk to most everything in town , however the local food land has closed rather than compete with the larger grocery store on highway 12 about 2 km away ...so you kinda need a car to get groceries , it’s a bit of a hike to the grocery store ..
description.interaction: We are available over this message board , and wifi is available in our boathouse , free of charge .
description.house_rules: No unregistered guests. The guests must be disclosed when you are booking. The suite should be returned to same state of cleanliness as found on check in date. Please have dishes and cook ware cleaned and put away. Please place garbage and recycling in bins provided outside the door. Please take all remaining food with you.

hosts.about:
My wife, Valerie, and I love hosting guests from the beaches of NC to the mountains of the Appalachians.  We have 4 boys who keep us very busy between school, sports, and what feels like a birthday party to attend every weekend.  We specialize in Real Estate to include renovating and flipping, investing in the Short Term Rental Market industry, photography, and sales.

If you want to reach my directly look up Jeremiah Barnett Realtor and you will get my contact info there.  

My motto is a Stranger is nothing more than an Unmet Friend.

recent.comments: Jeremiah was a very responsive and helpful host. The place itself is great for large gatherings and benefits from the ability to section off different areas of the house. Beautiful view, great porches, and stocked with fun lake toys (floating mats, kayaks, etc.)

items.comments: Jeremiah was a very responsive and helpful host. The place itself is great for large gatherings and benefits from the ability to section off different areas of the house. Beautiful view, great porches, and stocked with fun lake toys (floating mats, kayaks, etc.)
Great spot for a big family reunion!  We brought our boats and tubed with the kids in a private cove, spent time at the Shady Shack down the road, and had a great week of lake relaxing together.

There is plenty of space with this duplex renting as one house. Double of everything.... indoor and outdoor space, fridges, kitchens, decks, bedrooms. 😊
Walk is further to the dock than we estimated from the pics. We were new to Lake Gaston and didn't realize how steep some sides of the Lake are. Not easy for elderly parents. 
Jeremiah was very easy to communicate with and responded quickly to texts. 
The Lake was incredible! Perfect weather and water temp for the week of the 4th! 😎🇺🇲

This place is fabulous for a large group - two separate, but identical units that open to connect to each other. Plenty of space and you have the ability to either hang together or find your own secret spot for peace and quiet. The best part is you can bring your furbaby! They even have a fenced yard which is so convenient and makes having them outside worry free. While the inside is great, it is the outside which is the draw. Beautiful setting, lots of deer in the yard, and many leveled decks to enjoy the views while having tea or bbq’ing. We thoroughly enjoyed setting up an inflatable movie theater outside on the deck in the evening and eating s’mores. Fair warning, there are lots of stairs headed down to the dock, but by the end of the week you will have buns of steel, and being able to access the great dock below is worth it. Renting a boat was super easy and fishing, kayaking and laying on the giant mat was a treat for all. Something for everyone! Thanks Jeremiah!

Jeremiah’s place really is what you think of when you hear lake house. Such a beautiful home right on the lake in the nicest, quietest neighborhood. Came in a winter month but will definitely try to make it back in the summer. This home is so spacious for a big family and has several amenities to keep you occupied on rainy days in doors. Can’t wait to plan a fishing trip back with buddies.

Jeremiah was very attentive and communicative from the time I contacted him with questions, up until the end of our stay!  The home was very clean and comfortable and there was room for everyone. Very private, beautiful surroundings and quiet. We had a wonderful vacation!

description.summary: Lake Gaston Duo is the perfect vacation spot.  Traveling with other friends or family?  This home includes 2 kitchens, 2 Living Rooms, 2 Dens, 2 Game Rooms, 6 Bedrooms, 4 Bathrooms, 2 upper level decks, and 2 lower level decks with beautiful water views!  There are TV's in every bedroom, the 4 larger TV's are equipped with a nice Soundbar and Subwoofer speaker system. The boat house comes with 2 kayaks and 2 18 Ft Watermats! You are located on a quiet cove perfect for fishing or swimming.
description.interaction: We live in Wilmington, NC.  I'm available via text or app from 9am until 7pm.  If it is an emergency, feel free to reach me direct on my cell phone.
description.house_rules: Quiet hours outside are from 9pm until 7am.  It is extremely important to abide by these hours set forth by our HOA.  A noise complaint from neighbors will result in the reservation being terminated.

recent.comments: Very Accommodating Host!

items.comments: Very Accommodating Host!
Had the most terrific stay this past 4th July weekend. Such a unique accommodation in a beautiful location. Joseph was incredibly responsive and accommodating. We hope to stay again!

It is not a boat, it is not a house, it is a beautiful perfect place  to enjoy the comfort of a house with the sea as a garden. Joseph was always very attentive to every detail. We will for sure coming back, so far was the best Father’s Day we spend in family!! Thank you Joseph.

What an amazing place and amazing time. The place was peaceful and located privately in a marina that have live music on the weekend with a nice bar. The host was very responsive and helpful! We look forward to making a trip back down! Thanks Joseph!

Joseph’s place was incredible. This was our very first time EVER staying in an Airbnb. The location and the views were pristine. A very unique experience. I’ve never stayed in a houseboat until now. We did not, however, you may experience some motion sickness during tidal changes if you’re prone to it. But, Joseph built a sea wall, for lack of a better term, to limit movement, which I thought was brilliant. Overall, we had an amazing time and we really enjoyed Joseph’s home.

description.summary: Come enjoy Joe's floating home! It is located in Causeway Cove Marina on South Hutchinson Island . Swim in the emerald waters of the Treasure Coast . Located just over the bridge is downtown Ft. Pierce is known for its shopping, restaurants, live entertainment and two locally owned micro brewery's and the Sunrise Theater .  Rent boats, jet skis,and kayaks. at the Marina and enjoy the Wet Whistle bar on the deck overlooking the beautiful  Indian River Lagoon, or bring your own, private slip.
description.space: Joe's Floating House is a one of a kind experience that could be a romantic getaway or room for six guests.  This is a real house , not a boat. The home has its own personal seawall to limit any movement. The home has everything you need including a full kitchen, two bedroom, two baths and washer and dryer. All utilities are included with your stay. Watch the stars from the deck as you grille your favorite fish or steak. Located in the Causeway Cove Marina, you will have access to the Wet Whistle deck and bar, jet ski , boat and kayak rentals. Also free transportation through the city's Freebee service. items.comments: thank you for such a beautiful paradise!
Island Life houseboat was a gorgeous place to stay! Spacious, beautiful views, well equipped with everything one could think of. Definitely worth it and will be going back!!

Wonderful stay. Everything as stated. Pantries FULL of EVERYTHING extra you always need to bring. (Condiments, coffee, bags etc.)  Kim was very responsive and very fair in-spite of my puppies chewing up a few things. She even provided cookies for the pups. The kids were fighting for the cookies until I read they were dog cookies! Games for kids, EASY access to TV.    The marina provides wagons for off loading your things from your car to the House Boat but I was glad we had brought our own as we could not locate one upon arrival. The most enjoyable time was just relaxing off the back and watching the grandchildren catch fish and releasing them back into the water all while grilling lunch and dinner on the grill! 

Easy boat rentals which enhanced our adventure and brought back wonderful memories of growing up on a lake. Sharing this with family was amazing. 

Thank you again Kim!

description.summary: Island Life by Boatiful Life is a one of a kind getaway! A lovely space to unwind and allow your everyday worries to “float” away. This is truly water living at it’s best! Nestled in between the city and the country, the boat is perfect for a nice escape and home base for unique shops, excellent restaurants, community events and the Sunset Tiki Bar right on site. The island's location is ideal for small city outings to big city nightlife.
description.space: This luxury vacation rental has a fully equipped kitchen, a washer and a dryer, a queen sleeper sofa, 2 twin beds in the loft and a queen bed in the master bedroom along with vaulted ceilings and surrounding window views that make this property feel large and open. Entertain guests with a fully stocked kitchen including a full size oven and refrigerator. The kitchen is open to the living room, so you won’t miss any vacation memories while you cook. If cooking isn’t on your itinerary, there are several excellent dining options just a short distance from the marina.
description.access: Guests will have full access to the entire boat & Sunset Tiki Bar
description.notes:
You definitely don’t want to miss the breathtaking views this property provides. There is a lower deck and an upper deck on this vessel, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine while viewing a stunning sunset, or enjoy the sunset at the tiki bar playing giant connect four or simply relaxing by the fire pit.

The lower deck also includes a brand new state of the art gas grill sure to meet all of your grilling expectations.

Book Island Life today and be ready for a one of a kind getaway. This beautiful property will not disappoint!

* This property does not travel. It stays at the marina.

description.summary: Welcome to our floating cottage located at Hickory Star Marina in Maynardville TN.  Our cottage is anchored out in the water so you must have a boat, raft, canoe, or jet ski to get to it.  It’s a perfect place to get away from it all and decompress.  Bed accommodations include two bunk beds and one couch.  Kitchenette is furnished with propane stove and microwave. Propane grill on the floating deck is available.  Running water from the lake used for all sinks and shower. Nice simple clean place
description.space: We have a gas can on site which can be filled at the marina to run the portable generator.  Window placed AC only operates when the generator is turned on.  A stand up fan will circulate the air through the boathouse quite nicely. You must bring your own towels.  Beds have mattress covers, pillow with cover and simple bed spread.  We do not have a refrigerator on the boat, so you may want to bring good coolers.  Ice can be purchased at the marina.  Water level is pretty deep around the house, so you must bring your own life jackets. Paddle boat and kayak are on site for your enjoyment.  If you love camping this is the place for you.  If bugs bother you and you’re not use to being out in the wilderness, well you may want to rethink this option.  Basic necessities such as dish soap, toilet paper, & paper towels are provided.  You may want to bring extra paper plates. Lake water from the sinks are not suitable for drinking.  Please bring your own bottled water.  Shower water is directly from the lake, so it may emit a well water type odor. Also the shower does not have hot water.  Water temp will vary from the beginning of the season to the end of the season.  Our little houseboat is a perfect getaway for those wanting some rest and relaxation.  Nothing like waking up with a cup of coffee in hand and seeing the sunrise in the morning on the lake.
description.access: For safety reasons please do not climb the rear ladder onto the roof.  Jumping off the roof into the water is dangerous and you can get injured which would ruin your vacation.  We sincerely appreciate if you honor our policy.  Thank you.
description.notes: Although there is a ladder, please do not climb it and get on the roof.  For safety reasons climbing on the roof to dive off is not permitted.  We would sincerely appreciate you not even attempting to go on the roof.
description.interaction: We have our personal house boat nearby and will be available should you need anything.
description.house_rules:
You must be at least 21 years old in order to book and stay at our place.   Anyone that is staying at our place that is under 21 years of age are not allowed to consume alcohol on our houseboat. 

Please do not flush toilet paper or any other items down the commode. A small trash can is provided for used toilet paper etc. Portable generator stored Inside the boathouse must be moved outside and connected with a main cable (provided) in order to run AC ,fan, and microwave. You must bring your own gas or fill our gas can up at the marina.  Please take your own trash with you. Dumpsters are located in the parking lot for disposal. Lake water from the sink is not suitable for drinking. If you take a shower lake water may emit a sulphuric like odor. The water is deep around the boat house. Please bring your own life vest especially for small children.  Lastly, please do not climb the ladder at the rear of the boat onto the roof.  For safety reasons, getting on the roof to dive into the water is forbidden.         Our no pet policy is put in place so that we can maintain our houseboat as clean as possible. Although your pet may be well trained at home, pets react differently when in a new environment such as out in the water with boats passing close by.  Please respect our no pet policy and if you show up with your pet you will not be allowed on the boat and we will gladly offer a full refund.

description.summary: This unique space offers the best of all worlds. Located just minutes from Trenton on a dead end road but with that country feel. This quiet location offers serenity at night with the ability to check out the local wineries just 30 minutes away in Prince Edward County.

recent.comments:
Lovely place, overall. 
Check-in was not smooth on a VERY hot day: I was not able to get my luggage down to the secure dock area so I go cool off somewhere. Host had been responsive on day prior to check-in, but then on day OF check-in, there was no response for several hours, and I was stuck my bags and nowhere to go. 
It turned out that the automated instructions should have been sent two days prior. Host was apologetic once they finally responded, then gave me a phone contact number, but it was very upsetting & soured me a bit.
Also - if you are wanting to use the 2nd bed ("Oversized sectional couch, that can be configured to sleep two") then *request extra linens* blanket, pillow(s) & towels *ahead of time*
Other than that - high praise for the housekeeping staff!!
The boat was immaculate, and the kitchen very well stocked, as advertised. 
Beautiful, quiet, and safe-feeling area. Part of the week we booked, it was me as a solo traveler; I was super comfortable, enjoyed the stay.

description.summary: ONE-OF-A-KIND LUXURY HOUSEBOAT WITH OVER 650 SQUARE FEET OF LIVING SPACE, CUSTOM KITCHEN, AND HUGE DECK!
description.space:
Stay a weekend. Stay a week! All of the amenities of home are included in this spectacular apartment-on-the-water in the heart of Boston's North End. Enjoy amazing harbor views and cool ocean breezes in the light-filled stateroom.  Prepare breakfast in the fully stocked chef's kitchen, complete with stainless steel appliances and a granite island. Invite friends over for drinks on the enormous deck. This is truly Boston's most unique and memorable vacation experience.
 
Unlike other boats, HouseBoat Endless Summer offers unparalleled comfort and convenience in a beautifully designed, spacious cabin.
 
 
Features:
Queen-sized master bedroom with deck access
Central AC and heat
Large capacity washer/dryer
Dishwasher
Stand-up tiled shower
Oversized sectional couch that can be configured to sleep two (or even 3). 
Roof deck with lounge furniture
 
 
10% Discount for a stay of 3 nights or more! 
 
 
Amenities:

Linens and bath towels

Soap, shampoo, and conditioner

Cookware, cutlery and dishware

Free Wifi

Free coffee

Roku TV

Access to an electric grill on the dock

No Pets Allowed


 

Location:

Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Boston at Lewis Wharf, this boat is just steps away from the New England Aquarium, Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall, the North End, Boston Garden, a public ice skating rink, and countless other things to see and do.

 

Transportation:

Short walk (less than 10 mins) to Aquarium, North Station and Government Center subway stations

The adjacent parking lot charges $30-35 for 24 hours (this does not include in-and-out privileges)

Looking for a different type of transportation? Book a tour of the Boston Harbor with our partners, Red Top Boats, for a water taxi service or boat charter.

 

The Experience:

Lewis Wharf is a private dock with close neighbors in an exclusive North End residential area. Only those with the key can pass through the gate providing a secure place to sleep! Quiet time is from 10 pm to 8 am. Please be respectful of our neighborhood.

After a long day of touring the city there is nothing better than relaxing on your own private deck with a cold drink in hand, listening to the soothing sounds of the ocean as you enjoy the fantastic waterfront atmosphere!

Although generally calm, there can be some occasional movement during the day when boats pass by. At night the waters are very calm and some guests even find that a bit of gentle swaying relaxes them and makes for a very restful sleep.

Take advantage of this unique experience! Book with us today!

 

Please note:

Check in is at 3pm unless pre-approved. Check out is at 11am, no exceptions.

The extra person fee applies for every guest after two guests.
description.house_rules:
Rental Agreement

RENTAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS
 
DEPOSIT AND PAYMENTS: 50% of your reservation is due at the time you make your reservation. The total is due 30 days prior to your check in date. If you have a credit card on file it will be charged automatically unless other payment arrangements are made. Please review your reservation and make sure all the information including check in and check out dates are correct.
PAYMENT TERMS: We only accept credit cards (Mastercard, Visa or Discover) as forms of payment.
CANCELLATION: A sixty (60) day advance notice is required for refundable cancellation. Cancellations that occur more than sixty (60) days prior to the arrival date will befully  refunded, however, cancellations that occur within 60 days of the arrival will result in a 50% refund. If the reservation is cancelled less than 30 days prior to the arrival date, the full payment is forfeited. Early departure does not warrant a refund of rent or deposit.
RATES: Rates, terms and applicable taxes are subject to change without notice. In the event of unforeseen circumstances, SleepAfloat reserves the right to move guests to a comparable property or refund the Guest the amount paid.
MARINA RULES: Guest agrees to abide by the rules of the marina at all times.
DAMAGE AND CLEANING ISSUES: A damage waiver of $39 is required. The waiver provides $1,000 of protection coverage for ACCIDENTAL damage. Any damage or cleaning issues noticed upon arrival should be reported to SleepAfloat immediately. If damage has not been reported within 3 hours of arrival, it will be deemed your responsibility and your credit card may be charged for the cost of the repair. SleepAfloat reserves the right to CHARGE THE CREDIT CARD on file for MALICIOUS, INTENTIONAL, or NEGLIGENT damage caused to the property during your stay. You will not be held responsible or incur additional charges for damages provided the following provisions are met: No damage is done to the unit or its contents including the linens. No items are missing upon the inventory check (this includes, but is not limited to, transferring items to other units). All debris, garbage and discards are placed in proper containers. All soiled dishes are placed in the dishwasher. The maximum occupancy of the unit was not exceeded. There was no smoking in a designated non-smoking unit. Unit is left in neat condition. Pet friendly units show no sign of pet damage or excessive cleaning. All keys are left on the kitchen table and/or lockbox and unit is left locked. All debris, rubbish and discards are properly bagged. If you experience any problems whatsoever with the vacation property during your stay, please contact the reservations manager and we will do our best to rectify the matter as soon as it is practically possible. Should a problem remain unresolved, you are required to notify us in writing within 7 days after check out. No action can be taken or liability accepted for any complaints received after this period. It is our goal to resolve complaints within 60 days from the time they are reported.
NO SMOKING: Smoking is not allowed in any of our units. Smoking is not allowed outside by any open window/door. Smoking on marina property is subject to the rules of the marina.
SEVERE WEATHER: We do not refund rents or deposits lost due to cancelled or shortened stays because of weather. Departures due to inclement weather do no warrant refund of rent or deposit.
PET POLICIES: (Allowed in Pet Friendly Units Only): There is a maximum of two pets allowed in each pet friendly unit at a flat rate of $50 per rental. Guest pets must be treated for fleas and ticks prior to arrival. Guests must pick up after pets and tightly tie the remnants in a plastic bag. Pets are not allowed on the furniture and all pet hair must be totally cleaned prior to departure. A $150 fee will be charged if there is any report of pet hair on bedding and sofas. Guest pets must be leashed at all times when outside of the unit. The violation of any terms of this pet policy subjects the guest to additional fees or termination of the rental. Guest pet policies are subject to change per county and local rules and regulations at any time.
FALSIFIED RESERVATIONS: Any reservation obtained under false pretense will be subject to forfeiture of advance deposit and/or rental money and the party will not be permitted to check-in.
MINIMUM AGE: We do not rent to anyone under 25 years of age unless accompanied by an adult guardian or parent.
MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY: The maximum number of overnight guests on the boat is detailed in your rental agreement. A FEE OF $50.00 PER GUEST/NIGHT OVER THE INITIAL 2 GUESTS WILL BE CHARGED. If more guests are found during the reservation, SleepAfloat holds the right to charge the credit card on file for the extra guests. There is a maximum of 10 daily guests per unit. If you would like to host more than 10 guests please notify the reservation manager prior to your arrival. If more than 10 daily guests are found, SleepAfloat holds the right to cancel the reservation and ask all guests to leave with NO REFUND. 
NO DAILY MAID SERVICE: While linens and bath towels are included in the unit, daily maid service is not included in the rental rate.
WRITTEN EXCEPTIONS: Any exceptions to the above mentioned policies must be approved in writing in advance. GUEST assures us that their parties will observe all conditions and terms of this agreement as to maintaining the rental in good order and appearance and will conduct themselves in a manner inoffensive to neighbors particularly relating to noise. GUEST assures that anyone in their party who violates any of the terms of this Agreement shall be immediately denied occupancy. GUEST agrees that any tenant who is found using illegal drugs or allows others to use illegal drugs on the premises will be immediately denied continued occupancy at these premises. GUEST and/or members of their party shall not disturb, annoy, endanger, or inconvenience neighbors, nor use the premises for any immoral or unlawful purposes, nor violate any law or ordnance. GUEST agrees that during the term of this agreement and such further time as he/she occupies the premises, he/she will keep the rental clean and free of trash, garbage, and other waste. All pipes, wires, glass, plumbing and other equipment and fixtures shall be kept in the same condition as at the beginning of the rental. GUEST agrees to indemnify and save SleepAfloat harmless from all liability, loss or damage arising from any nuisance or harm made or suffered on the premises by the GUEST, members of their party or from any carelessness, neglect, or improper conduct of any persons entering, occupying or visiting the premises. SleepAfloat accepts no responsibility or liability for any loss or damage or alteration to the terms of the reservation caused by events beyond its control, including but not restricted to war, terrorist activity, civil commotion, flight delays, or cancellations, airport closures, loss of luggage, adverse weather conditions, fire flood, or industrial dispute. SleepAfloat does not accept any liability for failure of public supplies such as water, electricity, or Internet. Nor for the consequences of the action or omissions of persons who may control or supply main services, or any actions taken by any authority over which there is no control. SleepAfloat does not accept any liability for GUEST’S and/or members of their party’s personal safety during the rental period. It is particularly important that children are supervised at all times inside and outside of the the vacation property. SleepAfloat assumes no responsibility for accidents. Guests are reminded to exercise care as to personal safety, and the safety of companions. Whenever possible, valuables should be left secure and out of sight. If for any reason, in the judgment of SleepAfloat, the boat becomes uninhabitable or otherwise unusable, or the boat slip becomes unable to be used, then, at the option of SleepAfloat, this agreement may be immediately terminated and all payments shall be totally refunded.

description.summary:
LABOR DAY WEEKEND SPECIAL 

MUST BE RENTED FOR 3 NIGHTS. FRIDAY-MONDAY OR SATURDAY-TUESDAY

The houseboat stays at the marina, for an extra fee lake cruises can be arranged directly with me on my SeaRay 215 cruiser. Sunset cruises,  half day lake tours, sandbar.

Also available for special occasions. Inquire within.
description.space: Beautiful 95x17 3 bedroom full kitchen dining room 4 season room and private patio off of master bedroom. 2 full baths and a tremendous patio upstairs with plenty of sun and a 17x20 canopy with misting system, fans and Bluetooth. Includes a kayak
description.access: Entire boat access
description.notes: Full coffee bar with espresso and cappuccino machine and flavored syrups. Welcome basket with wine and snacks welcome you upon arrival. No smoking, vaping, tobacco products allowed in the houseboat.
description.transit: Great restaurant right across the lake for great happy hour and late night drinks and food
description.interaction: I have a 22 foot SeaRay at the marina where I stay when the houseboat is occupied. For an additional fee I am happy to take you and your guests on a lake tour.
description.house_rules:
Guests have access to cooking and kitchen utensils but all must be washed and put back prior to leaving. 

No guests/visitors under 16.                             Houseboat sits in private marina and must follow marina rules. No loud music after 10:00pm

No additional guests including family or friends are allowed to stop by during the stay.

Enjoy motorcycle riding, boating, movies, nice night out, live entertainment,  music,  sports, etc.

recent.comments: Great place yo stay only drawback is small shower.

items.comments: Great place yo stay only drawback is small shower.
Clean, quiet and relaxing.

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Cypress Boathouse Retreat. It was perfect for the 2 of us. And the price was much less than any of the nearby hotels, that would have offered a lot less amenities. Most importantly of the Boathouse vs. a hotel:  the relaxed, at home feeling, and the setting can not be matched.  Keith is very friendly and accommodating.  We've told all of our family and friends about the Cypress Boathouse Retreat, because when my husband posted a video on social media, everyone wanted to know the details.
Keith’s boathouse provided the perfect space for a relaxing  weekend get away. Simple but very comfortable.

Keith went above and beyond.  We wouldn’t have changed anything.  Very peaceful, safe, clean and everyone was friendly.  Loved the boathouse cottage and the fact that we could dock the boat right there.  We’ll be back!  Highly recommend to others.

Everything about our stay at the boathouse was great. Everything is as described, if not better.  Keith, our host, couldn't be more accommodating.  We're hoping to return to the Boathouse on our next FL trip.

description.summary:
A retreat atop a real boathouse overlooking a beautiful canal which leads to the Dead River.  The Dead River connects Lake Harris and Lake Eustis.  The Harris Chain of Lakes attracts the pro bass fisherman.  Many pro fishing tournaments are held in these amazing lakes.  
While at the boathouse you might experience beautiful nature such as osprey, eagles, owls, and many other species of animals.
Location is a short ride to the world famous Leesburg Bike Fest.
description.space: Atop of your very own perch (boat house), you will experience beautiful nature such as osprey, eagles, owls, and many other species of animals.
description.access:
Bicycle ride along the bike path to the Tavares town center from the boat house. It is a short 3 mile bike ride.   Location is a short ride to the world famous Leesburg Bike Fest.  Beautiful Mt. Dora known as City of Festivals is located 5 miles away.
 The Villages is a short 25 minute ride.  Disney and the other attractions are a 1 hour drive away.
description.notes:
Beautiful Mt. Dora known as the City of Feastivals is 5 miles away. The Villages is a short 25 min drive.  There is a mall and many restaurants within a 5 minute drive. 
Ample parking for your boat trailer and truck. Boat dock available on premises. Tavares (America's Seaplane City) is bass capital of the world. Explore Tavares by boat, plane, or train. There are boats, jet skis, and kayaks to rent nearby or you can bring you own and leave right from your boathouse.
description.house_rules: No smoking in the boathouse.   No pets allowed.

name: Wake up ON the water- Island King
title: Port Clinton, Ohio

recent.comments: Our stay on a houseboat was unique! We enjoyed the sunrise and sunset along with fishing off of the boat. Sitting on the boat soaking in the sun was calming.

items.comments: Our stay on a houseboat was unique! We enjoyed the sunrise and sunset along with fishing off of the boat. Sitting on the boat soaking in the sun was calming.

Just the perfect place, I couldn’t thank Josh and Michelle enough for having such a nice place for us to stay while we were on our mini-vacation.  Great suggestions on food and local happenings. Thank you for sharing your oasis with us. I can’t wait to come back!!

Josh and Michelle were very responsive.  We had a few issues that they addressed quickly and they were very helpful.  Some key things for future guests: please use the beautiful bath house facility that is located at the end of the dock, rather than the toilet on the boat.  The bath house Josh had built  is very nice, and is kept very clean. Enjoy sunsets and time on the deck of the boat, it’s beautiful out on the water.  There’s a bunch of great places nearby to get out onto the lake, such as North Coast Beachfitters.  And the burgers were excellent at Dock’s Beach House, which was just down the street.  Overall, we had a nice break from our work week out on the lake!

Girls weekend with my daughters at the lake! What a great alternative to a hotel. We woke up each morning to the sun shinning, the water and coffee outside on the deck. Unfortunately we had mayflies, but Josh was there every morning blowing them off and pressure washing the boat to make sure we were able to enjoy the outer decks. The boat had plenty of room for the 3 of us and there are lots of things to do in the area. The bath house is such a great idea and also the barge with the grill for cooking. I will come back again for sure! Michelle and Josh were so nice. Thank  you for a lovely weekend!
A beautiful setting to relax and unwind.  Perfect!
What a fun and different place to stay! It very much is like “glamping” on the water. Fun stay! Thanks for everything!

description.summary:
Island KIng is a houseboat with tons of charm! Wake up to the sounds of the water and go to bed watching an amazing sunset! 

This is a boat on the water, in a marina. There are other houseboats and personal boats in the marina. The boats do not move from the dock, but simply camping on the water!
description.space:
Inside you will find a king size Sleep Number bed, kitchen area with fridge/microwave and kcup coffee maker. The front living area has a couch that can convert to a full size bed.  

The outside area of this boat is great! The front deck has a two comfy chairs to enjoy. 

While there is a bathroom on the boat, we ask this is used sparingly as the systems are sensitive. We have a bath house facility off the dock that includes showers and restrooms. There is a men's restroom, women's restroom and several unisex private restrooms with shower stalls.
description.access: You will love being able to walk to the beach and having Downtown Port Clinton activities within minutes. Restaurants, bars, live music, festivals, farmers markets, art shows and more! If you have a boat/jet skis/kayak this is the paradise for you. Please let us know if you would like to bring it, we have dock spaces available. There is access to Lake Erie and the Portage River directly from the marina. The Sandusky Bay is only a few minutes’ drive, as well as Cedar Point. The Jet Express is a couple minutes down the road, and you can be to Put N Bay or Kelley’s Island quickly!
description.notes:
Reminder, this is a boat on the water. Depending on the weather, there can be movement. There can also be different kinds of wildlife and bugs. This is similar to camping, but on the water! Spiders, Flies, Mayflies, Nats, etc are all creatures of the water areas. We do spray and clean for these, but want to make you aware that you may see them.  We do our best to keep you comfortable! Please let us know if there is anything we can do while you are with us.

New for 2023!! 

Kayaks and fishing poles will be complimentary for overnight guests! 

Island Getaway Boat Rental will have pontoon and fishing boats available foe daily rentals, at the docks to explore the area. 
New heating and ac units have been added! 
A brand new boathouse has been built AT our dock! Full size, full bathrooms, available steps from the boat. 

Check us out -
Island houseboat getaway
description.interaction: Our personal boat is also in the marina so we are around if you need anything!

items.comments: Had a great time, nice area

We had a really relaxing, good time. Super quiet, wonderful views of the river. The boat was very pretty and fun to stay at.  I had to contact Mark two times for situations totally not his fault, but he responded graciously and helped. I look forward to staying again in the future.

I recently had the pleasure of staying on this charming houseboat, and it was an experience unlike any other. Nestled on the tranquil St. Johns. This floating paradise offered a perfect blend of comfort, serenity, and unmatched views. 
Furthermore, the hospitality of Mark was exceptional. He was attentive, friendly, and made sure that every aspect of our stay was enjoyable.
Mark was very responsive and helpful. We loved our stay

This was the 3rd stay at Mark’s place since 2020.  He is always very responsive and has a friendly word when he is nearby caring for his boats.   The houseboat is well equipped, but starting to need a couple of updates.
Highly recommended!

description.summary:
Completely renovated custom 50x14 stationary houseboat for short/long term rentals.
   Enjoy the beautiful world famous St. Johns River. One of the only two rivers in the world that's flows north. Be surrounded by its natural beauty and wildlife! Experience the luxury of waking up in your own private setting, surrounded by nature.
description.space: This custom-spacious 50' houseboat allows you to feel as if you are waking up in your private oasis. The beautiful and spacious 14x16' master suite offers you a private sitting area with a full size sofa, as well as a comfortable queen size bed, 42" flat screen television, a nice size closet with custom shelving, full bathroom with a full tiled shower, vanity and tiled floors. As well as your own private 8'x14'outdoor deck for your private coffee in the morning, or beverage in the evening. The galley offers a beautiful leather sofa, which opens into a comfortable queen size bed for additional sleeping space. The full size fully stocked kitchen allows you to entertain and brings all the comforts of home with its full refrigerator, microwave, oven/stove, sink and plenty of cabinet and counter space. The galley is also equipped with an electric fireplace, center-island, as well as a 32" flat screen television, not leaving out the gorgeous views of the St. Johns River. The second 10'x14' outdoor living area is equipped with a barbecue, a beautiful and comfortable patio set that includes a custom table with fire pit.
description.access: Short distance from local famous beaches, Orlando theme parks, and the famous Daytona International Speedway.
description.transit: You will never run short of activities while on vacation. Our resort offers a large pool for your swimming pleasure, several outdoor sitting areas, deli and full restaurant with tiki bar and live music on premise, ship store, beautiful scenery, laundry facilities, and private parking at your slip. Boat rentals are available at the resort as well as at marinas nearby for your further enjoyment of the St. Johns River. Take a dinner cruise on the saint John's river from historic down town  Sanford minutes away from the resort. For all you Beach lover's  pick your choice from several local beaches including the world famous Daytona Beach conveniently located a short driving distance from the resort. You will be staying near all Orlando theme parks as well as water parks....  Minutes away is the central Florida zoo as well as the Seminole Town Center Mall and many restaurants to choose from for your eating pleasure.... Conveniently located near I4 and interstate 95 for your traveling needs.....
description.interaction: Book your next memorable vacation today to experience luxury and nature at its finest.

name: The Boathouse + Cottage on Stormy Lake
title: Haliburton, Canada

gallery.caption: Built in dishwasher for your convenience

hosts.about: Love to travel the world and meet new people!  Professional cottagers who believe that there is no bad weather, just bad clothing! Driven across Canada three times.

recent.comments: This was our second time renting Paul's cottage. The cottage itself is simple and lovely, and the lake feels like an old-fashioned family lake.  It's not too big and everyone there is friendly and respectful of one another. Morning coffee on the dock, wrapped in a blanket against the chill, watching the mist rise off the lake is a highlight. The huge boulders surrounding the fire pit are epic.  The road and trail are perfect for a jog, and it's only 15 minutes to town and an amazing book shop and antiques shop.  A nice blend of simple and elegant comfort surrounded in nature.

items.comments: This was our second time renting Paul's cottage. The cottage itself is simple and lovely, and the lake feels like an old-fashioned family lake.  It's not too big and everyone there is friendly and respectful of one another. Morning coffee on the dock, wrapped in a blanket against the chill, watching the mist rise off the lake is a highlight. The huge boulders surrounding the fire pit are epic.  The road and trail are perfect for a jog, and it's only 15 minutes to town and an amazing book shop and antiques shop.  A nice blend of simple and elegant comfort surrounded in nature.
Nice cottage for a relaxing getaway would recommend bringing your fishing rods lots of action of the dock

Paul’s cottage and boathouse rental and was a beautiful and very clean.  The spaces are very well maintained, with a fully stocked kitchen that includes all amenities and a bonus was having the dishwasher. Paul was very responsive with his communication prior to and during our stay. We were 2 families with a total of 3 children who enjoyed swimming the lake as well as usage of the other water toys (kayaks, row boat, pedal boat).  The property has a nice fire pit area and we had a lovely stay.
We had a fantastic weekend away on the Lake! Would recommend to anyone

Our family had a wonderful time at the Boathouse cottage! The beds are super comfortable, and the cottage was clean and stocked with everything we needed. The boathouse itself was lovely for chilling, naps, and watching movies. Kids loved the kayaks, paddle boards, and paddle boat (and the bunk bed!). This cottage is on a gorgeous, peaceful lake with quiet and friendly neighbours and Paul was friendly and responsive whenever we had a question. Would 100% stay here again!

We had a wonderful stay this weekend with our friends. The main cottage and small boathouse were well equipped and spotless on arrival. Paul was a super responsive host throughout our entire weekend. The dock was amazing with ample seating and lots of water sport activities provided. We would stay here again happily.

description.summary:
Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway. Come experience life directly on the water in a rare and charming Boathouse. Relax down on the Dock or go adventure out on the water! This 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom, with a brand new kitchen has all the amenities you need to forget the stress of the city, without distracting from the beautiful cottage charm. 
Watch the sunrise, the sunset, or the shimmering diamonds in the lake with the sound of the loons out on the water.
description.space: This cottage offers three bedrooms, one bathroom, a brand new kitchen with granite countertops, a dishwasher and sweeping views of the lake that is steps from your front door. There is a boathouse situated directly on the water with a large dock attached for maximum relaxation.
description.access: Everything on the property is yours to enjoy including 2 paddle boards, 2 kayaks, a canoe, a paddle boat & a row boat! There are three docks, a dock for all of your boating needs, a lounging dock & a floating swimming dock for those who like to make a splash!
description.notes:
A premium cell phone signal booster is installed in the cottage. This will ensure you're able to make important phone calls, browse the web, or stream your favourite media with your improved cell phone reception.


*Tap water is not safe to drink so it is advised you bring your own water jugs / bottles*
*Pets are not allowed*
description.neighborhood: This lake is very vibrant & full of life. Some of your cutest neighbours include beavers, chipmunks, loons, robins, foxes & more! The owners on either side of the property are life long friends who are wonderful neighbours to have.
description.transit:
Located halfway between Haliburton and Gooderham.
Large gravel driveway with ample parking for multiple cars. We are located 10 minutes from Haliburton which has tons of shops, restaurants & activities for you to enjoy! Check out our binder located in the living room media unit to see our recommendations!
description.interaction: The hosts of this property are: Paul, David & Taylor. We will be able to interact with you during the duration of your stay. Simply use this app and one of us will speak with you as soon as possible!

There is plenty of space - especially considering how small it seems initially.

Great stay! Loved the area and non commercial feel.  We had a great time sitting on the deck.  Even with the weather being pretty hot we still felt cool inside and overnight despite being on a boat.
Cool boat docked right next to a fun tiki bar makes for a great day/night on the water.

Such fun sleeping on the boat. Surprisingly very comfortable. Great location—we went to the music festival. Great restaurants in town. Michael was very accommodating and flexible for our schedule. Boat is air conditioned. A deck above to enjoy the summer air. Definitely a fun and comfy place to stay!

We have never stayed on a house boat before and I thought it would be a fun , interesting idea for a weekend away. My son loved it, he thought it was the coolest place to sleep… Michael was easy to communicate with and quickly responded to all questions.
Great place to stay. Clean. Nice people here. The Baja Boathouse nextdoor is a nice place to get drinks/food. Worth the money and would stay again.

description.summary: Newly renovated 2 bedroom houseboat. Sleeps up to 6 guests. Kitchenette, luxurious bathroom, sunbathing deck, patio seating deck and sleek modern sleeping quarters.  Set in a tropical tikki, waterfront resort setting, featuring daily live music, full service bar and restaurant with room service! Walking distance to Fire Island ferries and main street shopping, theater and eateries You won’t forget your time in this unique romantic, lively and memorable place.
