hosts.about: I work part-time as a dental hygienist and have two great teenagers.  I love spending time with family, gardening and being outdoors.  I've only been an Airbnb host since March 2018, but have thoroughly enjoyed meeting my guests and the experience has been wonderful!  My goal is to make you feel completely at home and for your travels to be memorable!  God bless!

recent.comments: It was a wonderful experience. Host was super and responsive. Marina was safe. Everything clean. Great for the family. Able to work from unit. Wifi reliable. Kids already asked about next year. Thanks for everything.

items.comments: It was a wonderful experience. Host was super and responsive. Marina was safe. Everything clean. Great for the family. Able to work from unit. Wifi reliable. Kids already asked about next year. Thanks for everything.
Very fun stay in Knoxville...different experience!  My daughter and I loved Angie's houseboat...much more interesting than a hotel room!  Would definitely book this again.
A great experience and Angie was a great host!

We absolutely loved staying on Angie's houseboat! This was our first time ever stepping foot on a house boat and it was such a cool experience! The location couldn't be beat with it's proximity to downtown and the greenway, very walkable to everything you need. The golf cart was especially helpful in getting our luggage to and from the car. We would highly recommend this to anyone looking for an unique lodging experience in Knoxville!
The boat is in a great location. We walked to the downtown area everyday. There are numerous restaurants and activities in the area. Angie is incredibly friendly and responds very quickly.

This was our 2nd time staying here, and we will definitely be back whenever we need to stay in the Knoxville area. This time was especially convenient as we were in town for the Superbowl of fishing, the Bassmaster Classic. Blastoff was at Volunteer Landing; this couldn't have been a better spot for us today. Just like the first time around, we were super impressed with the great communication and especially the cleanliness of the houseboat. Great dock, excellent location in Knoxville convenient to free shuttles, and so much more! Highly recommend.

description.summary: (Boat #1 of 3) Enjoy the gentle sway of my newly renovated 1984 50' Jamestowner houseboat!  Please note, it can’t be removed from the marina slip and must stay attached to the dock.  The Volunteer Landing Marina is centrally located in downtown Knoxville with an abundance of restaurants, activities, and sightseeing closeby!  Knoxville Greenway walking and biking trail runs behind the marina.  Neyland Stadium and Thompson Boling area are in walking distance.  Pets w/approval and fee applies.
description.space:
There is nothing like waking up and seeing the beautiful water right outside your window then sitting on the deck with a cup of coffee in the cool morning air!  Staying on a houseboat is different than a hotel room so please keep that in mind, but for those looking for a unique experience, it's truly special!  Practically everything in the houseboat has been renovated but I left interesting aspects such as the rustic ceiling beams and steering console.  It is a fun and different way to enjoy the beauty and experience of the water!  
The boat has a residential style heat pump for year round comfort that can be easily adjusted with a wall thermostat.  
***This accommodation may not be suitable for young children due to proximity of water.

I am happy to allow pets traveling with their families!  However, pets are permitted with approval only.  There is an additional $15/pet per day fee which can be paid at check in and may vary due to size and/or breed of pet.  I ask that pets are flea/tick free, not permitted on furniture or bedding, and not left alone when guests are away from the boat unless they are crate trained and not barking.  

2022 South Bay Pontoon Boats available to rent from the marina! 
Visit the Volunteer Landing Marina website for rental information.
description.access:
You'll have the entire houseboat to yourself!  
Check in times may be flexible if available.  Please contact me if you would like an earlier check in or later check out times.
description.notes:
***Tennessee Volunteers home football gameday weekends require a 3 night minimum stay***

There are other guests at the marina and unfortunately I cannot control the noise or hours, but I do ask that you are considerate and not loud during dark hours. Parties are not permitted and this is strictly enforced.  Any guests visiting must be approved.  
Pets are permitted for responsible pet owners and approval and fee are required.
Golf cart is available for transporting luggage to and from parking area.  It is shared between my other houseboat rentals so I ask that it not be left in the parking lot or kept out for extended periods of time.
Minimum age for guests completing the reservation is 25.
description.neighborhood: Downtown Knoxville has so many things to offer!  Calhoun’s on the River and Ruths Chris are the closest restaurants but the heart of downtown including Market Square and Gay St are a short walk away or utilize the free downtown trolley that comes by the marina parking area.
description.transit: A golf cart is available for your use and is shared by my other houseboat rentals.  There is a marina loading and unloading zone very close by and guest parking is nearby as well.  I will do my best to meet you at check in to get you oriented and answer any questions you may have concerning parking.
description.interaction: I will meet you at check in and provide a golf cart for your use during your stay.  I’m happy to help with any questions you may have during your stay!
description.house_rules:
*Children are permitted but I strongly advise parents to keep close eye on them at all times.  
*Boat cannot be removed from the marina and must remain attached to the slip at all times.  
*Absolutely NO parties or additional guests without host approval.  This is strictly enforced and guests may be asked to vacate without a refund if rules are not respected.  
*Quiet hours are 10pm-7am.

Henry is madd cool and the place is dope!  Love the terrace outside of the master bedroom 🤩.
Great Just Great! So welcoming and just as beautiful in person will come again❤️

Amazing stay!!! The pictures for this boat literally does not do any justice for this boat! I felt at home. Everything was so perfect and his response time was super quick. Whenever I come to NY this will be my choice of home.
Great views, relaxing and elegant

What an amazing place to stay! It was so much fun to have my family there. It’s near so many stores (walking distance)! Henry was great and answered any questions I needed. The photos don’t give this place enough justice and I’m already looking forward to booking here for my next stay.

description.summary: Enjoy the sounds of nature when you stay in this unique place.  The sound of the waves will make you feel relaxed as you sip your drink on the outdoor patio.  Then as the night falls you go into your modern state of the art bedroom!!!

hosts.about:
I have been renovating and renting houseboat’s for over 15 years through my marina business in long island and for the past 6 years on Airbnb in stony point, ny. I aim to make your stay on my houseboat as memorable as possible, with many extra amenities onboard and a beautiful view.

Trust in my experience and my guests reviews

recent.comments:
We were looking for something other than a boring hotel room, and we found it! Nick's houseboat was perfect for a 1-night adventure.  Roomier than an RV, the interior is just as pictured.  Free parking right next to the locked dock gate made it easy to unload bags/quickly store food in the large fridge. As there had been a thunderstorm earlier that afternoon, the water was a bit rough and made unlocking the padlocked front door an exercise in gymnastics (don't be wearing heels on the floating dock!) We didn't try the shower but the head-low seat and all-served its purpose. The marina restroom is ~200 steps away-a quick walk through the valeted parking lot of a restaurant that we didn't visit but sounded like a fun place.
At 5'8" the bed was just long enough; the futon is large & long. We expected it to be chillier at night but it was quite comfortable to sleep with open windows in mid- June, & by 5am the water was so calm we couldn't believe we were on the Hudson. Amazing sunrise.

Free parking right next to the locked dock gate made it easy to unload bags/quickly store food in the large fridge. Our stay was perfect. Had everything we needed and a great location within walking distance to a wonderful town.

Nick's yacht was so comfortable and beautiful! Photos cannot capture the beauty of this place, as the essence lies in the view from the windows. It was amazing to wake up on the river and see the sunrise from the deck. I was thankful for Nick's communication and attention to all the details, which made the stay comfortable. Everything was perfect, and I look forward to staying at this place again with my friends in the future. Thank you so much for everything!

The houseboat was as described.  Great location and lots of restaurants and cafes in easy walking distance.  Beautiful homes and gardens to admire.  Anyone with mobility issues may find getting on and around the houseboat challenging.  Easy parking, friendly marina staff and generally quiet esp at night, though it may be different during the height of the season. I appreciated the extras offered by Nick (coffee, sugar, spices etc.) Neighboring villages nice to visit and walk as well,  just a short car ride away.

Our stay in Nick's place was such a treat! The houseboat is adorable, well-equipped and comfortable. It's located in a marina behind an exceptional seafood restaurant that was very busy for the weekend, but fortunately we were able to order takeout and enjoy our food on the boat. We saw lots of wildlife right outside (including a rare night heron). Beds are comfortable and the gentle rocking made for a great night's sleep. Nick is a very responsive host and he made our visit easy and enjoyable. A great place for a peaceful and unusual stay. We will be going back for sure.

This was an amazing place to stay! My husband and I had several good laughs as he is 6ft 3inches and he had to duck and squeeze to fit in the small area, but we loved every bit of it!! Such a unique place to stay! Nick was super helpful and kind when checking us in and marking sure we knew how to work everything! Watching the sun rise on the crisp fall morning was beautiful and peaceful!

description.summary:
This 60ft yacht can be yours for a day, a night, a week or a month. She features three staterooms, 2 full baths, outdoor showers, and a full-beam mid-ship master suite. Perfect for week long trips or long weekends  to the keys or the Bahamas with two couples or a family.  

Also great for day trips!

The Airbnb fees are only to stay overnight. 

Pricing to take the boat out.

4 hrs $2300
6 hrs $2600
8 hrs $2800
Plus tip for crew (typically20%). 

Ask about our pricing  for longer trips
description.space:
Why stay in a hotel, house or condo when you can stay on a yacht that has 3 bedrooms and accommodates 6 overnight while you island hop in the Bahamas or cruise around the Miami/ Fort Lauderdale  area. 

Please note you can not stay on the boat while it is docked at its home port marina. Airbnb's are not allowed there. For guests that want to stay on-board there will be additional costs to move the boat to another marina inclusive of captain fee, and dock fee and subject to slip availability. Please reach out with questions. 

We can accommodate up to 12 for day charters. Perfect for going to the sand bars. Hang out in the water with our water pad and just have a blast. 

We pick up and drop off at Duffy's and can also pick up and drop off at other locations at the charterers expense.
description.notes:
A qualified captain, along with a stew/mate will need to be hired and are not included. We will provide you with a list of great captains and stews. You will chose your own crew. Fuel at idle speed is included for short local trips. You will need to pay for your own fuel usage for any trips out in the ocean or where the boat will be traveling at cruising speeds. An additional cleaning fee of $360 will be charged for each charter and is included in the Airbnb fees. Your stew/host will provide you with a five-star experience. Prepare food, shop for you, clean, serve and act as you VIP host during your charter. They also help the captain with everything on the boat. Please note in order to book a charter we will need at least 7 days of advance notice to guarantee the availability of the crew. If you give shorter notice than that we will still try our best to accommodate, but we won’t be able to guarantee availability. 

In order to use the jet-ski you must have prior jet-ski experience and demonstrate that and prove that for the insurance company. You must also have a Florida boating safety certificate. You can take the course online prior to your trip if you don't have one. The Jetski is rented separately at $150 an hour and fuel is not included. If you drink you will not be allowed to use the jetski. 

Oh and don't forget to tip the crew if they do a great job. It is customary to give the crew a 15-20% gratuity on charters, similar to a restaurant.
description.neighborhood: Boat is located in a very safe gated and secured area. The boat is docked in a private marina next to homes and some neighbors that stay on their yachts. As such all loading and unloading will be done at Duffy's in North Miami unless otherwise agreed to. No pets please.
description.transit: Uber and Lyft work great here.
description.interaction: I am always available by phone. Please text or call with any questions whatsoever.
description.house_rules:
1)  No more than 12 guests aboard. 

2) Shoes off! There is basket when you first walk into the boat to keep shoes. 

3) Have fun

4) No Smoking

5) Don't touch any buttons or controls without asking.

6) DO NOT THROW ANYTHING IN THE TOILET THAT DOESN'T COME OUT OF YOUR BODY. You can only throw very special marine biodegradable toilet paper in the toilet. Nothing else or you will break the system and it isn't cheap to fix. 

7) There is a standard cleaning fee of $180 for the interior and $180 for the exterior. 
We will charge an additional cleaning fee when the boat is left needing extra attention.

8)You will need to sign a separate charter agreement and liability waiver.

9) The jet-ski can only be used by experienced operators with a Florida Boating Safety Certificate. If you don't have one go online and take the course prior to your trip.  

10) If you drink you can not use the jet-ski or any other water toys. NO EXCEPTIONS.

11) There is one security camera in the living room above the TV facing the exterior door. This is there for security purposes. The camera is secured with Velcro so please feel free to put it in a drawer or just face it down during the duration of your stay and please remember to put it back in place when you leave. Thank you.

12) Please report anything that is broken immediately.

The boat itself beautifully decorated, clean, and just a joy to stay on for this trip. The upper deck overlooking the Riverwalk made for fun people watching and beautiful sunsets. description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 
Floating atop the Cape Fear River, Houseboat Luxe will offer you an experience unlike any you've had before. 
From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.
description.space:
Using our detailed directions, you'll make your way to the Riverwalk, into the gated Marina, and down the floating dock to find your new version of paradise.

Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that this is the luxurious version of a boat you didn't know you've always wanted.

Upon entering Houseboat Lux, you'll be surrounded by soothing, water-inspired colors alongside our signature gold accents. As you open the sliding glass door you'll likely notice how spacious the open concept kitchen/dining/living area is and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) With dining seating for 7, living room seating for 5, and a fully stocked kitchen, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here.

Moving past the kitchen, you'll find your way into the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower, toilet, sink stocked with some essentials, and full size washer and dryer. Just through the lockable pocket door is the first floor bedroom, which has a Queen bed, large closet, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the small back patio, which is a great spot for some quiet reading or meditation.

As you make your way up the staircase, you'll find another large living area with a sofa bed, loveseat, 60" Smart TV, and a beautiful view through the sliding glass door. Stepping outside, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor sink, mini fridge, and a dining table with four chairs overlooking the Cape Fear River. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, and even some yoga. (It's truly that big!) In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Heading back inside, you'll walk through the living room to find the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet & 55" Smart TV. The lockable pocket door connects you to the second floor bathroom, which offers another walk-in shower, toilet and large sink space. Once you curl up in bed, the dimmable lights,  well insulated walls (for both noise and temperature), ceiling fan, and gentle rocking of the river are sure to provide you an excellent night of sleep. 

Location:

Houseboat Lux is located in the Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the award-winning Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, making your way into Downtown will be easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, museums, live music, and events, there is always something for everyone to enjoy. Check out Wilmington and Beaches online for more info about local events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and so much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this houseboat is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other houseboats at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance.
description.access: Guests have access to the entire houseboat for the duration of their stay.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent houseboat community. 

Though they are currently scattered among the docks, we are excited that our permanent dock, which is being custom built specifically for our houseboats, will be completed in Spring of 2023. This dock will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per houseboat. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)

Michael was great as was his pier-mate Jimmy and the location was amazing! The pkace was very unique like being on a boat! There was no shower and the small salt water toilet smell was pretty strong. The worst was the community shower & facilities. Maybe it was just prior to cleaning day but it was horrible.
The boat is a very fun place to stay! Michael was super accommodating. As others have noted, the bathroom is interesting - but it's a boat! A "regular" bathroom is nearby.

Michael was a great host - always quick to respond and on-site for any questions. The place was very clean and attractive. Not a boat but like a tiny cottage on the dock next to the other boats in the wharf. Great location - close to all kinds of attractions and restaurants in Salem. Public showers were not so nice, but the AirBNB itself absolutely was! Thanks Michael!

The location is absolutely perfect—in walking distance to so many shops and restaurants. The house felt safe, it was nice to be in a gated area with a code to enter. 
The only slightly negative aspect is the toilet in the house, it is not a normal toilet and difficult to get to flush. Otherwise our stay was amazing!
This was so adorable! It was the perfect little place if you’re looking for a fun more novelty type stay. Plus the wharf is so amazing! Such cute shops and cafes!

hosts.about: I work part-time as a dental hygienist and have two great teenagers.  I love spending time with family, gardening and being outdoors.  I've only been an Airbnb host since March 2018, but have thoroughly enjoyed meeting my guests and the experience has been wonderful!  My goal is to make you feel completely at home and for your travels to be memorable!  God bless!

recent.comments:
An amazing adventure! We wanted to find out if houseboat living was for us. It definitely is going to be in our future. I was hoping to sell my dream of living aboard to my family, and now they are selling my dream back to me. I couldn't be happier. 

         Angie is INCREDIBLE!  She was friendly and informative. She is a remarkable hostess and knows how to execute the details to perfection. She even checked in with us prior to a heavy rainstorm to make sure we knew she'd be available in case we needed support. It's the little touches like this that make her stand above the rest as a hostess. The boat is clean, bright, happy, and more spacious than you might think. 

         We got to spend time speaking with other live aboard families at the marina and learned so much from their wealth of knowledge. They were all very friendly and willing to share their experiences. The people of Tennessee are AMAZING!

items.comments:
An amazing adventure! We wanted to find out if houseboat living was for us. It definitely is going to be in our future. I was hoping to sell my dream of living aboard to my family, and now they are selling my dream back to me. I couldn't be happier.

Angie is a great host and we loved our stay on her houseboat. We were there to explore UTK with our daughter and loved how central the marina was to everything we wanted to see and do. We brought our SUPs and enjoyed morning paddles after our coffee. The boat itself was really lovely. Decorated nice, very comfortable, & just an overall fun experience. Would definitely stay again.

This place was absolutely wonderful. Great place for a group. Plenty of space to hang out, play games, cook dinner, and sleep. We had everything we could need, even Kayaks and bikes. Close to downtown, restaurants and The University of Tennessee. This place is kept sparkling clean and comfortable. Highly recommend. Will definitely come again.
Great place - Highly suggest staying here!

I can not express what a WONDERFUL host Angie was to my family. Angie was exceptional from the start to the  finish of our stay, such an extremely friendly and gracious host! The houseboat was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING and so much open area to move freely around. The houseboat is so large, and yet, with such warm and thoughtful touches and decorating, it feels cozy and inviting. As far as the "housekeeping " Angie goes WAY BEYOND most places to ensure that EVERYTHING is absolutely IMMACULATE. The place was spotless, and yet Angie absolutely encourages you to make yourself at home.  We were greeted by Angie with a warm welcoming smile, and she took time to go over everything so our stay would be optimal. I was somewhat unsure about how everything would function on a foreign houseboat to me/ my family,  but again,  Angie has thought of EVERYTHING and it SO SUPER EASY to stay there & just relax & have a great time. Do NOT second guess this rental, Angie and her houseboat are both INCREDIBLE!!

description.summary:
(Boat #3 of 3)***Brand new listing!*** Spectacular houseboat with brand new renovation!  Enjoy a stay at downtown Knoxville walkable to Neyland Stadium, Thompson Boling Arena, Civic Coliseum, and all that downtown offers!  Please note: houseboat can’t be moved.
Enjoy the natural scenery and tranquility of the Tennessee River while being close to all the action!  This newly renovated houseboat offers 4 staterooms and 2 full bathrooms.  Additional photos and updated description will be added soon.
description.space:
I am super proud to offer this brand new listing.  The vessel is a 1997 Lakeview 76' houseboat with a full rooftop deck with covered area and wet bar! Everything was touched from the ceiling to floors to offer guests an amazing experience that is better than home! The updated kitchen offers granite countertops, stainless appliances, Keurig and drip coffee maker.  The main living are features reclining leather furniture and a 55" smart TV.  The master bath has a tub/shower combo and the guest bath has a stall shower...both with updated granite, new fixtures, and tile floors with plenty of amenities to make your stay super comfortable.  The lower sleeping area offers a sink for convenience.  
The expansive rooftop deck has two easily accessible entrances (forward and aft) for watching all the beauty of the Tennessee River.  Enjoy dinner with family and friends while taking in the panoramic view of the water! (You won't get that with a condo downtown!)

The boat is located adjacent to two other boats that I have available at the gated Volunteer Landing Marina which is known for it's central location and family oriented, friendly residents.  

***Please note:  NO parties or large gatherings, loud/obnoxious behaviors are permitted by guests.  This is not a party boat!  The boat is to remain docked at all times.  
Pontoon rentals are available at the marina. 
I offer use of a golf cart to transport luggage only.  It cannot be taken on the greenway or downtown.  I also offer kayaks and bicycles !  These items are shared between my 3 boats so please be considerate and don't keep them out for extended periods of time.  
The expansive Knoxville greenway runs directly behind the marina and is an excellent location for walking/running, dog walks, and bicycle excursions.  
I am happy to allow pets to accompany responsible owners!  I do ask that they are preapproved and a fee will apply.  They must be flea/tick free, not permitted on bedding or furniture, and not left alone on the boat unless they are crated and non barking.  
The accommodation may not be suitable for young children and parents are strongly encouraged to ensure their safety by watching them closely.  

***Tennessee Volunteers home football game weekends require a 3 night minimum stay***

Check out my other two boats as well!

description.interaction: I will meet you at the marina for check-in and will give a brief tour to make sure you are familiar with the boat and answer any questions you may have!
description.house_rules:
Boat cannot be moved and must stay moored to the dock at all times.  

Quiet time is dusk to dawn and outdoor music is prohibited due to proximity of the boat to neighbor boats.  

Absolutely no parties/get-togethers or unauthorized guests onboard the boat without host permission.

No smoking/vaping or drug use.

Pets only permitted with preapproval and fee applies typically $15 per pet per day, but fee may vary due to size/breed of pet and length of stay.  Pets must be flea/tick free, not permitted on bedding or furniture, not left alone while guest leaves the boat unless crated and non barking.  

Guests are responsible for any and all damage caused by themselves or anyone in their group onboard or using the golf cart and bicycles.

Parents are STRONGLY encouraged to closely watch children at all times due to proximity of water.  

Swimming is not permitted at the marina or off of the back of the boat.  

Violations are grounds for eviction without a refund.  

Note: dock cams are in use throughout the marina.

hosts.about:
I started teaching at Cornell on Art and Architecture in 2002 and now teach part of the year and have recently started working in Real Estate.
I love our beautiful town with its old interesting houses situated both on hillsides and in the flats near the lake.  We are surrounded by bubbling waterfalls and enjoy one just a few feet from our house.  My husband is architect/designer/artist who also teaches at Cornell.  We both enjoy sharing our home for a brief time each year when Cornell students celebrate their graduation.
We look forward to welcoming folks to our city.

recent.comments: Fun little weekend get away!

items.comments: Fun little weekend get away!

My girlfriend and I absolutely loved Pauline’s place. This one is a gem. The lake was one step away, truly a great experience. The house was modest but perfect. 

Pauline was responsive and helpful whenever we needed something. 

This place has quickly become one of our favorites. We will be returning every year during the summer. Can’t wait to go back .

Highly Recommended!

This is a perfect lakefront property for two people. 
My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary with a weeks stay here. When we arrived the host had a bottle of sparkling wine waiting for us and a list of recommendations for great local restaurants and coffee shops. We were within 10 to 30 minutes of all the activities we wanted to enjoy. At the property you can picnic under the big ash tree, canoe/kayak, swim, fish, have a bonfire, birdwatch, read a good book, play board games, and most of all enjoy the beautiful Cayuga Lake view! So peaceful!

Wonderful home, just like the photos. Peaceful and private with gorgeous shade trees so you can relax outside in the shade within full view of the water. Pauline was a wonderful host - very responsive and kind. We made great use of the kitchen for nearly all our meals and ate dinner out on the picnic table nightly. We didn't use the canoe b/c it seemed like it would be difficult to maneuver in/out of the water, but we enjoyed swimming in the lake very much. It's a bit shallow at that end, but that was fine by us. The porch windows don't open, which meant it was uncomfortably warm to sit in there on warm, sunny days. The house also warms up quickly and retains heat, but the air conditioners quickly cool it down if need be.  Local restaurant and grocery recommendations were helpful and we enjoyed Sauders, the Mennonite grocery, very much. Great deli meats among many other interesting items.

We really enjoyed our couple of lakefront days at the Boathouse! The bungalow was adorable, clean, and private—with wonderful views and instant access to the lake! We LOVED drinking our morning coffee while watching the sunrise and seeing the Osprey and other birds fish at dusk. We took the canoe out for a spin around the lake during a cloud-covered day and enjoyed using my inflatable paddle board during the better weather. We also enjoyed exploring historic Seneca Falls and trying out the local haunts. Thanks for a great stay!

We loved our long weekend on Lake Cayuga. Everything in the home was just as advertised. We especially loved sitting outside and watching the birds, boats…even some fish! What a fabulous location! Pauline helped us right away when we needed it. She is very responsive. Pauline, thank you! We hope to visit again someday.

description.summary: Modern renovated Boathouse getaway right on the water.  one bedroom and bath. The boathouse is  RIGHT ON water  with 180 degree views of Cayuga lake.   Private setting with only one neighbor 40 feet away.  Cottage has  fully equipped kitchen with cozy  living area,   and one bathroom.
description.space: We are off carbon,  we heat and cool through sustainable electric sourcing.  In the summer we hang dry sheets and towels to get the freshest smell possible.  All materials and products are organic and sustainable.
description.neighborhood: Cottage community with many year round residents.
description.transit: Seneca Falls town center a few minute drive away.  Parking is available on the property.
description.house_rules:
No parties and noise after 10:00 p.m.  No more than 10 people on the property at any time.
No heals or pets in the house.
No smoking or vaping policy.

name: Charlestown houseboat, walk to Boston attractions
title: Boston, Massachusetts

gallery.caption: Nearby views of the skyline

recent.comments: Overall, I highly recommend staying in this house boat, and would stay again! It was very cute, spacious, clean, and helpful hosts. My only negative feedback is that it was very hot and the AC did not work very well, but it was an unusually hot 90° weather day. But again we had a wonderful time and our five -year-old daughter really enjoyed the experience! The separate bedroom and pull out couch was also very nice with 3 people.

items.comments: Overall, I highly recommend staying in this house boat, and would stay again! It was very cute, spacious, clean, and helpful hosts. My only negative feedback is that it was very hot and the AC did not work very well, but it was an unusually hot 90° weather day. But again we had a wonderful time and our five -year-old daughter really enjoyed the experience! The separate bedroom and pull out couch was also very nice with 3 people.
Great stay, easily walkable and loved the houseboat!
Unique weekend stay on a houseboat vs a stuffy hotel room. Really enjoyed sitting on deck and enjoying the morning sunshine.
Loves the house boat! A really fun and unique way to see Boston. Great location.
very relaxing place to stay,  you don't feel like you're in a large city.
Enough room for 2 adults. The boat was pretty awesome well located and we had a great time. Fairly calm as long as no wind and rain. I would recommend on sunny days.

description.summary: Skip the hotel and do something really unique and fun! Experience Boston from the perspective of your own floating home! Nestled in a protected marina in Boston Harbor, our houseboat is fully equipped with all the comforts and amenities of home! The boat is fully air conditioned in the summer and heated during the winter. The covered front deck has outdoor seating.  Sip your cocktail and watch the harbor traffic . Free Wi-Fi is included in your rental.   Parking is limited at $25per day
description.space:
Perfect for 2  it can also be an economical choice for 4 with the sleep sofa in the living room. We are located in the Charlestown Marina. Accessible via water taxi, car, or taxi. Walk to the USS Constitution, Bunker Hill , TD Garden and the North End. MBTA water shuttle is a short walk. UBER readily available. Parking is available at $25 per day and will be billed separately.
Located in a very secure and gated marina, our houseboat is just minutes away from downtown Bostons' most popular attractions; Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market, the North End, the New England Aquarium, the Children's Museum and the Boston Convention Center. Our convenient location makes it easy for you reach points of interest. We just acquired this houseboat but have owned other boats for several years
description.notes:
Parking is limited to  first come first serve at $25 per day.
 Please note $59 "management fee" is a damage waiver that covers up to $1500 of accidental damage . Which is why we do not require a security deposit.
description.house_rules:
Quiet hours 10 PM to 8 AM
Must be 25 years old to rent
No swimming or fishing from the docks.
Children under 12 must wear life vests while on docks
Well behaved pets considered with a pet fee of $50 per pet.
The rental period begins at 3:00 p.m. on the day of arrival and terminates at 11:00 a.m. on the day of departure, unless prior arrangements have been made. Early check ins or late departures may incur an additional charge of $25. Check in is from 3 pm to 8 pm. Guests arriving between 8 and 10 pm must pay a $50 late fee and guests arriving between 10 pm and 11pm must pay $100. Advance notice required. No check in or refunds for arrival past 11 pm.

Winding driveway into pristine tranquility.

A huge elevated deck overlooks the river below.
Watch fish jump and listen to the sounds of nature from your own private deck.

hosts.about: I'm a native Floridian and my husband Ray is from Ohio but has lived in Florida over 40 years. We both are members of the adult Second Time Arounders Marching Band where we met in 1998. We married in April 1999 and have two sons. We bought this beautiful river house from my uncle in 2015 and have continued to rent it out for others to enjoy. Our favorite part of sharing our home is meeting so many nice people from all over the world. We look forward to greeting each guest in person upon your arrival. We hope you will chose our home for your relaxing get away.

recent.comments: It is the perfect get away. The view is so peaceful and the house is perfect for family bonding time. It has excellent privacy in the  sleeping quarters. The host is so helpful and responsive at any time. She even made brownies that greeted us upon arrival. The fire pit is awesome at night time. The sounds at night are hypnotic. The location is close to unique shops and the Rainbow River. It is in a private area just far enough away to feel alone yet close enough to know you are not alone.

items.comments: It is the perfect get away. The view is so peaceful and the house is perfect for family bonding time. It has excellent privacy in the  sleeping quarters. The host is so helpful and responsive at any time. She even made brownies that greeted us upon arrival. The fire pit is awesome at night time. The sounds at night are hypnotic. The location is close to unique shops and the Rainbow River. It is in a private area just far enough away to feel alone yet close enough to know you are not alone.

10/10 stay. Everything was great from top to bottom. No complaints and would absolutely love to stay here again.

Thank you so much, Lisa!

We really enjoyed our stay. The river house was very clean and the host thought of all the needed amenities. 

The house was large and very comfortable. We enjoyed coffee on the deck listening to all the birds and watching nature. When it rained we sat in the porch and play pool. I have already recommended this house to family and friends.
Really enjoyed our stay. House was clean and accommodating. Nice little town with good restaurants and is only 20 minutes or so to Crystal River. Really quite and peaceful area. Had a great time.
Me and my family had a great stay at the house on the Withlacoochee.  Lisa was a very nice host.

Lisa’s home was amazing and perfect for our family getaway! It was clean and Lisa was very accommodating. We were so happy and enjoyed being there. It felt like a home away from home. You could tell Lisa puts so much effort to make your stay perfect ! We thank her so much for sharing her special space with us !

description.summary: The natural sights and sounds from this river home will quickly ease you into vacation mode. With 2,600 square feet, this 3-bedroom/loft, 3-bath home, can accommodate the whole family. A short walk from this hidden treasure is historic Dunnellon, where you’ll find antique shops and fun local restaurants. Rainbow Springs State Park is an 8 minute drive from our home or swim in the crystal clear water at the local beach park  minutes away. We have 3 single & 2 tandem kayaks to explore our river.
description.space: The private master suite features a king-sized bed, plus a cozy living area of its own. Other rooms feature a queen-sized bed, twin beds, and double beds.
description.notes: We also have 3 single kayaks,  2 tandem kayaks, and a peddle boat for you to enjoy right off of our dock so you can explore the beautiful nature that surrounds us on the Withlacoochee River. We are located on a quiet part of the river so fishing is great for the Big Mouth Bass.
description.neighborhood: Our home is surrounded within 52 acres of wooded lots as our home is right on the Withlacoochee River. It sits next to the quiet Vogt Springs neighborhood. All you hear are the beautiful sounds of nature, but the best part is that you are only a few minutes away from Rainbow Springs State Park, Juliette Falls Golf Club, the grocery, fun local restaurants, and the historic downtown Dunnellon filled with antique shops and art.
description.interaction: We can't wait to welcome you when you arrive! We'll show you around and give you a tour of our home. After that we are a phone call away if you need anything. You'll have complete privacy for the rest of your stay.
description.house_rules:
NO PETS ALLOWED. Owner has severe allergies to animals.
NO LOUD NOISE OUTSIDE AFTER 10:00pm - Sound travels on the river & disturbs neighbor

Please don't use bed comforters for your blanket. They are just for show. Fold them neatly & put them aside. All beds are made with a blanket & if you need more blankets they are in the closets of each room.

Cover Pool Table when not in use to keep it clean.

Keep deck chair cushions in deck box when not in use. Florida rains pop up at anytime & we don't want them to get wet/moldy if they are just left out during your whole stay.

Garbage Pick Up is on Monday & Thursday. Map on refrigerator for where to place trash cans. If you are departing on or the day before a garbage day please get all trash out to the street. Otherwise put all trash in the cans on the side of the house.

Make sure ALL dishes are washed and put away before final departure day. Leaving them clean in the dishwasher is NOT put away.

Leave beds as is. I wash room by room. If sofa sleepers were used you can strip those and put in the laundry room.

Put all used towels in the laundry basket.

Set thermostat to 79 degrees cool before leaving. DO NOT EVER USE EMERGENCY HEAT SETTING.

THANK YOU FOR FOLLOWING OUR RULES TO KEEP OUR HOME NICE FOR EACH GUEST WHO STAYS AT OUR RELAXING RIVER HOME.

BE PREPARED TO PAY OUR MARION COUNTY LOCAL TAX. AIRBNB DOES NOT COLLECT THIS AND IT WILL BE AN ADDITIONAL COST ABOVE WHAT YOU PAY TO AIRBNB. Based on 2023 tax rate a 3 night stay would be approx $44 - 5 night stay would be approx $70. To be collected by Lisa Rice.

hosts.about: My husband Doug, and I retired to the Raystown Lake area in 2019 to be closer to our children and grandchildren.  We love the lake area and all that it has to offer.

recent.comments: This was a beautiful place to truly relax with many activities readily available. Our host thought of everything that we might have forgotten to bring along! Thank you for a wonderful family time. I would surely like to return.

items.comments: This was a beautiful place to truly relax with many activities readily available. Our host thought of everything that we might have forgotten to bring along! Thank you for a wonderful family time. I would surely like to return.
We had a great time, everything was terrific. Roxanne is a great host, would love to come back.

This place has become such a favorite that we have come back every year for the last few years! Roxanne is so helpful and kind! The place is spotless and has everything we need! We will be back again!
Absolutely loved Roxanne’s place! She was so overly prepared even down to the s’mores plate! Super clean and had all the family fun!
A wonderful home away from home.  We enjoyed the flexibility of arriving and departure.  Our family gathered for fun and relaxation.  Overall it was a blessing
This was our third time  staying in Roxanne’s apartment. It is always a great stay which is why we keep coming back. Clean, comfortable and perfect for fun at the lake!

description.summary:
We are situated less than 200 yards from the entrance to Seven Points Recreation Center, and you can't get much closer to the water than this!  We would love to have you stay with us in our private second floor Condo.

WE HAVE GREAT NEWS!  Many past guests have asked us if we have Kayaks, Paddleboards, or Boats for rent.  Starting with the 2022 season, we will be making Kayaks, Paddleboards, and Pontoon Boat rentals available.
description.space:
Come enjoy our two bedroom Condo.  We offer a fully equipped kitchen, central air, WIFI, cable, two flat screen TVs, Washer/Dryer, gas grill, fire pit with wood, private deck and yard, and ample car and boat parking.

WE HAVE GREAT NEWS!  Many past guests have asked us if we have Kayaks, Paddleboards, or Boats for rent.  Starting with the 2022 season, we will be making Kayaks, Paddleboards, and Pontoon Boat rentals available.
description.neighborhood: We are 1.5 miles from the Seven Points Visitor Center, with a lovely view of Raystown Lake.  The public beach and Marina are less than a mile further, where you can spend the day swimming, fishing, boating, and more.
description.interaction: We are readily available to assist you with any needs that may arise
description.house_rules: Sorry no pets or smoking.

title: York, South Carolina

gallery.caption: looking out of the houseboat
Houseboat!  Completely remodeled and full on LUX
Houseboat, boat slip, sun deck and outdoor living space
Ceiling fans for some breeze or use the house sized A/C and heat. Sofa converts to queen bed.
full bath with lots of hot water and fully functioning toilet (not a "boat toilet")!
Cal King lux mattress and bedding.  super comfortable like all our mattresses
Open air kitchen and dining area; safe to stash valuables inside of bench
full size appliances unique for a houseboat
Sun deck - 2 person max

hosts.about: Rick and Karen are avid travelers and have hosted people from all over the world.  We focus on providing a luxury experience and have owned and hosted vacation rentals for 20 years.  We love boating and swimming, ping pong, the beach, unparalleled relaxation.  It’s a joy to cook in our gourmet kitchen while looking out at the lake and spending time with friends and family.

recent.comments:
We absolutely loved our little nest on the water! The bed was super comfy,  the space clean and the full sized kitchen a bonus.   You can't ask for a better location.  
We spent our days kayaking around the lake,  lounging in the shade and visiting family in ther area. 
Highly recommend this houseboat 💞

items.comments:
We absolutely loved our little nest on the water! The bed was super comfy,  the space clean and the full sized kitchen a bonus.   You can't ask for a better location.  
We spent our days kayaking around the lake,  lounging in the shade and visiting family in ther area. 
Highly recommend this houseboat 💞

Thank you to Rick and Karen, we had a wonderful time for my fiancés 40th birthday. The boat was clean and tidy and was such an experience. We fished right off the boat and caught a few monsters. The place was private and the neighbors who said hello were friendly and kind. Thank you guys for opening your house boat to us!

Loved our stay on this houseboat! The inside has a modern look, amenities and distances to restaurants and grocery stores as described, and the place felt super cozy to us. The location and view of Lake Wylie are spectacular.
One of my favorite trips yet. So fun, relaxing & unique! Great communication from hosts. I can’t wait to go back, would give a 20/10 if possible!!!!

Great staycation at Rick and Karen's boathouse. I live about 30 minutes away and wanted a little relaxing getaway for the weekend with my 2 girlfriends and this was great! The location is fantastic and the views are picture perfect! Rick was super responsive through our stay. I have a boat on Lake Wylie and being able to bring it and dock it next to the house boat for when we wanted to hop on and take a ride was the cherry on top. Super quiet and peaceful, I hope to book again in the near future! Thank you so much for letting us stay :)

What an awesome find. This is a great spot for relaxing on the lake. Saw loads of wildlife, fishing, kayaking and sat on deck watching the sun go down. The boat was well equipped, well laid out and perfectly located in a nice private spot on Lake Wylie. Hosts, Karen and Rick, were great. Recommended.

description.summary:
You'll love this unique and romantic escape.  This moored 1st class renovated houseboat is remarkable.  It is the epitome of a private vacation.  
JUN-AUG RENTABLE ONLY WITH LUXURY PENINSULA HOUSE SAT-SAT
Soak up the sun on the sundeck and cool off in the lake.  Master suite has a Cal King bed and private deck.
The front deck is comfortably appointed with latest style high end furniture. 2nd pullout Queen bed. 
Open plan kitchen.
Panoramic views.
A/C  

Close to CLT / CHARLOTTE
description.neighborhood: The houseboat is in its own private slip (not in a marina).  The location is along a peninsula is in the middle of the main channel with views out on all sides including a smaller inlet and two coves.  The private location is tucked away and not part of a subdivision.  The location is ideal to get away and perfect for lake lovers.  Its 10 minutes to grocery stores, big box retail, etc and only 30 minutes to the airport
description.transit: Parking is readily available on the gravel area at the houseboat.  Getting around the area is most fun by use of the free kayak!  Jet skis, pontoon boat and Hobie cat can be rented as another way to get around the lake.
description.interaction: I'm just a phone call away!
description.house_rules:
No more than 2 people on the roof/upper deck at any time.  No jumping off of roof
No walking beyond the captain's perch on roof.
(Roof is older and cannot handle thanks for being considerate!)

We have agreed with our neighbors for no parties or events.

for additional rules please see the contract:

"THIS IS A VACATION RENTAL AGREEMENT UNDER THE SOUTH 
CAROLINA VACATION RENTAL ACT. THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE
PARTIES TO THIS AGREEMENT ARE DEFINED BY LAW AND INCLUDE UNIQUE
PROVISIONS PERMITTING THE DISBURSEMENT OF RENT PRIOR TO TENANCY AND
EXPEDITED EVICTION OF TENANTS. YOUR SIGNATURE ON THIS AGREEMENT, OR
PAYMENT OF MONEY OR TAKING POSSESSION OF THE PROPERTY AFTER
RECEIPT OF THE AGREEMENT, IS EVIDENCE OF YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE
AGREEMENT AND YOUR INTENT TO USE THIS PROPERTY FOR RENTAL."

TERMS AND CONDITIONS:
In consideration of the rent received and mutual promises herein, the Owner of the subject property and premises (hereinafter “Premises”, including, but not limited to, any and all fixtures and moored vessels for residential, does hereby lease and rent to the Guest (the person whose name appears below)
the Premises described above, under the following terms and
conditions:
1.
Agency Disclosure:
There is no Agency.

2.
Property Description:
The Premises is privately owned and reflects the individual owner's tastes and style. It is the
responsibility of the Guest to ensure that the Premises meets the Guest’s requirements for space,
accommodations, physical condition and amenities prior to renting.  Guest and its invitees, licensees, guests and any third parties upon the Premises at the invitation of or with permission of Guest shall assume any and all risks associated with the Premises, including, but not limited to, the decks and docks, the Premises itself and the adjoining land.  Guest agrees, on behalf of Guest and any other party, to defend, indemnify and hold Owner harmless from any and all claims asserted by anyone in conjunction with Guest’s use of the Premises.  

There shall be no jumping, diving or other propulsion from the roof of the houseboat.

3.
Occupancy:
Guest agrees that the maximum occupancy of four (4) people in the moored houseboat.
Occupancy count includes children of all ages and guests of Guest. Groups, including but not limited
to, high school and college aged people, house parties organized to celebrate graduations, proms,
youth groups, fraternity, sorority, or other school functions are specifically not allowed.
House parties will be evicted immediately. Any group or party renting this property under false
pretenses or exceeding 4 people shall be immediately evicted with no refund.

Guest agrees that the number of people on the roof sun deck of the moored houseboat is two (2) people at any time.  The roof has weight limit restrictions and larger groups are not allowed.  No one is permitted to step up onto the forward portion of the houseboat roof (also called the helm or cockpit) where the steering wheel is located as the structure has strict weight limits.  

Identification shall be presented if requested. Guest signing this Agreement shall be at least 28 years of age and be the person who actually takes possession of the Premises for purposes of rental.

4.
Security Deposit:
The Security Deposit is five hundred dollars and 00/100 ($500.00).   Guest agrees that all security deposits will be refunded within forty-five (45) days after departure excepting  damages or additional fees charged to the unit at the sole and absolute discretion of Owner.  The Security Deposit may be applied toward actual damages and other deductions as permitted by the South Carolina Security Deposit Act.

5.
Payments:
Checks are accepted if the reservation is made more than thirty (30) days in advance. Please make checks payable to:
VIP Solutions.  A $25 fee will be charged on all returned checks.

We also accept: PayPal, Venmo, Zelle, CashApp or cash.

Guest is responsible for sales and occupancy taxes calculated.

6.
Cancellation:
Any cancellation of a confirmed reservation must be made in writing by Guest. Reservation
payments are not reimbursable unless the Premises can be re-rented for the same rate and time
period. Every effort will be made to rebook the Premises. If Premises is re-rented, Guest will receive
reimbursement of payments made less nonrefundable reservation fee of five hundred and dollars and 00/100 ($500.00) and all applicable taxes. Under no circumstances shall Guest assign this Agreement nor sublet the Premises.

7.
Tenancy:
If this tenancy is for thirty (30) days or less, Guest is subject to expedited eviction. Guest may be evicted
under such procedures if guest: (I) holds over in possession after guests’ tenancy expired; (II)
commits a material breach of any provision of this agreement, including any addendum hereto that
according to its term would result in the termination of Guests’ tenancy; (III) fails to pay rent as
required by this agreement; or (IV) has obtained possession of the Premises by fraud or
misrepresentation.

8.
Pets:
Pets are not allowed unless a special exemption has been made in writing by Owner.  

9.
No Smoking Property:
Use of cigarettes, pipes and cigars are prohibited inside home or on any deck or dock, or porch.
Failure to observe this prohibition shall result in immediate eviction without a refund and a charge of two hundred dollars and 00/100 ($200.00).

10.
Check in:
Check in will begin at 4:00 PM on the day of arrival.
Early check-ins may be available for a non-refundable fee of fifty dollars ($50.00).  Late and early arrivals should make prior arrangements with Owner. Guest will not be allowed to check in until the Premises has been cleaned and passed inspection by Owner.

11.
Check-out: 
The Premises must be vacated by 10:00 AM on date of departure.
Failure to do so may result in late check-out fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) deducted from the security deposit or, if the security deposit is applied to damage or other deductions as referenced herein, the late check-out fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) may be assessed to Guest in addition to the security deposit.
ALL KEYS must be returned at the time of check out, failure to return all keys to the owner will result
in the Guest being charged to rekey ALL locks.

12.
Grills and Fire Pits: 
Fines and prosecution may result from the use of grills on decks, porches or too near a
Building or other structure including the houseboat. The grills and fire pits must be cleaned and coals, wood, ash or other debris disposed of properly upon departure. Failure to do so will result in additional cleaning charges. Do not grill catfish on bbq as it leaves grill inoperable for future guests; failure to do so may result in a fee of two-hundred-and-fifty dollars ($250.00) deducted from the security deposit, which will go toward purchase of new grill.

13.
Neighborhood respect:
Guest agrees to abide by all laws concerning noise ordinances and respect any and all neighbors’ right to
Privacy and quiet enjoyment of their property. All stereos and loud noises are to be kept within those applicable noise ordinances and respectable volumes so as not to infringe upon others. 

14.
Owner's Closets:
The Premises contains locked owner's closet(s) for the Owner's personal use and is not part of this rental.

15.
Temperature Settings:
Thermostats for heating and cooling shall not be set below 75 degrees for air conditioning nor above
70 degrees for heating.
The refrigerator temperature dial shall not be set to anything other than mid-range.
The cost of excessive heat or cooling shall be charged to Guest.

16.
Lockout:
Guests locked out after hours will be charged a $50 fee for Owner personnel to come unlock the
door.

17.
Inoperative Equipment and Owner Entry: 
Appliances, air conditioners, TVs, internet, etc., are not guaranteed to be operational. Owner will make every good faith effort to have any inoperative equipment repaired as quickly as possible. Guest agrees that Owner or employees/contractors of Owners may enter premises for purpose of effecting necessary repairs and/or maintenance, for showings or other necessary purposes. NO REFUNDS WILL BE MADE.

18.
Lake:
The Guests agree to swim and otherwise utilize the lake and its shores at their own risk and realizes that there are no lifeguards on duty.  Owner specifically disclaims any and all liability for any activities undertaken by Guest at, on, in or upon the water, beach or adjoining land as well as upon and in the use of the Premises.  Guest further agrees to defend, indemnify and hold Owner harmless from and against any and all claims made by any third parties against Owner or any Owner representative, employee, agent, assign, or beneficiary.  

19.
Rip rap:
Guest and its invitees, licensees, or guests are prohibited from climbing, walking, and/or fishing from or upon the retaining rocks. The rocks are there to protect the Premises from erosion and will slide into the lake if walked upon. Thank you.

20.
Cleaning / Trash / Yard Maintenance:
Property is professionally cleaned prior to arrival and after departure. Guest must report within 24 hours any cleaning issues. Guest is responsible for completion of the items on the OWNER Checkout Procedure issued to Guest at check-in, including, but not limited to, washing all dishes, stripping beds, closing and locking windows and doors. Guest shall place all trash inside trash cans in trash bags only.

21.
Septic:
Septic system is sensitive and should only be used to dispose of wastewater and toilet paper. Guests must not put sanitary pads or tampons, condoms, disposable toilet wipes, paper towels, cigarette butts or other items into the toilet.  The sink in the houseboat should not be utilized to dispose of food scraps, coffee grinds, grease or other items.

22.
Owner Duties:
Owner agrees to provide the Premises in a fit and habitable condition. If at the time Guest is to begin
occupancy of the premises and the Owner cannot provide the Premises in a fit and habitable
condition, then the Owner shall refund to Guest all payments made by guest. The Owner shall
conduct all brokerage activities in regard to this Agreement without respect to the race, religion, sex,
national origin, handicap or familial status of the guest.

23.
Mandatory evacuation: 
If State or local authorities order a mandatory evacuation of an area that includes the Premises, Guest must comply with that order. Guest shall not be entitled to any refunds if they did not purchase insurance to protect against this event.

24.
Indemnity:
Guest agrees to release, indemnify and hold harmless Owner from and against all liability for injury
to the person of the Guest, to any member of his party or any guest of the Guest, resulting from any
cause whatsoever. This indemnification specifically includes use of any boats e.g. kayaks, hobie cat
sail boat, pontoon boat, jet skis or other water toys. Boats are inherently dangerous and all users must obey the South and North Carolina laws while on the lake including/especially that life jackets will be worn by children and readily available for adults. User of boat takes on all liability for use of said boats and holds
harmless the owner/owners from any liability for injury or death as a result of use of these boats.

25.
Indemnification and Hold Harmless:
Guest agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Owner from and against any liability for personal injury
or property damaged sustained by any person (including guests’ guests) as a result of any cause,
unless caused by the negligent or willful act of Owner. The lake is a swim at your own risk situation
with no life guard on duty.

gallery.caption: It's all about your water view with boats, dolphins and manatees passin by your front porch all day long. End of canal to left is Intercoastal Waterway
Work on your tan while getting the best view of nature and water activity up and down the lagoon.
Upper deck with both covered lounge area with 55" TV and open area for catching some sun
Park next to the boat

rear porch with small bistro table and two chairs for the marina ambiance. Gas barbeque grill with utensils and skewers.  Stairs to upper floor at rear of this area. Remember to come down same way you go up
dining for four with extra seating if needed
covered porch/bow with swivel recliner
Slide  Sun screen open when more shade is desired or close for more sun on bow
Two story houseboat looking from stern (back porch) towards front (bow) with 2nd. living room and lounge chairs on top deck.
Do you like a little quirkiness, like my jellyfish light fixture?
Find cards and board games in the top vintage suitcase
little boho gallery wall in living room

full kitchen minus a dishwasher.  Four gas burner stove, side by side full fridge w/freezer. new quartz counters.  Air fryer, microwave, Kuleg coffee maker, blender, cooking and dining and flatware service
bedroom with queen bed and overhead fan
vintage stain glass in bedroom windows
bedroom make up table or second work area and 2nd. ROKU TV.
cubby area in hall for work desk/chair, printer available if needed
small, but efficient bathroom, but try not to drop the soap when in shower
Plenty of drawer space in cubby area
Catch some sun on the two lounge chairs on upper deck
Taken from my front porch after one of our many Cape launches
Love watching the dolphins.  We get a pod of two and another pod of three
The dolphins like to swim in the marina as well as in the barge canal.  This would be your view when sitting on the stern.
Never get tired of so  many different boats passing  by the front porch
Try a little cruise down the waterway.  Tiki cruises is moored in our marina and takes passengers out twice a day. Bring your own booze.
Something more to do:  Sail Cocoa beach is moored at the marina and take passengers out twice daily
Early mornings the lagoon is like glass
All types and sizes
Northern college for skull rowing practicing in the winter
Always lots of kayaks
Meet Mark, a marina sailboat liveaboard and the nicest guy ever

I'll leave a few plants on the bow & stern in hopes kind guests might water them occasionally.  If not, oh well, I've killed a few in my day.  I don't allow candles for obvious reasons, but these are the battery types and add ambiance in the evening
I love flamingoes, so you'll see them scattered throughout.
Dolphins Restaurant/Marina boardwalk. A few discount coupons left on board for you. Highly recommend the fish spread and seafood chowder for an app. Music on weekends
For you sports lovers, Sports bar as well as great food
Dolphins is just a fun and lively hangout day or night
The boat rentals at marina next to Dolphins  offer Stand-up  Paddleboards
Kayak Rentals as well

Motorized Craigcat Rentals
My personal favorite for meandering down the waterway for observing nature up close and personal and if your very lucky you’ll get some dolphins swimming beside you
We now have a weekend afternoon cruise or evening dinner boat moored just down our drive- walk home
Roll up the blinds for full on marina feel
Upper out door 2nd. living room with 47' TV
Upper deck
Four burnergas range
Queen bed with enhanced linens
Funky jellyfish dining light on dimmer
Great room with minimal steps
Air fryer, coffee maker, blender, small crock pot, wok and so much more.  Explore the cabinets
Plenty of drawer space for longer stays
washer/dryer with soaps and dryer pads included
morning coffee when you want the marina ambiance
games for a little family time

hosts.about: I'm a little quirky and like a few "unusual" things in my decor and savor having a constant great water view and being comfortable over all else.  If I can't put my feet up on the sofa, it's too formal for me. I LOVE sitting on my bow and just relax and unwind while watching the activity of boats of all sizes, dolphins and occasional manatee pass by my front door. Enjoy waiving to the boaters.

recent.comments: Love love love! We had an amazing week! This place was incredible. We even saw baby dolphins. Couldn’t have been any better!

items.comments: Love love love! We had an amazing week! This place was incredible. We even saw baby dolphins. Couldn’t have been any better!

Bring nature lovers we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Watching the dolphins, manatees and birds from the back deck, while enjoying our morning coffee, was delightful .  The accommodations were great, everything one needed was available.  Loved the bohemian vibe .  Will definitely be planning another stay.

I’ll start by saying that I am super picky when it comes to cleanliness- Jacqui’s place was impeccably clean! We didn’t really know when we would arrive, but luckily check-in was very flexible and stress-free. The boat had the best spot in the marina! In the mornings, we would have a cup of coffee and sit out on the patio watching the dolphins splash around. We made friends with so many other local residents of the marina which made our trip even more exciting. I would highly recommend visiting!

My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Pura Vida for the month of February 2023.  This houseboat AirBB – was very clean, well-stocked with supplies and appliances, and had beautiful views of the space launches.  We were surprised by how spacious both the kitchen and the bathroom were.  The washer/dryer came in very handy since we were there for a month.  The boat is a charming space with a lovely dock path to walk around the marina/resort to take in the surroundings.  Being directly on the canal between the Indian River and Banana River, our morning coffee and breakfast was enjoyed most mornings on the bow deck where an occasional manatee or a pod of dolphins would pass by.  Jacqui and her team were excellent hosts in greeting us at the beginning and checking in on us from time to time during our stay! We are already looking forward to next years stay!  Thanks, Jacqui, for a fantastic stay!

description.summary: A "floating" vacation on my 62x14 ft Sumerset Houseboat offering comforts of home while gazing at the ever changing waterscape.  Boats of all sizes and descriptions plus dolphins will pass by your front porch all day long.  If you're seeking an experience, something different,  but in a tranquil relaxing more private setting, you found it.  Pura Vida will stay at dock during stay, will not leave dock.
description.space:
Park right next to Pura Vida, my one bedroom houseboat.  Steps down to the dock and a few more steps down to enter onto your covered front porch (bow) with direct water view.  Have your morning coffee, dine or just relax in your recliner while watching nature, dolphins and the myriad of boats pass by.  The boat will slightly sway once in awhile, which I find soothing. Don't forget to waive, as boaters are a very friendly lot. Located in the best spot in the marina with direct waterfront view and no boats in front or either side of you.  You are on the Indian River lagoon between the Indian River (Intercoastal waterway) and the Banana River.  Space Coast rocket launches right in front of the bow.  Boats entering or leaving the marina will pass you by on your starboard (right) side. 

Step into your very comfortable living room and (hopefully) smile at my boho/vintage/contemporary vibes.   Sofa is a brand new queen sleeper.  Dining area sitting four directly across from your full  kitchen with a four burner gas range, full size fridge/freezer and new quartz counter tops.  No dishwasher, but if more than two of you, try paper/plastic plates. All new flooring, paint, ceiling fan, counter tops and window blinds.  If you have to work, cubby around the corner with desk/chair. Small but sufficient bath, but try hard not to drop the soap in shower, as it's the same size as a typical RV shower.  As we are a boat, we provide marine grade toilet tissue throughout your stay.  Please don't use any other.  Few more steps into your private bedroom with queen bed and and a makeup table or second work area. Small combo washer/dryer in a closet, but recommend very small loads or clothes will look wrinkly, but I do provide a small handheld steamer, if needed. Glass door leading out to your rear covered porch (stern) with a small bistro table and two chairs for when you want to feel part of the marina.   Climb the stairs to your second covered living room with two sofas, chairs, and a 55" Smart TV.  Two  swinging chairs coming soon with photo to follow.  If you want more privacy, drop down the Isinglass, which also keeps wind out for cooler days.  Want a tan, step out to the open area for relaxing on the two loungers and catch some rays.  Be sure to come down the stairs same way you go up; face the steps.  There are a few walls with "wrinkly" areas, which will be replaced in the spring.  The marina is not part of the resort, so there is no access to the resort's pool or clubhouse. I think you will find that staying on Pura Vida will be a very fun, unique and rewarding experience.   As Pura Vida is my  home, she will only be available for a few months of the year:  Feb. thru mid-April and again June thru mid-Aug.    No reviews yet, as I'm just now making her available for you to enjoy.
description.access: Enjoy the entire houseboat except the basement for my storage.
description.notes: For the safety of toddlers and small children, I don't recommend,  unless you are watching constantly.  Too easy for them to fall overboard.  Unfortunately, my boat can not accommodate a wheel chair.
description.neighborhood: Leisure walk around the marina perimeter to Dolphins tiki style restaurant/bar  and Cape Crossing boat rentals.  Mention you're staying on Pura Vida for a discount for their many water craft including SUPs.  Short walk to the dumpster for emptying trash and a little further to the marina office for complimentary full size washer & dryer.
description.transit: Approximately 35 min. east of Orlando International airport, eight miles north on Courtney to Kennedy Space Center and ten min. east to Cocoa Beach and it's beautiful sandy beaches. Park your vehicle right next to Pura Vida.  If larger wash loads, free larger size washer/dryers just down the short road to Marina office.
description.interaction: Have staff onsite if needed
description.house_rules: Boat does not leave dock.

The view of Jamaica Bay
view at sunset from the foredeck
sleeping area
