hosts.about: We are two artists. I am a comedian and editor and my wife is a visual artist, originally from Sweden. We are hoping to share the amazing houseboat experience in NYC with a stay on our houseboat, Freja.

recent.comments: I've stayed on houseboat Freya at least 9 or 10 times. My previous reviews go into detail about this special place. I'll be back again for sure. Thanks, Ambrose!

items.comments: I've stayed on houseboat Freya at least 9 or 10 times. My previous reviews go into detail about this special place. I'll be back again for sure. Thanks, Ambrose!

Amazing location with easy access to bus stops, free ferry shuttle stop right outside the main gate of the marina and walking distance to the surfers beach.  Nice views of the waterfront, the full moon and night skyline from the boat roof terrace and a covered and breezy bench sitting area on the bow. A wonderful glamping experience in the middle of “Un verano en Nueva York”with all its sights and sounds. Not for the faint of heart.
We were thrilled to get to stay on this boat. Really unusual spot but perfect for us. We loved all the neighbors and the proximity to beach.

Thank you so much Ambrose & Florence!!  Your boathouse was a Blessing ... perfect for what I needed & was seeking, it was retreat 'like'.  The people at the Marina were family 'like' as well, very helpful, friendly, & cool folks as well (of course, they have boats in the marina)!! The grocery mart right outside the marina entrance, though a little small, had everything a big grocery would have & good prices as well, very convenient.  Grateful for Ambrose & Florence sharing their cute boathouse in this way, I'll always cherish the stay!! Rick from Tonawanda NY
My husband and I had a great stay here! The boat was super cute and cozy, and it was exactly as described. Perfect for anyone wanting a chill, easy getaway

Freja was exactly what we expected and needed--a basic vintage boat situated in a peaceful marina. It's pleasant to wake up on the water and have coffee sitting on top of the boat. It's perfect for turning one beach day into two.

description.summary:
NOTE: DO NOT SUBMIT a "Reservation Request" on Airbnb until YOU HAVE MESSAGED US FIRST to say hi. Thanks!

Relax not by the water but on the water with lots of fresh air, lots of sun, and a 7 minute walk to the beach. 
Freja is a 1970 Nautaline, 34' by 12' wide. This is a cabin on the water. It isn't fancy. Bathrooms/hot showers are on land about a 2 minute walk. Bring your own sheets/towels.
There are pillows/blankets but a sleeping bag is best.
Sorry, we don't rent to people with kids/pets.
description.space: Freja is a 34' Nautaline and she's been our home away from home for 9 years now. We love her dearly and would like that all guests treat her with respect. She is 52 years old and has quite a number of quirks. To be clear, do not expect a pristine, hotel-like experience. Staying on Freja is a lot like "glamping" on the water. There is a small fridge, microwave and a toaster oven and basic dishes, cups, silverware. Stove does not work at the moment. There is a sink on board, and we use a gallon water jug to do the dishes that is filled on the dock. The main bed is long and narrow and roughly full size, so big enough for two. There is smaller bed for humans under 5'10"  in the pilot house. You need to bring your own sheets, pillowcases and towels. A sleeping bag is best. There is one space heater and a fan. The bathrooms and hot showers are on land near the marina office, a two minute walk down the dock
description.access: The berth below the pilot house is off limits as well as the closet leading to the space. Thanks.
description.notes:
You must bring your own sheets (full size), pillowcases and towels. There are two pillows for sleeping but feel free to bring your own, ours are well used.
 DO NOT use the toilet onboard in any circumstance! Please only use the toilets on land by the marina office.
There is no WiFi but great cell service so your hotspot will work fine.
We ask that you treat Freja with respect and love.
description.neighborhood: There is a small grocery store right outside the marina and a huge Stop and Shop a 15 minute walk or short bike ride. The beach is a 5 minute walk. If you don't want to cook there are several restaurants near by. Rippers beach bar on the boardwalk at and the Rockaway Surf Club are not to be missed.
description.transit: If you have a car, there is ample parking. Or bring your bike. Otherwise take the A train to Beach 60th st. and it is a 2 minute walk to the marina
description.interaction: We won't be there, she's all yours. Feel free to text or call with any questions.
description.house_rules:
Our boat is suitable for only one or two people to stay. Sorry no kids. 
Please be respectful of our neighbors and other boat owners. Absolutely no parties.

name: Wake up ON the water aboard Ramble on Rose
title: Port Clinton, Ohio

recent.comments: Our family of 4 just finished up our 5 days of our Port Clinton vacation. We had originally booked for 4 days, but we were able to book an extra day because we didn't want to leave! Josh and Michelle have done an amazing job at making these house boats such a fun experience of "camping on the water" as described. They are very responsive for any needs or questions during your stay and are just so welcoming! It exceeded our expectations and made a memorable vacation for us. We can't wait to book again to do even more activities around the Port Clinton area. Whether you need a home base to go explore and plan activities or just somewhere to relax with just a short drive to an amazing beach, these listings are for you!

items.comments: Our family of 4 just finished up our 5 days of our Port Clinton vacation. We had originally booked for 4 days, but we were able to book an extra day because we didn't want to leave! Josh and Michelle have done an amazing job at making these house boats such a fun experience of "camping on the water" as described. They are very responsive for any needs or questions during your stay and are just so welcoming! It exceeded our expectations and made a memorable vacation for us. We can't wait to book again to do even more activities around the Port Clinton area. Whether you need a home base to go explore and plan activities or just somewhere to relax with just a short drive to an amazing beach, these listings are for you!
Everything about it was perfect! Josh and Michelle were such welcoming hosts and the dockside live music created the best vibe.  The boat was comfortable as well…we will definitely be back!

My boyfriend & I decided to take a last minute weekend getaway up to Lake Erie. I was trying to find something last minute that was available & a decent price.  I found the houseboat & began looking into it.  I have been going up to the islands since I was little and always stayed at hotels or cottages. I  thought staying on a houseboat would be a fun & different experience.  After our stay I asked him if we could do another weekend on one this summer.  The check in was easy & the owners were very helpful with any questions we had or if we needed help with anything.  The interior was decorated nicely; they had coffee and little snacks available.  We slept amazing. The king size bed was super comfy & the ac kept us nice and cool all night.  I loved that they had seating on top of the boat and at the entrance.  It was nice to sit on top and have coffee in the morning and enjoy a nice view.
What a fun and relaxing weekend! Perfect home-based for day trips to PutInBay, the Perch festival and so much more! The hosts are awesome and quick to respond when needed.

If you are into camping and enjoy being on the water this place is perfect. Very quiet, cozy and relaxing. The family is welcoming and makes you feel comfortable from the minute you get there. 1 issue with air conditioning came up but they had it fixed very quickly! Close to a lot of places to eat and adventure around. Would definitely stay here again!!

description.summary:
Ramble on Rose is a houseboat with tons of charm! Wake up to the sounds of the water and go to bed watching an amazing sunset! 

This is a boat on the water, in a marina. There are other houseboats and personal boats in the marina. The boats do not move from the dock, but simply camping on the water!
description.space:
Inside you will find a king size bed, kitchen area with fridge/microwave and kcup coffee maker. The front living area has a futon couch to use as additional sleep space.   

The outside area of this boat is great! The front deck has a table and 4 chairs. The upper deck has a set of patio furniture to enjoy the view and the amazing sunsets. 

While there is a bathroom on the boat, we ask this is used sparingly as the systems are sensitive. We have a bath house facility off the dock that includes showers and restrooms. There is a men's restroom, women's restroom and several unisex private restrooms with shower stalls.
description.access: You will love being able to walk to the beach and having Downtown Port Clinton activities within minutes. Restaurants, bars, live music, festivals, farmers markets, art shows and more! If you have a boat/jet skis/kayak this is the paradise for you. Please let us know if you would like to bring it, we have dock spaces available. There is access to Lake Erie and the Portage River directly from the marina. The Sandusky Bay is only a few minutes’ drive, as well as Cedar Point. The Jet Express is a couple minutes down the road, and you can be to Put N Bay or Kelley’s Island quickly!
description.notes:
Reminder, this is a boat on the water, in a marina. There are other houseboats and personal boats in the marina. The boats do not move from the dock, but simply camping on the water!Depending on the weather, there can be movement. There can also be different kinds of wildlife and bugs. This is similar to camping, but on the water! Spiders, Flies, Mayflies, Nats, etc are all creatures of the water areas. We do spray and clean for these, but want to make you aware that you may see them.  We do our best to keep you comfortable! Please let us know if there is anything we can do while you are with us.

New for 2023!! 

Kayaks and fishing poles will be complimentary for overnight guests! 

Island Getaway Boat Rental will have pontoon and fishing boats available foe daily rentals, at the docks to explore the area. 
New heating and ac units have been added! 
A brand new boathouse has been built AT our dock! Full size, full bathrooms, available steps from the boat. 

Check us out -
Island houseboat getaway
description.interaction: Our personal boat is also in the marina, so we are around if you need anything!
description.house_rules:
Children under 12 should wear a life vest when outside the boat and on the dock. 

Smoking is only permitted outside the boats. Please be mindful of your neighbors and dispose of butts properly.

hosts.about: I am married and have a wonderful husband of 30 years, with three adult children. I have just become a new Grandma.  I treasure the time I have with my family and friends.  My husband and I enjoy entertaining.   We have travelled to many different destinations but our go to would be somewhere warm and tropical.

recent.comments: Can’t say enough wonderful things about this boathouse!  This is the second time my family and I have stayed here and it doesn’t disappoint.  Everything is very comfortable and welcoming, the boathouse is beautiful and perfectly maintained.  Lyn and her family are friendly and extremely respectful in providing you with the space and privacy to really get the most out of your vacation.  Will definitely stay here again.

items.comments: Can’t say enough wonderful things about this boathouse!  This is the second time my family and I have stayed here and it doesn’t disappoint.  Everything is very comfortable and welcoming, the boathouse is beautiful and perfectly maintained.  Lyn and her family are friendly and extremely respectful in providing you with the space and privacy to really get the most out of your vacation.  Will definitely stay here again.

We just came back from an excellent stay at Lyn’s. The boathouse was beautifully decorated and had more than we could ask for in amenities. We enjoyed the open bright space and beautiful balcony overlooking the lake. We also were able  to use the Muskoka chairs on the dock to enjoy the afternoon. When we arrived and met Lyn she was helpful in showing all the features of her accommodation and all the items (dock, kayak, SUP) for guests. She was always around for any questions we had. The boathouse is in an exceptional location in a lovely quiet area but very close to places such as Bala and Port Carling. When visiting the area again we would love to stay again at Lyn’s boathouse and would highly recommend to anyone visiting the area on a getaway to Muskoka.
We loved our time at this beautiful boathouse. It was very clean, welcoming and well appointed. The hosts were  very responsive.

This place is as it is described, a piece of paradise on top of the lake :)
We really enjoy it and 
Lyn was the perfect host, always available if we needed anything and still leaving us all the privacy to make us comfortable with this boat house built on a shared deck :)
The Bala Boathouse was great.  10+++

This property is fantastic and the pictures don’t do it justice!  The location is perfect and the boathouse itself is perfect for a family.  Lyn goes above and beyond in every sense and really makes this place feel like a home away from home!

description.summary: Lake Muskoka - Minutes from Bala and Port Carling.
description.space:
The Boathouse on Sunset Bay is nestled on Lake Muskoka.  You will enjoy your private space on the upper level of the boathouse.  The boathouse will spoil you with two bedrooms, one bathroom, kitchenette and living room.  You will be able to sip your wine  on the lakeside balcony over looking the incredible view of Sunset Bay.  There will be a BBQ available for you to use.  For your convenience we will provide you with information for water toy rentals.  Docking is available.
No parties or events are permitted on the premises during your stay.
description.access:
The guests will have their own private space while residing on the upper level of The Boathouse.  The dock is a common area that can be used for our guests as well as my family.  We respect the privacy of our guests and usually do not use the dock while they are enjoying it.
.  There will be a fire pit available according to summer burning by-laws.  The first floor of the boathouse is not available to guests as well as the trampoline in the backyard.
description.neighborhood: My home is minutes away from Bala and Port Carling.  We have many tourists attractions occurring during the summer months.  The Johnston's Cranberry Marsh and Muskoka Winery is minutes away from our Airbnb.  There are Farmers Markets occurring weekly, Art shows, hiking and weekly Ski Shows.  This is just a few exciting events that you can enjoy while staying in Muskoka.
description.transit: There is no public transit available.  There are taxi services available.
description.interaction: We are always available for questions but we respect your privacy and therefore we will let you relax and enjoy your own space.
description.house_rules:
There is to be no other persons on my property other than what has been registered at the time of the booking.
There is to be no events or parties taking place while at my Airbnb on my property.

hosts.about:
July 2018 was our first time posting our boathouse apartment.  A family of 4, we and our pets have spent our summers at Cuba Island in the Thousand Islands for 30+ years!  Dinners on the porch, watching the sunset is a favorite part of the day.  Winters are spent in Boston.
2019 the river water was very high, over our docks to above our knees!, so we could not host guests at all.  
Back to hosting summer of 2020

recent.comments: This was our second stay at Cuba Island. We fell in love with it during our first stay and love it more each time. We're sad when we leave and can't wait to get back. Judy and John are absolutely lovely and have taken care to provide everything that will make your stay enjoyable. As travelers, we discovered that not everyone thinks of the "little" things that are important to a traveler. Judy and John have thought of those things. Chairs in the bedrooms and the bathroom, plenty of hooks for hanging towels/clothing/toiletry bag in the bathroom, fans in the rooms - including the bathroom, everything you could possibly need in the kitchen, comfy towels and bed linens (very comfy mattresses!!), and welcoming goodies. Those are just a few of the extra touches Judy provides. The decks and scenery are so beautiful and peaceful (including Judy's beautiful gardens). Fishing is fantastic, and so is birding....right from the island and waters just beyond. Incredible!

items.comments: This was our second stay at Cuba Island. We fell in love with it during our first stay and love it more each time. We're sad when we leave and can't wait to get back. Judy and John are absolutely lovely and have taken care to provide everything that will make your stay enjoyable. As travelers, we discovered that not everyone thinks of the "little" things that are important to a traveler. Judy and John have thought of those things. Chairs in the bedrooms and the bathroom, plenty of hooks for hanging towels/clothing/toiletry bag in the bathroom, fans in the rooms - including the bathroom, everything you could possibly need in the kitchen, comfy towels and bed linens (very comfy mattresses!!), and welcoming goodies. Those are just a few of the extra touches Judy provides. The decks and scenery are so beautiful and peaceful (including Judy's beautiful gardens). Fishing is fantastic, and so is birding....right from the island and waters just beyond. Incredible!

She helped us find her location. They met us at the dock to help unload our stuff and explain everything we needed to know about staying there. Everything was very pleasant and they bought us some groceries to be nice. We definitely recommend staying there and look forward ourselves to staying there again.

gracious hosts , very friendly and accommodating. pointed us in a few directions for places to see and food to try. location is perfect because docking is not on the main channel so much calmer water. will definitely be back
We had a great weekend stay. Great host and perfect location! Everything was exactly as described. Host was very helpful and responsive! We will definitely stay again in the future!
Another wonderful stay at the Cuba Island Boathouse. Perfect location to enjoy the history and beauty of the 1000 islands. It's a privilege that Judy & John share this special space.
Extremely welcoming host and absolutely stunning view. We couldn’t have had a better weekend.

description.summary:
APRIL 2021 * Pleasant & cheerful 2BR 2BA above boathouse on an  island in the Heart of the 1000 Islands.  5 minutes outside of popular Alexandria Bay & Boldt Castle.  Apartment is directly above the boat slips.  Stairs of about 10 steps to front door.   NOT suitable for young children, pets, anyone w/mobility concerns.
Swim from the dock, relax on the deck, enjoy exploring the river.  A boating paradise!
Must have a boat!  If renting locally, we can make suggestions.  Large boats OK, 80 ft dock!
description.space:
Thousand Islands Region, 1000 Islands Region
SPACIOUS Open kit/liv/din rm.  Sliders to DECK w/VIEW of main shipping channel, freighters, Devils Oven & sunrise!  Constructed from the Turn of the century to Mid-century the apt is mostly original.  50's vintage kitchen, no granite or stainless in sight!  

Generous BR’s with AC. BR’s are located on opposite sides of liv room for privacy.

Bonus room - there is also a small common den.  2nd BR can be entered from the den or through a private door from the porch

Our house, the main house, is about 100 feet away from the boathouse.  No other houses on the island.

You must have your own boat or rent one locally.
description.access:
* Must have your own boat or rent one locally
*Swim from the dock, relax on the balcony
*80 foot dock for your small, medium or large boat
*Private entrance to apartment in Boat House.
*Dock space at island provided with accommodation.  The Keewaydin Marina, for launching, is 10 min away. 
* If you plan to rent a boat locally, we can make suggestions. 
*No dishwasher, washer/dryer
*Non-Smoking  
*No parties or events
*A/C in bedrooms only
description.notes:
50's kitchen
2nd full bath is small
2nd bedroom can be entered from den but also has a Private entrance door from the porch 
Stairs with approx 10 steps from dock to entrance of the apartment
 Must have your own boat.  Docking space for your use.
We will also use our dock space periodically but will make every effort to not disturb you—please do the same.
Sounds - you will hear pleasure boats and freighters going by, sometimes music from Alex Bay - depending on the direction of the wind, and of course birds, geese, sometimes coyotes yipping on the mainland!
description.neighborhood:
Thousand Islands Region, 1000 Islands Region - Conveniently located on Cuba Island  just 10 minutes outside of Alexandria Bay, Millionaires Row.  15 min from Boldt Castle.  Cuba Island is across river from Coast Guard station.
Big M supermarket can be reached by small boats.
description.transit: You must have a boat!  Keewaydin Marina is 10 min away for launching.  Rentals available in the area.
description.interaction: We live in the main house on the island and are around most of the time.
description.house_rules: Quiet time after 10pm.  Our home is about 100 feet away.

hosts.about:
I am a long time resident of Newport, RI. I'm always excited to meet people interested in experiencing this special property, a renovated houseboat. I am an avid water lover and cannot think of a better place to live, work and enjoy life in the  lovely town of Newport. 
"The cure for everything is Saltwater....
Tears, Sweat or the Sea"

recent.comments: Awesome. There’s no other way to describe the experience of staying on Carl’s Houseboat.  The perfect compromise between a hotel and a boat. Spacious, clean and quiet. Being on the water, watching the action in the harbour was a treat. A quick walk to all of the action. Kathy is an amazing host.  A perfect place to stay in Newport.

items.comments: Awesome. There’s no other way to describe the experience of staying on Carl’s Houseboat.  The perfect compromise between a hotel and a boat. Spacious, clean and quiet. Being on the water, watching the action in the harbour was a treat. A quick walk to all of the action. Kathy is an amazing host.  A perfect place to stay in Newport.
Absolutely fantastic.  We cannot wait to go back.

We loved this place! Newport is certainly about the boats and the bay, and being right out there, kayaking easily over to the Newport shipyard, and around Goat Island was just wonderful. There are a number of great restaurants in easy walking distance. We were here for the folkfest and that was also an easy bike ride!  The place itself is a very cool, refurbished, old houseboat with charm and very comfortable. We used all the outdoor spaces for coffee and drinks at various times.   Climbing the ladder to the second floor was no problem for us and the breeze was just fine without air conditioning.  We hope to stay there again.

Probably the most exotic AirBnB we've ever stayed in. My family and friends loved the houseboat! We were entertained by the various boats going by, kayaking and paddleboarding, great surfing nearby, excellent restaurants (Perro Salado was our favorite, but all were great), and Kathy was the BEST host ever - just a super nice person and a great human being. We all agreed to return to this cool spot!
Great Stay! Sunset are amazing on the boat.

Our stay at Capt Carl was nothing short of relaxing! Kathy was the most responsive, friendly and helpful host. We had some bad weather headed our way and Kathy was sure to let us know where we could locate the umbrella and how long the storm was predicted to hang around. Kathy made sure we knew she was available at all times and was very approachable is we needed anything. The house boat itself was everything the listing said and more, even with so many delicious restaurants around we felt more at home sitting on back deck of the boat sharing delicious food we prepared on the boat with the amazing view of the marina. It was the perfect family getaway.

description.summary: This charming,  renovated houseboat is located at the north end of Newport harbor. You’ll love the unique setting, secure on a dock, in a private marina with easy access to town. You'll have plenty of activities right on the dock. We have kayaks, 2 single, right out your door. Be part of this new experience on Casey's Capt. Carl houseboat. You will fall in love with Newport Harbor.  Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families.
description.space: Our houseboat is a truly unique experience. Life on a boat that is more similar to a cozy home. The Capt. Carl was newly renovated in 2015. She has beautifully varnished woodwork. A full galley kitchen. Gas grill on the dock.
description.notes: There are two bedrooms up top. Both have full size built in beds. You have north and south window exposures in each. One bedroom has a slider with access to the upper decks. You'll enjoy sunrise every morning and the perfect sunset view overlooking Newport harbor and the Newport/Pell Bridge.  The bedrooms are at the top of the stairs and open to each other.  Cozy boat living !!
description.neighborhood: We are located a short walk to downtown. Lots of great restaurants, shops and plenty to do without getting in your car. We are right next to the state fishing pier. Right around the corner is the famous Newport Ship Yard, well worth a visit.
description.transit: No need to get in your car. We have a wonderful, fun PediCab system. You can pick one up easily!
description.interaction: My partner lives at the marina. I'm there daily as well. We love to help our guest enjoy all that Newport and the marina have to offer.

hosts.about: At Constitution Marina's Bed and Breakfast Afloat you can relax and enjoy the breathtaking views of Boston Harbor with all the amenities of a modern hotel, at affordable rates.

recent.comments: It was a beautiful spot! Great view of the city at night. Great location- we walked everywhere we went, besides Fenway. Great stay!!

items.comments: It was a beautiful spot! Great view of the city at night. Great location- we walked everywhere we went, besides Fenway. Great stay!!

Place was clean and well stocked. Outdoor deck space was a nice place to sit. Check in staff was friendly and helpful. When I messaged the host with questions, the response was slow. Basically had to figure some things out on our own. Overall a nice unique experience
Great host, great location, great food, and most importantly worth every penny that was spent!

We loved the boat & where it was! Our only issue was there were no clear check in instructions or any helpful information when it came to parking.

Keith 10:05 AM
What are the check In instructions?
Melissa 11:09 AM
Hi,
Please go to the Marina office to check in.
Melissa

We had no clue where the marina office was.. you have to actually pay parking to even get into the marina office! It’s over $10 for the first 10 minutes, $20 for after 20 minutes!  When I started seeing charges sent by text for parking, I was kinda freaked out by how quickly they were accumulating. So I messaged Mellisa.

Keith 5:39 PM
With parking, we pulled straight into the marina parking.. do you know the price if we leave it there? Til Thursday morning, or is it an hourly thing?
Read by Melissa
Melissa 11:46 PM
Sorry just seeing this.

Again.. no help whatsoever. 

So here’s the parking info fir the marina. There is a max charge per day in the marina. We pd $89 for parking from 5pm Tuesday to 9am Thursday morning
Awesome little spot for a stay i Boston. Great experience of being on the water and close to the city.
totally worth it, great location and unique experience!

description.summary:
At Constitution Marina's Bed & Breakfast Afloat you can enjoy the ambiance, the comfort, the romance of staying ON THE WATER with all the amenities of a modern hotel, at rates as low as you'll find anywhere in Boston!
For boats with 2 staterooms, there is an additional fee of $100.00 plus tax/night if the 2nd room is rented.  The 2nd room is booked directly through the host.
description.space:
Single Stateroom
 
Casita provides the unique perspective of a floating hotel room. The cozy houseboat includes a queen bed with an en-suite bath. Casita has an inviting private deck with a table and colorful Adirondack chairs, and is surrounded by flowers. Relax and enjoy the breathtaking views of Boston’s beautiful skyline.
 
 Houseboat Amenities:
 Breakfast is included
 A/C and Heat
 Cable Television and Wifi
 Refrigerator
 Coffee Maker, Hair Dryer, Iron
description.notes:
Terms & Conditions: Bed & Breakfast Afloat vessels do differ from a standard hotel room and most people feel that this adds a certain charm and seaside ambiance to the accommodations. Please keep in mind that you will be staying on a boat and there will normally be some movement - most people find this very comforting.  The boats are spread throughout Constitution Marina and there will be a short walk to your Bed & Breakfast vessel.  If you have any mobility issues please contact us prior to booking your reservation. These are not Party Boats, if you wanted to have a small party we recommend that you inquire about one of our many charter vessels where you can enjoy a sunset cruise or visit one of the many Boston Harbor islands. You can also inquire in the office about renting the deck.

Cooking is not allowed on any of the Bed & Breakfast vessels.

Due to insurance and concern for our customers' vessels, only as many people may visit you as are paying to stay overnight, i.e. two paying guests, two visitors; four paying guests, four visitors (no overnight visitors please).  Quiet time is from 11pm - 8am.  Dock staff has the right to ask you to vacate the boat if this rule is abused or if we have received reports of rowdiness.  Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 

Additional fees may be charged for any damage, loss of property, or extra cleaning.

Please note that prices are subject to change and special event rates may apply.

CHECK-IN: May: 3pm - 6pm | June - August: 3pm - 8pm | September - October: 3pm - 6pm

PARKING: Parking  for a fee is available nearby.
description.interaction: At Constitution Marina's Bed and Breakfast Afloat you can relax and enjoy the breathtaking views of Boston Harbor with all the amenities of a modern hotel, at affordable rates.
description.house_rules:
Latest check in is at 18:00

100% payment due at time of booking. Refunds will be issued if cancellation is received more than 7 days prior to arrival date, less a $35.00 cancellation fee. Less than 7 days: No refunds will be issued.  A credit will remain on your account to be used within the same season, based on availability.

recent.comments: We’ve stayed at Caroline’s a few times now and it’s always a relaxing and comfortable stay. The grounds are beautiful and the home is so inviting, it’s a lovely escape for some peace and quiet (and our teens love the barn with the ping pong and foosball and watching the swans down by the boathouse.) Caroline is a wonderful and responsive host.

items.comments: We’ve stayed at Caroline’s a few times now and it’s always a relaxing and comfortable stay. The grounds are beautiful and the home is so inviting, it’s a lovely escape for some peace and quiet (and our teens love the barn with the ping pong and foosball and watching the swans down by the boathouse.) Caroline is a wonderful and responsive host.

This is a true vacation spot and just has so much going for it. I visited with my family of 7 of various ages for a week and everyone loved it.  From the ping-pong to the campfire to the dock (BIG coy fish and swans) to the hot tub to the work out room to the big TV to the game room; there was always something going on with lots of space to do it in.  Smith Point beach is a half hour including a stop to get ice, drinks and snacks.  Cook dinner on the deck or run down to Patchogue for wonderful dining options. Caroline (and Scott) are great hosts and go out of their way to accommodate you in all ways.  Alexa is always ready.
The house is well appointed with a great balance between modern electronics and that vintage house character and charm.  We actually celebrated 2 birthdays there in a twice  decorated large dining room.  Everything is clean, well-maintained  and amenities are well thought out with 2 (two) big bathtubs/showers and lots of towels.  There are little solar lights everywhere for walking around at night to hear the raucous crickets and see the moonlight on the river.  Tip:  back into the driveway, or, turn around once in so that you can drive out.

This house is truly magical! I wish that I could stay here for an entire summer, penning a memoir in the multiple nooks throughout the property. Caroline & Scott have done an amazing job of updating the home with modern touches (light switches, bathrooms) while preserving the historical character (doors, windows, built ins). We even spotted 2 beautiful swans in the river behind the house. They had almost everything one might need for cooking and provided detailed instructions in a manual for the home. 

Tips for future guests: if you have heavier items or rolling suitcases, pull up in front of the house to wheel in on the stone path; the driveway is pebbles and there’s no paved path to the door; be careful walking on the street, esp at night—the cars drive fast; if you want to workout in the basement, turn the space heater on a little while before you want to be down there so it’s not too cold;  the heat defaults down to 66 F automatically, so it can get chilly—consider bringing warm clothing and slippers; the refrigerator & freezer are drawers and it’s very easy to not close them all the way, and they will beep until they are closed.

A lovely home for a weekend away, this is our second visit and we can’t wait to return again. A great kitchen to cook in, comfortable beds and two lovely soaking tubs inside. The outside grounds include a newly added fire pit, plus a wonderfully decorated small reading nook and a barn with foosball, ping pong and couch to hang out. Our family favorite is spending time at the boathouse on the river, feeding the swans that visit each day. It is an easy trip to many cute towns nearby, but if you stay here you may feel like we do - we never want to leave!

Caroline’s place in Yaphank is beautiful and unique.  It is so neat to stay in such a historic gem (with modern upgrades!!). There is also a lot to do in the area.  Our family had a wonderful time and I highly recommend it to others.   Enjoy your stay!
No thanks

description.summary: Stay at our historic 4 bedroom, 2.5 bath 1820's home, stylishly and lovingly restored by noted Designer/Author Tricia Foley. You will have private access to the entire 2 acre property on the tranquil Carmans River. Highlights include the main house with 2 soaking tubs, year round hot tub,  5 fireplaces, gym, and laundry room. There are also 4 stand alone buildings for guests use  - a boathouse with a private dock, a separate studio with 2 bikes for use, & garden house for relaxing.
description.space:
With an abundance of historical charm and modern updates for both relaxing and working from home, our place is a true gem and perfect for an escape for the weekend, a holiday or a longer stay. 

Our lovely 200 year old main house has four upstairs bedrooms and 2.5 baths.  
The chic and stylish main house is decorated with a mix of antiques from the 1800s and designer furniture, is impeccably clean, and has a multitude of modern amenities. Two of the bedrooms have desk space and one desk setup has a Herman Miller office chair. The private outbuildings also make perfect solo retreats for anyone working remote. 

Our Guests have full access to the private property which nestles the river and includes the main house as well as 4 out buildings.It is a very quiet and tranquil retreat, no matter the season. 

The Main house features: 
The downstairs includes a large formal living room with fireplace, a TV room with 55" Samsung HD4K television and fireplace, separate dining room for formal entertaining, powder room and cozy eat-in kitchen. 

The kitchen features antique cabinets from the 1800s, a thermador gas range, a designer range hood (not yet pictures) dishwasher, microwave, a fireplace and an antique table for dining. There is an extensive array of cooking tools including salt and pepper, olive oil, spices, sharp knives, salad spinner, cutting boards, food processor, baking sheets, basic spices, electric hand mixer, array of pots and pans, dutch oven, cocktail glasses, wine glasses, microwave, French press and tea kettle. Downstairs there is also an additional full refrigerator for guest use. 

A Jura espresso maker is a highlight in the kitchen ! 

There is high speed wifi provided with Eero wifi network making it possible for multiple people to be working at the same time. Additionally All buildings on our property are equipped with wifi boosters so Internet can be accessed throughout the 2 acres. 

There are 3 fireplaces on the main floor for guest use with duraflame logs. 

The basement includes a gym with new treadmill, stationary bike, free weights, pull-up station, and plenty of room for yoga, and a tv for streaming any workouts. There is also a large laundry room with new washer and dryer which guests may use during their stay. 

The upstairs has four bedrooms including - 

1-Master bedroom with Queen bed, 32 inch Samsung frame TV, fireplace and ensuite bath with deep soaking tub.

2- Full bedroom featuring antiques from the 1800s, luxurious 800 thread count sheets. 

3- Larger Queen bedroom in the front of the house with luxurious 800 thread count sheets and a desk space with Herman Miller chair if needed to work remotely. 

4- Twin bedroom with two antique beds. A Desk is also located in this room for
Remote work. 

2 full bathrooms for guest use are located upstairs including the Master ensuite bath with deep soaking tub and shower as well as the hall bathroom with the original antique clawfoot tub and separate shower. 

Guests are provided fine linens, towels and bathroom amenities - shampoo, conditioner, soap, blow dryer, and cleaning and laundry supplies for use. 

Immediately Outside our home there is a attached covered back porch with wicker loungers and a brick patio with a dining table and barbecue grill. There is a Sundance hot tub on the patio heated year round to 104 degrees where you can soak and relax under the stars.

Beyond this, enjoy exploring the grounds which includes a boathouse with a private dock and multiple unique structures; the original outhouse, restored chicken coop for relaxing or a quiet space to retreat, and a designer studio once featured on the cover of Martha Stewart Living. 

The studio is a chic lounge space with ping pong, foosball, and a sectional couch. We also have 2 bikes for guest use in the studio. 

The boathouse with private dock is the perfect place to watch the sunset, feed the swans or dine alfresco waterside.

Other notable features include: high speed internet, designer furniture inside and out, Jura Espresso machine, 2 bikes (we do not provide helmets), an array of books to read, and board games (Monopoly, Scrabble, Uno, etc). There are 3 smart TVs in the home - in the gym, front parlor and master bedroom. 

Guest access: 
Entire home- kitchen, dining room, formal living room, TV room, four bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms with one clawfoot tub and one shower/deep tub combo, and basement with gym and laundry.
4 outbuildings as described above. 

We do have a couple locked cabinets and closets throughout the home however they will not impact your stay in any way.
description.access: Guests have full access to the private property which nestles the river and includes the main house as well as 4 out buildings. There are 4 parking spots in our driveway when double parked. The hot tub is available for use year round. We do have a few locked owner's cabinets and the garage and utility room in the basement are off limits.
description.notes: A Guest guidebook will be provided at our home which includes house rules, tips and local recommendations.
description.neighborhood: The property feels like a tranquil escape with direct access to the waterfront and is perfectly suited for watching nature, relaxing and getting away. Our home is located near several charming towns, including our favorite Bellport, New York. Bellport is a quaint gem that boasts many bakeries, delis, shops, restaurants and in the summer fabulous farm stands. Enjoy a Hampton's-esque experience a quick 77 minute train ride or sixty mile drive from Manhattan. We have private parking for 4 cars in our driveway.
description.transit: A car is needed to explore all that the area has to offer. Though guests could spend an entire weekend relaxing and enjoying the property without leaving.
description.interaction:
You will check in on your own however Feel free to reach out via texts with any questions.

Additionally we do offer "add ons" for your stay for additional fee - These include - 

Custom Birthday  setup to surprise a friend or loved one 
Custom Cheese plates @cheesebycarol 
Grocery Provisioning prior to your arrival. 

Should you be interested please inquire.
description.house_rules: No smoking anywhere on the property. Inside or out.

gallery.caption: Sunset and golden hour.
A great way to enjoy fishing.
We have larger boats that sleep 10. Ask if you're interested.
Boldt Castle
Singer Castle. A true time capsule. All original furnishing.

recent.comments: perefct Weekend in perfect location

items.comments: perefct Weekend in perfect location

We are already planning a longer trip for a couple of summers from now! The boats are showing their age, but it doesn't matter in the least. Everything functions beautifully. What a fabulous way to explore one of the most beautiful areas. If you are planning on sleeping six on one of the red boats, you will need to all really like each other and have the ability to sleep in close quarters. As it was, we were just the two of us, and it was perfect!

Though these houseboats are a bit dated, everything is in good working order.  Check in was very easy and the staff were very supportive and helpful!  We had 6 people in the 6 person boat,  3 adults and 3 teens.  It was a bit snug, but we made it work.  We had an absolutely great adventure, and can't wait to go back again!

Best girls’ trip ever!! Houseboating is the way to go for a special time with friends or family. Bill was super quick to respond to my questions, the check in process was thorough, friendly, and helpful which set us up for a magical meander through the islands!! We are already planning on doing this again. Great setup to the boat, complete with what you need. A perfect vacation.

Our house boat get away was better than expected! It was a great way to travel and more than comfortable for 4 people... The scenery was beautiful and the Bill was quick to respond to any questions I had. The house boat holiday staff at the marina were great as well, they provided us with all the details before heading off and went out of their way to make sure we knew the routes we were taking. Would def recommend to anyone!

Great family trip. Boat was as we expected - floating RV. Everything was working and in good condition, only bare minimum utensils & pots/pans for cooking. Lots of storage spaces and we really enjoyed the picnic facilities when we docked at the national park islands (fees included with rental) We relied heavily on Navionics app to get us safely through the area, map was provided but we aren't experienced boat people.

description.summary: There is no better way to enjoy the Thousand Islands. Sleeps six (best for four adults and two kids) and comes with fully functional kitchen and bath. Explore the islands. Dock at one of the National Park islands or tuck into a secluded bay. No license required.
description.space: Imagine views all around you. Lots of glass and plenty of room. Boats are 38' feet. We have a couple of boats that sleep 10 and are 48'.  Many customers come back year after year.
description.access: Dock right at Boldt Castle (passport required and no overnight docking) or do some river fishing. We can supply a fishing guide. The national park has 23 islands (many of them close to Gananoque) where you can dock or tie up to a mooring can.
description.notes: AirBnB does not cover insurance on these types of rentals. Insurance is optional but is recommended. The cost is just $10/day. We also require a $200 cash or cheque deposit for gas refill on your return.
description.neighborhood: The 1000 islands is like no other place on earth offering lots of attractions and a spectacular National Park where you can dock or tie up to a mooring can. Or just anchor in a secluded bay.
description.interaction: We pride ourselves in customer service and we're here for you if you have any questions or need some help.
description.house_rules: Rentals are Mon-Fri, Fri-Mon for weekend and midweek. Fri-Fri or Mon-Mon for weekly rentals. Some flexibility in off-peak periods.

What a beautiful home in a picture-perfect setting! We spent all our free moments on the porch taking in the views and catching some fish. Highly recommend this treasure.

We love staying at Lisa' and have already booked for next year! We felt right at home. The cottage is perfect and there is plenty to do in the area. Lisa is always responsive to questions and she even stopped by to say hi.

description.summary:
Beautiful boathouse on the water with a separate bunkhouse with bathroom located on picturesque Lake Bonaparte on the foothills of the Adirondacks.  We have a tandem kayak for use just bring your life jackets.
A new Keurig to make your morning coffee to sit on the front porch and enjoy the loons.
We have all new mattresses throughout, a new grill and bathroom towels are provided.
There is a boat slip available on the side of the boathouse. 
Lake Bonaparte is 40 min from Watertown.

hosts.about: High School Computer Teacher and operate a family owned lake side marina in upstate New York where we rent two log cabins year round and run a general store on the water in the summer months.

recent.comments:
Wow! I am honestly both blown away and heartbroken at the same time, the latter because I had to check out of this beautiful home located in a breathtaking location! 
In Upstste NY, there are quite a few waterfront rentals, but NONE of them compare to this amazing property! I absolutely LOVED how this home is directly on the water! The views from every window are spectacular! 
The home is spotless and decorated so beautifully- both inside and out. We felt right at home for our stay and verything we could have wanted was there. 
Nicole was very quick to respond and incredibly helpful and kind. She made sure everything was perfect for our stay.
We had the perfect birthday getaway here! The water, amazing location, beautiful surroundings, the tranquility and peacefulness of it all made it so we never had to leave! (And we didn't want to either!) 
We definitely want to make the trip here an annual birthday thing, but next year stay for a longer time! Incredible isn't a strong enough word!

items.comments:
Wow! I am honestly both blown away and heartbroken at the same time, the latter because I had to check out of this beautiful home located in a breathtaking location! 
In Upstste NY, there are quite a few waterfront rentals, but NONE of them compare to this amazing property! I absolutely LOVED how this home is directly on the water! The views from every window are spectacular! 
The home is spotless and decorated so beautifully- both inside and out. We felt right at home for our stay and verything we could have wanted was there. 
Nicole was very quick to respond and incredibly helpful and kind. She made sure everything was perfect for our stay.
We had the perfect birthday getaway here! The water, amazing location, beautiful surroundings, the tranquility and peacefulness of it all made it so we never had to leave! (And we didn't want to either!) 
We definitely want to make the trip here an annual birthday thing, but next year stay for a longer time! Incredible isn't a strong enough word!
the cottage is in a beautiful location on the lake and was relaxing and peaceful.
I stayed here for my birthday and it was just gorgeous

I loved it from the minute I walked in.  It was exactly how I imagined it. Beautiful old rustic cottage right on a very small private lake. It was perfect for relaxing, paddle boarding, kayaking and you could fish right off the back deck. I caught a couple of good sized large mouth bass  off the deck. I would definitely go again.

We loved our stay here and would absolutely stay again! The location is great and absolutely beautiful. We had a relaxing, peaceful weekend on the water, went to a local brewery and had the perfect getaway. 

The place itself was clean, spacious for two people and being right on the water was a big bonus!

The Lakeside location is wonderful and the furniture is comfortable. One thing I did not know, but I think people need to know is that the water is not potable. It is piped directly from the lake and that’s what’s in the shower and the faucets so for cooking and brushing teeth you use bottled water. We were also warned about the small septic tank and provided with paper plates and plastic silverware to cut down on water use. This made the kitchen more useful for warming premade meals, sandwiches, cereal, picnic fare but not really a place to do serious cooking . This worked out for us but it is good to be forewarned.

description.summary:
Take it easy at this old fashion lake house and tranquil getaway right on the top of the water.  Meant for 1 - 2 people, no kids, no pets please.

This seasoned cottage sits right on the water's edge with the deck itself directly overtop of the waterfront, perfect for fishing, swimming, boating and sitting outside. The view is all water and the houses along the lake's shore. Enjoy the morning and afternoon sun and there are two single person kayaks. Life jackets by all are required at all times.
description.space: The family friendly DeRuyter Lake General Store is just around the corner by car or a 15 minute walk down the road. The store is open May to October.
description.access: You park right next to the cottage and walk down a set of steps to the deck door. The location is just minutes from walking trials, waterfalls, breweries, vineyards, and more.  The DeRuyter Lake General Store is just on the South end of the lake and a great place to get camp fire wood, snacks, ice, ice cream, T-shirts, etc., and the friendly owners can help you with anything else around the lake.
description.notes: Please plan to bring your own pillows, linens, and towels and bottled water for your stay. There are two full (double) size beds, one in each bedroom. We provide the kitchen dish towels, the bathroom hand towels, dish soap, toilet paper and paper towel.
description.neighborhood: You will be staying right on DeRuyter Lake in beautiful upstate New York. Overlook the lake from the deck, kitchen, and living room windows. Very peaceful surroundings in the country with downtown DeRuyter just three miles away and Highland Forest Park and Trails 4 Miles north. The water in the cottage is drawn from the lake, we cook with it, but we recommend bottled water for drinking. Conserving water usage is good with the tank being lakeside it has limited capacity. Great fishing, the lake is stocked with bass and walleye. At the south end around the corner, you will find the friendly DeRuyter Lake General Store with bait & tackle, ice, candy, ice cream, snacks, firewood, logoed T-shirts & sweatshirts, marine fuel, and other lake items.
description.transit: Park your car, up to two spots, right next to the cottage just off the road, and walk down a set of stairs to the deck door.
description.interaction: Feel free to reach out anytime during your stay right through the Airbnb messaging.
description.house_rules: Open to service dogs, please just ask.

name: Best N Life 2 bedroom  houseboat with scenic views
title: Beaufort, North Carolina

hosts.about: Please call me Wayne

recent.comments: Had a great stay! Great sunset views and fishing right off the back of the boat. Wayne met us and went through everything. Would stay there again for sure.

items.comments: Had a great stay! Great sunset views and fishing right off the back of the boat. Wayne met us and went through everything. Would stay there again for sure.

Wayne’s houseboat was outstanding! Beautiful location, amenities and great view from top deck! Full kitchen, Kuerig and full cookware set. Wayne was a great host and met me at the dock to show me the boat with a nice cart to get my stuff to the boat. He also left muffins, juice and k-cups.

One note on the bed situation. It is bunk over bunk, so whomever has the top bunk has a private room, but that is also where the only bathroom is located and the door with which we entered the boat. That bed is also very high!  So, think fancy royal beds!

The bottom bed is down three stairs from the top bed and the mattress is on the floor (which is why the top bed is high - you’re under the that bed!)  I slept down there and was very cozy!  But I’m glad it was just me and one other female, because of my needing to go into her room to use the bathroom at night.

Just wanted to explain the beds, but we loved everything else about the boat!  We’d both rent it again!

Wayne's place was absolutely perfect. The boathouse had everything we needed. It was very peaceful and the views were stunning. Specifically from the top deck. We sat up there alot and enjoyed the colorful lights and music and the boats passing by. We'll definitely go back.
Wayne was an outstanding host…the houseboat was a great choice and would love it so it again and again…beautiful scenery with a prime location…a thank you for everything!

This was everything we hoped it would be and more! It was so relaxing and beautiful. The bed slept like a cloud and the porch furniture offered a place that you could sleep if you so desired. We will absolutely make this a yearly destination!! Thank you Wayne for sharing your place with us!

Wayne was a great host! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and hope to come back! We enjoyed feeling like family and welcomed to their boat for the weekend. Old Beaufort was an easy walk from the marina too, which we loved.

description.summary: Sunrise on the Stern- sunset on the bow- sit on top of boat to enjoy these views

hosts.about: My name is Walker. I am a southern boy who found this beautiful city of Naples over 15 years ago.  Being an avid water bug, I came up with the idea of sharing my experience of staying on the water with others like you. Walker's Retreat is my home away from home.  Having been in Real Estate since moving here, I would love to give you first hand knowledge of the attractions and things to do here in Naples. From restaurants recommendations, to exciting and fun water activities, entertainment, events, or just chilling out, I would love to direct you. Lets have fun.  Come see me.

recent.comments: Our stay with Walker was an incredible experience. From the moment we met, Walker was extremely helpful, friendly, and accommodating. The views from the boat are beautiful, the accommodations were clean and comfortable, and the location very convenient.  The experience is unique to say the least and we couldn’t be happier with our decision to book with Walker.  We hope to return again and again.

items.comments: Our stay with Walker was an incredible experience. From the moment we met, Walker was extremely helpful, friendly, and accommodating. The views from the boat are beautiful, the accommodations were clean and comfortable, and the location very convenient.  The experience is unique to say the least and we couldn’t be happier with our decision to book with Walker.  We hope to return again and again.

Second stay at Walker’s Retreat - did not disappoint !
* Felt right at home in the marina community - Chickee Bar with music and pool time
*Bike or walk  to downtown Naples 
*easy access to charter boats
*restaurants flanking your ‘boat away from home’
* sunrise and sunset views from the decks …the best !

My wife and I just completed a 7 day stay on Walker’s houseboat on Naples Bay. Wonderful time and a unique experience. We will miss mornings with coffee and evenings on the main outdoor deck with a fantastic bay breeze and peaceful water views. Walker was an attentive and gracious host throughout. For something different I highly recommend it. Easy walking distance to everywhere in downtown Naples. I plan to be back.

We loved our time on Walker’s houseboat in Naples Bay! The accommodation is spacious and beautifully decorated. The upper veranda was our favorite spot from dawn to dusk with ample seating and bay views of both the sunrise and sunset. Walker is a true southern gentleman and by far the most attentive and friendly host. There was so much to do and see within a short distance. Walker even recommended a stunning restaurant for our final evening in Naples. A truly fantastic stay from a couple who have rented Airbnbs from around the world. We look forward to returning soon!
Wonderful experience! Beautiful boat in a beautiful marina! Walker was super attentive and helpful. We hope to be back soon.
Walker is a great host....responsive, friendly, went out of his way to be helpful and personable.

description.summary: Our beautiful 52 foot Houseboat will give you the experience of your life. Located on Naples Bay in downtown Naples, you can walk or bicycle to the beach, 5th Ave, Tin City, and most all the attractions Naples has to offer.  Only Houseboat in Naples.
description.space: This is truly a unique experience.  Staying on the water at the dock in Naples Bay, within walking access to the beautiful beaches, Fifth Ave, Third Street, Tin City and much more.  Two bicycles are provided.  Water taxi comes every hour.  Waterfront restaurants within a stone's throw.  Boat rentals, jet ski,kayaks, paddleboards, and Segway tours are only a few blocks away. Take a cruise with the Naples Princess and experience the many waterfront homes.
description.access: The Houseboat has access to washer, dryer facilities ,swimming pool, three restaurant facilities on premises, lounge chairs, outdoor grill and picnic area.
description.notes:
(Vistabee  Naples ) 900 Broad Ave S for video link.

( Chillin on a Houseboat in Naples) for an article about the Houseboat.
description.neighborhood: Old Naples is the jewel of Florida.  Within walking distance of the Houseboat are some of the nicest homes in Naples with prices ranging up to $80 million in value. Experience Old Naples the unique way.
description.transit: Two bicycles are provided.  Walking distance to beaches, restaurants and shopping.  Cab service is available.  Trolly and Segway tours only blocks away.
description.interaction: I am available for recommendations and suggestions.
description.house_rules: This is a Houseboat located at the Cove Inn Hotel, and although not affiliated directly with the Cove Inn, we abide by their house rules concerning excessive noise, etc.  Rules will be provide upon arrival.

Great stay. Nearby restaurants. Bit of a hike, but could walk to town and beach, take trolley, or rent bikes nearby. Bikes are best way to get around a bridge is very busy when it is nice out.
Super cute place, had the bow of the boat as a private little balcony on the water. Traci and Michael are super accommodating and welcoming hosts. Would recommend over a hotel any night
unique experience in a good location (walking distance to beaches).  Who wouldn't want to sleep in a cabin on a big boat?!  common spaces were great too!  would definitely stay here again.

Would totally recommend for a short stay!  Rooms are very nice and well maintained.  We met a really nice couple while watching the sunset on the top deck, which did not disappoint.  There are no small refrigerators in the rooms which is a bummer but the kitchen is well stocked on the 2nd level.  Will absolutely stay again as you cannot beat the location.

Excellent location. It’s a one of kind experience. Amenities included on the yacht are likely more than what you will receive compared to renting a hotel room. Full kitchen, living room, fridge/freezer, ice machine, top deck patio with amazing view of sunset and bay! You’re skipping a majority of the long traffic line to cross the bridge to enter into Ft. Myers Beach. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. Not too many folks can share that they stayed on a yacht vessel during their stay at Ft. Myers Beach. I’m planning on staying here again soon. Five stars.

description.summary:
Six Toed Cat Master King Cabin 6 & Private Full Bath on Amazing Yacht at Ft Myers Beach. Spacious Owners cabin with gorgeous water views, sitting area, desk and private walk out deck! Close to everything.. water sports, fishing, restaurants and beach activities!
Shared spaces including indoor bar / lounge areas, kitchen galley, living room dining room, outdoor covered cafe deck and a large upper sundeck including horse shoe shaped bar, layout chairs and patio furniture.
description.space:
Private Master King Bed Cabin 6 is aboard The Six Toed Cat, a yacht that just completed a total renovation/ restoration (2020) with 6 bedrooms and 6 baths.  Your private stateroom is conveniently located on the entrance deck. This keeps the stateroom deck  private, away from the remaining common areas of the yacht.  Your stateroom is very large and comfortable with a king bed, hanging closet, dresser, Smart TV, and sitting chair. The Stateroom also has a full baths with full size tub /shower.  Complete with WIFI!
All staterooms come with soap, shampoo, conditioner, iron, ironing board, all the amenities of home!
The common areas are as follows: The main deck has the helm area with cozy seating lounge, a full commercial kitchen (galley), a large full bar, dining area, living room area and a covered outdoor cafe deck.  The upper deck boasts a large horseshoe shaped bar a sitting area and layout chairs. Throughout the boat you will find thoughtful touches and decor that will make you never want to leave!

Need additional cabins? Check out our listings for our other cabins:

>King Cabin 5: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/41799544
>King Cabin 4: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/41801727
>King Cabin 3: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/41802242
>King Cabin 2: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/41815158
>Full Cabin 1: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/41815991
description.access: When not in your cabin, enjoy the shared spaces including indoor bar / lounge areas, living room and dining room, outdoor covered cafe deck and a large upper sundeck including horse shoe shaped bar, layout chairs and patio furniture.
description.notes: There is a boarding ramp that can be steep at low tide. Also there is a single small entry step on the main entry level and full stairs to the middle and upper decks.
description.neighborhood: 20-25 minute walk to Ft Myers Beach. Two minutes to Pinchers, Nauti Parrot or Maria's Seafood. Seafood vendor on site!
description.transit: Free trolly two doors down. Uber or short walk/ bike ride to the beach.
description.interaction: Always available
description.house_rules:
No Smoking on the Boat. There is a dock area for smoking behind boat.
Parties allowed only with pre approval  and additional fees.
The Middle Deck closes at 11pm (Entire Yacht bookings Excluded).
The upper Deck  is open 24 hours (subject to Ft Myers Beach Code of conduct rules).
No  unregistered guests on board without owner approval.

recent.comments: MaggiJo was awesome! What an adventure with lovely views and lots of fun! The place is clean and surroundings are gorgeous. Hope to stay again!

items.comments: MaggiJo was awesome! What an adventure with lovely views and lots of fun! The place is clean and surroundings are gorgeous. Hope to stay again!
Kevin was great. Very quiet and relaxing.

The pictures didn't represent that you had to go down narrow windy stairs to get to the two beds.  might be difficult for seniors.  it was a very isolated area.  Also a terrible smell from the papermill that's in the area..  Kevin was out of town for truck repairs so his wife Karen did her best in explaining the features of the houseboat.  She was delightful and even gave us her phone number just in case we had any questions.
Thank you

Serene surroundings, quiet, and relaxing. The houseboat was clean and had all amenities one could reasonably wish for. 
Kevin was a chill but always available host.

Awesome, I Brought My Kids For There Christmas Surprise And They Absolutely Loved It. Kevin Is Indeed A Great Host And It Was A Pleasure Talking With Him And Visiting Again, I Will Definitely Bring The Kids Again When It's Warmer To Do Some Fishing, Again Thanks For The Great Hospitality Kevin And Happy New Year
Peaceful,Friendly and Enjoyable, Kevin is an awesome host for whom I enjoyed working with, definitely had a great time and plan to return in the near future

description.summary:
Maggie Jo is a 37’ completely restored houseboat located just up river from Winyah Bay . Come enjoy all the Grand Strand has to offer. Start by fishing , use the 2 kayaks  or relax on the boat . Go downtown Georgetown and eat, shop or take one of the boat tours  out to the lighthouse.
Georgetown is on the south end of the Grand Strand. Just head North to Myrtle Beach ,35 miles away or head south to Charleston 55 miles away. This is a great location to enjoy 3 great South Carolina Cities !
description.space: Maggie Jo is immaculate inside, cold air, 3 decks ,rental comes  use of 2 tandem kayaks and gear. The river is so peaceful, the wildlife is plentiful and the sun rise and sets are unbelievable .
description.access:
Maggie Jo is fully equipped with anything  everything . Complete cook ware to make any meal. Blender, wine glasses corkscrew. Cook inside or on the grill. Alway super clean , plenty of extra linens . 
Enjoy the deck , watch some tv go for a kayak ride , catch a fish or just enjoy the scenery
description.notes: Maggie Jo sits on a tidal river so  when using kayaks , keep that in mind of which way you want to go.
description.neighborhood:
The marina is in a private community so please take caution while coming in or out.
CHILDREN AT PLAY
description.transit: Parking is free at the marina . There are picnic tables, charcoal grill and a fire pit at the head of the docks
description.interaction:
Me or my wife like to meet our guest at the boat. There a couple simple functions different from a house. Typically how to turn on propane tanks and valve for cooking and go over kayak use . I am almost alway available to answer questions or give suggestions . 
If we don’t meet , that’s no problem I can walk you through any function very easily!
description.house_rules: Your safety is my #1 goal. Friendfield Marina and Maggie Jo are meticulously maintained  for that reason. It is still over water and it is your responsibility to protect yourselves from any accidents on docks, boat and kayaks! The steps going into galley and aft berth have tall risers , so you must be careful!!! All children are welcome, children under 12 must wear life jackets on decks or docks!!! All children must have constant supervision being over water!!! Life jackets are monitory for everyone using kayaks!!!

recent.comments: Amanda was an amazing Host, very flexible with check in. She was extremely attentive during our whole stay. Kept checking up to see if we needed anything. Description  and pictures of the house were spot on. No surprises. Very large house with lots of rooms and space for larger families. Lots of amenities and extras in the boat house , very nice to not have to bring all the floats and chairs for the stay. We would definitely look into staying here again!!! Thank you again Amanda for everything.

items.comments: Amanda was an amazing Host, very flexible with check in. She was extremely attentive during our whole stay. Kept checking up to see if we needed anything. Description  and pictures of the house were spot on. No surprises. Very large house with lots of rooms and space for larger families. Lots of amenities and extras in the boat house , very nice to not have to bring all the floats and chairs for the stay. We would definitely look into staying here again!!! Thank you again Amanda for everything.

Amanda was an exceptional host and the house was perfect for my family. We had an unexpected situation come up at home and Amanda let us check in early which was a huge help. Everyone from my 88 year old mother in law to my 9 year old son was comfortable in the home. First floor bedrooms and bath were convenient. The game room was a perfect getaway for the kids on the rainy day. The best part was no steps to the lake! We would stay again!
Great location and big house.  Exactly as described.  Clear instructions.  No issues.  Easy 5 star property.  Would stay there again.

House is just as described.   Large rooms and open spaces.  Stocked kitchen for cooking meals.  Beautiful large backyard and great views of the lake.  Our multi-generational group had a great time.   The house met everyone's  needs regardless of age.  We had no issues preparing and cooking a Thanksgiving dinner in the kitchen.   If we find ourselves in the area again.  We will definitely come back to make more great family memories.

Really had a great time at this property. Plenty of room inside for our family of 5 couples (12 total people). Kitchen and family room made for easy gatherings. The basement makes for a great gaming area. Not to mention all the room outside in the backyard. Perfect place to kick back and unwind.

WOW what an incredible trip! Amanda was an amazing host, she even left customized welcome gifts for us! My friends and I had the best time celebrating my 30th birthday. We spent most of our time on the dock or on the expansive lawn. The boat house was well stocked with floaties and chairs, and there were plenty of paddle boards for us to cruise around on as well. 

The house was perfect for our large group and I would not hesitate to come back in the future!

description.summary:
This 4,400 sq foot lake house has 5 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms, 2 car garage, and a large basement- so there is plenty of room for everyone!  

It has many places on site to relax and unwind!  Whether you are drinking coffee in the sun room, relaxing on the couch, spending time together in the kitchen and dining room, sipping wine and grilling out on the patio, playing games in the basement, or enjoying the water, this house is your home away from home!  There is truly something for everyone!
description.space: Our lake house sleeps at least 12 people with its 2 King, 2 Queen, 2 Full, and 1 Twin size beds.  There is option for additional people on couches or room to accommodate air mattresses.  Open kitchen floor plan.  Large back patio to relax and watch the kids play in the huge backyard! Its full basement brings plenty of entertainment with a pool table, air hockey table, ping pong table, and board games!  Fast (600MB) Wi-Fi, YouTube TV, and Disney Plus are also available!  Perhaps its best feature is the flat walkway to the boathouse- a rare find at Hyco Lake!
description.access: If you want to venture out, this house has easy access to the freeway to get to the Virginia International Racetrack, Roxboro, Danville, Semora, Milton, Durham and other local towns.  The property is also close to a boat ramp, boat shop, marina, and a convenient store.

description.summary: Tired of staying in the same old stuffy boring hotel room? So were we so we decided to own our own Houseboat on the Tennessee River, where we could walk to just about everything. The “Moonlight Madness” is docked at  Volunteer Landing Marina in Knox. The marina is steps away from award winning “Ruth’s Chris” steakhouse and Calhoun’s On the River. We provide free parking pass, golf cart, 2 kayaks, 1 SUP, 2 cruiser bikes.  We're in a covered slip but you can sun bath off the stern deck.
description.space: Tired of staying in the same old stuffy boring hotel room? So were we, so we decided to own our own Houseboat on the Tennessee River, where we could walk to just about everything. The “Moonlight Madness” is docked in the peaceful Volunteer Landing Marina in Knoxville. The marina is steps away from award winning “Ruth’s Chris” steakhouse and Calhoun’s On the River. You can walk to both as well as the Neyland Greenway, James White Greenway, Neyland Stadium, Thompson-Boling arena, University of Tennessee and the vibrant Market Street in Downtown Knoxville. We can accommodate 6 people in beds. We have 2 bedrooms, one king size bed in the master and a Full bed in the crew quarters and a queen size pull out couch, along with 2 bathrooms. We feature 3 decks, one off the bow, one off the stern (great for morning coffee or sun bathing ) and a 70' PARTY DECK on the roof. The party deck has abundant seating along with 2 flatscreen HD television and a gas grill. The master also has a 40' Vizio UHD flatscreen with Smartcast. The salon also has a 50' UHD flatscreen. Our boat comes fully stocked with clean linens and towels. The galley also comes fully stocked with dishes, utensils and small appliances along with Hi-Speed internet. You will meet a lot of very nice people that reside at the marina full time. Also, we have a EZGO golf cart and 2 Kayaks, 1 SUP and 2 beach cruiser bikes that are available for you to use while at our boat. Sorry but the Houseboat doesn't leave the marina slip however you can rent an easy to drive pontoon boat from the marina.
description.access: You will have full use of the boat space.  We provide 2 parking passes for game days.
description.neighborhood: Walk almost everywhere form the Marina
description.transit: You can walk, use our golf cart or ride one of our 2 cruiser bikes.

description.summary: Welcome to the Ledges Resort & Marina! We are located on the St. Lawrence River across from Boldt Castle and Sunken Rock Lighthouse. We have ten cottages of various sizes spread throughout the property. Six acres of landscaped grounds and gardens wander along the river for your enjoyment. We have decks, hammocks, and gazebos along the water. The large in-ground pool is newly renovated. Each cottage has their own firepit with Adirondak chairs, and we provide firewood for free!
description.space:
High speed Wi-Fi is in every cottage and throughout the grounds. Each cottage has an outdoor dining area and gas grill. There are plenty of open lawn areas to play catch, yard games, or just take a walk.

Canoes and kayaks are available to Ledges guests at no charge. We have Boston Whaler and pontoon boat rentals on site. We also offer guided scenic tours in an antique wooden boat! Or if you want to bring your own boat, dockage for up to a 25' boat is included with the Harbor House. If you need a larger dock slip they are available for $2 per foot/per night. Dock slips include power and water hook-ups. We have plenty space to park your boat trailer, and there are three free public launch ramps within one mile of us.

Each cottage is fully prepped and stocked with anything you would need. All beds are made up with fresh sheets, blankets, and comforters. The bathrooms are set with fresh bath towels, hand towels, wash clothes, a bathmat, and luxury toiletries. The kitchens have everything you need including pots, pans, silverware and dishes. They have a micowave, drip-coffee maker, toaster, blender, and tea kettle. You will also find kitchen basics like dish soap, tin foil, dish sponges, paper towels, salt, pepper, and other items.

From The Ledges it is an easy one mile walk to the center of downtown Alexandria Bay. You will have easy access to shopping, dining, tours, parks, and attractions. There is a new public playground right on our street. Downtown you fill find scenic view park. It has a public beach for river swimming, a playground, and a large pavilion on the water. With our location and six acres of private grounds we offer a level of peace, space, and privacy that you won’t find at a hotel. At the Ledges you have the best of both worlds, relaxation and convenience!

The Ledges is a dog friendly resort. We do require dogs to be kept on a leash at all times, be cleaned up after, and kept off all furniture. Owners must be responsible and make sure their dogs do not cause noise or disturbances to other guests. There is a $35 per night/per dog fee. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This listing is for the Harbor House. It is a three bedroom, two bath home. It is actually a floating cottage! If you have your own boat or rent one you can tie it up right in front of your living room! There is a deck all the way around the cottage on the lower level. The master bedroom has a balcony with a view of Boldt Caste.  The deck is a great place to fish or just relax and enjoy the river.  

Upstairs:  The master bedroom has a queen size bed. The balcony has a spectacular view of the Boldt Castle and Sunken Rock Lighthouse. The second bedroom upstairs has two queen beds. The upstairs bathroom has a stand-up shower.

Downstairs: There is a large entryway. This leads to the downstairs bedroom, bathroom, and living room/kitchen. The downstairs bedroom has a double bed. The downstairs bathroom has a full tub and shower. The living area is combined with the kitchen. The kitchen features a full size stove with oven, full-size refrigerator/freezer, microwave, coffee maker, and dishwasher. It has all new cooking utensils, pots, pans, glasses, and dishes. There is a dining table with seating for six with another outdoor dining table on the deck. The living room offers a beautiful view of the river.  There are French-doors that open up to the deck.
description.access: We have plenty of parking on site. If you are bringing your own boat we have trailer parking available. There is a free public boat launch less than a mile from us. We have six acres of landscaped grounds where you can walk, fish, ship-watch, and relax. We have a large in-ground pool area for our guests. We have easy access to everything in The Thousand Islands. There is a playground with a basketball court on our street. The public golf course is less than a mile from us. There is a neighborhood grocery store at the end of our street. You can hire a fishing guide that will pick you up in their boat right at our dock! We also have boat rentals available at The Ledges. Downtown Alexandria Bay is also easily walkable from The Ledges Resort for shopping, restaurants, boat tours, a public beach, and lots more!
description.notes:
