This cottage includes dockage for up to a 25' boat free of charge. If you need dockage for a larger or additional boat it is $2 per foot/per night.

Downtown Alexandria Bay is also easily walkable from The Ledges Resort for shopping, restaurants, boat tours, a public beach, and lots more!

hosts.about:
I live to innovate and develop building and lifestyle techniques that enable our labor to yield healthy water, food, shelter and energy using as little resource as possible. An ever aspiring minimalist, artist through and through, dreamer and mover. Always asking questions and looking to explore what's going on! Passionate about mud (of all kinds), treks in the forests and hills, and good company.

My home is an eccentric work of art, renovated purposefully to accomodate your AirBnB experience. 

I live only with my plants, am an avid sprouter, and have an awesome vermiculture setup that ties it all together in an urban permaculture way.

All questions welcomed..

My name is Bonnie and I am the captain and co-captain of the River Den, the River Zen, The Nellie, The Dragon and the Cove (4 season chalet).  

 I'm the daughter of a québécois log driver and I grew up on the river in Low Qc, driving boats and living on islands. I am passionate about artistic building  and designing dens. My current project is the completion of an island meditation retreat on the island of Oddiyana.

I have been an entrepreneur since the age of 19 and plan on continuing to explore my creativity through inspiring and creative business endeavours of designing and creating sacred spaces fit for kings and queens.

description.summary:
The Dragon is a 4-season houseboat moored at a private island in Manitou bay off the Gatineau River, accessed by boating 800m from our home parking. For winter, it returns to freeze into the ice 30m from our home parking, allowing access via foot.

In summer, the island will be yours alone, offering a unique opportunity to reconnect with nature and a loved one! The Dragon has solar power, as well as a propane cookstove, fridge and fireplace. 

We provide several boat-in options described below:
description.space:
'The Dragon' is an artisanal 4 season houseboat designed and built by a pirate in Wakefield, Qc. The boat now rests at a private island, along side a 40' dock on the Paugan reservoir of the Gatineau River, in the Manitou Bay. In the winter months, she is stationed 30m from our mainland home (in the ice!) to remain accessible throughout the year.

The living space is 24'x10' open concept, with patio doors on all sides, a propane fireplace for winter coziness, running water in the warm months, a mini fridge and 3 burner propane stove. 

There is a queen size Ikea foam futon, with linens and towels provided. We also provide drinking water in 18L jugs.

There is a full size rooftop deck created for sunbathing and stargazing, a swimming ladder, and an outdoor metal fire bowl on the front patio, in the chest of the Dragon!

On the island there is an outdoor compost toilet. In winter you can use the bucket toilet in the boat, or place the bucket toilet on either exterior deck for use outside the main cabin. If our main house "Manitou Cove" is not rented during your visit you can use the shared basement bathroom with typical sink, toilet, and shower. Please ask us via Airbnb messaging if you are curious if you can use the house bathroom.

The island belongs to our friend and we ask that you treat the space like the sanctuary that it is, refraining from removing any natural vegetation or making fires.

There is plenty of wildlife to keep you company; blue herons, loons, beavers, ducks, bald head eagles, geese, deer, and on...

There is off grid 12V solar electricity for lights, sink pump and a USB charging port, but no 120V AC electricity. 

There are essential kitchen utensils, plates, and cookware. Please inquire if you have particular requests.

There is good cell reception including data!

We welcome all questions~


Please choose from one of the following options for getting to the boat:

A) 0$ extra: Bring your own motor boat or canoe to access the Dragon. Motor boats launch from one of two public boat launches 10km away. IF YOU ARE COMING WITH YOUR OWN CANOE OR NON-MOTORIZED BOAT, you are welcome to park at our home boat launch 800m from the Dragon. We provide a map via digital image.

B) 50$ extra: Park at our home and rent our canoe.  We provide a map to the Dragon via digital image, as well as a labeled laminated map and compass in the canoe. It is around 800m or a 15-25 minute paddle from our parking to the Dragon.

C) 120$ extra: Park at our home and book a round trip ferry ride on one of our motor boats, and rent our canoe for use during your stay. We coordinate a meeting time at our waterfront home parking, and drive you to the Dragon in one of our motor boats, leave you with a canoe, map and compass, and arrange a pickup time to come back and get you at the end of your stay.

hosts.about: Downtown Augusta is where we decided to land, not only to reside but also to start our two businesses. One focusing on hospitality and the other on outdoor recreation. Our passion for Augusta and the outdoors shows in each of our properties in their own unique way and sometimes where you least expect it. We know what to do, where to eat and what to see here in the city so feel free to ask if you need some ideas. Other than outdoor recreation, we love to spend time with our two fur babies, keeping up with our backyard plants and volunteering time to a variety of different organizations around town. We’re excited to meet you and welcome you to one of our properties!

description.summary: The spacious Savannah Rea is docked first at the 5th Street Marina, just steps away from Downtown Augusta! Sitting directly on the Savannah River, the houseboat provides gorgeous views from inside your corridors or from one of three outdoor spaces including the 700 sq.ft. rooftop deck.
description.space:
Bow and stern outdoor patios have seating for four and provide exceptional views of the Savannah River from sunrise to sunset. There is a charcoal grill on the back patio. 

Rooftop deck has a 360’ view which includes views of Downtown Augusta, The Augusta Riverwalk, the iconic 1912 Southern Railroad Bridge and lastly, Augusta’s newest attraction, the Freedom Pedestrian Bridge. 

Inside, the wet bar ties the living room, kitchen and dining area all together in one open space. The couch in the living room folds out to a full sized bed, high top table sits four, kitchen has microwave and refrigerator/freezer (THE STOVE/OVEN, DISHWASHER AND TRASH COMPACTOR ARE OUT OF USE) and wet bar has built-in ice-maker and countertop k-cup coffee maker. Behind the closet doors in the kitchen you’ll find a full use stacked washer/dryer with detergent and whitening pods which are under the sink. 

Large bathroom has full sized walk in shower, high end marine toilet, three shelf vanity. 

Queen sized bedroom has fantastic large windows and back sliding glass door with back patio access. Multi-functional built in desk has plugs for computer charging. Left hand closet has robes, grilling accessories and vacuum.

The houseboat is cooled by a mini-split A/C system which includes two separate wall units, one in the living room and another in the bedroom. 

The marina has a public Wi-Fi network which can be connected to throughout the houseboat.
description.access:
The entire inside and outside of the houseboat are open for use. 

We offer early check-in (12 NOON) and late check-out (1PM) for $35/occurrence. Availability is based on a first pay/first service basis and may not be available in all cases. ( i.e. guest pays $35 for a 1PM late check out, there would be no option for the next guest to pay $35 for an early 12 NOON check-in. ) We recommend that you request either or both when sending your initial introduction message upon booking.
description.notes:
We don’t want any surprises when you arrive so these are the things to expect. 

GLAMPING - The only difference between the houseboat and a camper is the ground beneath, or lack there of. We throw the “Glam” in because this is glamping at its finest. 

SAVANNAH RIVER - We see many different species of wildlife both in and out of the water. Insects, reptiles, birds and fish will all make a presence here on the river. We spray the outside of the boat to minimize insects from intruding your space. Keeping the windows closed and closing the doors behind you, especially in the summer months will also help tremendously. 

FISHING - We do not supply any fishing gear but Walmart (less than 10 minutes away) has a full fishing department. Fishing is ONLY allowed off the boat itself, not the dock. Visit Georgia’s Department of Natural Resources website to purchase a fishing license and to read all rules and regulations before casting your line. 

MARINE TOILET - We have a zero tolerance policy for any kind of waste to enter the river. The toilet used on the boat is very high end and is nearly identical to the one used at your home. We supply the bathroom with marine grade toilet paper which is the only thing besides waste that should be flushed. A $400 charge applies to any waste system failure that is caused by any prohibited object or thing you flush. 

SECURITY CAMERAS - We have a Ring security system installed throughout the dock space to monitor our kayaking business, specifically the kayaks themselves, our storage spaces, the gas pump and the associated dock space. It records 120 seconds of both video and audio when it detects any motion. THIS MEANS THAT EACH TIME YOU, ADDITIONAL GUESTS OR VISITORS PASS THROUGH, YOU/THEY WILL BE RECORDED. 

PETS & ADDITIONAL GUESTS - We love fur babies! We have two of our own and they go with us everywhere we go! As long as they are accounted for on the reservation, we would love for your pup(s) to stay aboard. PLEASE BE AWARE THAT THE ENTIRE PERIMETER OF THE HOUSEBOAT HAS OPEN RAILINGS AND FIVE ENTRY/EXIT POINTS THAT ONLY HAVE A ROPE ACROSS THEM. DO NOT LEAVE THEM UNATTENDED WHILE OUTSIDE. We TOTALLY GET that accidents happen when dogs are in spaces that they are not used to. We'll say this again, WE TOTALLY GET IT. Please send us a message via AirBnB Inbox if there are any bathroom accidents and/or stomach accidents that occur so we can make sure they are attended to right away. Like many others, we do not enjoy foul smells and/or stains on carpets or linens so we would like to ask you for a few minutes while you are on-board for us to shampoo rugs and/or change any linens out if they are spoiled in anyway.  NO OTHER TYPE OF PET IS ALLOWED ONBOARD. We encourage you to invite any friends or family aboard during your stay but ask you to send us a message via AirBnB Inbox to give us a heads up if there will be a total of 5 or more people (max 10) on the boat at any given time. Only the amount of guests that are associated with your reservation are allowed to spend the night.
description.neighborhood:
The marina property is a well-lit space that accommodates the general public 24 hours a day. Parking is free throughout for both visitors and residents and has handicap spaces that are designated by sign. You will notice that the terrace in front of the gift shop has open seating for the public to use. 

The dock space that the houseboat is docked at, is the same dock space that we run our kayaking business on so you will more than likely see us at some point during your stay!
description.transit:
15 MINUTE DRIVE TO AUGUSTA NATIONAL GOLF COURSE

Parking - Free and open! Once you’ve entered the marina, you’ll make your way to the parking lot at the bottom of the hill. You’ll see the Riverside Cafe’ food truck and 5th Street Marina gift shop. 

Ridesharing - Uber and Lyft are both available throughout the entire Augusta metropolitan area. 

Downtown Access - Easily get to any of Downtown Augusta with a few steps, or a less than five-minute drive. The Riverwalk starts under the railroad bridge, follows the GORGEOUS Savannah River and ends at 10th Street. There is an upper and lower trail, the upper is much easier to walk (except climbing the staircase) and is recommended to use at nighttime. The lower is more of a walking trail but allows you to see our rivers unique wildlife up close. DO NOT ENTER THE WATER FROM THE RIVERWALK AND DO NOT FEED THE WILDLIFE.
description.interaction: We prefer to communicate through the AirBnB app and usually respond to any inquiries within 15 minutes. If you need us immediately feel free to call!
description.house_rules: No guests and/or visitors 12 years old are permitted on the houseboat. No one is permitted to be on the section of the rooftop deck that covers the lower front porch. No jumping off the boat into the river.

description.summary: The brand new, contemporary, 200 square foot boathouse, sits directly over water - you can actually hear the gentle sounds of the water beneath you. Amazing water views can be seen out of the two 8x8 foot sliding doors. There is a queen sized bed, small couch, kitchenette and mini split with heat/AC in the living space.
description.space:
The boathouse is located in our backyard and we have neighbors on both sides.  There is no running water (although water is supplied). The boat garage side of the boathouse has a private bathroom with composting toilet, and has no heat or AC, however you don’t need to leave the boathouse to use it. There is a functional outdoor shower and sink under the main house. 

If you can handle the above, this space is for you. It truly is glamping (glamourous camping) at its finest. Once in the boathouse it feels like a quiet retreat and as if you have the whole lake to yourself.  You are also more than welcome to use our canoe.

Please note, smoking is not allowed in the house or on the premises.

You can find us on Insta @thelittleblueboathouse 

Dogs and thru-hikers:

** A note about dogs: Unfortunately, at this time, we are not allowing dogs. Jack, our English Cream Golden Retriever, lives here and will want to play with your dog. All. Day. Long. It is also very easy for a dog to escape the backyard by swimming over to the neighbors house. The neighbors have four cats and we want to be sure to respect their privacy.

***Thru-hikers: A discounted stay is available to those thru-hiking the Palmetto Trail.
description.access: The dock, the boathouse, the boat garage, the enclosed area under the main house, the backyard...
description.neighborhood:
Lake Lanier is a private, 140 acre lake and is one of the best kept secrets of the Upstate. Nestled directly in between Asheville and Greenville, the boathouse is five minutes from beautiful Tryon, NC, 15 minutes to downtown Landrum, SC and 25 minutes to the Tryon International Equestrian Center.

Bring your bike and ride the 5-mile lake loop, or for the advanced rider, ride up Hogback Mountain or up the Saluda Grade and down the watershed and back. Down the road, is fantastic hiking at the Blue Wall Preserve/Palmetto Trail. You could also paddle our canoe around the peaceful 140-acre lake or simply relax and enjoy the stillness and quiet of true lakefront living.
description.transit: There is enough parking for ONE vehicle only.
description.interaction: Feel free to text or email me with any questions or concerns.

There is only one parking space available for guests.

The upper porch is a great place to have breakfast or enjoy sunset views in the evening. 

There are two queen beds in the unit, both with attached bathrooms and televisions. Great place to stay as a couple!

You will be living the "sweet life" on this modern, impeccably built and designed houseboat that offers all the amenities of home, including two living spaces, a gourmet kitchen, two beds, two baths, designer furnishings, and a deck to enjoy the sunsets on the Cape Fear River. Close to everything! Enjoy an onsite restaurant and entertainment pier, where concerts and festivals are held. Stroll the Riverwalk for scenic views, shopping, restaurants, and entertainment.

recent.comments:
We had an amazing local getaway for a kid-free couples weekend at this incredibly charming and surprisingly spacious houseboat. It is just like the pictures and description say but somehow felt more spacious once we were inside and was such a fun experience! It was exactly what we expected based on the description. 
It was a hot day when we came and I was a little worried if it would feel hot on the boat but the window ac unit was great at keeping the place cool and we felt extremely comfortable for sleeping (really comfy bed, with enough pillows for us too!) we also had a pretty big rainstorm the first night we were on the boat but felt totally great during the storm- it was actually very peaceful and a great atmosphere. Kelly’s instructions for where to park and how to get in were super clear and helpful and she was super responsive when we had a few questions after checking in. We’re so grateful for an amazing experience! Can’t wait to come back!

Had such a great time on the houseboat, it was Perfect for my weekend stay! KJ was a great host, and the local small beer garden with woodfired pizza and live music was a huge bonus. Also, waking up and taking the (free) kayak out for a morning paddle was a great way to start the day. Began on the water, and finished the day soaking in the sunset with a cold beer on the rooftop of the boat. Definitely staying here again next time I’m in town!!
Super cute place to stay for a few days. The location was great: kayaking, lots of restaurants,  and close to the city. Neat experience for the kids.

wonderful place for a peaceful outdoor getaway. it was a really unique experience to stay on a boat and have direct access to kayaks and sups! definitely read the entire description as this property is for the more adventurous. if you are comfortable with the coziness of a boat then this place is for you

We enjoyed our stay. It was cozy and perfect for my husband and I. Kelly made sure that we read the description carefully. There are steps leading to the float that could be difficult for some people. We wished we could have enjoyed the top deck but it rained during our stay. The back deck is partially covered so we got to enjoy the river view a bit. There was everything we needed on the boat.

What a totally unique experience! Approaching the houseboat, it’s as advertised. Upon entering, it’s better. Comfortable accommodations and total climate control allowed me to enjoy my surroundings. Clear operating instructions thoughtfully placed throughout the houseboat make some of the quirks of the mechanicals a nonissue. There are also 3 separate sleeping areas! Book this property and enjoy a memorable weekend or getaway.

description.summary: Come Glamp with us on our tiny 1972 Nautline houseboat located on the beautiful Allegheny River.  We are in Verona, PA, a little river town about 10.7 miles upriver from Downtown Pittsburgh.  Enjoy a complementary kayak, paddle board or canoe rental to enjoy the river.  Create your own river adventure to Sycamore Island, or Plum Creek to explore or just take it easy and hang out on the houseboat and enjoy a dip in the Allegheny to cool off.  Enjoy the sunset on the top deck.
description.space:
This boat may not be suitable for people who are tall. I’ve had a guest with a tall husband, he complained of low ceilings.

IMPORTANT: This boat is down a flight of 12 plus stairs down to the dock. It is not a good fit if you have trouble going up and down stairs.  The dock rocks back and forth from the wake of other boats. If you have trouble with balance this would not be a good fit. There are no railings on the dock.  If you get sea sick this would not be a good fit. The boat does rock back n forth with wake when boats pass. Sometimes this can be little bit and sometimes this can be a lot. 

The Nautaline named Oolikhanna  is situated on the Allegheny River. The name Allegheny comes from a local tribe called Lenape. The word, welhik hane or Oolikhanna,  which means "best flowing river of the hills" or "beautiful stream".  

It is not unusual to spy a blue heron, bald eagles or even a beaver or a turtle among other river inhabitants. We have enjoyed walking along sandy beaches of the Allegheny collecting treasures of the river both natural and man made.

Note:  Please pack Lightly, like you are camping. Large luggage is not a good fit when carrying down the stairs and rolling it on the dock.  Please do not bring items of great value. Things do fall in the water!  If you bring a computer or a phone be extra cautious with them because accidents can happen. 

Noise & Marina Activity 
This an active Marina. We have a Kayak, Sup and Canoe Rental business that runs thru out the week. There are other boats in the Marina that will be your neighbor. We have events Friday, Saturday and Sunday with live music, brewery/distilleries, and food trucks. Typically music ends by 9.  Check out the events @ 10.7 Marina. 

There is a train across the river that is on the loud side. It varies on time that it comes by. 

We have rowing teams that are often out on the river early in the am. They may be loud do to the mega phone that they use.

Please be ADVISED there are 17 stairs down to boat! And it is advised to pack lately it is a small boat with many stairs down to it.
description.access: Guest will have access to river, rental equipment, marina terrace and houseboat.
description.notes: This an active marina with many activities going on during the week and weekend.
description.neighborhood:
Verona is a quaint neighborhood with a few restaurants, a coffee shop two breweries and a cider house and meadery  All within walking distance of the marina.

Oakmont is our neighboring community with many yummy restaurants and shops that can be accessed with a 3 min car ride or 15 min bike ride. Oakmont is walking community.
description.transit: There is one reserved parking space at the marina for one vehicle, however street parking is usually available .
description.interaction: We are available during normal waking hours to assist with any questions or needs that arise.
description.house_rules:
Must be 21 to book. 
No Parties, small gatherings allowed if communicated with host. 
No smoking in the houseboat. 
Please clean up after yourself: move furniture back where it was originally, pick up trash on and around boat...etc. 
Put all trash in trash bag and set by door .
Put wet towels in shower stall.
Close all windows upon leaving!!!
Clean and wash all dishes.
No jumping off the top of the boat.
If swimming wear a life vest. 
If you accidentally damage something please just let us know.

I loved the little private deck with table and chairs so you to sit and look out at the water. There is even a suggested itinerary! Reliable Wi-Fi for remote working!

your boatel is super super cool. one of my best AirBNB experiences (of 70+)

description.summary: Our floating tiny home was designed to give our guest a memorable experience on the water that is centrally located in Jacksonville. During your stay you'll get to enjoy your time drinking coffee at sunrise, kayaking the river, taking naps in the hammocks, and dinning out in Riverside, Avondale or San Marco in one our cities best restaurants and breweries!
description.space:
Our floating tiny home is a converted pontoon boat that is docked at our home. The inside has the amenities of a tiny home featuring: a full bath, Keurig, fridge stocked with drinks, microwave, full size bed, TV and wifi. The floating tiny home will have a relaxing rock from time to time with nearby boat traffic, it's a great addition to the relaxing experience. 

Centrally Located: You'll be 5 minutes to Riverside and Downtown, 20 minutes to the airport, and 30 to the beaches.

Experience the Water: We have two kayaks and two paddle boards available during your stay. Feel free to catch a quick paddle at sunrise or sunset. Bring a fishing pole along with you for the ride and you might catch a bass or catfish.
description.access: Guest limit is two people max. Kids are welcome, but be mindful you are staying on floating tiny home. There is no room for a pack and play.
description.notes:
We designed our guidebook that is available in the boat to give you our favorite recommendations for nearby dining out and places to visit. We even created a perfect day in Jacksonville itinerary for you from breakfast to dinner to save you the work of deciding where to eat and visit. 

We can't wait to meet and host you for your stay at our floating tiny home. We hope it will be a memorable and relaxing experience.
description.neighborhood: The floating tiny home is docked in our backyard on the Cedar River which is a smaller river that flows into the Ortega/St. Johns River. We are in a quiet neighborhood right outside of our cities urban core neighborhoods.
description.transit: There are two places you can park while you stay with us. You can either park on the street in front of our house or in the far left space in our driveway.
description.interaction: We live on the property full time, so we are available as much or little as needed.

title: Cocoa Beach, Florida

The dock is a nice little area with friendly neighbors and a bar and restaurant right on it. Mya, the dock doggie, was a cutie just moseying around when we woke up in the morning. The only flaw we encountered was that the AC doesn’t really cool the boat enough, especially when the sun is out. They were kind enough to provide us with a fan after we asked for one though.

awesome stay good fun

Unusable at check in as it was very hot.  At night without the sun beating down and all closed up got very cool.  It had one power strip for electric and one desk lamp. Public bathroom next to the bar was unusable someone threw up all over.  Sorry I don’t like leaving unfavorable reviews. Small sail boat not for me.
Great stay. Fun and affordable option for those who are on a tight budget and like to be busy during the day!
Great stay! Will be back

I love to travel, and the Hemingway Hideout is one of the neatest places I've stayed. It's beyond worth the rate. It's by a lot of different restaurants, coffee, surf shops, and close to the beach (within walking distance). People nearby in the marina were very kind as well, which made the experience so much dreamier. Big bonus - the sailboat stayed perfectly cool the entire time. Definitely stay here if you're considering it! Bring people you're comfortable being in a snug space with.

description.summary: Get the best sleep you've ever enjoyed while you gently rock to sleep aboard our comfortable Hunter 27' Sailboat. This boat was abandoned and then re-habbed into the perfect little floating hotel for up to 5. Docked in a gorgeous marina... Sit in the cock-pit and imagine you are sailing the seven seas on your next vacation. The vessel is equipped with a little extras too like electric and air conditioning. No bathroom on board, but marina bathrooms are only a short walk from your dockage!
description.space: This accommodation is a lot like camping on water. We have bath towels available at the marina upon request. Fitted sheets and blankets on board for sleeping.This sailboat comes with a little extras though like air conditioning and electricity. Please note that there is no head on board and all  bathroom/shower usage is provided by the marina facilities that are open 24/7 and maintained daily. The boat is not a pretty one  on the outside but is very comfortable and well kept on the inside.
description.access: There is plenty of parking on site and our location is walking distance to lots of Cocoa Beach attractions like Ron Jon Surf Shop, The Beach, Kayak/SUP Rental Places, Restaurants, and more!
description.notes:
Staying on a boat is more about the adventure then glamor. If you're looking for mints under your pillows please book the Hilton instead. 
Our boats are old but well maintained and comfortable for thier age. Weather can affect your stay, and this is a lot like camping.  
We provide linens  but feel free to bring your own for added comfort.  

THIS IS A CAMPING  STYLE STAY 
PLEASE ADVISE TO PREPARE FOR SUCH  WITH ITEMS LIKE BUG SPRAY, DISPOSABLE CUTLERY, COOLERS, CHAIRS, ETC.
description.neighborhood: The marina is always on island time... It is a great place to bring your family or escape for a girls weekend. Live music is always jamming on the weekends, and the bar and grill on site is the place to be. Mingle in with the locals on the docks and maybe even get a free boat ride!
description.transit: uber, lyft, e-scooter and e-bike rentals are also available all around town
description.house_rules:
Pets should be registered with your reservation and kept leashed and cleaned up after while at the marina. This is a boat on the water so safety should be a top priority. 
If you prefer to have a lock to secure the boat when you leave it (totally unnecessary for us, but a lot of people feel more comfortable that way), we no longer provide locks, please bring your own padlock type of combo or key lock, and please also take it with you when you leave!!

hosts.about:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

I'm Marcia, a Wilmington local, Property Manager for The Cove, and the luckiest employee in the world. Can you think of a cooler place to work? I can't.

From the gentle rocking of the river beneath you, to the beautiful nightly sunsets, a stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed and ready to re-enter the real world. (Although we would love to have you stay for a while!)

Check out our listings below to see the beautiful decor, spacious rooms, and luxurious furnishings that make our floating villas the perfect place for your stay.

Thank you for an enjoyable experience!

description.summary:
Welcome to The Cove, Wilmington's most unique vacation rental community. 

Floating atop the Cape Fear River, our Riverwalk Villas offer an experience unlike any you've had before. 

From the gentle rocking of the river, to the peaceful view of the sunset, your stay at The Cove is sure to leave you feeling refreshed, restored, and wanting to return again soon.

*Please note: Decor differs from current pictures, but is equally as beautiful. Updated pictures coming soon!
description.space:
After parking in our free lot and making the 4 minute stroll down onto the docks of the Port City Marina, you’ll arrive at The Cove, Riverwalk Villas. Secured with dock ties and connected to electricity and water, you'll quickly realize that a stay at our dockside community offers the perfect mix of adventure, luxury and relaxation.

Upon entering your villa, you’ll notice the spacious open concept kitchen/dining/living area and think to yourself, "I should have brought more friends!" (Don't worry, there's always next time.) 

Cooking & Eating:
With a dining table that seats four, three benches along the island, and a kitchen stocked with everything you need to make a great meal, you could actually host your next Thanksgiving here. Complementary coffee, creamer and sugar are provided, alongside a drip coffee maker.

Living Room 1:
If cooking isn't your idea of fun, you may be more drawn to the beautifully decorated downstairs living space, where you can relax on the cozy couch surrounded by tall windows that overlook the Marina. 

Bathroom 1:
Just past the common area is the first floor bathroom, which features a walk-in shower and full size washer and dryer. Complementary shampoo, conditioner and body wash are provided in each of the bathrooms, as well as laundry pods, dryer sheets, hair dryer and a steamer. 

Bedroom 1 (Queen):
Connected by a pocket door is the downstairs bedroom with a Queen bed, large closet, ceiling fan, 40" Smart TV, and access door to the quaint back patio; a great spot for some quiet reading or alone time.

Living Room 2 (Sofa bed):
As you make your way upstairs, you'll discover another large living space with a sectional couch (with pull out sleeper), 55" Smart TV, desk and chair, and a beautiful view of the Cape Fear River through the sliding glass doors. 

Upstairs Patio:
Just outside those doors, you'll find yourself on a large patio featuring an outdoor bar (sink & mini fridge), and a variety of comfortable furniture options. This patio is a fan favorite for everything from morning coffee, afternoon reading, evening spirits, or enjoying a meal. In the Summer months, you'll often hear live music coming from Marina Grill, our delicious on-site restaurant, or Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, which is only a block away.

Bedroom 2 (King):
Back inside and beyond the living room is the second floor bedroom, featuring a King bed, dresser, large closet, ceiling fan & 50" Smart TV. 

Bathroom 2:
The pocket door connects you from the bedroom to the second floor full bath.

Location:

The Cove is located in Port City Marina, which sits on the North end of the Riverwalk in Downtown Wilmington. Just a few steps from the Wilmington Convention Center and one block from both The Wilson Center, and Live Nation's Live Oak Bank Pavilion Amphitheater, a stay at The Cove offers the perfect solution for those wanting to avoid the chaos of parking, event traffic, and needing a DD.

Less than a mile away you'll find the heart of Historic Downtown Wilmington. Whether you choose to stroll along the Riverwalk, take the free trolley, or drive a few blocks down Water Street, getting there is easy. With many local shops, restaurants, breweries, live music, and events, Downtown offers something for everyone to enjoy. Check out our Guidebook or "Wilmington and Beaches" online for recommendations and events.

Beyond the borders of Downtown, a quick 8 minute drive or Uber ride will get you to the Wilmington International Airport (ILM), and within a 10 mile radius you'll find Wrightsville Beach, Jungle Rapids amusement/water park, UNCW (Go Seahawks!) and much more.

If you're interested in bringing your boat, our friends at Port City Marina would love to rent you a slip! Please reach out to them directly to coordinate that for the dates of your stay.

If this Villa is not available during your preferred time frame, please check out the listings for our other Riverwalk Villas at The Cove, and don't hesitate to reach out for assistance. We would love to have you Stay Afloat!
description.access:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent floating villas. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 villas and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.neighborhood:
Port City Marina (PCM) is a gated, full-service, deep water marina featuring over 200 state-of-the-art floating concrete wet slips. Uniquely located on the Cape Fear River, PCM hosts everything from transient boaters to our permanent floating villas. 

Though currently scattered among the docks, we are watching with excitement as our custom built permanent dock is being constructed. This dock will host all 40 villas and will feature angled slips, beautiful landscaping, and a community space at the end of the dock.
description.transit:
Free parking is provided for one vehicle per villa. Our parking lot is located about 1,000 feet (4 min walk) from the Marina, so we recommend packing in suitcases with wheels if you have them, and bringing an umbrella or rain jacket. 

If you will have more than one car, you can park in one of the two paid parking garages located diagonally from our parking lot. (Pier 33 apartments or Wilmington Convention Center)

hosts.about: We are a family run business. A father, daughter and son team. 40 plus years of real estate investment experience. Over 10 years of vacation rental experience. We love to travel and stay in Airbnb’s ourselves, but there is no place like home in Tampa, Florida!

recent.comments: This is a unique property. Being surrounded by the water was such a peaceful feeling, and the view of the city at night was amazing. We would definitely stay here again!

items.comments: This is a unique property. Being surrounded by the water was such a peaceful feeling, and the view of the city at night was amazing. We would definitely stay here again!

The Boathouse is rather unique with windows on all sides and nice views of the river and the city. It is close to restaurants, attractions and shopping, but away from traffic and noise. There were many positives: a comfortable bed, good wifi, a/c,  plenty of fluffy towels, adequate kitchen supplies, secure parking and a pleasant wrap around deck. However, it is old and in need of a few updates/maintenance with slanting floors, worn carpets and rugs and some general wear and tear. Overall, the positives outweighed the negatives and we enjoyed our stay in this little hidden cottage. boathouse.

An amazing location like all the reviews state - a very special spot 

Anyone looking for brand new , modern build place to stay this isn’t for you , could do with a good spring clean 

Lauren is great and very responsive 

We had an amazing time and enjoyed all what tampa had to offer

Amazing home ! Enjoy celebrating our honeymoon in this home. We instantly felt like it was home, really felled in love with the place. Small and unique. Amazing views both during the day and night. Near a lot of cool places to visit. Love love the boat taxi , definitely worth it.

Das Bootshaus hat eine wunderbare Lage am Fluß und das ist der absolute Pluspunkt an dem Haus. Leider überzeugt das Haus von innen nicht mehr. Es ist renovierungsbedürftig und schon sehr in die Jahre gekommen. Es war nicht besonders sauber und die zentrale Klimaanlage sehr laut.
Great cabin on the river, close to the water taxi and restaurant. Clean and friendly. 2nd time renting an will be back?

description.summary: Welcome to your own private oasis on the Hillsborough River with breathtaking water and downtown Tampa views. Relax on your own private dock with a cocktail while you wave to passing boaters, kayakers and the occasional dolphin.
description.space: The house sits on a dock IN the Hillsborough River. You will instantly relax when you walk into the living room and are greeted with sweeping views of the river and downtown Tampa. The house was built over 50 years ago ( perfect if you are a lover of the charm of old houses) and is updated with modern amenities and decorated "shabby chic" in the old Florida style. You will spend most of your time sitting out on the dock, watching the passing boaters, wildlife and the beautiful view of downtown Tampa. There is nothing fancy about the boathouse, but it has what we all need -a comfy bed, fast WIFI and a comfortable and clean space to relax and get away from it all!
description.access:
You have the entire house to yourself, the dock is for the exclusive use of boathouse guests.

The parking lot is shared with the other house that sits on the property, which is also a vacation rental. If you have a large group traveling with you, consider renting the house that sits on the shoreline- it's a two story duplex, called " The Bungalow on the Hillsborough River" and the " Perch on the Hillsborough River".
description.notes:
There is a private, gated parking lot in front of the house that is shared with another house which is also a vacation rental.

We are taking the recommended steps as presented by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for cleaning, disinfecting and preparing our condo for your arrival. We are following the protocols laid out by the CDC and using the EPA-approved disinfectants for Hard (non-porous) Surfaces, Soft (Porous) Surfaces and Electronics. The linens, towels, bed sheets, etc. are washed per manufacturers guidelines.
description.neighborhood:
The boathouse is located in Riverside Heights. This is one of the original neighborhoods that make up Tampa's urban core. The area is going through some new development, you will see many new apartment buildings going up in the area. It is an urban area, but once you walk out onto the dock, you feel like you are miles from everything but still right in the middle of it all.

If you ever decide to leave your chair on the dock, there is a TON to do in the area, But my favorite MUST Do is:


Walk next door to Rick’s on the River and hop aboard the Pirate Water Taxi. This hop on/ hop off water taxi has over 18 stops up and down the river including stops at places like Curtis Hixon Park, the Tampa Museum of Art, the children’s museum, as well as numerous restaurants and bars.

You can also easily access all of Tampa's top attractions- Busch Gardens is a 15- 20 minute drive. Raymond James stadiumm/George Steinbrenner field  is a 5 min drive. The Tampa Riverwalk and Armature Works are a 5 minute drive. UT, downtown Tampa, Ybor City and South Tampa take 5-10 minutes to reach by car.
description.transit:
You definitely need a car to get around. The neighborhood does have 1 restaurant next door, otherwise you'll be driving everywhere, but 5-15 minutes to get to all Tampa has to offer.
Uber or Lyft’s are plentiful in this area!
description.interaction: I am 10 minutes away, if you ever need anything I am here when you need me!
description.house_rules:
No pets and no smoking inside. Do not swim off the dock.

Check out time is 11am, check in is 4pm. 
Quite time observed between 10pm and 7am.

Cleaning fee does not include trash removal or dish washing. Please complete these items upon check out. There is a $25 fee if not completed. 

Property owner can not guarantee any services provided by 3rd party vendors such as cable, wifi, electric and water. If any issues arise during guest stay due to storms, area outages or any other vendor issue, property owner is not liable.
* Please note our cancellation policy is not waived in the event of severe weather. It is highly recommended to purchase trip insurance when traveling to Florida during Hurricane Season*

We then got the idea to use the "old girl' as a short-term rental so we could share our little slice of heaven with others.  We hope you enjoy it as much as we have.

recent.comments: Beautiful place to stay, enjoyed the view from the boat very relaxing 😌

items.comments: Beautiful place to stay, enjoyed the view from the boat very relaxing 😌

if you are looking for a quiet, stress free place , then 'why not' check out the why not? It is everything you could hope for and then some. 'Wally' the alligator did his daily visit!  We have stayed in several Air B&B's and this place I would rate it a 100 if I could! You will not be disappointed!

what a fab place, sat on the boat watching some amazing wild life. got to see an alligator catch a huge fish, saw osprey fishing, turtles and a manatee with its calf  plus watched the space x launch.
sanford had quite a bit going on the weekend we were there which was an added bonus.
the hosts were really friendly and informative, we had a great time.

We had a lovely peaceful stay. We were fortunate enough to see a rocket launch from the houseboat, which they texted us when it was going to happen. The beds were comfortable, and when we had a torrential rain storm, it was glorious listening to it hit the roof while sleeping and feeling a gentle rocking from the wind. The area is very pretty and the upper deck is great. The interior is a home, with adorable signs everywhere. Michael and Rebecca were very nice. They also provide toiletries and coffee and certain kitchen necessities. The barbecue works but 
needs to be thoroughly cleaned and a new grill, which I believe is in the works.
We had the BEST time there!
Our second time visiting and the friends we brought along loved it and we’ll all return

description.summary:
Stay aboard this luxurious 2-bed/2 bath, 2-story "floating condo" docked 3 short blocks from Historic Downtown Sanford. Fish off the dock. Observe birds, turtles, and manatees. Bike or walk to town. Enjoy the lakeshore RiverWalk. See a play/catch a show at the historic theatre.  Browse an art gallery. Enjoy the  ecclectic mix of restaurants, bars, and shops. Feed a giraffe, try the zipline/aerial obstacle course at the Central Florida Zoo. 

PLEASE NOTE:  THE HOUSEBOAT DOES NOT LEAVE THE DOCK.
description.space:
Docked at the Lake Monroe Marina on  beautiful Lake Monroe, part of the St. Johns River System, this 60-foot houseboat has all the amenities of a luxury condo.  The air-conditioned main deck has 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, salon and kitchen area with full-size appliances.   Three independently controlled  minisplit ACs keep the downstairs cool in the summer and warm in the winter. The open-air upper deck has a summer kitchen, dining table, firepit, curvy couches for TV viewing, and chaise lounges for sunning or watching sunsets.  Two bicycles are provided to cruise the downtown area or 5-mile RiverWalk.  TVs (4), CDs, DVDs, books, and games also provided. 

PLEASE NOTE:  THE HOUSEBOAT DOES NOT LEAVE THE DOCK.
description.access: Within walking distance of Historic Sanford where you will find an eclectic mix of bars, restaurants, art galleries, and music venues.  Browse the many resale shops.  Two bicycles are provided to cruise the downtown area or 5-mile RiverWalk.  Approximately 20 minutes to Orlando,  45 minutes to Disney/Universal. Explore the many natural springs in the area.  Dinner cruise paddle-wheel boat docked at same marina for a fun time on the river.  Watch the sun rise and set over the lake.  Lots of bird life.  Fishing and boating but NO SWIMMING permitted in the marina. Parking is FREE at the marina.
description.notes:
We greet all our guests upon their arrival to go over the unique features of the houseboat. We do our best to accommodate guests who cannot check in at 
2 PM BUT...
IF A LATER CHECK-IN IS NEEDED, PLEASE NOTIFY US WHEN YOU INITIALLY BOOK.

Boats and jet skis are rented at the marina by Buzz Boats

Two bicycles are provided to cruise the downtown area or 5-mile RiverWalk.   .

Any guests wishing to bring a boat MUST make arrangements with the Lake Monroe Marina.

NO SWIMMING PERMITTED AT MARINA.

HOUSEBOAT REMAINS DOCKED.  PLEASE DO NOT ASK IF IT CAN BE TAKEN OUT AS THE ANSWER IS AN UNEQUIVOCAL NO!
description.neighborhood: Docked in Downtown Sanford at Monroe Harbor Marina (MHM) on Lake Monroe, which is part of the St. Johns River System. MHM is home to the Barbara Lee (a paddlewheel dinner cruise ship), U-Sail sailing school, and Buzz Boats rentals.  Dine at the St. Johns Steak and Seafood or Sanford Pizza. RiverWalk is the recently completed 5-mile long lakeshore pathway.  Walk, bike, or jog while enjoying the lake views.   "Big Kid" swings dot the path near the marina.  Ft. Mellon and Veterans Memorial  parks are within walking distance.  The Central Florida Zoo is a few miles west and has a zipline/obstacle course.
description.transit: A trolley runs through downtown Sanford and makes several stops.  Golf carts are permitted in town and there are 2 rental locations. Feeling strong? Try the Limo Cycle bus or Pedal Cruise party boat, both pedal-powered - as in you pedal.  There is shuttle bus service to the Sunrail station (train service that runs from DeBary to south Orlando). Many of the stations has shuttle bus service to their points of interest.  Amtrak has a station in Sanford and is home of the Auto Train that runs from Sanford to Lorton, VA.  Parking at the marina is free.
description.interaction: We greet all guests and to give instructions/answer questions.  Please note, check-in is at 2 PM.  Should you need a later check-in,  please notify us when making your reservation.  Feel free to call or text at any time during your stay.  We are always available.
description.house_rules:
HOUSEBOAT REMAINS AT DOCK.
No swimming in marina.
All garbage must be removed at check out.

hosts.about:
Bienvenue  à Aloberge
Bien que les hébergements flottants soient en eux seuls des expériences uniques, nous avons pour but d'aller encore plus loin et de nous distinguer dans la catégorie des prêts-à-camper flottants, par un maximum d'équipement (selon les limites d’électricité de 30 ampères disponibles sur les quais) et par une ambiance zen, afin de rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible. Il nous tient à coeur que tout soit à votre satisfaction.

recent.comments:
Amazing hosts! We decided to stay the night and were looking last minute for a place, this place was a golden find in such short notice, and also because we were travelling with our dog.

Very cozy place, clean and peaceful, within walking distance of a lake, and several docks for boating. 

Easy to find, available parking and short walking distance to the place. Amenities were great and Nathalie was very responsive and helpful with very detailed instructions for everything.
We’re definitely looking forward to coming back for a longer stay.

This is close to Parc Safari, St. Jean Sur Richelieu, and Montreal. I loved watching the sky at night and being right on the water. I would definitely stay here again.
Nathalie was super firendly and communicative! location was peaceful and beautiful - made for a great little weekend romantic getaway.

Wonderful little stay, we stayed one night and had a great time, our dogs joined us, it’s off season so there were only a few other people in other cabins, we rented the boats and used the pedal boat to explore a bit. Very clean, little space heater was perfect. Dock was relaxing and we will definitely be back!

description.summary: Joli prêt-à-camper flottant avec grande terrasse zen, vue panoramique, électricité, barbecue & autres petits équipements de cuisine, ainsi que place gratuite pour votre petite embarcation. Chiens bienvenus. Prenez vos repas/barbecues et relaxez entourés d’eau et de nature, en observant oiseaux, castors ou poissons. Le jour profitez des nombreuses activités du site et la nuit admirez confortablement le ciel étoilé. Endormez-vous et réveillez-vous bercés par les flots et par le chant des animaux.
description.space:
***SPÉCIAUX/PROMOTIONS 2023:  Réservez 2 nuits consécutives en basse saison 2023 (avant le 16 juin et après le 16 septembre) ET OBTENEZ L'ACCÈS JOURNALIER GRATUIT À 6 PETITES EMBARCATIONS: 1 PLANCHE À PAGAIE, 1 PÉDALO, 1 KAYAK SIMPLE, ET 3 CANOTS (une à la fois par hébergement, selon disponibilités, 2 heures maximum à la fois par embarcation).  VALEUR DE 90$ 

DESCRIPTION DÉTAILLÉE DE L'UNITÉ ET INCLUSIONS

Aloberge 1 est la première des six unités du magnifique site " Le Refuge de l’Île-aux-Noix"  (celle la plus au fond du canal). L'unité est de catégorie « prêt-à-camper avec électricité (30 ampères) » et les chiens sont bienvenus.

La plate-forme flottante mesure 12 x 26 pieds et est fixée en permanence au quai.

La cabine est de grandeur 10 x 12 pieds et elle comprend : 

-Deux banquettes simples avec sommiers en lattes, dont l'une peut s'étirer en lit double (capacité de dormir 3, mais l'hébergement est idéal pour 2) 

-L'équipement de cuisine suivant : frigo compact avec compartiment de congélation, micro-onde, grille-pain, bouilloire, cafetière à filtre et cafetière Keurig avec k-cup réutilisable, mixeur, vaisselle de base pour 3 personnes, poêlon et/ou wok en fonte pour le barbecue, nécessaire pour faire la vaisselle, bol à chien, table d’appoint (long banc pliable) 

-Une distributrice d’eau avec 3 gallons d’eau de puits. (L'eau courante n'est disponible qu’à l’entrée du quai et à la capitainerie) 

-A/C et petite chaufferette 

-Serviettes pour 3 personnes et articles de bains (séchoir à cheveux, trousse de premiers soins, petits échantillons de savon & shampoing écologique à la citronnelle) 

-Literie pour 3 personnes: oreillers, ensemble de draps simples et doubles (COUVERTURES NON INCLUSES/en option). 

-Espaces de rangement (tiroirs des banquettes, petites étagères)

-Fenêtres qui s'ouvrent des 4 côtés (pellicules de polymère anti-uv)

La grande terrasse avant, de grandeur 12' x 10', comprend : -2 chaises longues à gravité zéro -Une table avec rallonge et 2 chaises -Un appareil électrique chasse-moustique 

Le balcon arrière comprend : -Barbecue extérieur avec rond de cuisson intégré, ustensiles pour barbecue, plaque ou tapis de barbecue (gaz propane non inclus/en option) -Banc-coffre avec articles de loisirs (ballon, jeux de boules, raquettes de badminton, frisbee)

-Place gratuite pour amener une petite embarcation, si elle rentre à côté de l'hébergement (l'espace disponible mesure 8 pieds par 15 pieds)

-Deux salles de bain unisexes avec douches, disponibles à moins d'une minute de marche, à la capitainerie du site 

-Stationnement gratuit 

-Wi-Fi à partir de la capitainerie (72 Mbits/sec dans l'hébergement) 

-Accès gratuit au terrain du Refuge et à ses infrastructures (foyer extérieur, quai de pêche, terrain de volleyball, petit sentier, aménagement de sable, tables, barbecues à briquettes).


EN OPTION (à commander si possible plus de 24h d'avance)
-Couverture chauffante (8$+taxes/séjour)
-Gaz propane pour le barbecue de l'hébergement (7,5$/nuitée + taxes)
-Avant le 26 juin et après le 4 septembre: Accès journalier partagé aux 6 petites embarcations d’Aloberge: 45$/jour + taxes  (*voir conditions)
-Tours en voilier avec initiation à la voile (disponibilités à confirmer)

-Disponible en LOCATION SUR PLACE EN HAUTE SAISON : Entre la Saint-Jean-Baptiste et la fête du travail, la municipalité prévoit louer sur place ses propres embarcations à pagaie lors de beau temps. 


(* Conditions d’utilisation des petites embarcations d’Aloberge : À utiliser une à la fois par hébergement, 2 heures maximales à la fois par embarcation, selon disponibilités et selon les règles de sécurité mentionnées dans le contrat de location).
description.access:
Accès privé au prêt-à-camper flottant avec terrasse et barbecue.
Accès partagé au site du refuge et au bloc sanitaire avec les autres visiteurs et citoyens de la municipalité.
description.notes:
NON INCLUS/À AMENER : 
-Briquettes si vous préférez utiliser les barbecues sur le site 
-Chaussures d’eau pour la baignade dans le Richelieu (jetée rocailleuse)
-Veste de flottaison pour enfant de moins de 12 ans, obligatoire sur les quais 
-Eau potable (si plus de 3 gallons sont nécessaires)
-Lotion chasse-moustiques
-N.B. : L’hébergement n’étant pas isolé/insonorisé, et le mode de chauffage étant d'appoint (petite chaufferette),  IL EST FORTEMENT CONSEILLÉ D'APPORTER DES COUVERTURES TRÈS CHAUDES EN BASSE SAISON, ou de commander une couverte chauffante (si possible plus de 24h d'avance)
description.neighborhood:
Les hébergements sont situés à St-Paul-De-L'Île-Aux-Noix, capitale nautique du Québec, au Sud du Québec, à 18 km des frontières de l’état de New-York et du Vermont et à seulement 40 minutes (58 km) de Montréal (pont Champlain). 

Pour les nombreuses activités de la région, consultez notre guide de l'hôte, les sites de Tourisme Montérégie et de Tourisme Haut-Richelieu, ainsi que le site de Alorichelieu  (disponibilités à vérifier pour chaque endroit avant de vous déplacer)
description.transit:
L'Hébergement est accessible par voiture, vélo et petite embarcation nautique
Stationnement gratuit et amarrage gratuit d'une petite embarcation a coté de l'hébergement (max 8'x15')
description.interaction: Vos hôtes demeurent à 10 minutes de l'hébergement et se feront un plaisir de vous aider ou de répondre à toute question
description.house_rules:
RÈGLES À RESPECTER AFIN D'ÉVITER DES FRAIS SUPPLÉMENTAIRES OU LA PERTE DU DÉPÔT DE SÉCURITÉ (OU MÊME L'EXPULSION)

*Sauf avis contraire, arrivée après 16h à l’hébergement (vous pouvez arriver quand vous voulez sur le site du refuge)
*3 Personnes maximum en tout temps et 2 chiens maximums (propres, tranquilles et non agressifs). 
*Pas de bougie permise et interdiction de fumer dans l'hébergement. 
*Si vous utilisez le barbecue sur l’hébergement, il faut fermer la bouteille de gaz (disponible en option) après chaque utilisation.
*Les chiens ne peuvent monter directement sur les banquettes, à moins que vous apportiez des couvertures pour recouvrir entièrement les banquettes, dossiers inclus.
*Les toiles blanches enroulées doivent être légèrement retenues en les remontant afin d’éviter qu’elles ne remontent complètement d’un coup sec et que les ressorts se désajustent.
*Toutes les fenêtres et portes doivent être fermées en cas de risque de pluie ou de grand vent ou lorsque vous quittez pour la journée. 
*Les procédures de départ (rappel sur le frigo) doivent être suivies (le barbecue, les accessoires de cuisson et la vaisselle doivent être nettoyés pour être aussi propres qu’à votre arrivée, poubelles et recyclage disposés dans les bacs extérieurs appropriés, fenêtres fermées, portes verrouillées). Nous nous réservons le droit de vous charger tout frais supplémentaires en ménage suite à votre départ. Notamment, DES FRAIS SUPPLÉMENTAIRES DE de 20$ SERONT CHARGÉS SI NOTRE ÉQUIPE D'ENTRETIEN DOIT NETTOYER LA VAISSELLE, LE BARBECUE OU DES POILS DE CHIEN SUR LES BANQUETTES SUITE À VOTRE DÉPART. 
*L’hébergement et ses équipements doivent être intacts à votre départ, sinon nous en avertir dès que possible. Nous nous réservons le droit de vous charger tout équipement brisé, perdu ou volé.   
*Nous aviser dès que possible, de tout manque, inconvénient ou problème concernant l’hébergement, afin que nous puissions y remédier dans les plus brefs délais et améliorer votre séjour, ainsi que celui des prochains clients.

RÈGLEMENTS MUNICIPAUX DU SITE 
*** Aucun bruit ne sera toléré après 22h. 
*Stationnez aux endroits indiqués
*Tenir les chiens en laisse et svp ramassez les excréments
*Respectez les règles sanitaires
*Enfants de moins de douze ans, veste obligatoire sur les quais 
*Respectez les lieux, gardez la rivière propre, ramassez vos déchets
* Pêchez aux endroits permis
* Interdiction de consommer de l'alcool et des drogues sur le site (alcool permis sur les hébergements)
* Interdiction de faire des feux autres que dans le foyer et vous assurer qu'il est éteint en partant
* Interdiction de couper et ramasser le bois (lorsqu’il y a des cordes de bois sur le site, vous pouvez prendre quelques bûches pour le foyer extérieur)
* Aucun VTT n'est toléré sur le site
* Les contenants en verre sont interdits
* Pas de lavage de vaisselle dans les salles de bains (un lavabo extérieur est disponible sur la terrasse de la capitainerie/bloc sanitaire)
N.B. La descente de bateau sur le site est réservée aux citoyens de la municipalité. Il y a une descente payante à 5 minutes en voiture (Pourvoirie Guy Mayer)
N.B. La municipalité permet aux clients des hébergements d'amarrer une petite embarcation, si elle rentre dans la place restante à côté de l'hébergement et qu'elle ne dépasse pas 8' x 15'. 

RÈGLEMENTS LORS DE LA LOCATION DES PETITES EMBARCATIONS D’ALOBERGE

À utiliser à vos risques, par beau temps, une à la fois par hébergement, deux heures à la fois par embarcation. Tous les utilisateurs doivent porter en tout temps les vestes de flottaison : il faut prévoir d’amener celle pour un enfant, adaptée à sa taille. (Seuls deux vestes pour adultes sont disponibles sur l’hébergement). Ne pas consommer d’alcool. Rester le long des berges. Être prudent et visible lors de la chasse aux canards (à partir de septembre). Revenir avant le coucher du soleil. Remettre l’embarcation exactement comme elle était (à sa place, cadenassée et remettre la protection par-dessus s’il y a lieu). Veuillez noter qu'en cas de pluie, les clients sont responsables de vider l'eau accumulée dans les petites embarcations avant utilisation.

En acceptant ce contrat, vous acceptez de respecter les règles ci-hauts mentionnées et vous acceptez de dégager Aloberge de toute responsabilité en cas de problème pendant votre séjour, ou en cas d’imprévus vous obligeant à annuler votre séjour (mauvais temps et maladie/décès dans la famille inclus). Aucun remboursement n’est possible en dehors de la politique d’annulation, sauf si l’hébergement est déclaré inaccessible par les autorités, un crédit pourra alors vous être alloué pour un prochain séjour.


Pour toute question, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter 

Un très bon séjour !

name: The Boat House on Lake Dora - Downtown Waterfront
title: Mount Dora, Florida

gallery.caption: Christmas thru January at the Boat house
Boat House is completely over Lake Dora.
Welcome!
Rear screened porch with dining table and grill.
Rear view of Pampy's Boathouse.
View from rear screened porch.
Living room has sleeper sofa.
Murphy bed is easy to open and don't worry about how neat you make your bed, just closet it up in the closet and you are good to go!
View of Boathouse Row from upper deck.
Pampy, Lou Ronca. the boat house carpenter & builder with his lovely wife, Carla,  and his old wood boat "Beauty"  (painting by a local artist.)
Dining room and kitchen with bar seating.
Pathway to parking.
View into house from lakefront porch.
Large open kitchen with range, refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher and garbage disposal.
Grill on back screened porch.
View of downtown Mt. Dora from upper deck.
Upper deck.
View of boatlift and lake from screened porch.
Washer and Dryer
Outside dining waterfront on screened porch.
Full bathroom with tub/shower combo.
One great big Studio, everything open to expansive lake views.
Couch pulls out to sleeper sofa.
Boat slip with lift. Also docking space on side with ladder.
Large, open kitchen.
Happy Holidays at the Boathouse

recent.comments: The Boat House was exactly what we needed for our family getaway!  Natalie went above and beyond to accommodate our needs.  We woke up early each morning to catch the sunrise over the  lake.   And the proximity to downtown could not be better!  A fantastic stay, highly recommend

items.comments: The Boat House was exactly what we needed for our family getaway!  Natalie went above and beyond to accommodate our needs.  We woke up early each morning to catch the sunrise over the  lake.   And the proximity to downtown could not be better!  A fantastic stay, highly recommend
Excellent experience.    Highly recommend.  Probably the BEST stay via AirBNB ever.

We had a wonderful stay at the Boathouse. So close to everything in this special town. Can't wait to stay again. The place was so comfortable and the views were great. Really, really loved it. Nice private road to walk our dog. Easy to walk to restaurants and stores. We will be back! Natalie was a great host.

The Boat House is an absolutely perfect little house "over" the lake! it has a wonderful screened in porch and a upper sun deck with amazing views of the lake! Steps away from the many unique shops and a variety of dining experiences.  Natalie is a perfect host! Her place is very clean and we love having a covered parking spot!
This place is adorable! Natalie was a very responsive host. We enjoyed our stay. Highly recommend.

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time at the Lake House for our anniversary. The views of the sunset were amazing! Especially from the second story deck! Mount Dora had a lot of fun stuff to do, the food was amazing, and the little shops were nice. From this lake house you are in walking distance of downtown Mount Dora, so you don’t have to drive anywhere. Staying here is definitely worth the money, and Natalie was a great host. Better than staying in a hotel with paper thin walls and no privacy.

description.summary: WATERFRONT! The Boat House is an 800sf private residence built directly over Lake Dora offering panoramic lakefront views. Located on Mount Dora's Famous Boat House Row, right in the heart of downtown Mount Dora, where you can roll out of bed and walk a few steps to one of the quaint coffee shops.  The Boat House was once a tin boat shed with floors open to the water and housed two boats. Today, you will find warm, cozy furnishings, comfortable beds,  a quiet location and sunsets every evening!
description.space:
The only way to be closer to the lake is to be a FISH!

You will never want to leave!

This is the PERFECT Honeymoon Suite!

Mount Dora is known for its historic downtown  (founded in1880) with antiques, unique gift shops and award winning restaurants all owned and operated by locals.... You won't find any chains here. Enjoy a Punk-N-Spice latte at the Edge coffee shop or a glass of wine and some live entertainment at Maggie's Attic. Top notch fine dining at local favorites The Goblin Market, The Olive Branch and Pisces Rising.  The live entertainment and excellent fried cod or haddock at the Magical Meat Boutique can't be beat. Enjoy the holiday lights from the balcony at One Flight Up and try the Cheesy Onion Dip or stop in the alley at The Salted Fry and try the best fries and tuna melt EVER! Fiesta Grande is popular for their delicious food and vegan options, and 2 for 1 Margaritas everyday -- And don't forget to get ice cream at Scoops on 5th and breakfast at Cody's on 4th.... too many to list! You will discover so many more restaurants and shops during your stay and we hope you will share your favorites.

Farmers Market every Sunday 9-3,  walk up the street. 

Palm Island Park - Walk through downtown and past the Historic Lakeside Inn and Mt. Dora Marina until you find Palm Island Park - a long boardwalk over Lake Dora and hiking in the woods which is a great place to walk a dog. You will most likely spot an alligator or two in the water.

Springs:
Enjoy nearby springs which are open year round with water temperature of 72 degrees:
Kelly Park - Rock Springs Run - Kings Landing kayaking
Wekiva Springs Park - canoe, kayak, swim, hike
Alexander Springs - Ocala State Park
Blue Springs - Orange City where you will see manatees in the cold weather

Renniger's Antique and Flea market open  Friday - Sunday.

Trader Mae's Flea Market in Apopka near Kelly Park/Rock Springs Rd. Great little flea market with many local gifts and items. Check it out before or after you go to the spring!

Fish right from the Boathouse. 

Pets are welcome. $50 (total) pet fee per pet. Please send a photo of your pet with your booking. Pet fee is billed after booking.

Enjoy a romantic evening every day viewing a gorgeous sunset from your own private house.

This is the perfect Honeymoon, Babymoon or Anniversary Suite.
description.access: Parking for 2 vehicles in the driveway. Extra parking downtown.
description.notes: The Boat House has a queen sized murphy bed which is very convenient to pull down and push back up every day. Its easier than making a bed! And is very comfortable. There is also a couch that can be made into a bed (sleeper sofa).
description.neighborhood: Beautiful waterfront, quiet street of boat house homes, just down the street from downtown Mount Dora, near Pisces Rising.
description.transit: If needed, Mount Dora has a free golf cart valet service which will take you anywhere in the historic downtown area, including uptown restaurants such as Pizzamore, Jeremiah's  and the Streatery, if you do not feel like walking. Just leave a tip!
description.interaction: I live nearby and can assist with any issues you may have.
description.house_rules:
No outside noise past 9pm. 
No outside noise that would disturb neighbors.
1 pet allowed. Pet fee required.

hosts.about:
Husband, father and recently retired educator, we’re happy to offer our comfortable year-round cottages from which we venture in all directions for sightseeing and activities.  
We’re proud of our guest reviews!  Please note that reviews are from different sites. Cottage details can be viewed at individual listings.

recent.comments: Great location. We enjoyed the local restaurants and close proximity to Newport. The boathouse has a nice deck that feels private and so peaceful. Loved the water view.

items.comments: Great location. We enjoyed the local restaurants and close proximity to Newport. The boathouse has a nice deck that feels private and so peaceful. Loved the water view.

The boathouse interior was very nicely done. It was very relaxing and close to alot. It was so relaxing sitting watching the water and birds that it brought my heart rate down by 10 points. Overall everything perfect plus more!!!! I would stay again!
Second time staying and it won’t be the last! The cottage is the absolute best get away for two and Bill is always an outstanding host!

Bills cottage was the perfect place for a relaxing week away. He provided great local restaurants that could either be a nice walk or a short drive. The cottage was spotless upon arrival and the perfect space for a couple to relax. The deck was everything we could ask for with amazing water views and tons of aquatic birds to watch swim and fish.
We spent a wonderful weekend at Bill's place and it was just perfect. the water view was beautiful, the neighborhood was peaceful and everything was just as it's pictured.
Peaceful, cozy, comfortable and with a view of the cove. We really enjoyed our stay at the cottage and highly recommend it. It was a great find.

description.summary:
The Boathouse Cottage studio suite is truly a former boathouse and is partially in the water!  
Panoramic views with aquatic bird life and a single level flow from front to back give this property a cozy, comfortable and peaceful appeal.
description.space: Comfortable, new, clean and serene, the Boathouse is designed for 1-2 people to relax and unwind.
description.access: The single level studio suite is completely yours. Check in at your convenience.
description.notes:
With Airbnb’s most lenient cancellation option, the entire cottage to yourselves, and easy access to the areas favored attractions, this property is a must stay destination.

To those who question smoking:
Yes, smoking outdoors is fine. 
The deck surrounds the entire cottage and there is ample seating. A small section of the deck is not usable where some things are stored. 
Please know, guests must keep any smoke from wafting into the cottage through open doors or windows. 
The indoors of Boathouse Cottage is a smoke free area and the burning of incense or scented candles is not permitted indoors.
description.interaction: Guests are on their own however your host is readily available for questions and requests regarding your visit
description.house_rules: No diving into water from the boathouse!

gallery.caption: When you reach the docks, the views will get better!
Your view of Turner Creek from the cockpit of our boat.

There are clean bathrooms and showers in this building, as well as laundry machines. Grab a cart to bring your stuff to the boat, but always remember to return it for the next person, when you are done!

hosts.about: Hi, my name is Chris and I am a Savannah firefighter living near Savannah. I love being outdoors whether it’s sailing or camping or just hiking with my dogs! I also love to travel and see how the rest of the world lives.

recent.comments: Second time in 4 months.  You can't beat it. Absolutely worth it...

items.comments: Second time in 4 months.  You can't beat it. Absolutely worth it...
Staying on this sailboat was definitely a fun adventure that I would 100% do again.
Una esperienza disastrosa, da possessore di barca devo convenire che questa è una topaia puzzolente
Great place to stay. Chris was very responsive to any issues we had. It was quite, beautiful, and very unique. A great stay for any couple in the area.
Loved the sailboat! I would come again.

Our stay on Chris's boat was just as listed.  Beautiful, peaceful surroundings.  Instructions were well written and easy to understand.  We happened to stay during a very hot and humid week, but the boat was very well air conditioned.  Using the marina for showers was exactly like another person described, camping on the water.  We have no problems with using the marina and the few other boaters we met were very friendly.  The location was also convenient for both Savannah and Tybee Island.  

If we get back in the area, would definitely consider staying there again.

description.summary: Do you like tiny houses or RVs? Try staying on a sailboat! Located on Turner Creek on Wilmington Island, watch the sunsets and dolphins from the comfort of a lovely 31 foot sailboat. A short 10 minute drive to historic downtown Savannah, but with several restaurants and bars on the island. Kroger, Publix, and pharmacies are also on the island. Bring your paddle boards or kayaks and get out on the water! Boat rentals and deep sea fishing charters are also available just down the road. NO PETS.
description.space: The boat is all yours!
description.access: You will have the boat to yourself. There are full bathrooms with showers in the parking lot of the marina.
description.notes:
There is a notebook with directions on how to use boat systems located on the boat.

No pets. No exceptions. We will charge you the full deposit if evidence of a pet is found on board.
description.neighborhood:
Ever dreamed of sailing to new, exotic locations? Or living in a  tiny house? Try staying on a sailboat but with the comforts of being ashore. Power, water, heat, AC and heat.
Grocery stores, restaurants, bars, liquor stores, pharmacies, and anything else you may need are all available on Wilmington Island and just a short drive from the boat!

Historic downtown Savannah is 15 minutes away!

Tybee Island is 15 minutes away! 

The views of the water. The wildlife you will see- oh, yes, dolphins! The sunrise. The sunset.
description.transit:
Parking is readily available at the marina. 

Uber, Lyft, and taxis are all available.
description.interaction: Please message me via Airbnb with any questions or concerns.
